2017-10-01.abstract: With a nod to a more ornate past, a new structure designed by BKSK Architects at 529 Broadway belongs entirely to the present.
2017-10-01.snippet: With a nod to a more ornate past, a new structure designed by BKSK Architects at 529 Broadway belongs entirely to the present.
2017-10-01.lead_paragraph: I am as devoted to modern style as anyone. I type on an Eames chair, eat with Arne Jacobsen cutlery and rest tired eyes on the colored squares of Josef Albers. But when I step out from my white-cube apartment, I find a different kind of pleasure that’s equally thrilling: My New York neighborhood is full of Victorian tenements covered in a riot of decoration, from carved heads and scallop shells to flower garlands and twisting columns that don’t hold anything up. I dare anyone to resist their splendor.
2017-10-01.headline_main: Reviving the Joy of Decoration at Nike’s New SoHo Building

2017-10-01.abstract: “We Were Eight Years in Power” is a selection of Coates’s most influential pieces from The Atlantic, with new material about what he was thinking and feeling when he wrote them.
2017-10-01.snippet: “We Were Eight Years in Power” is a selection of Coates’s most influential pieces from The Atlantic, with new material about what he was thinking and feeling when he wrote them.
2017-10-01.lead_paragraph: Ta-Nehisi Coates’s “We Were Eight Years in Power” has yet to come out, but it’s already generated a storm of discussion. The Atlantic ran an excerpt; conservatives went on the attack; George Packer, a highly-regarded and left-leaning journalist who got caught in Coates’s cross hairs, issued a rebuttal. A new book from Coates is not merely a literary event. It’s a launch from Cape Canaveral. There’s a lot of awe, heat, resistance.
2017-10-01.headline_main: Through the Lens of the Obama Years, Ta-Nehisi Coates Reckons With Race, Identity and Trump

2017-10-01.lead_paragraph: At 73, Jacques Grange is cleaning house. For half a century, the French interior designer has not only created homes for Yves Saint Laurent, Sofia Coppola, Princess Caroline of Monaco and others, but advised his clients on which art and furniture to buy and how to arrange it in a loose, layered style sometimes called haute bohemian. He plays the role of the sophisticate’s sophisticate.
2017-10-01.headline_main: Jacques Grange’s Collection of a Lifetime, Now Up for Sale

It’s great to be back, and very special thanks to the uncommonly informative Martin Herbach, the startlingly dangerous Caitlin Lovinger and the incredibly intrepid Sam Ezersky for doing such a terrific job while I was on another assignment. It’s nice to know that our Wordplay puzzlehead family is growing, and by doing so, that we can offer you more to read about this pastime of ours. 2017-10-01.abstract: While planning for the 100th anniversary of the Drama Book Shop, the owners uncovered one small problem: It may have started in 1916, not 1917.
2017-10-01.snippet: While planning for the 100th anniversary of the Drama Book Shop, the owners uncovered one small problem: It may have started in 1916, not 1917.
2017-10-01.lead_paragraph: In planning for the 100th anniversary celebration of the Drama Book Shop in Midtown Manhattan on Monday, no detail was overlooked. Fresh blue carpeting was installed on the stairs. The 50-seat basement theater was stocked with black cushioned chairs. And the bookshelves — lined with scripts, plays and monologues — were dusted off.
2017-10-01.headline_main: Drama Book Shop Celebrates Its Centennial. But Is It Too Late?

2017-10-01.abstract: Growing in importance but still not well understood, Bitcoin is a virtual currency with a novel background.

2017-10-01.lead_paragraph: If you find the concept of Bitcoin confusing, you are not alone. The virtual currency has been a constant source of controversy, but it is still not well understood.

2017-10-01.lead_paragraph: Bitcoin has many cousins and competitors. None have grown more popular than Ethereum, a global computer network with its own virtual currency, called Ether.

2017-10-01.lead_paragraph: JERSEY CITY — No need for the Coast Guard to respond to the S O S from the luxury liner, captained by Steve Stricker and Nick Price, that ran aground Sunday along the Hudson River, in the shadows of Lady Liberty. The Presidents Cup, a poorly constructed idea manufactured by the PGA Tour to make boatloads of money, has been listing ever since the United States posted an 8-point victory in the inaugural event in 1994.

In this week’s episode, the pot veritably boils over with the sort of scenery chewing that makes it feel as if it covered as much ground as a feature film. It wasn’t particularly resonant, but sometimes a show just wants to take a breather, set up new pieces, have some fun and wink at the audience.

2017-10-02.abstract: Iran almost certainly has the design for a weapon. If President Trump withdraws from the pact, it will be able to assemble a weapon in just months.
2017-10-02.snippet: Iran almost certainly has the design for a weapon. If President Trump withdraws from the pact, it will be able to assemble a weapon in just months.
2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: On Oct. 23, 1966, China conducted a nuclear test with a device that was flown on a Dongfeng missile. It produced a yield of 12 kilotons of equivalent TNT — a little less than what destroyed Hiroshima. Like the Hiroshima bomb, its fissile material was highly enriched uranium. However, its design was different. It used implosion to assemble the critical mass by compressing the sphere that was made of the fissile material.

This was British Columbia, after all, and no one was going to let a little rain get in the way.

2017-10-02.abstract: Children’s head injuries are scary for parents — and doctors — but it’s possible to reduce CT scans and keep children safe.
2017-10-02.snippet: Children’s head injuries are scary for parents — and doctors — but it’s possible to reduce CT scans and keep children safe.
2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: More than 30 years ago, my toddler stood up in his stroller, evading the various belts and restraints, and took a dramatic header down onto the pavement. He cried right away — a good thing, because it meant he didn’t lose consciousness, and by the time we got home, he seemed to be consoled, though he was already developing a major goose egg. I was a fourth-year medical student at the time and called the pediatric practice at University Health Services, and explained, somewhat frantically, that I was due to get on a flight to California with him in a couple of hours; I was going out for my all-important residency interviews.
2017-10-02.headline_main: Managing Head Trauma in Children

2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: After several months of declining home prices and sales, Toronto’s real estate market seems to be rebounding. Many brokers say that as inventory has declined, they are seeing bully offers make a comeback. (A bully offer is an offer that is submitted before a designated “offer day” when the seller plans to accept offers.) The rebound has not extended to neighboring provinces though. Last week, the Canadian Real Estate Association announced market activity across the country was down 9.9 percent in August and sales had dropped from the year before in 60 percent of local Canadian markets.

2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: MANILA — The Roman Catholic Church has offered to protect police officers who want to come forward and testify about their participation in President Rodrigo Duterte’s bloody war on drugs, a prominent archbishop said on Monday.

2017-10-02.abstract: City Saucery sells preserved local tomatoes at several Greenmarkets.
2017-10-02.snippet: City Saucery sells preserved local tomatoes at several Greenmarkets.
2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: As the local tomato season winds down, the frivolous grasshoppers among us who did not diligently can batches of them for winter dinners have a new resource. Amid the overflowing stands of shiny red orbs still in the markets in early fall are bright jars of preserved local, organic tomatoes sold by Jorge Moret, a partner in City Saucery. The company uses the recipes of Carolina Marino, a native of Calabria, Italy, and is run by her son Michael Marino and his companion, Mr. Moret. The jarred tomatoes include yellow ones and a sauce made from bruised “ugly” tomatoes. The company also sells Calabrian-style sauces and condiments online and in stores: City Saucery summer tomatoes, Union Square, Fort Greene and McCarren Park Greenmarkets; sauces and condiments, $14.98 and up, citysaucery.com.
2017-10-02.headline_main: Jarred Tomatoes Capture the Fleeting Flavors of Summer

2017-10-02.abstract: Niman Ranch’s cured ham is aged for at least a year.
2017-10-02.snippet: Niman Ranch’s cured ham is aged for at least a year.
2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: Increasingly, American producers are selling prosciutto. Niman Ranch is the latest. The hams are cured in the traditional fashion — rubbed only with sea salt and lard, without added nitrites or nitrates — and hung to air-dry in stages for at least a year by a processor in Rhode Island. The fragrant, deep rose result, sold as whole hams with and without bone, or sliced in three-ounce consumer packages, is meaty and slightly saline, with good prosciutto’s typical shadow of sweetness. The label says “uncured” because, according to Agriculture Department rules, products made without sodium nitrite or sodium nitrate must be labeled that way: Niman Ranch Prosciutto, $7.99 for three ounces, $199.95 for boneless ham, $250 for bone-in ham, debragga.com.
2017-10-02.headline_main: A New American Prosciutto

2017-10-02.abstract: The shop in the Lotte New York Palace hotel sells pastries and food to go, including apple cider doughnuts and a new take on the black-and-white cookie.
2017-10-02.snippet: The shop in the Lotte New York Palace hotel sells pastries and food to go, including apple cider doughnuts and a new take on the black-and-white cookie.
2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: Pomme Palais has reopened after having been closed all summer. The chef Michel Richard, who died last year, originally opened the shop for pastries and takeout in the New York Palace hotel. Homemade apple cider and cinnamon doughnuts, autumn ginger snaps, pastrami salmon sandwiches and a new take on the black-and-white cookie with an amaretto base highlight the new fall menu: Pomme Palais, Lotte New York Palace, 30 East 51st Street (Madison Avenue), 212-303-7755, pommepalais.com.
2017-10-02.headline_main: Pomme Palais Reopens in Midtown

2017-10-02.abstract: A demonstration next month at the De Gustibus Cooking School will focus on Boston and pasta, among other things.
2017-10-02.snippet: A demonstration next month at the De Gustibus Cooking School will focus on Boston and pasta, among other things.
2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: Pasta will be just one subject of a conversation at the De Gustibus Cooking School on Nov. 20 between Barbara Lynch, the Boston chef and restaurateur, and Mark Ladner, the former Del Posto chef whose soon-to-open Pasta Flyer will put a new spin on fast-service spaghetti. Expect them to demonstrate some pasta-making tips and recipes, and along the way, perhaps divulge some revelations. (Ms. Lynch is the author of the tell-all memoir “Out of Line,” and Mr. Ladner, who worked in Boston, can share memories with her.) Food and wine will be served: 6 to 8:30 p.m., Nov. 20, $115, De Gustibus Cooking School, Macy’s Herald Square, 151 West 34th Street, 212-239-1652, degustibusnyc.com.
2017-10-02.headline_main: An Evening With the Chefs Barbara Lynch and Mark Ladner

2017-10-02.abstract: The museum celebrates the 50th anniversary of Tanaquil Le Clercq’s ‘Ballet Cook Book’ with two nights of discussion.
2017-10-02.snippet: The museum celebrates the 50th anniversary of Tanaquil Le Clercq’s ‘Ballet Cook Book’ with two nights of discussion.
2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: The ballerina Tanaquil Le Clercq, a star of the New York City Ballet and a wife of George Balanchine, was an accomplished cook. Polio ended her dancing career in 1956, so she spent more time in the kitchen and eventually wrote “The Ballet Cook Book” (Stein and Day) with recipes and anecdotes from the files of leading figures in the world of dance at that time. The more than 90 contributors include Alicia Alonso, Erik Bruhn, Leslie Caron, Margot Fonteyn, Serge Lifar, Arthur Mitchell and Edward Villella. It’s an international cookbook with a strong Russian influence and photographs of dancers, not food. Ballet buffs would love it, but for now, it’s out of print. Next month, for the book’s 50th anniversary, there will be a program about it at the Guggenheim Museum, with the dancers Jacques d’Amboise, Allegra Kent, Jared Angle and Adrian Danchig-Waring in a conversation with Meryl Rosofsky, a food scholar. Some dishes from the book will also be served on a special menu (not included in the program price) at the museum’s restaurant, the Wright: Nov. 5 and 6, 7:30 p.m., $40 ($35 for museum members), worksandprocess.org; the Wright, 212-427-5690, opentable.com.
2017-10-02.headline_main: Guggenheim Talk Focuses on Legendary Dancer’s Cookbook

2017-10-02.abstract: The new dining room at the Museum of Contemporary Art pays homage to the Venezuelan-American sculptor.
2017-10-02.snippet: The new dining room at the Museum of Contemporary Art pays homage to the Venezuelan-American sculptor.
2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: To honor the Venezuelan-American artist María Sol Escobar, known as Marisol, who died last year, the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago has named its new restaurant after her. Decorating the Marisol dining room was the job of the English artist Chris Ofili, who also painted the colorful mural and the other artwork on the walls. The chef Jason Hammel, who owns Lula Cafe in Chicago, features dinner and counter service, and soon, lunch and brunch with menus that are contemporary and long on vegetables. There’s a steak sandwich with egg called At the Spring Street Diner c. 1972, in homage to Marisol, who donated the museum’s first acquisition. She is said to have liked to eat steak and eggs late at night in SoHo in New York: Marisol, 205 East Pearson Street (North Mies van der Rohe Way), Chicago, 312-799-3599, marisolchicago.com.
2017-10-02.headline_main: Chicago Art Museum Opens a Restaurant Named for Marisol

2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: ULAN BATOR, Mongolia — The land beneath Dolgor Dashnyam’s home is wet and gritty and smells of decay. Here, atop one of Ulan Bator’s largest landfills, Ms. Dashnyam lives under a roof made of soggy mattresses. She spends her days rummaging through piles of gin bottles and discarded animal bones, picking up pieces of scrap metal to sell in order to buy water and bread.
2017-10-02.headline_main: ‘We Don’t Exist’: Life Inside Mongolia’s Swelling Slums

2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: Ludmila Belousova, a petite Russian figure skater who, with her husband, Oleg Protopopov, dominated pairs competition in the 1960s, winning two Olympic gold medals for the Soviet Union with a dreamy style that evoked the Bolshoi Ballet, has died. She was 81.

2017-10-02.snippet: TV images of Madrid’s crackdown on Sunday’s secession referendum reinforce the need for a political solution to this standoff.
2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: The brutality of the Spanish police on Sunday in their mission to shut down the Catalan secession referendum succeeded mostly in deepening a political crisis. Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy had the law largely on his side, but Barcelona now has the television images and the solidarity and sympathy they generate, leaving the prime minister looking like an intransigent bully and rendering any possible political resolution of the conflict more remote.

2017-10-02.lead_paragraph: Arthur Janov, a California psychotherapist variously called a messiah and a mountebank for his development of primal scream therapy — a treatment he maintained could cure ailments from depression and alcoholism to ulcers, epilepsy and asthma, not to mention bring about world peace — died on Sunday at his home in Malibu, Calif. He was 93.

2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Tom Petty, who died on Monday, was one of the quintessential American rock stars of the late 20th century. The remarkable streak of hit singles he wrote and recorded between 1976 and 1993 — mostly with his band, the Heartbreakers, but at times on his own or in collaboration with other artists — guaranteed that anyone who listened to the radio or turned on a television in those years knows at least a few of his songs by heart.

2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif. — Like every other 8-year-old whom I tutored at a local school, Omar didn’t know anything — and didn’t care much — about high-stakes disputes over net neutrality, free speech and privacy that have consumed much of the news coverage of the telecommunications industry in recent years. Yet the inability of Omar’s parents to afford broadband internet access lies at the heart of a battle that will have a far greater impact on his future: the fight over street poles.

2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Establishment Republicans have tried five ways to defeat or control Donald Trump, and they have all failed. Jeb Bush tried to outlast  Trump, and let him destroy himself. That failed. Marco Rubio and others tried to denounce  Trump by attacking his character. That failed. Reince Priebus tried to co-opt Trump to make him a more normal Republican. That failed.

2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: The Fulton Fish Market in the Bronx is less a market than a refrigerated warehouse. Relocated in 2005 from its old home in Lower Manhattan, it is almost a quarter-mile long, with  almost 30 seafood wholesalers selling more than 300 varieties of fish, from barramundi to wahoo. On a recent Wednesday morning, before the sun rose over the East River (the action starts daily at 1 a.m.), fishmongers, journeymen, wholesalers and dispatchers talked about what they were wearing.

2017-10-03.abstract: How French intellectuals, cigarette smoke and questions of the self gave way to an obsession with apocalypse.
2017-10-03.snippet: How French intellectuals, cigarette smoke and questions of the self gave way to an obsession with apocalypse.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Last month, after Hurricane Irma rolled over Florida, the state’s commissioner of agriculture took in the damage to citrus crops and deemed it “a unique and existential threat to the industry.” This was an alarming thing to say: Taken literally, it suggests that one of his state’s signature industries might cease to exist. And if it doesn’t sound alarming, perhaps that’s only because we’re surrounded on all sides with existential alarm, to the point where it feels almost like a tic to identify it. In the same month, a corporate lawyer, marveling at Equifax’s handling of an enormous data breach, called it “a botched response to an existential threat.” Climate change is considered an existential threat to all life on earth; a source in one news report deemed Brexit an existential threat to Irish beef exports.
2017-10-03.headline_main: The Golden Age of ‘Existential’ Dread

2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: No travel assignment is ever straightforward, but reporting on the place you grew up presents specific challenges. Walking along the bungalow- and tree-lined streets in the Beverly neighborhood of southwest Chicago, where I lived until 2nd grade, a fog of memory followed me as I passed businesses my family used to frequent and the houses of old neighbors. I scarcely recognized Sutherland Elementary School, a red and white brick structure on my block. The house where I lived as a child was equally foreign, and seemed tiny, like a dollhouse.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Through Three Neighborhoods, Revisiting Chicago’s Charms

2017-10-03.snippet: The rarity of automatic weapons fire in mass shootings proves that restricting firearms actually works.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: IN the immediate aftermath of one of the worst mass shootings in American history, I sought information about what happened by googling “fully automatic weapons” and “Las Vegas.” Audio recordings from the scene had picked up the utterly distinctive sound of fully automatic gunfire. (It appears the gun was a modified semiautomatic weapon.) But instead of turning up details of the massacre, the top search results yielded multiple advertisements for sites like “Battlefield Vegas” (“Book Now!”) and M.G.V. (“Machine Guns Vegas”), where customers can purchase firing-range time with fully automatic “exclusive Las Vegas gun range packages,” according to the second website.
2017-10-03.headline_main: America Used to Be Good at Gun Control. What Happened?

2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Those looking to learn the basic outlines of the life of the singer Chavela Vargas could do worse than watch “Chavela,” but this plodding documentary from Catherine Gund and Daresha Kyi rarely transcends simple biography. While the film includes footage of Ms. Vargas onstage and recordings of her music, it doesn’t convey the power of her artistry, giving the viewer a sense of why, to paraphrase the musician Miguel Bosé from the film, listeners might believe that she could die from being overwhelmed in the middle of a song. (Separately, we learn that may have been her wish.)

2017-10-03.abstract: Friend’s book argues that the sexual and political attitudes of the 1990s shaped, in ways both progressive and conservative, the ground we stand on today.
2017-10-03.snippet: Friend’s book argues that the sexual and political attitudes of the 1990s shaped, in ways both progressive and conservative, the ground we stand on today.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: The schisms of the 1960s, which opened up when many baby boomers were teenagers or in the first stages of adulthood, are commonly used as a Rosetta stone to decipher current political and cultural battles in the United States. In “The Naughty Nineties,” David Friend turns instead to the 1990s, when those same baby boomers were in positions of greater power: from Bill Clinton in the White House to Howard Stern on the radio to the producers Mary-Ellis Bunim and Jonathan Murray on MTV with “The Real World.” Friend finds that the decade’s sexual and political attitudes shaped, in ways both progressive and conservative, the ground we stand on today. On one side are widespread moves to the left on social issues. “But a good case can be made,” he also writes, that Donald J. Trump’s presidency “would never have been possible had the 1990s not normalized and formalized personal branding, reality programming, 24/7 news, tabloid scandal coverage and online self-expression.” Below, Friend discusses how Viagra inspired the book, how the election of Trump changed his plans and more.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: David Friend on ‘The Naughty Nineties’

2017-10-03.abstract: Chen Lieh Tang, the son of Shorty Tang, is back to opening restaurants; Eleven Madison Park unveils its renovated space; and other restaurant news.
2017-10-03.snippet: Chen Lieh Tang, the son of Shorty Tang, is back to opening restaurants; Eleven Madison Park unveils its renovated space; and other restaurant news.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: HWA YUAN SZECHUAN Chen Lieh Tang is back to opening restaurants. His father, Yun Fa Tang, known as Shorty, arrived in New York in 1963 and introduced Sichuan food and notably sesame noodles. Chen Lien Tang put the family name on many restaurants before retiring to spend time in China, New York and Taiwan. But he recently became bored. “He’s getting old, and he felt the need to do it again, one last time,” said his son, James Tang, who is also involved in the business. Last spring, the family opened Shorty Tang Noodles in Chelsea. Now, they have installed a grand restaurant seating about 350 on three floors in the family-owned building (formerly the Bank of China) next door to where Shorty Tang, who died at 50, opened his original Hwa Yuan restaurant in 1968. (The restaurant closed in the 1980s.) The elder Mr. Tang, now 66, designed the new restaurant, seeing to every detail, including richly hand-carved doors he brought from China. “I’m going to remake history here,” he said. “Sesame noodles, fine scallion pancakes, Sichuan kung pao chicken done simply, the way it’s supposed to be, just with chiles and garlic.” He will also serve some banquet dishes on a menu that leans toward Sichuan heat but not exclusively so. He plans to try new ideas, he said, because “times have changed.” Among them are raw-bar selections displayed at one end of the bar in the front dining room, and cheesecake for dessert. (Opens Thursday): 42 East Broadway (Catherine Street), 212-966-6002.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Hwa Yuan Szechuan From the Owners of Shorty Tang Noodles Opens

2017-10-03.abstract: New takes on signet rings, a surf spot in Malibu — and the softer side of Cecily Brown.
2017-10-03.snippet: New takes on signet rings, a surf spot in Malibu — and the softer side of Cecily Brown.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: “My paintings have always dealt with turbulence and conflict,” says Cecily Brown, the British-born artist who was declared an art world virtuosa almost as soon as she arrived in New York 23 years ago. Indeed, Brown’s canvases — layered abstractions with erotic undertones that have earned her comparisons to de Kooning — are known for their fierce energy. This month, a solo exhibition opening at Paula Cooper (Brown’s first at the gallery) reveals a softer side. The artist employed faster, looser brush strokes, creating veils of blues, pinks and grays to achieve a delicate transparency.

2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Released in June, Katy Perry’s fourth major label album, “Witness,” has been her least commercially successful and her most artistically confused. Take “Bon Appétit,” the album’s second single, a discoesque club song featuring the rat-tat-tat Atlanta rap trio Migos. Ms. Perry is somewhere in there, singing, but her voice is the least essential part of the song. And in the video, she’s manhandled like dough by a gaggle of chefs, then covered in vegetables before getting dumped in a caldron and basted.

2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: A billion years ago (give or take), in a galaxy far, far away, two black holes concluded a cosmic pas de deux. After orbiting each other more and more closely, their mutual gravity tugging each to the other, they finally collided and merged into one. Their collision released enormous energy — equivalent to about three times the mass of our sun. The black holes’ inspiral, collision and merger roiled the surrounding space-time, sending gravitational waves streaming out in every direction at the speed of light.

2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: When Charles Fuller’s drama “A Soldier’s Play” had its world premiere Off Broadway in 1981, the playwright envisioned an audience — and a public — that was ready to face uncomfortable truths about the enduring, unwieldy legacy of white supremacy in America. It had been nearly two decades since the passage of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, and Mr. Fuller had grown weary of what he called “the simple racial conflict,” in which white characters and black ones are neatly arrayed on opposite sides of a battlefield.

2017-10-03.abstract: Mr. Loeb’s hedge fund has a $3.5 billion stake in Nestle and may seek to make boardroom changes. With its board in need of new skills, Nestlé can beat him to the punch.
2017-10-03.snippet: Mr. Loeb’s hedge fund has a $3.5 billion stake in Nestle and may seek to make boardroom changes. With its board in need of new skills, Nestlé can beat him to the punch.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Nestlé can pre-empt the activist Dan Loeb’s next move. Directors at the $265 billion Kit Kat maker are light on consumer and digital expertise. Half the 14-member board is from Switzerland, the company’s home market but one that’s worth just 2 percent of sales. Nestlé’s latest plans to revamp are far from radical, and Mr. Loeb, the founder of Third Point, may next seek boardroom changes. Nestlé could head off a fight by beating him to it.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Nestlé Can Head Off a Fight With Dan Loeb

2017-10-03.abstract: She endured death camps, slave labor and Communist dictatorship to become her instrument’s first soloist to record all of Bach’s keyboard works.
2017-10-03.snippet: She endured death camps, slave labor and Communist dictatorship to become her instrument’s first soloist to record all of Bach’s keyboard works.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Zuzana Ruzickova, who survived Nazi concentration camps and a Communist dictatorship in the former Czechoslovakia to become one of the world’s most renowned harpsichordists and a leading interpreter of Bach, died on Sept. 27 in Prague. She was 90.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Zuzana Ruzickova, Leading Harpsichordist and War Survivor, Dies at 90

2017-10-03.abstract: The Kurds provoked Iraq by voting for independence. Iraq replied with military and economic threats. Having made their points, both sides now seem willing to de-escalate.
2017-10-03.snippet: The Kurds provoked Iraq by voting for independence. Iraq replied with military and economic threats. Having made their points, both sides now seem willing to de-escalate.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: ERBIL, Iraq — The world could be excused for thinking that another war was about to break out in Iraq.
2017-10-03.headline_main: After Threat of War, Iraq and Kurds Lower the Temperature

2017-10-03.abstract: The Twins scored three runs in the first inning, but the Yankees’ bats and bullpen quickly took over. Up next: the Cleveland Indians.
2017-10-03.snippet: The Twins scored three runs in the first inning, but the Yankees’ bats and bullpen quickly took over. Up next: the Cleveland Indians.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: The Yankees are headed to the American League division series after beating the Minnesota Twins, 8-4, in the wild-card game.
2017-10-03.headline_main: M.L.B. Playoffs: How the Yankees Beat the Twins in the Wild-Card Game

2017-10-03.abstract: Shortly before it was acquired by Verizon, the company had said one billion users were hit by what was considered the largest known breach of a company.
2017-10-03.snippet: Shortly before it was acquired by Verizon, the company had said one billion users were hit by what was considered the largest known breach of a company.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: It was the biggest known breach of a company’s computer network. And now, it is even bigger.
2017-10-03.headline_main: All 3 Billion Yahoo Accounts Were Affected by 2013 Attack

2017-10-03.abstract: A lingering question is answered at a critical moment.
2017-10-03.snippet: A lingering question is answered at a critical moment.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2017-10-03.headline_main: Helping a Hurt Pigeon on Columbus Avenue

2017-10-03.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-10-03.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2017-10-03.headline_main: Las Vegas, Puerto Rico, Tom Petty: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing

2017-10-03.abstract: A Swedish court sentenced a government soldier, who is now a refugee, for violating the dignity of a corpse in Syria.
2017-10-03.snippet: A Swedish court sentenced a government soldier, who is now a refugee, for violating the dignity of a corpse in Syria.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — For the first time, six years into a war that began with Syria’s secret police accused of torturing teenagers and has escalated in brutality ever since, a member of the Syrian military has been convicted of a war crime.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Syrian Soldier Is Guilty of War Crime, a First in the 6-Year Conflict

2017-10-03.abstract: Brown’s latest novel features a brilliant futurist and a plot that revolves around the tensions between creationism and science.
2017-10-03.snippet: Brown’s latest novel features a brilliant futurist and a plot that revolves around the tensions between creationism and science.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Dan Brown has thrown off the doldrums of “Inferno” with a brisk new book that pits creationism against science, and is liable to stir up as much controversy as “The Da Vinci Code” did. In “Origin,” the brash futurist Edmond Kirsch comes up with a theory so bold, so daring that, as he modestly thinks to himself in Brown’s beloved italics, “It will not shake your foundations. It will shatter them.” Kirsch is of course addressing The World, because that’s the scale on which Brown writes.
2017-10-03.headline_main: In Dan Brown’s ‘Origin,’ Robert Langdon Returns, With an A.I. Friend in Tow

2017-10-03.abstract: Last week, the Los Angeles-based jewelry designer Sophie Buhai hosted an intimate dinner in Paris that featured food installations, lounging — and even a try-on-clothing session.
2017-10-03.snippet: Last week, the Los Angeles-based jewelry designer Sophie Buhai hosted an intimate dinner in Paris that featured food installations, lounging — and even a try-on-clothing session.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: “I grew up going to sleep to the sound of my parents having a party,” says the jewelry designer Sophie Buhai. “It was very much a part of life — eating and celebrating.” Following that example, Buhai, who founded her eponymous jewelry line in 2015, gathered friends together on Friday night in Paris to celebrate both her collection and that of her longtime friend, the designer Maryam Nassirzadeh.
2017-10-03.headline_main: How to Throw a Laid-back Parisian Dinner Party

2017-10-03.abstract: Financing for the Children’s Health Insurance Program expired on Sunday, leaving states to prepare contingencies as lawmakers struggle for legislative consensus.
2017-10-03.snippet: Financing for the Children’s Health Insurance Program expired on Sunday, leaving states to prepare contingencies as lawmakers struggle for legislative consensus.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Federal officials on Monday approved a $3.6 million emergency infusion for Minnesota after the state’s human services chief warned that pregnant women and some children were at imminent risk of losing health care coverage under the Children’s Health Insurance Program.
2017-10-03.headline_main: States Gird for Worst as Congress Wrestles with Children’s Insurance Program

2017-10-03.abstract: Billy McFarland, whose would-be luxury festival crashed and burned in the Bahamas, faces a maximum penalty of 20 years if he is convicted of defrauding investors.
2017-10-03.snippet: Billy McFarland, whose would-be luxury festival crashed and burned in the Bahamas, faces a maximum penalty of 20 years if he is convicted of defrauding investors.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Billy McFarland, the entrepreneur who became a lightning rod in April after his ambitiously marketed Fyre Festival devolved from a would-be luxury getaway into a jamboree of schadenfreude and cold cheese sandwiches, pleaded not guilty to charges of fraud in United States District Court in Manhattan on Monday. Mr. McFarland, 25, who was arrested and charged in June, is accused of misrepresenting financial information about his company to investors who paid him $1.2 million.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Fyre Festival Organizer Pleads Not Guilty to Fraud Charges

2017-10-03.abstract: The ride-hailing service’s board voted for corporate governance changes and a potential stock sale to the Japanese conglomerate SoftBank.
2017-10-03.snippet: The ride-hailing service’s board voted for corporate governance changes and a potential stock sale to the Japanese conglomerate SoftBank.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Uber’s board of directors voted on Tuesday for governance changes that will reshape the balance of power at the ride-hailing service, paving the way for a stock sale to the Japanese conglomerate SoftBank and for the company to go public by 2019.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Uber’s Board Approves Changes to Reshape Company’s Power Balance

2017-10-03.abstract: Jurors at the trial of Ahmad Khan Rahimi, the suspect in last year’s bombing in Chelsea, were shown articles found on his laptop about how to make explosives.
2017-10-03.snippet: Jurors at the trial of Ahmad Khan Rahimi, the suspect in last year’s bombing in Chelsea, were shown articles found on his laptop about how to make explosives.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: The magazine photograph shows a red chair, the kind arranged in pedestrian zones all over Times Square, this one on Seventh Avenue. There is a yellow cab in the background, driving past a TGI Fridays and a billboard for “Mamma Mia!” On the chair sits a single item, a colorful child’s backpack.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Key Evidence in Chelsea Bombing Trial: Articles on Building Bombs

2017-10-03.abstract: Dorsa Derakhshani is now playing for the St. Louis University chess team and officially registered to compete with the United States Chess Federation.
2017-10-03.snippet: Dorsa Derakhshani is now playing for the St. Louis University chess team and officially registered to compete with the United States Chess Federation.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: A female chess champion from Iran has joined the United States Chess Federation, months after learning that she was officially barred from playing for her homeland because she refused to wear a head scarf.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Iranian Chess Player, Shunned for Refusing to Wear Hijab, Will Play in U.S.

2017-10-03.abstract: The justices weigh whether to step in and stop one of the most corrosive practices in modern American democracy.
2017-10-03.snippet: The justices weigh whether to step in and stop one of the most corrosive practices in modern American democracy.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Early in oral arguments at the Supreme Court on Tuesday, Justice Sonia Sotomayor posed a simple question to one of the lawyers defending Wisconsin’s legislative district maps against charges that they were drawn intentionally to maximize and entrench Republican power — the practice known as gerrymandering.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Steak Rubs, Gobbledygook and the Future of American Politics

2017-10-03.abstract: A plan to repeal the state and local deduction is running into resistance from Republican lawmakers whose constituents use the tax break.
2017-10-03.snippet: A plan to repeal the state and local deduction is running into resistance from Republican lawmakers whose constituents use the tax break.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Republican leaders are backing away from a proposal to fully repeal an expensive tax break used by more than 40 million tax filers to deduct state and local taxes amid pushback from fellow lawmakers whose residents rely on the popular provision.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Republicans Are Reconsidering Full Repeal of State and Local Tax Deduction

2017-10-03.abstract: Hurricane Maria smashed through parts of St. Croix in the Virgin Islands, and residents are busy restoring lives and neighborhoods.
2017-10-03.snippet: Hurricane Maria smashed through parts of St. Croix in the Virgin Islands, and residents are busy restoring lives and neighborhoods.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: FREDERIKSTED, V.I. — On Tuesday morning, as President Trump prepared to meet with Gov. Kenneth Mapp of the United States Virgin Islands on a Navy amphibious assault ship offshore, the residents of the island of St. Croix were busy putting together lives and neighborhoods wrenched apart by Hurricane Maria.
2017-10-03.headline_main: As Trump Visits Offshore, Virgin Islands Struggle to Recover

2017-10-03.abstract: Kathleen Sebelius, the former secretary of Health and Human Services, testified about a meeting she had with Senators Robert Menendez and Harry Reid in 2012.
2017-10-03.snippet: Kathleen Sebelius, the former secretary of Health and Human Services, testified about a meeting she had with Senators Robert Menendez and Harry Reid in 2012.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: NEWARK — Kathleen Sebelius, the former secretary of Health and Human Services, testified on Tuesday that she frequently met with members of Congress about policy issues, but that a meeting in 2012 with Senator Robert Menendez was unusual because it came after a request from another member: Senator Harry Reid.
2017-10-03.headline_main: At Menendez Trial, Ex-Health Secretary Recalls an ‘Unusual’ Meeting

2017-10-03.abstract: Mr. Singh, the first nonwhite leader of a major political party in a country that promotes multiculturalism, looks to extend his party’s power on the national stage.
2017-10-03.snippet: Mr. Singh, the first nonwhite leader of a major political party in a country that promotes multiculturalism, looks to extend his party’s power on the national stage.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — While Canada has long promoted multiculturalism, it took until this week for a major Canadian political party to choose a leader — Jagmeet Singh — who was not a white man or woman.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Jagmeet Singh, Canada’s Newest Political Star, Lifts His Party’s Hopes

2017-10-03.abstract: Stiffer regulation is considered less likely in the current administration, apparently curbing the instinct to stockpile firearms.
2017-10-03.snippet: Stiffer regulation is considered less likely in the current administration, apparently curbing the instinct to stockpile firearms.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Stock prices for firearm companies rose this week after a gunman killed dozens of people in Las Vegas, an apparent continuation of a morbid trend linked to mass shootings.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Gun Stocks Rise After Las Vegas Shooting, but Sales Drop Under Trump

2017-10-03.abstract: The justices considered whether immigrants facing deportation are entitled to periodic hearings before a judge to decide whether they can be released on bond.
2017-10-03.snippet: The justices considered whether immigrants facing deportation are entitled to periodic hearings before a judge to decide whether they can be released on bond.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Amid a nationwide surge in immigration arrests spearheaded by the Trump administration, the Supreme Court weighed on Tuesday whether immigrants facing deportation are entitled to have their detentions, which can stretch for years, reviewed by a judge.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Supreme Court Weighs Immigrants’ Rights to Have Detention Reviewed

2017-10-03.abstract: The promotion for the sports channel FS1 appeared on subway trains this week, asking if people were hopeful or hopeless about the Knicks. The ads are to be removed after hitting nerves — perhaps as intended.
2017-10-03.snippet: The promotion for the sports channel FS1 appeared on subway trains this week, asking if people were hopeful or hopeless about the Knicks. The ads are to be removed after hitting nerves — perhaps as intended.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Just one day after it was unveiled, an advertising campaign that offended the Knicks by asking New Yorkers if they were hopeful or hopeless about the hapless team will be stripped from the subway cars they were placed on.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Like the Knicks, an Ad Campaign Fades Quickly

2017-10-03.abstract: Writers from across the political spectrum on the aftermath of the shooting in Las Vegas and the debate over gun control in the United States.
2017-10-03.snippet: Writers from across the political spectrum on the aftermath of the shooting in Las Vegas and the debate over gun control in the United States.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. That’s why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Right and Left React to the Las Vegas Shooting and the Gun Control Debate

2017-10-03.abstract: As chief of the Silicon Valley giant from 2005 to 2013, he solidified its position in PCs but missed the mobile phone boom.
2017-10-03.snippet: As chief of the Silicon Valley giant from 2005 to 2013, he solidified its position in PCs but missed the mobile phone boom.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Paul S. Otellini, who as chief executive expanded Intel’s already commanding chip-making business but failed to build a company franchise in mobile phones, died on Monday at his family’s second home in Sonoma County, Calif. He was 66.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Paul S. Otellini, Who Led Intel and Saw It Grow Even More, Dies at 66

2017-10-03.abstract: At the second day of the trial of a Libyan man accused of helping orchestrate the 2012 attacks, witnesses described trying to survive and escape.
2017-10-03.snippet: At the second day of the trial of a Libyan man accused of helping orchestrate the 2012 attacks, witnesses described trying to survive and escape.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — David Ubben, disoriented and bleeding, was crawling through a burning building at the American Mission in Benghazi, Libya, when he stumbled across the lifeless body of Sean Smith.
2017-10-03.headline_main: At Benghazi Trial, Attack Survivors Recount a Night of Horror

2017-10-03.abstract: Zahra Lari of the United Arab Emirates failed to qualify for the 2018 Winter Olympics, but she hopes progress was made for athletes who wear hijabs.
2017-10-03.snippet: Zahra Lari of the United Arab Emirates failed to qualify for the 2018 Winter Olympics, but she hopes progress was made for athletes who wear hijabs.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: OBERSTDORF, Germany — Zahra Lari of the United Arab Emirates did not qualify for the 2018 Winter Olympics in figure skating in her final opportunity on Saturday. In fact, she finished last among 33 skaters at the Nebelhorn Trophy competition here. But, for Muslim women, Lari considered this a step forward, not backward.
2017-10-03.headline_main: She Finished Last on the Ice, but Moved Forward

2017-10-03.abstract: The bill would make permanent emergency measures put in place after terrorist attacks in 2015, effectively institutionalizing a trade-off between security and civil liberty.
2017-10-03.snippet: The bill would make permanent emergency measures put in place after terrorist attacks in 2015, effectively institutionalizing a trade-off between security and civil liberty.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The French government on Tuesday moved a significant step closer to making permanent some of the emergency measures put in place after the terrorist attacks of 2015, expanding the powers of the security forces to combat terrorism in ways that critics say may also curtail civil liberties.
2017-10-03.headline_main: French Parliament Advances a Sweeping Counterterrorism Bill

2017-10-03.abstract: Prosecutors said about half of the 30 people charged in the scam parked in spaces reserved for city agencies, like the Fire Department and Department of Health.
2017-10-03.snippet: Prosecutors said about half of the 30 people charged in the scam parked in spaces reserved for city agencies, like the Fire Department and Department of Health.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Thirty people were hauled into state court on Tuesday in handcuffs and charged with using fake parking placards made to look like city-issued documents to park in special zones and to avoid paying tickets.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Dozens Charged With Using Fake Parking Placards to Avoid Tickets

2017-10-03.abstract: Our talent is boundless but our complacency is galling.
2017-10-03.snippet: Our talent is boundless but our complacency is galling.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: “God bless America,” our president said, dutifully, after the bloody Sunday in Las Vegas. It’s a wish worth repeating. It’s an intervention sorely needed in a country seriously lost.
2017-10-03.headline_main: God Bless America

2017-10-03.abstract: Vonn’s request to enter a men’s downhill race next winter was formally discussed at a preliminary meeting of members of the International Ski Federation. Her previous attempts were rejected.
2017-10-03.snippet: Vonn’s request to enter a men’s downhill race next winter was formally discussed at a preliminary meeting of members of the International Ski Federation. Her previous attempts were rejected.
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Lindsey Vonn’s quest to race against men took a small step forward Tuesday, though it is likely the decision on whether to allow her to enter a men’s World Cup race late next year will be postponed until May.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Lindsey Vonn Clears One Gate in Her Quest to Race Against Men

2017-10-03.abstract: The country music star, who fled the stage when the shooting began in Las Vegas, won’t be performing this weekend “out of respect for the victims.”
2017-10-03.snippet: The country music star, who fled the stage when the shooting began in Las Vegas, won’t be performing this weekend “out of respect for the victims.”
2017-10-03.lead_paragraph: Jason Aldean, the country music singer who was onstage when bullets rained down on concertgoers in Las Vegas on Sunday night, has canceled his tour dates for this weekend.
2017-10-03.headline_main: Jason Aldean Cancels Shows to ‘Mourn the Ones We Have Lost’

2017-10-04.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, October 4, 2017.
2017-10-04.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, October 4, 2017.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: “I think people are going to have to take steps in their own lives to take precautions. To protect themselves. And in situations like that, you know, try to stay safe. As somebody said — get small.”
2017-10-04.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: Conversation Turns to Guns, Then Republicans Change the Subject

2017-10-04.abstract: If background checks can’t stop this, we need something else.
2017-10-04.snippet: If background checks can’t stop this, we need something else.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: We live in a country where so long as you follow the rules, you have relatively unfettered access to weapons capable of mass devastation. This week, we can see once again the carnage the rules have made possible. The number of victims of the terrorism in Las Vegas this week is staggering — at least 59 dead and more than 500 injured.
2017-10-04.headline_main: No More Shootings That Follow the Rules

2017-10-04.abstract: Pressed by lawmakers, Defense Secretary Jim Mattis reiterated his view that the Iran accord is working, a quiet break with President Trump.
2017-10-04.snippet: Pressed by lawmakers, Defense Secretary Jim Mattis reiterated his view that the Iran accord is working, a quiet break with President Trump.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Days before President Trump has to make a critical decision on whether to hold up the Iran nuclear deal, Defense Secretary Jim Mattis openly split with him on abandoning the agreement, the second senior member of the president’s national security team to recently contradict him.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Mattis Contradicts Trump on Iran Deal Ahead of Crucial Deadline

2017-10-04.abstract: Do more guns mean less gun homicides? Did Planned Parenthood outspend the National Rifle Association? And what is the impact of a gun silencer?
2017-10-04.snippet: Do more guns mean less gun homicides? Did Planned Parenthood outspend the National Rifle Association? And what is the impact of a gun silencer?
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: At least 23 weapons were found in the Las Vegas hotel suite of the gunman who targeted an outdoor concert on Sunday night, killing 59 people, including himself, and injuring more than 500 others. Authorities found 19 more firearms, and hundreds of rounds of ammunition, in the home of the gunman, Stephen Paddock.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Spurious Chart, Data on N.R.A. Spending Mislead in Gun Debate

2017-10-04.abstract: Thousands of people who had come from far away suddenly found themselves under fire.
2017-10-04.snippet: Thousands of people who had come from far away suddenly found themselves under fire.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: The weekend was perfect for an escape. It was Las Vegas, the poster city for getting away, and a dazzling lineup of entertainment beckoned, a three-day country music festival known as Route 91.
2017-10-04.headline_main: For Music Fans Drawn to Las Vegas, a Retreat Became a Trap

2017-10-04.abstract: The scale of this massacre might make a stronger-than-usual case for new regulation.
2017-10-04.snippet: The scale of this massacre might make a stronger-than-usual case for new regulation.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: After mass shootings like the nightmare in Las Vegas, there are always complaints that we don’t talk enough about gun control in America, that we need to actually have the debate about guns and mass murder that the National Rifle Association and the Republicans supposedly keep shutting down.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Why Gun Control Loses, and Why Las Vegas Might Change That

2017-10-04.abstract: Glen Simpson, a manager for a Las Vegas ambulance company, raced through gunfire to bring aid to shooting victims.
2017-10-04.snippet: Glen Simpson, a manager for a Las Vegas ambulance company, raced through gunfire to bring aid to shooting victims.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Read the latest on the Las Vegas shooting with Wednesday’s live updates.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Dodging Bullets, a Medical Coordinator Responds to a Crisis

2017-10-04.abstract: There is temporary netting running along the stands. That’s to protect fans during batting practice. And there are screens on the field — for the players.
2017-10-04.snippet: There is temporary netting running along the stands. That’s to protect fans during batting practice. And there are screens on the field — for the players.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: During games at Yankee Stadium, when baseballs are about to be thrown pretty hard and hit even harder, the protective netting in the box-seat area stretches from behind home plate to the inner edge of both dugouts.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Screens Are Everywhere at Yankee Stadium — Before the Game

2017-10-04.abstract: The life-or-death quality of the wild-card play-in contest can provide intense drama. Although maybe not when the Yankees are playing the Twins.
2017-10-04.snippet: The life-or-death quality of the wild-card play-in contest can provide intense drama. Although maybe not when the Yankees are playing the Twins.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: There is nothing quite like an elimination game. The utter desperation, with the season in the balance for both teams, is compelling theater. It is part of what makes the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament and the N.F.L. playoffs so gripping.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Like It or Not, Baseball’s Instant-Knockout Game Seems Here to Stay

2017-10-04.abstract: New details emerged about how Stephen Paddock managed to kill 58 people and himself, and investigators said they hoped to learn more from his girlfriend.
2017-10-04.snippet: New details emerged about how Stephen Paddock managed to kill 58 people and himself, and investigators said they hoped to learn more from his girlfriend.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Before he mowed down concertgoers from a perch high in a hotel tower, Stephen C. Paddock created a ring of surveillance around him, with video cameras in his suite and in the hallway, law enforcement officials said on Tuesday. But investigators were still at a loss to offer a motive for the massacre.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Meticulous Planning by Las Vegas Gunman Before He Opened Fire

2017-10-04.abstract: New movies from Todd Haynes, Woody Allen, Claire Denis and Dee Rees are among the highlights of the festival’s second half.
2017-10-04.snippet: New movies from Todd Haynes, Woody Allen, Claire Denis and Dee Rees are among the highlights of the festival’s second half.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: The centerpiece of the 55th New York Film Festival (running now through Oct. 15) is “Wonderstruck,” Todd Haynes’s sweet, nostalgic and beautifully photographed excursion through Manhattan in the 1920s and 1970s. The closing-night film is “Wonder Wheel,” Woody Allen’s somewhat grimmer — though also visually gorgeous — venture into the Brooklyn of the ’50s.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Wonders in a Grim World: The New York Film Festival’s Best Trick

2017-10-04.abstract: Evan Mahnken, a student at Brandeis University, locates just the right words for us.
2017-10-04.snippet: Evan Mahnken, a student at Brandeis University, locates just the right words for us.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE — Hands up if you’ve ever solved a puzzle, sat back and thought, “Man, I wish I’d thought of that.”
2017-10-04.headline_main: Finding the Right Words

2017-10-04.abstract: The orchestra taps the Danish conductor, who has been its principal guest conductor, to succeed Ludovic Morlot as its next music director.
2017-10-04.snippet: The orchestra taps the Danish conductor, who has been its principal guest conductor, to succeed Ludovic Morlot as its next music director.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: The Seattle Symphony enjoyed a string of artistic successes under the musical leadership of the French conductor Ludovic Morlot, so when he announced last spring that he would step down after the 2018-19 season, there was widespread curiosity about who would succeed him.
2017-10-04.headline_main: The Seattle Symphony Looks Inward for Its Next Maestro: Thomas Dausgaard

2017-10-04.abstract: Representative Tim Murphy of Pennsylvania asked a woman with whom he was having an extramarital affair to “abort our unborn child,” according to a report.
2017-10-04.snippet: Representative Tim Murphy of Pennsylvania asked a woman with whom he was having an extramarital affair to “abort our unborn child,” according to a report.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Representative Tim Murphy of Pennsylvania, a strong and frequent critic of abortion, asked a woman with whom he was having an affair to undergo an abortion, according to a report published on Tuesday by The Pittsburgh Post-Gazette.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Anti-Abortion Congressman Asked Woman to Have One, Report Says

2017-10-04.abstract: Footage released by the Las Vegas police shows officers pleading with civilians to run for cover as gunfire erupts in the background.
2017-10-04.snippet: Footage released by the Las Vegas police shows officers pleading with civilians to run for cover as gunfire erupts in the background.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Footage released by the Las Vegas police shows officers pleading with civilians to run for cover as gunfire erupts in the background.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Police Body Camera Footage of Las Vegas Shooting

2017-10-04.abstract: In this week’s episode, everyone’s pretty clear about what they actually want.
2017-10-04.snippet: In this week’s episode, everyone’s pretty clear about what they actually want.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: People are funny. For example, just when you think you know someone, he goes and does … exactly what he said he’d do. Or, if he didn’t say it outright, he was telegraphing it to the world in block letters the size of the Hollywood sign. And for some reason we’re surprised. Funny.
2017-10-04.headline_main: ‘Law & Order True Crime’ Episode 2: No Surprises

2017-10-04.abstract: Corrections appearing in print on Wednesday, October 4, 2017.
2017-10-04.snippet: Corrections appearing in print on Wednesday, October 4, 2017.

2017-10-04.abstract: It was through writing that I came to fully understand my disability and my body.
2017-10-04.snippet: It was through writing that I came to fully understand my disability and my body.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: One morning in my 18th summer, the guy I thought I loved stopped by to invite my roommates and me to pick apricots from the tree he’d discovered behind the Boulder Public Library. Five of us gathered paper grocery sacks and trooped over, marveling that in the several weeks we’d all been in town, studying poetry at Naropa Institute, none of us had noticed the fruit tree. Actually, the others marveled and I pretended to. Growing up in Queens, N.Y., the only apricots I’d seen came dried and flattened into sticky sheets on paper backing my mother bought in rolls.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Finding Myself on the Page

2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: After a passer-by handed over a half-used pack of cigarettes to a homeless man on a Melbourne street, the man asked that I accompany him to a nearby convenience store to help him buy more cigarettes as he was running low for the week. That way, he claimed, he would be able to spend the small sums he received on food. Cigarettes are indeed expensive in Australia, as they come with a high disincentive tax. My offer to buy him sandwiches instead was vehemently refused. The homeless man accused me of being miserly and “dishonoring our agreement” (in my view, we didn’t have one). He said that I was clearly not as generous as my benevolent predecessor. I refused his request for money in the belief that it would be wasted on cigarettes.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Is It O.K. to Give Cigarettes to a Homeless Person?

2017-10-04.abstract: The moderator of “Meet the Press” on how the media covered the events of 2016 and whether sports figures should weigh in on political issues.
2017-10-04.snippet: The moderator of “Meet the Press” on how the media covered the events of 2016 and whether sports figures should weigh in on political issues.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: You’ve been moderating “Meet the Press” for just over three years. Do you think your job is the same today as it was, say, 10 months ago? What the audience expects hasn’t changed. People come to us for the same reasons: to be educated and informed. My biggest change is that I feel the need to reinforce the wall between the news media and the politicians. The wall has always been there, but sometimes there have been too many holes in it. One legitimate criticism of the political press over the last two decades has been the appearance of coziness between people in the media and the political elite. It’s a lot easier for me, say, as a sports fan to accept a personal fandom, whereas in politics, I’m not going to tell anybody whom I vote for, not even my kids, who ask me all the time, because their friends ask them.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Chuck Todd Thinks It’s Important to Stay Neutral

2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Uber’s relationships with cities tend to begin or end in war. Smaller markets experience the company as a powerful invading force — often a welcome one. The company’s model easily outclasses and undercuts provincial competitors, conscripting local cabbies and enlisting new drivers. Flimsy taxi regulations backed by weak municipal governments are quickly overwhelmed by the multibillion-dollar company and its armies of lawyers and lobbyists and their briefcases full of case studies and legislative suggestions.
2017-10-04.headline_main: What if Platforms Like Facebook Are Too Big to Regulate?

2017-10-04.abstract: Exploring nearly 30 years of genre-bending, improvisational work.
2017-10-04.snippet: Exploring nearly 30 years of genre-bending, improvisational work.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Ideally this article would start with a single-word sentence. A single short word. A short word like “quiet” or, in musical terminology, “piano.” That word, “piano,” would be repeated. It would be repeated several times. As it was repeated, we would become conscious that it had changed, that in the process of being repeated it had changed, quietly, had expanded from quiet to quietly, imperceptibly. And as this imperceptible change became perceptible, so we would notice that another deeper aspect of its meaning — also simple — was making itself felt: a basic figure of speech, a bass figure. Alongside piano and bass something else would emerge, a rustle so faint it could be nothing, a nothing stirring into something that sounds breeze-scattered: a rattle, dimly perceived, moving so slowly it will have to develop significantly before it can be recognized — measured — by the form of time known, since the dawn of time, as rhythm and, later, as percussion. At some point — though the key point is that we will not be able to say with certainty when, where or how this point was achieved — piano, bass and drums will have moved either into a deep propulsive groove or into a maelstrom of relentless intensity. And then, after an extended stretch of time, the music will subside — or plunge — back to the silence from which it emerged faintly, quietly. So this article, ideally, would unfold in a single, long paragraph as a way of approximating the experience of listening to a typical performance by the Necks, the Australian trio who, for the last dozen years, have obsessed me to the point of mania.
2017-10-04.headline_main: My Obsession With the Necks, the Greatest Trio on Earth

2017-10-04.abstract: After years as the industry’s top African-American talent agent, Charles D. King is building an audacious new production company — with a vision for bringing long-neglected stories to the screen.
2017-10-04.snippet: After years as the industry’s top African-American talent agent, Charles D. King is building an audacious new production company — with a vision for bringing long-neglected stories to the screen.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: During the 10-day run of the Sundance Film Festival each January, the otherwise-unassuming ski hamlet of Park City, Utah, begins to look like the Hamptons on Fourth of July weekend. Traffic inches anxiously along the snow-carpeted Main Street, littered with the accidents of those unused to driving on snow or unused to driving at all. Angelenos and New Yorkers line the sidewalks in the gathering darkness, presenting their bona fides or tall tales to the nearest bouncer, straining their necks to find old friends — or new connections who might see in them what they see in themselves. They are easily distinguishable from the locals by their attire, everything from freshly purchased skiwear to full-length furs to homemade-looking get-ups sparkling with the jewels of American self-invention.
2017-10-04.headline_main: A Former Superagent Bets Big on a More Diverse Hollywood

2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Taste presents an age-old quandary: It is notoriously hard to define. Discussions on the topic often fade into unhelpful aphorisms like “to each her own” or “live and let live.” After all, what is too much chintz to one person is comfortable and cozy to another. My favorite abstract painter may leave you cold or, in that proverbial art jab, look like the work of a toddler.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Is Good Taste Teachable?

2017-10-04.abstract: Uber may have lost its license in London but there are plenty of other apps to choose from there and in New York. Here’s our guide.
2017-10-04.snippet: Uber may have lost its license in London but there are plenty of other apps to choose from there and in New York. Here’s our guide.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: When it comes to ride-hailing apps worldwide, Uber may be the most popular brand, but it is by no means the only one. So the 3.5 million people in London who have used Uber in the last three months will have plenty of options to choose from in the wake of the decision by London’s transportation agency not to renew its license to operate there. So, too, do the 3.5 million Uber users in New York, who don’t have to contend with losing the service altogether but may want alternatives during peak demand, when surge pricing becomes more common. Fortunately, each destination happens to have a robust network of ride-hailing apps, said Andrew MacDougall, the head of communications for Citymapper, an app that helps its users connect with local transportation in 40 cities. “New York and London have plenty of competitors to Uber,” he said.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Here Are Some Alternatives to Uber

2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: MELBOURNE, Australia — The Australian government wants to strengthen its counterterrorism efforts by making use of a fundamental part of all Australian citizens: their faces.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Australia Wants All Citizens’ Driver’s License Photos, Citing Terror Fight

2017-10-04.abstract: The European Commission said it would take Ireland to court for not clawing back billions from Apple, and ordered Luxembourg to recover around $293 million from Amazon.
2017-10-04.snippet: The European Commission said it would take Ireland to court for not clawing back billions from Apple, and ordered Luxembourg to recover around $293 million from Amazon.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — European competition regulators on Wednesday mounted a push against tax avoidance by Silicon Valley giants, announcing plans to take Ireland to court for failing to collect back taxes from Apple and ordering Luxembourg to claim unpaid taxes from Amazon.
2017-10-04.headline_main: E.U., Citing Amazon and Apple, Tells Nations to Collect Tax

2017-10-04.abstract: Jacques Dubochet, Joachim Frank and Richard Henderson developed a process that may lead to “detailed images of life’s complex machineries,” the committee said.
2017-10-04.snippet: Jacques Dubochet, Joachim Frank and Richard Henderson developed a process that may lead to “detailed images of life’s complex machineries,” the committee said.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Three European-born scientists were awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry on Wednesday for developing a new way to assemble precise three-dimensional images of biological molecules like proteins, DNA and RNA.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Nobel Prize in Chemistry Awarded for 3D Views of Life’s Biological Machinery

2017-10-04.abstract: Exercise changes the workings of new brain cells in ways that may protect against dementia, a study in mice suggests.
2017-10-04.snippet: Exercise changes the workings of new brain cells in ways that may protect against dementia, a study in mice suggests.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Because we can never have enough reasons to keep exercising, a new study with mice finds that physical activity not only increases the number of new neurons in the brain, it also subtly changes the shape and workings of these cells in ways that might have implications for memory and even delaying the onset of dementia.
2017-10-04.headline_main: For Your Brain’s Sake, Keep Moving

2017-10-04.abstract: Staying mindful during an argument allows us to choose conversation, discourse and debate in ways that do not escalate the situation.
2017-10-04.snippet: Staying mindful during an argument allows us to choose conversation, discourse and debate in ways that do not escalate the situation.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: “Just because we disagree with someone, it doesn’t have to become a heated exchange. Staying mindful during an argument allows us to choose conversation, discourse and debate in ways that do not escalate the situation.” — Holly Duckworth, a speaker and executive coach who focuses on mindfulness.
2017-10-04.headline_main: How to Be Mindful in an Argument

2017-10-04.abstract: Wednesday: Examining laws around firearms in our city and state, art from inmates, and preparing for Open House New York.
2017-10-04.snippet: Wednesday: Examining laws around firearms in our city and state, art from inmates, and preparing for Open House New York.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Good morning on this mild Wednesday.
2017-10-04.headline_main: New York Today: What Are New York’s Gun Laws?

2017-10-04.abstract: Federal prosecutors went after payments to college athletes but lost on appeal in 1993. Now a case against 10 men, including four coaches, offers a new approach.
2017-10-04.snippet: Federal prosecutors went after payments to college athletes but lost on appeal in 1993. Now a case against 10 men, including four coaches, offers a new approach.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: It was almost a quarter-century ago that the Justice Department couldn’t get charges to stick when it went after secret payments to college athletes. A novel strategy may give it a better shot this time around.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Taking a New Strategy to Court in N.C.A.A. Case

2017-10-04.abstract: We look at how the National Rifle Association became a powerful lobbying group, and a gun store owner talks about selling military-style weapons to civilians.
2017-10-04.snippet: We look at how the National Rifle Association became a powerful lobbying group, and a gun store owner talks about selling military-style weapons to civilians.

2017-10-04.headline_main: Listen to ‘The Daily’: The Power of the N.R.A.

2017-10-04.abstract: Regulators will take Ireland to court over Apple’s taxes and order Luxembourg to collect $293 million from Amazon, turning up the heat on American tech giants.
2017-10-04.snippet: Regulators will take Ireland to court over Apple’s taxes and order Luxembourg to collect $293 million from Amazon, turning up the heat on American tech giants.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Today, European Union regulators stepped up their tax campaign against American tech giants in a big way.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Europe Gets Tougher on Tech’s Taxes: DealBook Briefing

2017-10-04.abstract: For 11 years, a passionate film buff has been inviting neighbors to watch movie classics on a piece of large fabric that hangs behind his house.

2017-10-04.abstract: Duane Buck, who was sentenced in 1997 to death by lethal injection, was resentenced to life in prison plus two 60-year terms.
2017-10-04.snippet: Duane Buck, who was sentenced in 1997 to death by lethal injection, was resentenced to life in prison plus two 60-year terms.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: Duane E. Buck barged into his girlfriend’s Texas home after she broke up with him and killed her and a friend. Later that morning in July 1995, he fired a rifle at his stepsister, who survived because the bullet just missed her heart.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Texas Man’s Death Sentence Thrown Out Over Racist Testimony

2017-10-04.abstract: On Tuesday, the Yankees’ 2 through 7 hitters were all 28 or younger. But Brett Gardner and David Robertson starred.
2017-10-04.snippet: On Tuesday, the Yankees’ 2 through 7 hitters were all 28 or younger. But Brett Gardner and David Robertson starred.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: The Yankees are back in a playoff series for the first time in five years, back in a setting that once seemed automatic. They once did it 13 years in a row, a streak that stopped in 2008, the year they welcomed David Robertson and Brett Gardner to the roster.
2017-10-04.headline_main: A Young Yankees Team, Led by Two Veterans

2017-10-04.abstract: A politics correspondent who lived on St. Thomas 15 years ago is reminded how uniquely isolated America’s Caribbean territories are.
2017-10-04.snippet: A politics correspondent who lived on St. Thomas 15 years ago is reminded how uniquely isolated America’s Caribbean territories are.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: After even the most vicious of hurricanes, most Americans find there are comforts they can fall back on, however minuscule. They probably have a job to go to. Their cellphone can make calls. And even if they have no electricity, there is someplace a reasonable drive away that does — a friend’s or relative’s home, a restaurant that serves a hot meal.
2017-10-04.headline_main: ‘Are You FEMA?’ Reporter Returns to Islands to Find Despair

2017-10-04.abstract: Thesis and antithesis at Thom Browne and Miu Miu; synthesis at Louis Vuitton.
2017-10-04.snippet: Thesis and antithesis at Thom Browne and Miu Miu; synthesis at Louis Vuitton.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The last long walk of fashion month took place on an excavated 12th-century moat by the walls of the medieval castle that formed part of the foundation of the Louvre. An uplit passageway lined with metal stools by the Japanese designer Teruaki Ohashi led inexorably to the Great Sphinx of Tanis at the end of the tunnel. Where the Louis Vuitton show began.
2017-10-04.headline_main: The Fashion Dialectic

2017-10-04.abstract: The painter insists that to focus too much on what is in his paintings is to miss something more important: their structure.
2017-10-04.snippet: The painter insists that to focus too much on what is in his paintings is to miss something more important: their structure.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: David Salle’s new paintings are crowded: The nine large canvases upstairs at the Skarstedt gallery on the Upper East Side are brimful of archetypal images from 1960s-era advertisements — cars, cigarettes, shoes and food.

2017-10-04.abstract: Bad history continues for Minnesota playing New York. And no Twin has felt it more than Joe Mauer.
2017-10-04.snippet: Bad history continues for Minnesota playing New York. And no Twin has felt it more than Joe Mauer.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: For the past 14 years, the Minnesota Twins’ relationship with the Yankees in October has been roughly akin to a comic strip, with one character being mercilessly made a fool of by the other.

2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: COPENHAGEN — A Danish inventor’s explanation of how the journalist Kim Wall died on his submarine was further cast into doubt after an autopsy revealed she had been stabbed more than 14 times and the police found video footage of slain women on a hard drive linked to the suspect.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Kim Wall Was Stabbed After Boarding Submarine, Danish Prosecutor Says

2017-10-04.abstract: Big creditors are trying to disrupt the restructuring of the island’s huge debt. If they succeed, they will devastate post-hurricane rebuilding.
2017-10-04.snippet: Big creditors are trying to disrupt the restructuring of the island’s huge debt. If they succeed, they will devastate post-hurricane rebuilding.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: While the citizens of Puerto Rico persevere through the devastating aftermath of Hurricane Maria, the island’s creditors are engaged in a very different recovery effort. At the very moment when the island needs relief, those creditors are trying to increase the value of their debt holdings. Few things could be more damaging to Puerto Rico’s ability to rebuild.
2017-10-04.headline_main: Don’t Make Things Worse for Puerto Rico

2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Long-simmering tension within President Trump’s national security team spilled into public view on Wednesday as Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson took the extraordinary step of calling a news conference to affirm his support for Mr. Trump, despite what associates describe as his deep frustration with the president and talk of resignation.

2017-10-04.abstract: The British foreign secretary said a group of business people could turn a war-torn city into “the next Dubai” if they could just dispose of corpses there.
2017-10-04.snippet: The British foreign secretary said a group of business people could turn a war-torn city into “the next Dubai” if they could just dispose of corpses there.
2017-10-04.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Boris Johnson, Britain’s top diplomat, with a reputation for undiplomatic comments, came under fire on Wednesday for telling an audience at the Conservative Party’s annual conference that the Libyan city of Surt, a former stronghold of the Islamic State, could become “the next Dubai” if the authorities could just “clear the dead bodies away.”
2017-10-04.headline_main: A Dubai in Libya? Boris Johnson Says It Just Needs to Clear ‘Dead Bodies’

Set on Coney Island in the 1950s, the drama stars Justin Timberlake as a lifeguard who falls for a mobster’s imperiled wife (Juno Temple).
