2017-10-07.abstract: The two centerpieces of the Cubs’ lineup broke through against the Nationals’ Stephen Strasburg, who had a no-hitter for five innings.
2017-10-07.snippet: The two centerpieces of the Cubs’ lineup broke through against the Nationals’ Stephen Strasburg, who had a no-hitter for five innings.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Kris Bryant and Anthony Rizzo form the formidable heart of the Chicago Cubs’ lineup. So when Stephen Strasburg, the Washington Nationals’ starter, made them look silly in their first two at-bats of Game 1 of a National League division series on Friday night, it was a notable feat. They are rarely overmatched so completely in the same game.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Cubs Open Title Defense With a One-Two Punch From Bryant and Rizzo

2017-10-07.abstract: You can get your fix of frozen bananas and Bluth family egotism by streaming reruns of the show on Netflix.
2017-10-07.snippet: You can get your fix of frozen bananas and Bluth family egotism by streaming reruns of the show on Netflix.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: The fifth season of “Arrested Development” doesn’t arrive until next year, but until then, you can get your fix of frozen bananas and Bluth family egotism by streaming reruns of the show on Netflix.
2017-10-07.headline_main: 5 Things to Cook While Watching ‘Arrested Development’ Reruns

2017-10-07.abstract: When labor markets tighten, wages are expected to rise. But in recent years, as unemployment has fallen below 5 percent in the United States, wages have not been increasing as fast as in the past. Economists debate the reasons; workers grapple with the consequences.
2017-10-07.snippet: When labor markets tighten, wages are expected to rise. But in recent years, as unemployment has fallen below 5 percent in the United States, wages have not been increasing as fast as in the past. Economists debate the reasons; workers grapple wit...
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: When labor markets tighten, wages are expected to rise. But in recent years, as unemployment has fallen below 5 percent in the United States, wages have not been increasing as fast as in the past. Economists debate the reasons; workers grapple with the consequences.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Why Aren’t Wages Rising Faster Now That Unemployment Is Lower?

2017-10-07.abstract: Kyle Almaguer has a rare syndrome that has kept him in hospitals for most of his life. When Hurricane Harvey hit, his parents struggled to get him to safety. Now they face the daunting task of rebuilding.
2017-10-07.snippet: Kyle Almaguer has a rare syndrome that has kept him in hospitals for most of his life. When Hurricane Harvey hit, his parents struggled to get him to safety. Now they face the daunting task of rebuilding.

2017-10-07.headline_main: Rebuilding After Harvey: ‘Our Son Needs Us’

2017-10-07.abstract: The remote Haitian island of Île-à-Vache was devastated by Hurricane Matthew in October 2016. Some residents have been able to rebuild their homes. For others, it is taking longer.
2017-10-07.snippet: The remote Haitian island of Île-à-Vache was devastated by Hurricane Matthew in October 2016. Some residents have been able to rebuild their homes. For others, it is taking longer.

2017-10-07.abstract: Our top 10 comments of the week: Readers discussed the deadly shooting in Las Vegas, the death of Tom Petty, and Harvey Weinstein.
2017-10-07.snippet: Our top 10 comments of the week: Readers discussed the deadly shooting in Las Vegas, the death of Tom Petty, and Harvey Weinstein.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.
2017-10-07.headline_main: ‘I Applaud the Women With Courage to Step Forward’

2017-10-07.abstract: “It has completely overwhelmed us,” Dr. Thomas A. Andrew said of the opioid crisis. His new ambition: minister to the living about the dangers of drugs.
2017-10-07.snippet: “It has completely overwhelmed us,” Dr. Thomas A. Andrew said of the opioid crisis. His new ambition: minister to the living about the dangers of drugs.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: CONCORD, N.H. — In the state morgue here, in the industrial maze of a hospital basement, Dr. Thomas A. Andrew was slicing through the lung of a 36-year-old woman when white foam seeped out onto the autopsy table.
2017-10-07.headline_main: As Overdose Deaths Pile Up, a Medical Examiner Quits the Morgue

2017-10-07.abstract: In 1990, 47 women took to the road to demand the right to drive. They paid dearly for it, but they have lived to see the end of the ban.
2017-10-07.snippet: In 1990, 47 women took to the road to demand the right to drive. They paid dearly for it, but they have lived to see the end of the ban.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: They were arrested, suspended from jobs, shunned by relatives and denounced by clerics as loose women out to destroy society. Their offense? They did what many in Saudi Arabia considered unthinkable: getting in cars and driving.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Once Shunned as ‘Drivers,’ Saudi Women Who Fought Ban Now Celebrate

2017-10-07.abstract: Even as job markets are tight in many major economies, low unemployment is failing to spur robust increases in wages, leaving workers angry.
2017-10-07.snippet: Even as job markets are tight in many major economies, low unemployment is failing to spur robust increases in wages, leaving workers angry.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: LILLESTROM, Norway — In the three-plus decades since Ola Karlsson began painting houses and offices for a living, he has seen oil wealth transform the Norwegian economy. He has participated in a construction boom that has refashioned Oslo, the capital. He has watched the rent climb at his apartment in the center of the city.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Global Economy’s Stubborn Reality: Plenty of Work, Not Enough Pay

2017-10-07.abstract: In a deal similar to the one that turned the tide against AIDS, manufacturers and charities will make chemotherapy drugs available in six poor countries at steep discounts.
2017-10-07.snippet: In a deal similar to the one that turned the tide against AIDS, manufacturers and charities will make chemotherapy drugs available in six poor countries at steep discounts.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — In a remarkable initiative modeled on the campaign against AIDS in Africa, two major pharmaceutical companies, working with the American Cancer Society, will steeply discount the prices of cancer medicines in Africa.
2017-10-07.headline_main: As Cancer Tears Through Africa, Drug Makers Draw Up a Battle Plan

2017-10-07.abstract: U.S. officials appear powerless to secure their release, and the dozen detainees may be bargaining chips in Turkey’s attempts to have Fethullah Gulen extradited.
2017-10-07.snippet: U.S. officials appear powerless to secure their release, and the dozen detainees may be bargaining chips in Turkey’s attempts to have Fethullah Gulen extradited.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: HATAY, Turkey — One is a NASA scientist who was vacationing with relatives in Turkey. Another is a Christian missionary who has lived in Turkey for 23 years. Others include a visiting chemistry professor from Pennsylvania and his brother, a real estate agent.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Americans Jailed After Failed Coup in Turkey Are Hostages to Politics

2017-10-07.abstract: The Swedish journalist’s severed head and legs were among the remains recovered. The inventor Peter Madsen has been charged in her killing.
2017-10-07.snippet: The Swedish journalist’s severed head and legs were among the remains recovered. The inventor Peter Madsen has been charged in her killing.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM — The Danish police said on Saturday that divers had recovered the severed head and legs of the Swedish journalist Kim Wall in a bay, as well as crucial evidence that is inconsistent with a Danish inventor’s explanation of how she had died on his submarine.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Danish Police Recover Body Parts of the Journalist Kim Wall

2017-10-07.abstract: They were involved for years in triangles with Yves Saint Laurent and others. Now Mr. Cox finds himself the guardian of the fashion designer’s legacy.
2017-10-07.snippet: They were involved for years in triangles with Yves Saint Laurent and others. Now Mr. Cox finds himself the guardian of the fashion designer’s legacy.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: As two museums devoted to the designer Yves Saint Laurent open this month, in Paris and Marrakesh, there has been plenty of chatter in fashion and cafe society (what’s left of it) about the estate of Pierre Bergé, the pugnacious business brain behind the original Yves Saint Laurent fashion empire.
2017-10-07.headline_main: For Madison Cox, Widower of Pierre Bergé, C’est Compliqué

2017-10-07.abstract: The company was struggling before a New York Times investigation found the entertainment mogul had paid off multiple harassment accusers. Now it’s in serious trouble.
2017-10-07.snippet: The company was struggling before a New York Times investigation found the entertainment mogul had paid off multiple harassment accusers. Now it’s in serious trouble.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — A bicoastal staff meeting of the Weinstein Company was hastily convened late Thursday. Staff members were scared and shaken after public complaints of sexual harassment against Harvey Weinstein, the entertainment company’s pugnacious co-founder. With the help of a video conferencing system, David Glasser, the Weinstein Company’s president and chief operating officer, tried to rally the troops.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Without Harvey Weinstein, Is There a Weinstein Company?

2017-10-07.abstract: “I was drawn to people really striving for individual style in a country where it's hard to have individual style,” said Rose Cromwell, a photographer who has been going to Cuba since 2005.
2017-10-07.snippet: “I was drawn to people really striving for individual style in a country where it's hard to have individual style,” said Rose Cromwell, a photographer who has been going to Cuba since 2005.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Angel Lazaro, 29, was hanging out with his friends (who call him Mayito) at Bar Roma, on the rooftop of a 1920s building in Old Havana. Mr. Lazaro hadn’t ended up at the bar from seeing it on the street. There was no sign outside indicating that a ride up in a rickety open-air elevator would lead him to one of the city’s most interesting watering holes.
2017-10-07.headline_main: In Cuba, Sourcing Style

2017-10-07.abstract: After a renovation, the Suttle Lodge emanates a sort of Wes Anderson Goes Glamping vibe, with a menu of expertly executed grown-up camp food.
2017-10-07.snippet: After a renovation, the Suttle Lodge emanates a sort of Wes Anderson Goes Glamping vibe, with a menu of expertly executed grown-up camp food.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: There are fish sandwiches, and then there is the fish and chips sandwich at the Boathouse, an all-day counter service spot tucked into an actual former boathouse at the Suttle Lodge, a magisterial 1930s-era property located in central Oregon’s Deschutes National Forest. A brawny trout filet is encrusted in pulverized Kettle brand potato chips, fried golden brown, and crammed into a squishy potato bun like a linebacker into a tutu. Accompanied by tartar sauce, pickles and iceberg lettuce, it’s less a sandwich than a piping-hot mess of pleasure.
2017-10-07.headline_main: On an Oregon Lake, a Lodge Serving Kicked-Up Camp Food

2017-10-07.abstract: The New York Giants star receiver drops by two promotional events and considers whether he’d emulate Mike Tyson.
2017-10-07.snippet: The New York Giants star receiver drops by two promotional events and considers whether he’d emulate Mike Tyson.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: On a recent Wednesday night, Odell Beckham Jr. and his phalanx of security guards and cronies poured through a back entrance at the House of Morgan, an imposing financial district landmark that was once the headquarters of J.P. Morgan and is now an event space. Today’s business was selling shoes, and the New York Giants star receiver was there to promote a new Nike collection from Virgil Abloh, the designer of Off-White.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Odell Beckham Jr. on a Nike-Powered Swing Through SoHo

2017-10-07.abstract: The author Gretchen Rubin’s division of people into Upholders, Obligers, Questioners and Rebels has earned her a devoted following. But I’m skeptical.
2017-10-07.snippet: The author Gretchen Rubin’s division of people into Upholders, Obligers, Questioners and Rebels has earned her a devoted following. But I’m skeptical.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: A few years ago, Gretchen Rubin, the best-selling self-help author, pivoted from the happiness racket into the habit business with her seventh book, “Better Than Before: Mastering the Habits of Our Everyday Lives.” Embedded in it was a personality typing system of her own invention she called the Four Tendencies: a homage to Freud’s “fateful tendencies.”
2017-10-07.headline_main: Whatever Happened to Just Being Type A?

2017-10-07.abstract: As the region threatens to declare independence from Spain, divisions have deepened between the national police and the regional force.
2017-10-07.snippet: As the region threatens to declare independence from Spain, divisions have deepened between the national police and the regional force.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: SANT BOI DE LLOBREGAT, Spain — Standing in front of his apartment across from barracks occupied by Spain’s national police, Xavi Gomez recounted the dueling protests over Catalonian independence that unfolded on his street the previous night.
2017-10-07.headline_main: In Catalonia Independence Push, Policing Becomes Politicized

2017-10-07.abstract: Russian hacking, secret payments to Paul Manafort, suspicions of missile technology smuggled to North Korea — seemingly all illicit roads lead back to one country.
2017-10-07.snippet: Russian hacking, secret payments to Paul Manafort, suspicions of missile technology smuggled to North Korea — seemingly all illicit roads lead back to one country.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: POLTAVA, Ukraine — After four years of investigation by the German police, the F.B.I. and other crime-fighting agencies around the world, heavily armed security officers stormed an apartment in the central Ukrainian town of Poltava. After a brief exchange of gunfire, they captured their prey: the man suspected of leading a cybercrime gang accused of stealing more than $100 million.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Schooled in Scandal: What Makes Ukraine a Hotbed of Intrigue

2017-10-07.abstract: “Edge of Desire,” watched nightly by some 50 million Brazilians, is shaping perceptions about gender identity in a nation where transgender people face stigmatization and violence.
2017-10-07.snippet: “Edge of Desire,” watched nightly by some 50 million Brazilians, is shaping perceptions about gender identity in a nation where transgender people face stigmatization and violence.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — “Edge of Desire,” a popular prime-time soap opera chronicling the transition of a transgender man, was about to start, and the residents at a shelter seemed oblivious to the sirens wailing outside and the cockroaches navigating a maze of dirty feet and popcorn bowls on the floor.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Transgender Brazilians Embrace Hit Soap Opera: ‘Now You Can See Us’

2017-10-07.abstract: A landlord wants to inspect apartments in a rent-regulated complex, making tenants anxious.
2017-10-07.snippet: A landlord wants to inspect apartments in a rent-regulated complex, making tenants anxious.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Q. I live a in a rent-regulated apartment complex in Corona, Queens. The landlord hired a private investigator to inspect every apartment to “ensure the level of quality in the building.” The inspection company, run by retired police officers, specializes in criminal investigations and surveillance, and uses policing techniques. Tenants must provide photo identification and sign an inspection checklist. This feels like an invasion of privacy that goes beyond typical maintenance-related inspections. Must I comply? If I refuse, could the landlord evict me?
2017-10-07.headline_main: Do I Have to Allow a Private Investigator Into My Apartment?

2017-10-07.abstract: The seizure of a key town shows that the government is taking back the country from the extremists, Yemeni officials say.
2017-10-07.snippet: The seizure of a key town shows that the government is taking back the country from the extremists, Yemeni officials say.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: AZZAN, Yemen — As hundreds of Yemeni troops rolled in here in August to attack Qaeda militants, secondary school students were sitting for final exams. Helicopters buzzed overhead and armed vehicles patrolled the streets, but the school’s principal, Saleh Al Wahidi, did not dismiss his students.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Yemenis See Turning Point After Ousting Qaeda Militants in South

2017-10-07.abstract: The driver was arrested then released, and the police said they were not treating the crash as a terrorist-related incident.
2017-10-07.snippet: The driver was arrested then released, and the police said they were not treating the crash as a terrorist-related incident.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The London police arrested a man on Saturday after his car jumped the curb and crashed into several pedestrians near the Natural History Museum, injuring at least 11 people, the authorities said.
2017-10-07.headline_main: At Least 11 Injured After Driver Crashes Car Into Pedestrians Near London History Museum

2017-10-07.abstract: President Trump’s aides, who once debated a scorched-earth strategy, hope the special counsel on Russia will give the president the public exoneration he has long sought.
2017-10-07.snippet: President Trump’s aides, who once debated a scorched-earth strategy, hope the special counsel on Russia will give the president the public exoneration he has long sought.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — White House officials once debated a scorched-earth strategy of publicly criticizing and undercutting Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel investigating Russian efforts to disrupt last year’s election. Now, President Trump’s lawyers are pursuing a different course: cooperating with the special counsel in the hope that Mr. Mueller will declare in the coming months that Mr. Trump is not a target of the Russia inquiry.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Hoping to Have Trump Cleared, Legal Team Eases Resistance to Inquiry

2017-10-07.abstract: Economic sanctions imposed on Sudan had turned it into a pariah state, with a national airline reduced to one plane. Their lifting is expected to increase Western investment.
2017-10-07.snippet: Economic sanctions imposed on Sudan had turned it into a pariah state, with a national airline reduced to one plane. Their lifting is expected to increase Western investment.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — Sudan Airways regularly ranks among the worst airlines in the world. The national carrier has only one working plane, and it has suffered so many deadly accidents in recent years that passengers have acquired the habit of praying before takeoff.
2017-10-07.headline_main: In Long-Isolated Sudan, ‘Lot of Excitement’ as U.S. Sanctions End

2017-10-07.abstract: Opossums, raccoons and deer all but disappeared from Everglades National Park in Florida after the Burmese python invaded. When they vanished, mosquitos turned to feeding on rats that can carry encephalitis. That could put humans at risk.
2017-10-07.snippet: Opossums, raccoons and deer all but disappeared from Everglades National Park in Florida after the Burmese python invaded. When they vanished, mosquitos turned to feeding on rats that can carry encephalitis. That could put humans at risk.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Opossums, raccoons and deer all but disappeared from Everglades National Park in Florida after the Burmese python invaded. When they vanished, mosquitos turned to feeding on rats that can carry encephalitis. That could put humans at risk.
2017-10-07.headline_main: How Pet Snakes Set Off an Unlikely Chain of Events That Could Make You Sick

2017-10-07.abstract: Richard Silvestri offers us a fun cryptic crossword to tackle.
2017-10-07.snippet: Richard Silvestri offers us a fun cryptic crossword to tackle.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — I’ve known about cryptic crosswords for a long time, but I always thought that I would never be able to solve them, what with all those mystifying clues. Shame on me.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Variety: Cryptic Crossword

2017-10-07.abstract: The Las Vegas gunman was a savvy businessman and an absentee neighbor who lived on his own terms, according to people who knew him.
2017-10-07.snippet: The Las Vegas gunman was a savvy businessman and an absentee neighbor who lived on his own terms, according to people who knew him.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Stephen Paddock was a contradiction: a gambler who took no chances. A man with houses everywhere who did not really live in any of them. Someone who liked the high life of casinos but drove a nondescript minivan and dressed casually, even sloppily, in flip-flops and sweatsuits. He did not use Facebook or Twitter, but spent the past 25 years staring at screens of video poker machines.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Who Was Stephen Paddock? The Mystery of a Nondescript ‘Numbers Guy’

2017-10-07.abstract: At least 22 people were killed across Costa Rica, Honduras and Nicaragua. The storm was upgraded to a hurricane as it plowed toward the Gulf Coast.
2017-10-07.snippet: At least 22 people were killed across Costa Rica, Honduras and Nicaragua. The storm was upgraded to a hurricane as it plowed toward the Gulf Coast.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Tropical Storm Nate barreled up the eastern coast of Central America this week, leaving destruction in its wake before being upgraded to a category 1 hurricane as it moved toward the United States.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Tropical Storm Nate Kills 22 in Central America Amid Flooding and Landslides

2017-10-07.abstract: People thronged to demonstrations in the two cities as Catalan leaders appeared on the verge of announcing independence.
2017-10-07.snippet: People thronged to demonstrations in the two cities as Catalan leaders appeared on the verge of announcing independence.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Spain — Thousands of people took to the streets for rallies in Madrid and Barcelona on Saturday as Catalan leaders appeared on the verge of announcing a unilateral declaration of independence from Spain, setting up a potential showdown with the national government.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Amid Catalan Crisis, Thousands Hold Rallies in Madrid and Barcelona

2017-10-07.abstract: Readers discuss and expand on the eight steps offered in an editorial last Sunday.
2017-10-07.snippet: Readers discuss and expand on the eight steps offered in an editorial last Sunday.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-10-07.headline_main: Solving the Opioid Epidemic

2017-10-07.abstract: The tug of war between establishment and upstart forces foreshadows a reorganization of the left that could reshape the Democratic Party’s ideology.
2017-10-07.snippet: The tug of war between establishment and upstart forces foreshadows a reorganization of the left that could reshape the Democratic Party’s ideology.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It started as a scrappy grass-roots protest movement against President Trump, but now the so-called resistance is attracting six- and seven-figure checks from major liberal donors, posing an insurgent challenge to some of the left’s most venerable institutions — and the Democratic Party itself.
2017-10-07.headline_main: The ‘Resistance,’ Raising Big Money, Upends Liberal Politics

2017-10-07.abstract: The London police detained a driver on Saturday after his car injured several pedestrians near the Natural History Museum. The crash, police said, appeared to be a “road traffic collision” and not terrorism.
2017-10-07.snippet: The London police detained a driver on Saturday after his car injured several pedestrians near the Natural History Museum. The crash, police said, appeared to be a “road traffic collision” and not terrorism.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: The London police detained a driver on Saturday after his car injured several pedestrians near the Natural History Museum. The crash, police said, appeared to be a “road traffic collision” and not terrorism.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Car Crashes Into Pedestrians in London

2017-10-07.abstract: As an equipment specialist, or “suit tech,” Mr. Schmitt was responsible for hooking up Alan Shepard, John Glenn and other astronauts before blastoff.
2017-10-07.snippet: As an equipment specialist, or “suit tech,” Mr. Schmitt was responsible for hooking up Alan Shepard, John Glenn and other astronauts before blastoff.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Joseph W. Schmitt, who as one of NASA’s earliest “suit techs” was often the last person to have face-to-face contact with astronauts before they shot skyward on their historic missions, died on Sept. 25 in Friendswood, Tex. He was 101.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Joseph Schmitt, 101, Spacesuit Technician for Early Astronauts, Dies

2017-10-07.abstract: With 90 percent of the island without power, Puerto Rico has become a place where houses, stores, apartments and public buildings run on diesel generators.
2017-10-07.snippet: With 90 percent of the island without power, Puerto Rico has become a place where houses, stores, apartments and public buildings run on diesel generators.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — Like many other frivolous things on the island these days, the shiny motorcycles at the Planet Honda showroom have been pushed to the side.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Minus Electrical Grid, Puerto Rico Becomes Generator Island

2017-10-07.abstract: Youths across Russia answered a protest call from the jailed opposition leader, Aleksei Navalny, but bad weather and fear of a harsh police response limited the turnout in Moscow.
2017-10-07.snippet: Youths across Russia answered a protest call from the jailed opposition leader, Aleksei Navalny, but bad weather and fear of a harsh police response limited the turnout in Moscow.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Answering a protest call issued from behind bars by the jailed Russian opposition leader Aleksei A. Navalny, small crowds of mostly young people gathered in towns across Russia on Saturday in a wave of nationwide demonstrations. The protests were timed to coincide with the 65th birthday of President Vladimir V. Putin.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Russians, Heeding Navalny’s Call, Mark Putin’s Birthday With Protest

2017-10-07.abstract: President Trump proposed yet another effort to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, but Senator Chuck Schumer later said he had quickly shot down the offer.
2017-10-07.snippet: President Trump proposed yet another effort to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, but Senator Chuck Schumer later said he had quickly shot down the offer.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump reached out to the Senate Democratic leader, Chuck Schumer, on Friday to propose yet another effort to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, but Mr. Schumer later said he had quickly shot down the offer.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Schumer Says He Rebuffed Another Offer From Trump on Health Care

2017-10-07.abstract: Ms. Bloom had been counseling the Hollywood mogul, who faces sexual harassment allegations, but was rebuked by at least two board members, including his brother, Bob Weinstein.
2017-10-07.snippet: Ms. Bloom had been counseling the Hollywood mogul, who faces sexual harassment allegations, but was rebuked by at least two board members, including his brother, Bob Weinstein.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: The lawyer Lisa Bloom resigned on Saturday as an adviser to Harvey Weinstein, the high-powered film producer facing allegations of rampant sexual harassment, amid harsh criticism of her handling of his defense.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Lisa Bloom, Lawyer Advising Harvey Weinstein, Resigns Amid Criticism From Board Members

2017-10-07.abstract: Desperate for hard currency to keep their operations afloat, diplomats from the so-called hermit kingdom smuggle liquor, drugs, cars and guns — and engage in more mundane activities.
2017-10-07.snippet: Desperate for hard currency to keep their operations afloat, diplomats from the so-called hermit kingdom smuggle liquor, drugs, cars and guns — and engage in more mundane activities.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: SOFIA, Bulgaria — While the embassies of most countries promote the interests of companies back home, North Korea’s are in business for themselves.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Hosting Proms and Selling Cows: North Korean Embassies Scrounge for Cash

2017-10-07.abstract: There is no war scenario that ends in victory.
2017-10-07.snippet: There is no war scenario that ends in victory.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — I cannot turn my thoughts from the news article I happened to see a few days ago. A man in his 70s accidentally dropped two thick wads of cash in the street. Two people who happened upon this bundle of money and shared it between them were caught by the police, made to give up the money and charged with theft.
2017-10-07.headline_main: While the U.S. Talks of War, South Korea Shudders

2017-10-07.abstract: His brigade is motley. His agenda? Disruption for its own ugly sake.
2017-10-07.snippet: His brigade is motley. His agenda? Disruption for its own ugly sake.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Remember all the talk, before Steve Bannon was expectorated from the Trump administration, that he’d be a worse menace on the outside than on the inside?
2017-10-07.headline_main: Yes, Steve Bannon Should Terrify You

2017-10-07.abstract: Despite fears that automation will eliminate jobs, work is actually plentiful across the world.
2017-10-07.snippet: Despite fears that automation will eliminate jobs, work is actually plentiful across the world.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: The recovery from the crisis of 2008 has been one of the weakest on record, but never in postwar history has so little growth created so many jobs. The unemployment rate in the developed world is down to 5.5 percent and approaching a 40-year low. This flies in the face of all the dire warnings about a “jobless future.”
2017-10-07.headline_main: No, That Robot Will Not Steal Your Job

2017-10-07.abstract: Machines will make a raft of decisions for my kids and others like them as they proceed through life. I’m worried.
2017-10-07.snippet: Machines will make a raft of decisions for my kids and others like them as they proceed through life. I’m worried.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: “You are going to have a chance to play with Alexa,” I told my daughter, Grace, who’s 3 years old. Pointing at the black cylindrical device, I explained that the speaker, also known as the Amazon Echo, was a bit like Siri but smarter. “You can ask it anything you want,” I said nonchalantly.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Co-Parenting With Alexa

2017-10-07.abstract: Don’t be fooled. Republicans and the gun lobby are still very much in love.
2017-10-07.snippet: Don’t be fooled. Republicans and the gun lobby are still very much in love.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: FOR years, Republicans have effectively outsourced their thought leadership to the loudmouths at the end of the bar. But perhaps the most extreme example of that trend has been the issue of guns, where the party has ceded control to a gun lobby that has built its brand on absolutism.
2017-10-07.headline_main: N.R.A. and G.O.P., Together Forever

2017-10-07.abstract: Harvey Weinstein and the predations of progressive men.
2017-10-07.snippet: Harvey Weinstein and the predations of progressive men.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: If you are surprised by the news that Harvey Weinstein of Miramax fame, a man well known for profane tirades and physical altercations and scrounging M&Ms off movie theater floors, is also the sort of charmer who loafs around semi-nude while asking subordinates for “back” massages, then you can be surprised by just about anything: the sun rising in the east, the fact that movie stars employ plastic surgeons, the news that “The Artist” didn’t actually deserve to win Best Picture.
2017-10-07.headline_main: The Pigs of Liberalism

2017-10-07.abstract: Hunters like me can help lead the gun control debate away from polemic.
2017-10-07.snippet: Hunters like me can help lead the gun control debate away from polemic.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: BEND, Ore. — When we hike together, my oldest son, who is 5, scans the ground for the perfect “gun.” His ideal stick has an ergonomic crook in it and is a comfortable size to hold. When he finds one like that, he lifts it for a test fire — pew, pew. A mile in, he’s usually got one in each hand but is still on the lookout for an upgrade: anything smoother or more gunlike. My youngest, who is 2, isn’t far behind. He’s been saying the word “gun” for more than a year.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Confessions of a Sensible Gun Owner

2017-10-07.abstract: My Republican friends think I’m missing something. Am I?
2017-10-07.snippet: My Republican friends think I’m missing something. Am I?
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: IT’S an odd feeling when you find yourself effectively living on an island unconnected to people with whom you were once politically close. But it’s a feeling with which I’ve become very familiar.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Seeing Trump Through a Glass, Darkly

2017-10-07.abstract: Global warming rejecters like President Trump and Scott Pruitt are having more and more difficulty defending their position.
2017-10-07.snippet: Global warming rejecters like President Trump and Scott Pruitt are having more and more difficulty defending their position.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Climate images have never been able to convey our full planetary danger until now. The extraordinary recent four-punch sequence of hurricanes — Harvey, Irma, Jose and Maria — threatened the lives of millions of people, obliterated their homes and has raised doubts that some places will ever recover. The rest of us have a newly immediate sense of catastrophes of biblical proportions. As meaning-hungry creatures we search for explanations. No wonder some have embraced the apocalyptic narrative of total destruction by an angry deity. And no wonder that climate-change rejecters like President Trump have increasing difficulty defending their position.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Our Changing Climate Mind-Set

2017-10-07.abstract: A friend, reflecting on his son’s opioid journey, once remarked, “I wish I’d held him closer.” Is it ever close enough?
2017-10-07.snippet: A friend, reflecting on his son’s opioid journey, once remarked, “I wish I’d held him closer.” Is it ever close enough?
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Here’s how I imagined it would go over the summer: He would have come up to stay with me and my husband for a long weekend, maybe a week even, away from the friends who gave him shelter when he was using drugs. From the specter that seemed to surface every few months like clockwork. We’d known him since he was in the womb, but that wasn’t the same as knowing him now. Still, we thought he’d come to stay and go to the beach nearby and body surf and stroll along the esplanade, smoking, gazing out at the swans and the geese he loved to feed back when he was a little boy and would come to visit.
2017-10-07.headline_main: When an Epidemic Is Personal

2017-10-07.abstract: Mayor de Blasio has failed to make distinctions that should have been apparent.
2017-10-07.snippet: Mayor de Blasio has failed to make distinctions that should have been apparent.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio, born Warren Wilhelm Jr., has long identified with his Italian heritage, bequeathed by his mother’s family. But to the organizers of a Columbus Day parade that will be held Sunday in the Bronx, the mayor is, as one of them put it, “a fake Italian.” He will not reign on their parade. That’s because he is conspicuously not invited (though he plans to march Monday in the big Columbus Day procession along Fifth Avenue).
2017-10-07.headline_main: Robert E. Lee, Christopher Columbus ... and Pétain?

2017-10-07.abstract: It’s unsettling to hear ordinary North Koreans talk of war with calm acceptance.
2017-10-07.snippet: It’s unsettling to hear ordinary North Koreans talk of war with calm acceptance.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Pyongyang, North Korea — North Korea’s capital city is awash in propaganda. Posters depicting missiles, some striking the United States Capitol, hang along major streets. In recent days, a million civilians, including high school students, factory workers and older men who long ago completed their military service, have signed up at the government’s request to fight the United States, if needed.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Seeing the North Korean Stalemate From the Other Side

2017-10-07.abstract: The void is as old as time, but it was a human innovation to harness it with a symbol.
2017-10-07.snippet: The void is as old as time, but it was a human innovation to harness it with a symbol.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Carbon dating of an ancient Indian document, the Bakhshali manuscript, has recently placed the first written occurrence of the number zero in the third or fourth century A.D., about 500 years earlier than previously believed. While the news has no practical bearing on the infrastructure of zeros (and ones) underlying our high-tech civilization, it does remind us how indebted we are for this invention. But to whom is this debt owed? And how should it be repaid?
2017-10-07.headline_main: Who Invented ‘Zero’?

2017-10-07.abstract: A woman said she was assaulted by the multiplatinum rapper on a tour bus in a Walmart parking lot.
2017-10-07.snippet: A woman said she was assaulted by the multiplatinum rapper on a tour bus in a Walmart parking lot.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Nelly, the multiplatinum St. Louis rapper, was arrested early Saturday morning in Auburn, Wash., after a woman accused the musician of raping her on his tour bus, according to local police.

2017-10-07.abstract: Leonardo Curzio quit in protest over demands to fire two co-hosts, and he compared the government’s influence over the media to “a disease that kills you slowly.”

2017-10-07.abstract: Hawkins, a playground legend in New York, did not make his N.B.A. debut until age 27 because of unfounded connections to a point-shaving scandal.
2017-10-07.snippet: Hawkins, a playground legend in New York, did not make his N.B.A. debut until age 27 because of unfounded connections to a point-shaving scandal.
2017-10-07.lead_paragraph: Connie Hawkins, a high-flying basketball sensation who was molded on the playgrounds of New York and inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame, but whose career was unjustly derailed when the N.B.A. barred him until his prime years had passed on suspicions of involvement in a college point-shaving scandal, died on Friday. He was 75.
2017-10-07.headline_main: Connie Hawkins, Electrifying N.B.A. Forward Barred in His Prime, Dies at 75

2017-10-07.abstract: The Yankees’ detail-obsessed manager invited a lot of scrutiny by not asking for a replay review of an inaccurate call in a playoff loss to the Indians on Friday night.

2017-10-08.lead_paragraph: MONROVIA, Liberia — For years, politicians have gamed the system during election season in Liberia, handing out food, money and clothes with promises of future largess, only to disappear behind tinted S.U.V. windows once they get into office.

2017-10-08.lead_paragraph: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif. — Movie potentates were peppered across the Tower Bar here as usual on Friday night. Over in one dimly lit corner sat a martini-drinking movie star and his manager. And the restaurant’s lively owner, Jeff Klein, worked the room as he normally does, pausing to schmooze here and shake an important hand there.

2017-10-08.lead_paragraph: Toward the end of Hope Jahren’s memoir, “Lab Girl,” the geobiologist author curses — twice in one paragraph — at a clump of moss. As soon as I read that page, I knew I’d give Ms. Jahren’s memoir to my friend, a cheerfully profane biology major. When I finished reading “Wild,” Cheryl Strayed’s memoir about hiking and grieving, I bought two copies: one for a friend who is an intrepid solo traveler, and one for my mother, who lost her own mother too young.

2017-10-08.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Zack Greinke sat at the far end of the visiting clubhouse at Dodger Stadium on Saturday night and used his shiny silver suitcase, which was not much bigger than the strike zone, as a footstool. While sipping water from a bottle, Greinke drank in the scene as one teammate after another was encircled by reporters.
2017-10-08.headline_main: Battered by the Dodgers, Diamondbacks Turn to Plan Z — Zack Greinke

2017-10-08.abstract: Hurricane Nate sped ashore in Mississippi as a Category 1 storm and quickly weakened, leaving Gulf Coast residents relieved that it wasn’t worse.
2017-10-08.snippet: Hurricane Nate sped ashore in Mississippi as a Category 1 storm and quickly weakened, leaving Gulf Coast residents relieved that it wasn’t worse.
2017-10-08.lead_paragraph: BILOXI, Miss. — As Hurricane Nate cut a path through the central Gulf Coast overnight with roaring winds and a rush of storm-surge flooding, a limb snapped from a tree and landed on the windshield of Terry Gentry’s convertible, cracking the glass and bending the hood.
2017-10-08.headline_main: In a Season of Monsters, Gulf Coast Feels Lucky All It Got Was Nate

2017-10-08.snippet: The Weinstein Company’s board announced Mr. Weinstein’s firing on Sunday, days after The New York Times reported on decades of harassment allegations.
2017-10-08.lead_paragraph: The Weinstein Company fired its co-founder Harvey Weinstein on Sunday, after a New York Times investigation uncovered allegations that he had engaged in rampant sexual harassment, dealing a stunning blow to a producer known for shaping American film and championing liberal causes.
2017-10-08.headline_main: Harvey Weinstein Is Fired After Sexual Harassment Reports

2017-10-08.abstract: The Jewish publication, which recently became a monthly magazine, has been aggressively reporting on so-called alt-right and white nationalist groups.
2017-10-08.snippet: The Jewish publication, which recently became a monthly magazine, has been aggressively reporting on so-called alt-right and white nationalist groups.
2017-10-08.lead_paragraph: The Forward has chronicled the experiences of Jews in the United States for 120 years. Initially published as a Yiddish-language lifeline for those who fled hatred and strife in Europe, in recent years it had to work harder to stay relevant to a community now largely assimilated, finding new stories to tell about transgender rabbis, the challenges of interfaith marriage and even the “secret Jewish history of The Who.”
2017-10-08.headline_main: Anti-Semitism’s Rise Gives The Forward New Resolve

2017-10-08.abstract: In a Facebook ad for Dove body wash, a black woman removes her shirt to reveal a white woman. The company apologized, but similar ads by others have been common.

2017-10-08.lead_paragraph: In a Facebook ad for Dove body wash, a black woman removes her brown shirt and — voilà! Underneath is a white woman in a light shirt.
2017-10-08.headline_main: Dove Drops an Ad Accused of Racism

2017-10-09.abstract: Baker was the Cubs’ manager in 2003 when everything went haywire just as a World Series seemed to be in reach. Now the Cubs are the champs, and Baker still waits.
2017-10-09.snippet: Baker was the Cubs’ manager in 2003 when everything went haywire just as a World Series seemed to be in reach. Now the Cubs are the champs, and Baker still waits.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Dusty Baker has managed almost 1,800 games since that fateful night, so many years ago, when ghosts still haunted Wrigley Field and played their cruelest trick. The Chicago Cubs banished them forever last autumn, finally capturing a World Series title after more than a century of anguish. In the end, perhaps, the torment of waiting made the triumph even sweeter.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Dusty Baker Is Back at Wrigley Field, Still Looking for a Ring of His Own

2017-10-09.headline_main: Greg Bird Preserves Yankees’ Season, Toppling the Indians With a Lone Blast

2017-10-09.abstract: In the violent, male-dominated world of the Times Square sex industry, maybe the question of “Why?” misses the point.
2017-10-09.snippet: In the violent, male-dominated world of the Times Square sex industry, maybe the question of “Why?” misses the point.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: This week’s episode opens with a fake-out. When we hear the command “Order up” over a greasy-spoon breakfast tray, we assume the episode is starting at Leon’s, which serves as a kind of home base for pimps and prostitutes at the beginning of the day. (Or, more likely, the end of the night, given the hours they keep.) But, in fact, we’re in a restaurant in Darlene’s North Carolina hometown, and Darlene is holding court with her old friends, who are calling her by her real name, Donna. The story she’s selling is a powerful one: She’s come back from New York City a more glamorous and confident woman. She’s got a man who’s taking care of her. They, too, can leave their humdrum lives behind and take a bite out of the Big Apple.
2017-10-09.headline_main: ‘The Deuce’ Season 1, Episode 5: The Way It Is

2017-10-09.abstract: Late-night shows have been quiet about the sexual harassment allegations facing Mr. Weinstein, a prominent liberal. Conservatives see a double standard.
2017-10-09.snippet: Late-night shows have been quiet about the sexual harassment allegations facing Mr. Weinstein, a prominent liberal. Conservatives see a double standard.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: The downfall of Harvey Weinstein would seem like obvious grist for TV’s late-night comedy shows. Mr. Weinstein was facing three decades’ worth of allegations that he sexually harassed women; on Sunday, his own film studio fired him. The story seemed to parallel those of other powerful men who were confronted with numerous accounts of sexual misdeeds, including Bill O’Reilly, Roger Ailes and President Trump — all of whom were widely pilloried in the monologues of the late-night hosts and on shows like “Saturday Night Live.”
2017-10-09.headline_main: ‘S.N.L.’ Prepped Jokes About Harvey Weinstein, Then Shelved Them

2017-10-09.abstract: Natural wines have taken off in Copenhagen, and seem tailor-made for a vibrant food scene that shuns pesticides and additives.
2017-10-09.snippet: Natural wines have taken off in Copenhagen, and seem tailor-made for a vibrant food scene that shuns pesticides and additives.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: In a wine shop called Rodder & Vin in the Norrebro neighborhood, two men were talking about natural wine. They sounded like music geeks in a record shop discussing who was a better frontman for AC/DC. They weren’t just talking about sommeliers and natural winemakers, but particular sommeliers and importers and their effect on Copenhagen’s flourishing natural wine scene.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Natural Wine Movement Finds a Lively Hub in Copenhagen

2017-10-09.abstract: Fifty years after the revolutionary leader was shot to death in Bolivia, his symbolic power remains.
2017-10-09.snippet: Fifty years after the revolutionary leader was shot to death in Bolivia, his symbolic power remains.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Fifty years ago, the news spread rapidly around the world: Che Guevara was dead, again, and this time, it seemed likely to be true.

2017-10-09.abstract: Residents of a tiny Bolivian hamlet vividly recall the day the guerrilla leader was shot at their school. “For us, this was a time of suffering,” says a woman who brought him soup.
2017-10-09.snippet: Residents of a tiny Bolivian hamlet vividly recall the day the guerrilla leader was shot at their school. “For us, this was a time of suffering,” says a woman who brought him soup.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: LA HIGUERA, Bolivia — Irma Rosales, tired after decades of tending her tiny store, sat back one morning with a box full of photos and remembered the stranger who was shot in the local schoolhouse 50 years ago.

2017-10-09.snippet: Five years before Qatar hosts the 2022 World Cup, the state of soccer there is still very much a work in progress.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: DOHA, Qatar — On the sideline of a grass soccer field a few hundred yards from the recently renovated Khalifa International Stadium, Bora Milutinovic is receiving a stream of well-wishers in four languages. Milutinovic, who has taken the national teams of five countries to the World Cup, shakes hands with dozens of people, seamlessly switching among Serbian, Spanish, German and English, as a match begins in front of him.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Qatar Has a World Cup Date. It Still Needs a World-Class Team.

2017-10-09.snippet: Boston went out in three games in the 2016 postseason and seemed about to do so again. But led by David Price’s stellar relief work, the Red Sox rallied for a 10-3 win.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — The Cleveland Indians had swept the Boston Red Sox in a division series last year and now, on Sunday afternoon at Fenway Park, the Houston Astros were seven innings from doing the same.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Red Sox Rouse Themselves to Beat Astros and Avoid Another Playoff Sweep

2017-10-09.abstract: Joseph Lombardo, the head of the Las Vegas police, must grapple with finding the motive for a horrific mass shooting while keeping the public calm and reporters at bay.
2017-10-09.snippet: Joseph Lombardo, the head of the Las Vegas police, must grapple with finding the motive for a horrific mass shooting while keeping the public calm and reporters at bay.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — In nearly 30 years with the Las Vegas police, Joseph Lombardo has helped defuse an armed standoff between federal agents and local ranchers, struggled to contain a spike in homicides and defended his officers against accusations of using excessive force against a professional football player.

2017-10-09.abstract: A Times investigation shows how Amtrak, wanting to keep trains running and favoring a nearby development project, put off replacing deteriorating tracks.
2017-10-09.snippet: A Times investigation shows how Amtrak, wanting to keep trains running and favoring a nearby development project, put off replacing deteriorating tracks.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Amtrak officials knew for years that they would have to replace large sections of deteriorating track in Pennsylvania Station in New York City. As engineering crews applied short-term fixes to rows of rotted ties, crumbling concrete and eroded steel, some of their managers repeatedly warned of the growing need to address underlying problems.

2017-10-09.abstract: I helped build a $5 billion company. There are much better ways to spur growth than putting more money in our coffers.
2017-10-09.snippet: I helped build a $5 billion company. There are much better ways to spur growth than putting more money in our coffers.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Foster City, Calif. — The tax cut framework recently put forward by President Trump relies on a central claim: that reducing taxes on corporations and wealthy individuals will open the wellsprings of entrepreneurship and investment, turbocharging job growth and the American economy. Were this premise true, reasonable people might countenance giving a vast majority of benefits to the very rich, as Mr. Trump’s plan does, in exchange for greater prosperity for all. But it’s not.

2017-10-09.snippet: For a generation of immigrants often caricatured as subhuman, Columbus was a figure to rally around against the anti-Italianism of the time.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: As I watched the disturbing events unfold in Charlottesville, Va., several weeks ago, I knew our Italian-American community would soon be called to once again address questions about statues celebrating Christopher Columbus and the day named in his honor. We would once again be called on to “defend Columbus” against efforts to remake his day into Indigenous People’s Day.

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: People who live in densely populated areas are all too familiar with sensory bombardment — the continuous light and noise pollution that has come to practically define the urban environment. Over time, most city dwellers grow so accustomed to this intense stimulation that they cease to notice it. Their perceptual thresholds, we might say, shift upward.

Born Walker Evans III, the scion of a prominent family, he grew up in privilege, attending Phillips Academy and then Williams College, dropping out after one year.

2017-10-09.abstract: A prehistoric hut, a 19th-century samurai’s dwelling, a traditional farmhouse: These new stays go far beyond Tokyo (and the ryokan, too).
2017-10-09.snippet: A prehistoric hut, a 19th-century samurai’s dwelling, a traditional farmhouse: These new stays go far beyond Tokyo (and the ryokan, too).
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Any traveler to Japan knows that its sense of hospitality — the sober, subtle beauty of the country’s lodgings, and the elegant, unobtrusive service within them — is unmatched anywhere else. For years, visitors could choose between two kinds of hotels: the Western kind (though often reinterpreted with Japanese materials, textiles and sightlines), or the traditional Japanese inn, the ryokan. Ryokans were originally built in medieval times to keep traveling merchants in comfort, offering ofuro baths, woven tatami floors and simple breakfasts of fish, tofu, rice and pickled vegetables. The new generation of Japanese accommodations, though, are neither ryokan nor hotel: They are restored samurai-era mansions, or refit prehistorical huts or even a Baja-esque beach camp. Significantly, many are also in less expected places — small towns and regions where tourists rarely go — giving travelers a chance to explore a part of the country they might otherwise not.
2017-10-09.headline_main: The New Generation of Japanese Accommodations

2017-10-09.snippet: In an interview with The New York Times, the man leading Qatar’s preparations for the 2022 World Cup discussed the advantages, and challenges, of the task he was given.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Qatar won the right to host the 2022 World Cup seven years ago, and it still has five years to get its country ready to roll out the welcome mat. But as world soccer begins to focus more intently on the 2018 tournament in Russia this week, and the teams that will be taking part, thoughts of 2022 are never far away. Hassan al-Thawadi, the British-educated son of a diplomat leading the 2022 World Cup organizing committee, is the man tasked with putting on his country’s big show. In an interview at The New York Times last month, al-Thawadi revealed that he supports — gasp! — Lyon and not Qatari-owned Paris St.-Germain. He also discussed worker welfare, the unique challenges of hosting a World Cup in a Muslim nation, and the World Cup stadium that will have a second life as a wedding hall.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Hassan al-Thawadi on Worker Welfare, Qatari Goals and the 2022 World Cup

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: With any luck, the television documentary “The Vietnam War” by Ken Burns and Lynn Novick may open the way for a new period of public and academic interest in the conflict. That may sound strange: How many movies, books, poems and documentaries have been made about the war, after all? A lot, of course. But with few exceptions, the “conversation” around the war has been stuck in neutral, focused on a few important but far from all-encompassing questions. But the Burns-Novick documentary could change that.
2017-10-09.headline_main: The Ken Burns Effect

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Environmental Protection Agency announced on Tuesday that Scott Pruitt, the chief of the agency, had signed a measure to repeal President Barack Obama’s signature policy to curb greenhouse gas emissions from power plants, setting up a bitter fight over the future of America’s efforts to tackle global warming.

2017-10-09.abstract: Annette O’Toole plays a mother whose daughter inexplicably falls for a boasting buffoon in this classic George Kelly comedy.
2017-10-09.snippet: Annette O’Toole plays a mother whose daughter inexplicably falls for a boasting buffoon in this classic George Kelly comedy.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: The title character of George Kelly’s 1924 play “The Show-Off” is a boasting buffoon named Aubrey Piper — a vain, dissembling blowhard with an obvious toupee and galloping delusions of grandeur. Spencer Tracy starred as Aubrey in the comedy’s second movie adaptation, Red Skelton in the third, but the team behind the play’s current Off Broadway revival seems to have taken inspiration from another star altogether.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Review: A ‘Show-Off’ Who Doesn’t Know When to Shut Up

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s latest rupture with a Republican senator has widened the schism with his own party on Capitol Hill, potentially jeopardizing the future of his legislative agenda even as he presses lawmakers to approve deep tax cuts, according to veteran Republicans and independent analysts.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Trump’s Fight With Corker Jeopardizes His Legislative Agenda

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Jamar Roberts has been around the world as a leading dancer with the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater. But a week after Hurricane Irma swept through Miami, he was back where he started, at Dance Empire, a studio in a suburban strip of warehouses here.
2017-10-09.headline_main: An Ailey Dancer Loyal to His Miami Roots and Mentor

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: The photographs record a 1967 antiwar demonstration in Central Park, a 1968 protest at Columbia University and an undated “gay power” demonstration. There is film footage of the first Earth Day march and a rally held by the Nation of Islam.

2017-10-09.abstract: The former ‘Top Chef’ finalist is about to make his biggest gambles in a $30 million empire that moves at a sharklike pace.

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Mike Isabella fanned himself with a hard hat as he stood on a construction site on the bank of the Potomac that workers were frantically trying to turn into a contemporary French restaurant. Permits and a liquor license had yet to materialize. The basement was nowhere near ready to receive shipments. The floors were — well, there were no floors.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Mike Isabella, Washington’s Restless Restaurateur

2017-10-09.abstract: Stony Brook WholeHeartedFoods sells four varieties of roasted seeds for snacking or baking.
2017-10-09.snippet: Stony Brook WholeHeartedFoods sells four varieties of roasted seeds for snacking or baking.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Stony Brook WholeHeartedFoods, in the Finger Lakes region of New York, has been selling excellent pumpkin- and squash-seed oils for several years. Now they are putting the whole seeds to another use, as snack fare. Pumpkin and butternut squash seeds are brined to soften the hulls, then roasted. They come plain and seasoned with maple or chile. You could also give the seeds a whirl as toppings for fragrant homemade autumn muffins, pumpkin pies or yogurt: Pepitas, Maple Pepitas, Butternut Pepitas and Sweet Chili Butternut Pepitas, each $3 for three ounces, or all, $14 for 16 ounces, wholeheartedfoods.com.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Roasted Pumpkinseeds Without All the Work

2017-10-09.abstract: The devastation left by Hurricane Maria has ignited a dire sense of urgency for politicians who feel compelled to look after their ancestral homeland.
2017-10-09.snippet: The devastation left by Hurricane Maria has ignited a dire sense of urgency for politicians who feel compelled to look after their ancestral homeland.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: José E. Serrano has been elected again and again to represent a tiny, tightly packed congressional district in the South Bronx. But since the storm that ravaged Puerto Rico, the island where he lived until he was 8, another constituency far from New York City has commanded more of his attention. It is one that has never voted for him, but that he has nonetheless adopted as his own.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Politicians With Puerto Rican Roots Challenge Trump in Push for Aid

2017-10-09.abstract: Coffee makers, teakettles and toasters that recall the sleek designs of the mid-20th century.
2017-10-09.snippet: Coffee makers, teakettles and toasters that recall the sleek designs of the mid-20th century.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Do you remember the Chevy Bel Air? If so, you may recognize a similar midcentury aesthetic in the Retro line from Russell Hobbs, an English maker of small appliances that came on the scene in 1952. The parent company, Spectrum Brands of Middleton, Wis., has made them available in the United States for the first time. There is an eight-cup drip coffee maker, a seven-cup kettle, and two- and four-slice toasters, all technologically advanced with features like a gauge to tell you how long your bread will take to toast and a lifter that lets you check its progress (think of that vintage Chevy with antilock brakes). The company also has a new space-age-style steel and glass line for the same appliances: Russell Hobbs appliances, $79.99 to $129.99, amazon.com.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Kitchen Appliances With a 1950s Feel

2017-10-09.abstract: Raghubir Singh captured the jumbled sensations of modern Indian life in his lyrical color photos. His first New York museum show is at the Met Breuer.
2017-10-09.snippet: Raghubir Singh captured the jumbled sensations of modern Indian life in his lyrical color photos. His first New York museum show is at the Met Breuer.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Near the end of his abruptly abbreviated life, Raghubir Singh complained about a curator who asked him why he didn’t photograph outside India. He observed that no one wonders why Walker Evans or Garry Winogrand stayed in the United States.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Seeing India Through a Contemporary Lens

2017-10-09.abstract: “Aida,” “Salome” and “Lohengrin” will be performed in both New York and Moscow from 2019 to 2022.
2017-10-09.snippet: “Aida,” “Salome” and “Lohengrin” will be performed in both New York and Moscow from 2019 to 2022.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Two of the world’s most important opera companies, the Metropolitan Opera in New York and the Bolshoi Theater here, will collaborate on three stagings in coming years, they announced on Monday. The productions — Verdi’s “Aida,” Strauss’s “Salome” and Wagner’s “Lohengrin” — will all star the Russian diva Anna Netrebko.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Anna Netrebko Will Star in Three Met-Bolshoi Productions

2017-10-09.abstract: Tittle endeared himself to New York not as a golden boy but as a muddied, grass-stained scrapper who had been discarded by the 49ers as too slow and too old.
2017-10-09.snippet: Tittle endeared himself to New York not as a golden boy but as a muddied, grass-stained scrapper who had been discarded by the 49ers as too slow and too old.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Y. A. Tittle, the Hall of Fame quarterback who led the Giants to three consecutive National Football League championship games in the early 1960s after the San Francisco 49ers had discarded him as too old and too slow, died on Sunday night in Stanford, Calif. He was 90.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Y.A. Tittle, Quarterback Who Led Giants to 3 Title Games, Dies at 90

2017-10-09.abstract: Dana Cowin, the former editor of Food & Wine magazine, will lead a talk with a “Top Chef” host and the outgoing president of the James Beard Foundation.
2017-10-09.snippet: Dana Cowin, the former editor of Food & Wine magazine, will lead a talk with a “Top Chef” host and the outgoing president of the James Beard Foundation.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: A panel discussion led by Dana Cowin, the former editor of Food & Wine magazine, will explore the future of food. Susan Ungaro, the retiring president of the James Beard Foundation, and Padma Lakshmi, a cook, author and a host of “Top Chef,” are among the experts participating in “The Next Big Bite: How We Will Eat and Drink,” sponsored by Les Dames d’Escoffier: Oct. 16, 5:30 to 8:30 p.m. with a reception till 6:45 p.m. when the discussion begins; $85 general admission and $115 (reserved seating and a book), Institute for Culinary Education, 225 Liberty Place (West Street), Third Floor, ldny.org.
2017-10-09.headline_main: The Future of Food Is Up for Discussion

2017-10-09.abstract: “3-Ingredient Cocktails” by Robert Simonson, a contributor to The New York Times, looks at the basics and forgotten simple drinks.
2017-10-09.snippet: “3-Ingredient Cocktails” by Robert Simonson, a contributor to The New York Times, looks at the basics and forgotten simple drinks.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Most classic cocktails — the martini, manhattan, daiquiri, old fashioned, Rob Roy, margarita, and gin and tonic — do not require more than three ingredients. And these days, when farm-to-barstool mixologists plunder Greenmarkets, back bars and spice caravans for their concoctions, it’s refreshing to revisit these basics, as Robert Simonson, a spirits expert who reports for The New York Times, has done in his new book. He is all for simplifying. Yet at the same time, you may make some winning discoveries, like the Alaska, a drink combining gin, yellow Chartreuse and bitters: “3-Ingredient Cocktails” by Robert Simonson (Ten Speed Press, $18.99).
2017-10-09.headline_main: New Book Glorifies the Cocktail Basics

2017-10-09.abstract: “Now” debuted at the top of the Billboard album chart, and records by Tom Petty surged as news of his death spread.

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — From Thursday through Sunday, audiences at FringeArts in this city’s historic district heard a saxophone distorted through six effects pedals squealing at peak volume, surrealist absurdism from a heritage jazz ensemble, atonal electric harp, and solo flute played in vehement gusts over a track of looming electronics.

2017-10-09.abstract: The Fight for 15 has won many victories, but the cost of living in New York and other big cities means that even that wage won’t lift workers out of poverty.
2017-10-09.snippet: The Fight for 15 has won many victories, but the cost of living in New York and other big cities means that even that wage won’t lift workers out of poverty.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: This past week, Randall Woodfin, a young Alabama city attorney, unseated a two-term Democratic incumbent to become the mayor of Birmingham. Mr. Woodfin’s campaign, which was committed to Trump resistance, brought him national attention and successful fund-raising in New York and Washington. Central to his progressive platform was a proposal to drive up Birmingham’s minimum wage, after a move last year to bring the city’s rate to $10.10 an hour was quickly undercut by the State Legislature. Mr. Woodfin maintains a more ambitious agenda, to eventually get the city’s minimum wage to $15 an hour.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Even at $15 an Hour, Need Is Close By

But ever since a century-old bridge nearby closed several years ago, crossing the river by car here can take up to 10 minutes more.

2017-10-09.abstract: With Harvey Weinstein, one of its founders, gone, the film studio faces a new set of risks — both in what he takes away and what he leaves behind.

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: There’s no such thing as a founder who goes quietly. The Weinstein Company, the film studio that fired one of its two co-founder brothers amid sexual harassment allegations, now joins other companies, like Fox News and Uber, that parted ways with influential bosses who misbehaved or stood idly by while others did. There’s dual risk, both from what the departing founder takes away and what he leaves behind.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Weinstein Company Joins Ranks of Firms With Bosses Who Misbehave

2017-10-09.abstract: Half the profit from Adirondack Creamery’s new date and walnut ice cream will be donated to the International Rescue Committee.
2017-10-09.snippet: Half the profit from Adirondack Creamery’s new date and walnut ice cream will be donated to the International Rescue Committee.
2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: The newest flavor of Adirondack Creamery ice cream recalls a pastry popular in Syria called ma’amoul, combining dates and walnuts. Translated into ice cream, it’s a nubbly, lightly sweetened confection with calls for unity plastered on the container. “Peace,” it proclaims in English, Arabic and Hebrew. “We are all immigrants,” it adds, and outlines the plight of Syrian refugees. Fifty percent of the profit from each pint is being donated to the International Rescue Committee’s efforts on their behalf: Adirondack Creamery Syrian Date & Walnut Ice Cream, $5.99 to $7.49 depending on the store; available at Kalustyans, Greene Grape Provisions, Fairway, Gourmet Garage and Fresh Direct.
2017-10-09.headline_main: Ice Cream Inspired by a Syrian Pastry

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: I went to Hollywood when I was 23. I had made a low-budget film, won an award at a prestigious festival, scored an agent and made a TV deal all within six months. It was a fairy tale most people will never experience, and I knew, as well as a 23-year-old can know anything, that I was getting a pretty great deal. I bounced from meeting to meeting with the joy of Cinderella at the ball.

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: In the past month, the American model Cara Taylor walked 41 runways across the four fashion capitals — each with a different hair-and-makeup look. “This time, there was more of an emphasis on natural beauty,” she noted, instead of the “no-makeup” look that actually requires gobs of products. “At some shows, they put on a tiny bit of foundation, and that’s all.” Backstage, she learned that to keep lips moisturized, “you should use lip conditioner and not Chapstick, because Chapstick is mostly a protector,” she shared, a tip worth keeping in mind year-round. Here, Taylor’s season of beauty looks, in pictures.

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: Though the roots of most Americans lie in other lands, there is among them a streak of xenophobia that can be broad. Chinese and Irish immigrants were the targets of nativist hostility in the 19th century, as were Eastern European Jews and Southern Italians in the early 20th. Japanese-Americans were confined to detention camps in World War II. Now the unwelcome mat is spread for many Latinos and Muslims.

2017-10-09.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — The scene of carnage this time was a flat 15-acre parcel of land without any permanent structures. It is a rectangle of blacktop surrounded by busy streets, including the famous Las Vegas Strip. Marketed as “Las Vegas Village” the past couple of years, it has the feel of a small county fairground. There are a few white corporate-style tents on its edges, and a large concert stage at the south end. It has been used to hold small music festivals and rodeos.

2017-10-10.abstract: If Senator Bob Corker believes Donald Trump can’t be trusted with the power he holds, shouldn’t he be trying to take that power away?
2017-10-10.snippet: If Senator Bob Corker believes Donald Trump can’t be trusted with the power he holds, shouldn’t he be trying to take that power away?
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Over the past few months, the country has been in a foul sort of trance. Among people who work in politics, Republicans as well as Democrats, it is conventional wisdom that President Trump is staggeringly ill-informed, erratic, reckless and dishonest. (He also might be compromised by a hostile foreign power.) But it’s also conventional wisdom that with few exceptions, Republicans in Congress are not going to stand up to him. America’s nuclear arsenal is in the hands of a senescent Twitter troll, but those with political power have refused to treat this fact as a national emergency. Thus, even though a majority of Americans consider the president unfit for office, a fatalistic sense of stasis has set in.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Corker Told the Truth About Trump. Now He Should Act on It.

2017-10-10.abstract: Arbitration clauses, blacklisting and retaliation must end if we want victims to come forward now, not decades from now.
2017-10-10.snippet: Arbitration clauses, blacklisting and retaliation must end if we want victims to come forward now, not decades from now.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Another day, another set of headlines about a powerful man who sexually harassed women for decades, without any repercussions besides writing checks to keep his victims quiet. The accusations  against Harvey Weinstein are dreadful, but the pace at which similar stories have emerged recently is mind-numbing. From Susan Fowler’s essay about her experiences at Uber to Taylor Swift’s testimony about a former radio host to Ashley Judd’s account of encounters with Mr. Weinstein, the floodgates have opened on sexual-harassment revelations. Heads up, predators. The story isn’t just that Mr. Weinstein has been fired. It’s that women’s voices are finally being heard.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Gretchen Carlson: How to Encourage More Women to Report Sexual Harassment

2017-10-10.snippet: A Nobel Peace Prize laureate discusses his strategy for reducing the global dangers of extreme wealth concentration.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: For more than 40 years, Muhammad Yunus, the Bangladeshi founder of the Grameen Bank and recipient of the 2006 Nobel Peace Prize, has been asserting that the most powerful way to eradicate poverty is to unleash the untapped entrepreneurial capacity of people everywhere. “Poverty is not created by poor people,” he says. “It’s created by the system we built. Poor people are like a bonsai tree. You take the best seed from the tallest tree in the forest, but if you put it in a flower pot to grow, it grows only a meter high. There’s nothing wrong with the seed. The problem is the size of the pot. Society doesn’t give poor people the space to grow as tall as everybody else. This is the crux of the matter.”
2017-10-10.headline_main: Giving Capitalism a Social Conscience

2017-10-10.abstract: From a tiny village in the country’s rural east, a leading nationalist intellectual builds a vision for the future of his movement across Europe.
2017-10-10.snippet: From a tiny village in the country’s rural east, a leading nationalist intellectual builds a vision for the future of his movement across Europe.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Götz Kubitschek, a self-proclaimed “rightist intellectual,” lives in a medieval manor house in Schnellroda, a rural village in eastern Germany. From this isolated, antique outpost, Kubitschek, who is 47, wields considerable influence over far-right thinkers, activists and politicians across Germany, who make regular pilgrimages to Schnellroda for an audience with him. The manor serves as the headquarters for the magazine and publishing house that Kubitschek runs with his wife, the writer Ellen Kositza, and also for a rightist think tank, the plainly named Institute for State Policy, and a small organic farm where he raises rabbits and goats. Kubitschek calls himself a conservative, battling to preserve Germany’s “ethno-cultural identity,” which he says is threatened by immigration and the alienating effects of modernity. He identifies as part of the German “New Right,” which seeks to dissociate itself from the “old right,” which in Germany means Nazis. German political scientists, by contrast, classify the brand of thinking Kubitschek ascribes to as either an ideological “hinge” between conservatism and right-wing extremism, or as simply extremist — not vastly different, in other words, from the old right. Kubitschek, however, presents his views with a disarming, Teutonic idealism that recalls a Germany that long preceded the rise of Hitler. The German magazine Der Spiegel once referred to him as a “dark knight.”
2017-10-10.headline_main: The Prophet of Germany’s New Right

2017-10-10.abstract: The author and humorist behind the best-selling “The Rap Year Book’’ takes on basketball in an illustrated book that asks and answers a lot of questions.
2017-10-10.snippet: The author and humorist behind the best-selling “The Rap Year Book’’ takes on basketball in an illustrated book that asks and answers a lot of questions.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Shea Serrano, the sportswriter and the San Antonio Spurs’ virtual cheerleader, made a name for himself by finding humor in the mundane on his Twitter feed. He has 169,000 followers and climbing. But what really brought him fame was the 2015 best-selling book “The Rap Year Book,” a laugh-out-loud, year-by-year argument for the best songs in hip-hop. Now, he is back with another eagerly anticipated, illustrated book, “Basketball (and Other Things): A Collection of Questions Asked, Answered, Illustrated,” which will be published Tuesday. Sample question: “If 1997 Karl Malone and a bear swapped places for a season, who would be more successful?”
2017-10-10.headline_main: What if a Bear Took an N.B.A. Star’s Place? Shea Serrano Has an Answer

2017-10-10.abstract: Republican leaders used to worry about the limits of their base. Now they find themselves increasingly at its mercy.
2017-10-10.snippet: Republican leaders used to worry about the limits of their base. Now they find themselves increasingly at its mercy.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Last month, Alabama conducted a novel political experiment, conscripting the state’s Republican voters as its lab rats. The question that was officially on the ballot was whom the party should nominate for the United States Senate seat vacated by Attorney General Jeff Sessions in February. One option was Luther Strange, a former state attorney general, who had filled the seat since being appointed by a Republican governor who happened to be under investigation by Strange’s own office. The other was Roy Moore, a twice-defrocked State Supreme Court justice described last month by the conservative National Review as “nothing more than a bigoted, theocratic and ignorant buffoon,” who has argued variously that Muslims shouldn’t be allowed in Congress, that homosexuality should be illegal, that multiple Midwestern communities are currently governed by Shariah law and that the Sept. 11 attacks might have been divine punishment for America’s sins.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Are Politicians Responsible for Their ‘Base,’ or Is It the Other Way Around?
