2017-10-10.abstract: A 5-year-old has two seemingly unrelated symptoms, but if they were connected, it might mean serious trouble.
2017-10-10.snippet: A 5-year-old has two seemingly unrelated symptoms, but if they were connected, it might mean serious trouble.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: “Is he a healthy kid?” Dr. Ingrid Polcari asked the boy’s father. He certainly looked healthy to the young dermatologist, except for the ugly, nickel-size sore that marred his otherwise smooth, plump cheek. The 5-year-old’s father had taken him in because of three awful-looking sores that appeared out of nowhere. The first one, near the right elbow, erupted a few weeks earlier; the second, on the left calf, a few days after; and the third one, on the face, just after that. His pediatrician had tried a couple of different antibiotic pills and creams, but the lesions just kept getting bigger and uglier.
2017-10-10.headline_main: If the Boy Had Pneumonia, Why Did He Have Odd Sores on His Body?

Mark Vanhoenacker, a pilot and the author of “Skyfaring: A Journey with a Pilot,” writes that for “those who grew up under 747-crossed skies, it can be hard to appreciate how revolutionary the jet’s dimensions were when it first (and improbably, to some observers) got airborne in 1969.” Here is a look at how the plane was marketed by the airlines that adopted it, and how The New York Times covered its (sometimes rocky) early days.

2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The high-profile American architectural practice Diller Scofidio & Renfro has been chosen to design the Center for Music, a future home for the London Symphony Orchestra and the Guildhall School of Music and Drama. It will be the first major project in Britain for the practice, which has been responsible for the High Line in New York, the Broad Museum in Los Angeles and Zaryadye Park in Moscow, among other projects, and is working on the renovation of New York’s Museum of Modern Art and the design of The Shed, a new arts center on the west side of Manhattan designed in collaboration with Rockwell Group.

2017-10-10.abstract: The designer blends Scandinavian-inflected minimalism with warm English comfort in her practice, and at home.
2017-10-10.snippet: The designer blends Scandinavian-inflected minimalism with warm English comfort in her practice, and at home.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: The London-based designer Ilse Crawford doesn’t believe genes are destiny. Yet she knows that her career — which includes introducing modern style to England in the 1980s as founding editor of British Elle Decoration and gaining global acclaim for her interiors at Manhattan’s Soho House — seems like a product of her parentage. Her Danish mother was an artist; her Canadian father was the economics editor of The Sunday Times of London. “I have both the analytical and the instinctual,” she says. “Working at a magazine taught me how to communicate my ideas, but like an artist, I’m willing to make some mistakes.”
2017-10-10.headline_main: Ilse Crawford’s Unerring Eye

2017-10-10.abstract: Sometimes a noble lie, sometimes just a disaster.
2017-10-10.snippet: Sometimes a noble lie, sometimes just a disaster.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Like the vast majority of economists, I was delighted to see Richard Thaler get the Nobel. Anyone with a bit of sense – a group that, believe it or not, includes many economists – knows that people aren’t perfectly rational. But the assumption of hyperrationality still plays far too large a role in the field. And Thaler didn’t just document deviations from rationality, he showed that there are consistent, usable patterns in those deviations.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Rationality and Rabbit Holes

2017-10-10.abstract: The storefront gallery in Little Italy is closing, another sign that New York is losing the things that made it so captivating.
2017-10-10.snippet: The storefront gallery in Little Italy is closing, another sign that New York is losing the things that made it so captivating.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Moe’s Meat Market, in Little Italy, hasn’t been a meat market for 40 years. But the floor is still tiled in black and white, the walls covered in porcelain-enameled tin sheets. When the artist Robert Kobayashi, known as Kobi, bought Moe’s and the rest of its building in 1977, he moved in with his wife, the photographer Kate Keller, and installed his studio in the storefront, leaving the walls intact. As a sculptor who worked with tin, maybe he felt an affinity for the sheet metal. Maybe he just appreciated the history.
2017-10-10.headline_main: The End of Moe’s Meat Market

2017-10-10.abstract: Contemporary Israeli dance rarely treats soldiers’ experiences as explicitly as it does in two works in New York this week.
2017-10-10.snippet: Contemporary Israeli dance rarely treats soldiers’ experiences as explicitly as it does in two works in New York this week.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: One of the first things visitors to Israel notice is the soldiers. They’re everywhere. Some are on duty, but others are slouched over coffee at a cafe, napping on a bus or just glued to their phones like everyone else. It can seem a peculiarly casual presence, but the ubiquity reflects how the military pervades all aspects of Israeli life. Reflecting on his career, the choreographer and performer Yossi Berg realized that its presence had infiltrated his dance work, too.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Soldier Dances, From a Land Pervaded by the Military

2017-10-10.abstract: White British adults are far more likely to be employed than are people from other backgrounds. But white working-class children do less well in primary school.
2017-10-10.snippet: White British adults are far more likely to be employed than are people from other backgrounds. But white working-class children do less well in primary school.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: LONDON — White British adults are much more likely to be employed and to own their own homes than are black or Asian people or those from other ethnic minorities, while working-class white British children are performing worse at primary school than are those from other ethnic groups, according to a new government audit published on Tuesday.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Whites in U.K. Own More Homes but Are Doing Worse in School, Audit Finds

2017-10-10.snippet: Cody Bellinger, a rookie first baseman, had his first significant moments of the postseason, and that was good enough to propel Los Angeles into the N.L.C.S.

With Los Angeles trying to sweep its National League division series against the Arizona Diamondbacks, Bellinger, the Dodgers’ first baseman and cleanup hitter, was pressing badly.

2017-10-10.abstract: Don Angie, from a husband-and-wife team, opens on Greenwich Avenue; a hotel restaurant with the former Le Turtle chef in the kitchen; and other news.
2017-10-10.snippet: Don Angie, from a husband-and-wife team, opens on Greenwich Avenue; a hotel restaurant with the former Le Turtle chef in the kitchen; and other news.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: DON ANGIE Some married couples strive for a home of their own. For the chefs Scott Tacinelli and Angie Rito, who have been cooking together since 2008, most recently at Quality Italian in Midtown Manhattan, their dream was to own a restaurant. They married in Florence, Italy, in 2015, and now they have their restaurant, a fairly intimate yet airy 58-seat space, done in white with rich marble accents. Both chefs are Italian-American, he from New Jersey and she from Cleveland. They’re putting a personal spin on some classics, like dressing garganelli with a “broken meatball” sauce, putting escargots instead of clams in a preparation for oreganata, using prime rib to make a braciola for two, and tossing a Caesar salad with chrysanthemum greens instead of romaine. “We’re definitely on the same page when it comes to food,” Ms. Rito said. Her husband added, “It’s not easy cooking together, but I trust Angie’s palate more than my own.” They’re also specializing in “red” amaro aperitifs, and the house wine, Don Angie Cali Chianti, is a Sangiovese from California and comes in a bottle wrapped in old-fashioned straw: 103 Greenwich Avenue (12th Street), 212-889-8884, donangienyc.com.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Italian in an Intimate Setting Comes to Greenwich Village

2017-10-10.abstract: At Frieze London, Alexander Coggin focuses on attendants’ clavicles to reveal clues about their roles in the art world.
2017-10-10.snippet: At Frieze London, Alexander Coggin focuses on attendants’ clavicles to reveal clues about their roles in the art world.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: At this year’s Frieze Art Fair in London, which wrapped up on Sunday, the photographer Alexander Coggin assumed the role of an art-world anthropologist for an ongoing series of what he terms “clavicle studies.” As Coggin says: “An event like Frieze comes with a coded social hierarchy courting many archetypes: the Gallerist, the Artist, the Curator, the Collector, the Critic. Every tribe ascribes to a different dress code according to their position in the art/business paradigm.” By focusing only on the subject’s clavicle area, Coggin assembles a vivid collection of character clues, allowing the viewer’s imagination to fill in the rest.
2017-10-10.headline_main: A Photographer Documents Art-Fair Archetypes — and Their Accessories

2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: I’ve watched the N.F.L. on ESPN for more than 20 years in part because I grew up with the kind of father who pretty much refused to talk to me until I showed interest in the game. One Sunday when I was 12, I parked myself on the couch next to him, and because we were watching Brett Favre, I asked him what an interception was. “When you throw it to the other team,” Dad said. That quarterback would go on to set the N.F.L. record for passing interceptions.

2017-10-10.abstract: A plaster version of a Canova is coming to New York. The original marble work, with wings, was carved as part of a monument to Pope Clement XIII in Rome.
2017-10-10.snippet: A plaster version of a Canova is coming to New York. The original marble work, with wings, was carved as part of a monument to Pope Clement XIII in Rome.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: The 18th-century Italian sculptor Antonio Canova made only a few plaster copies of his marble statues, as gifts for friends and patrons. One of the plaster works, which had ended up largely forgotten at a villa near Florence, will go on public view on Oct. 28 at the Tefaf New York show at the Park Avenue Armory. Trinity Fine Art, a London gallery, has priced it at $4 million.
2017-10-10.headline_main: A Wingless Angel Comes to Light

2017-10-10.abstract: President Trump demands an unseemly degree of gratitude and deference.
2017-10-10.snippet: President Trump demands an unseemly degree of gratitude and deference.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: No one besides Donald Trump was going to ask Rex Tillerson to the prom. No one else was going to pin a corsage on Jeff Sessions, pick up Steven Mnuchin in a chauffeured limo, give a box of Godiva chocolates to Betsy DeVos.
2017-10-10.headline_main: To Serve Is to Slobber

2017-10-10.abstract: Millions of children in the United States are living in terror because of President Trump’s deportation policies.
2017-10-10.snippet: Millions of children in the United States are living in terror because of President Trump’s deportation policies.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: DURHAM, N.C. — Forty years ago, when I was living in exile with my family in Amsterdam, my thoughts would often turn to the boys and girls back home in Chile, my small nieces and nephews so far away from us. I would worry how they might be coping with the dictatorship of Gen. Augusto Pinochet.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Children and Fear in Trump’s America

2017-10-10.abstract: Chernow is out to find undiscovered nobility in Ulysses S. Grant’s story, and he succeeds.
2017-10-10.snippet: Chernow is out to find undiscovered nobility in Ulysses S. Grant’s story, and he succeeds.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: The picture of Ulysses S. Grant on the cover of Ron Chernow’s overstuffed but essential new biography has been made prettier than its untouched version. Grant’s hair appears neatly trimmed, though in the original it looks gnawed on by wolves. His uniform has been given a dark, formal look; in the original image it’s light enough for wrinkles and shabbiness to show. The color tinting of this black-and-white image has made his eyes a piercing blue. The cover art’s beautification echoes what Chernow has done on the page.
2017-10-10.headline_main: In Ron Chernow’s ‘Grant,’ an American Giant’s Makeover Continues

2017-10-10.abstract: Wearing disguises in the courtroom, the C.I.A. officers described how their rescue team tried desperately to find the American ambassador and later came under mortar attack.
2017-10-10.snippet: Wearing disguises in the courtroom, the C.I.A. officers described how their rescue team tried desperately to find the American ambassador and later came under mortar attack.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Two C.I.A. officers recounted on Tuesday a predawn militant attack on their secret base in Benghazi, Libya, in 2012, detailing the devastating mortar fire that killed two operatives and badly wounded two other Americans after the agency had dispatched a team in a desperate attempt to find the American ambassador.
2017-10-10.headline_main: At Benghazi Trial, C.I.A. Officers in Wigs and Mustaches Recount Bloody Attack

2017-10-10.abstract: The time frame for moving injured troops is much longer in Africa, where four were killed in an ambush last week, than in Iraq or Afghanistan, military officials said.
2017-10-10.snippet: The time frame for moving injured troops is much longer in Africa, where four were killed in an ambush last week, than in Iraq or Afghanistan, military officials said.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When a team of Green Berets in unarmored pickup trucks came under fire in Niger last week, they quickly found themselves in the middle of a nightmare battlefield scenario: outgunned, taking casualties and far from friendly support.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Niger Attack Lays Bare U.S. Troops’ Long Wait for Medical Help in Africa

2017-10-10.abstract: What can happen en route to the top of the world? Join three Times journalists on Oct. 17 for an advance look at an ambitious project centered on Mount Everest.
2017-10-10.snippet: What can happen en route to the top of the world? Join three Times journalists on Oct. 17 for an advance look at an ambitious project centered on Mount Everest.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Welcome to Times Insider Events — live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Live Event: Everest, a Work in Progress

2017-10-10.abstract: Two week after the league stared down President Trump, Roger Goodell sent a letter to owners saying “we believe that everyone should stand for the national anthem.”
2017-10-10.snippet: Two week after the league stared down President Trump, Roger Goodell sent a letter to owners saying “we believe that everyone should stand for the national anthem.”
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: By appearances anyway, the N.F.L. was one big family two weeks ago. After President Trump urged owners to fire players who did not stand for the national anthem, everyone from Commissioner Roger Goodell to the 32 team owners to the players and coaches locked arms, in many cases literally, in defiance and unity.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Goodell and N.F.L. Owners Break From Players on Anthem Kneeling Fight

2017-10-10.abstract: Lisa Immordino Vreeland, who has a new book and documentary about Cecil Beaton, lives with art, sparely.
2017-10-10.snippet: Lisa Immordino Vreeland, who has a new book and documentary about Cecil Beaton, lives with art, sparely.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: A famous last name is handy for getting restaurant reservations, but it’s even better if you can use it to create art.
2017-10-10.headline_main: A Style-Minded Filmmaker at Home With Family Treasures

2017-10-10.abstract: Based on what we’ve seen in the video, it appears that a recent hire in a junior position violated our ethical standards and misrepresented his role.
2017-10-10.snippet: Based on what we’ve seen in the video, it appears that a recent hire in a junior position violated our ethical standards and misrepresented his role.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: The Reader Center is a newsroom initiative that is helping The Times build deeper ties with our audience.
2017-10-10.headline_main: The Times Responds to Project Veritas Video

2017-10-10.abstract: It makes sense that Pfizer is considering selling or spinning off its over-the-counter unit. It would also make sense for GlaxoSmithKline to make an offer.
2017-10-10.snippet: It makes sense that Pfizer is considering selling or spinning off its over-the-counter unit. It would also make sense for GlaxoSmithKline to make an offer.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Painkillers and hemorrhoid cream: These are either the recipe for a terrible night in, or a potentially good corporate deal.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Glaxo Could Make a Nice Home for Pfizer’s Consumer Division

2017-10-10.abstract: The tech giant begins spending the $1 billion it has set aside for new programming with a reboot of the 1980s NBC show “Amazing Stories.”
2017-10-10.snippet: The tech giant begins spending the $1 billion it has set aside for new programming with a reboot of the 1980s NBC show “Amazing Stories.”
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Apple is digging into the more than $1 billion it has set aside for original programming to create its first known television project: a revival of a Steven Spielberg series from the 1980s.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Apple Joins Forces With Steven Spielberg’s Amblin Television

2017-10-10.abstract: The conditions that lead to supereruptions can emerge within a single human lifetime, according to a study of the volcano’s remnants in the national park.
2017-10-10.snippet: The conditions that lead to supereruptions can emerge within a single human lifetime, according to a study of the volcano’s remnants in the national park.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Beneath Yellowstone National Park lies a supervolcano, a behemoth far more powerful than your average volcano. It has the ability to expel more than 1,000 cubic kilometers of rock and ash at once — 2,500 times more material than erupted from Mount St. Helens in 1980, which killed 57 people. That could blanket most of the United States in a thick layer of ash and even plunge the Earth into a volcanic winter.
2017-10-10.headline_main: A Surprise From the Supervolcano Under Yellowstone

2017-10-10.abstract: Many obstetricians resist giving epidural anesthesia because they believe it lengthens the duration of labor, but a new study found it does not.
2017-10-10.snippet: Many obstetricians resist giving epidural anesthesia because they believe it lengthens the duration of labor, but a new study found it does not.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Many obstetricians resist giving epidural anesthesia during the late stage of delivery because they believe it lengthens the duration of labor. But a clinical trial by Chinese researchers has found that it does not.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Epidurals Do Not Prolong Labor

2017-10-10.abstract: In its American premiere, Ashley Fure’s subtle experimental work plays like a cross between a gallery art show and a black-box theater spectacle.
2017-10-10.snippet: In its American premiere, Ashley Fure’s subtle experimental work plays like a cross between a gallery art show and a black-box theater spectacle.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: MONTCLAIR, N.J. — In the 50 years since Robert Ashley wrote “That Morning Thing,” some strategies for making new opera have become clear. Composers may sub out a symphony orchestra for pretaped material or electronically aided arrangements; linear narrative flow is often abandoned for more abstract approaches; vocalism can encompass speaking, screaming and much else beyond traditional lyricism.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Review: ‘The Force of Things,’ an Indirectly Audible Opera

2017-10-10.abstract: The actor, a star of Amazon’s “Transparent,” on how his friends and family reacted when he rolled around in bed with two actresses.
2017-10-10.snippet: The actor, a star of Amazon’s “Transparent,” on how his friends and family reacted when he rolled around in bed with two actresses.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: I promise I’m not bragging. I know it might seem like I am, but I’m not. I never asked to film a three-way sex scene for TV. But that’s what happened this past year. No big deal, just part of my job. What’s your job?
2017-10-10.headline_main: Rob Huebel: The First Time I Filmed a Threeway for TV

2017-10-10.abstract: New York City Ballet’s same-sex duets bring a contemporary sensibility to an art that can be slow to change.
2017-10-10.snippet: New York City Ballet’s same-sex duets bring a contemporary sensibility to an art that can be slow to change.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Two men run across the stage in sweeping circles until one stops the other by pressing a palm into his chest. They lock eyes. Then the second melts backward into the arms of the first.
2017-10-10.headline_main: When Two Men Fall in Love on the Ballet Stage, and Why It Matters

2017-10-10.abstract: Mr. Petty and his wacky visual aesthetic belonged to MTV, alongside Duran Duran and Cyndi Lauper, as much as it did to the rock ’n’ roll canon.
2017-10-10.snippet: Mr. Petty and his wacky visual aesthetic belonged to MTV, alongside Duran Duran and Cyndi Lauper, as much as it did to the rock ’n’ roll canon.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Tom Petty’s music has always sounded like open desert highway — what even a Martian would recognize as “America,” expressed with both wariness and enthusiasm. But in the early days of MTV, Mr. Petty was the Martian.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Tom Petty, Classic Rocker? Sure. And Weird Video Star, Too.

2017-10-10.abstract: It all depends on where you live.
2017-10-10.snippet: It all depends on where you live.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: It all depends on where you live.
2017-10-10.headline_main: How Will the Clean Power Plan Repeal Change Carbon Emissions for Your State?

2017-10-10.abstract: Great reads around the web, from Anna Dubenko, Jenna Wortham and others.
2017-10-10.snippet: Great reads around the web, from Anna Dubenko, Jenna Wortham and others.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What We’re Reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.
2017-10-10.headline_main: What We’re Reading

2017-10-10.abstract: Here is a peek at some of the latest bridal collections from top designers.
2017-10-10.snippet: Here is a peek at some of the latest bridal collections from top designers.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Theia, Ines Di Santo, Reem Acra and other designers presented their 2018 fall and winter bridal collections last week during New York Bridal Fashion Week.  The styles that graced the runways were a departure from tradition and a celebration of femininity and romance. Many of the looks featured gowns in soft shades of blush, body-hugging textured gowns adorned in fur and fringe, and showstopping bridal jumpsuits. Here is a look at some of what we saw during bridal fashion week.
2017-10-10.headline_main: What We Saw at New York Bridal Fashion Week

2017-10-10.abstract: Led by Ali Wong, a generation of women is earning laughs by talking bluntly about the realities of pregnancy and motherhood.
2017-10-10.snippet: Led by Ali Wong, a generation of women is earning laughs by talking bluntly about the realities of pregnancy and motherhood.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: One of the small surprises of fatherhood is how impressed some people are by the slightest attempt at child care. Dads like me benefit from low expectations, one of many of the resonant premises sharply exploited by the stand-up comic Ali Wong in “Baby Cobra,” her hit Netflix special last year.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Moms at the Mike, on the Verge of a Breakthrough in Comedy

2017-10-10.abstract: At a time when many large university funds are reporting gains in the midteens, Yale said it generated an 11.3 percent return for the fiscal year.
2017-10-10.snippet: At a time when many large university funds are reporting gains in the midteens, Yale said it generated an 11.3 percent return for the fiscal year.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Yale University’s endowment, the second largest among the nation’s colleges, has been distinguished in recent years for its handsome returns — and for turning out money managers who follow the investment principles of its chief, David F. Swensen. But its latest report card, issued Tuesday, was disappointing.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Yale Endowment, Often a Pacesetter, Is a Laggard This Time

2017-10-10.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-10-10.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2017-10-10.headline_main: Santa Rosa, Bob Corker, Harvey Weinstein: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing

2017-10-10.abstract: When Manager Joe Girardi chose Sabathia, 37 and possibly at the end of his Yankees career, to start Game 5, other members of the team heartily endorsed the decision.
2017-10-10.snippet: When Manager Joe Girardi chose Sabathia, 37 and possibly at the end of his Yankees career, to start Game 5, other members of the team heartily endorsed the decision.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: At the start of spring training, hardly anyone in the Yankees organization would have predicted that C. C. Sabathia, with a cumulative 18-26 record and 4.42 earned run average over the previous three seasons, would wind up being entrusted with the team’s most important start of 2017.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Yankees Ask Sabathia to Beat the Indians and Keep the Season Alive

2017-10-10.abstract: A cabdriver urges a fare to always stick up for herself.
2017-10-10.snippet: A cabdriver urges a fare to always stick up for herself.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2017-10-10.headline_main: Lesson Learned in a Taxi

2017-10-10.abstract: The feathers of birds preserved in natural history museum collections record changes to historical air quality across America’s Rust Belt, a new study finds.
2017-10-10.snippet: The feathers of birds preserved in natural history museum collections record changes to historical air quality across America’s Rust Belt, a new study finds.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Tucked away in the drawers of natural history museums across America’s Rust Belt, thousands of dead birds carry dirty secrets from America’s polluted past.
2017-10-10.headline_main: The Dirty Secrets Saved in Dead Birds’ Feathers

2017-10-10.abstract: A new musical at Paper Mill Playhouse in New Jersey based on the classic CBS sitcom does a good job playing to the fans
2017-10-10.snippet: A new musical at Paper Mill Playhouse in New Jersey based on the classic CBS sitcom does a good job playing to the fans
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: MILLBURN, N.J. — Four different actors are being greeted with entrance applause at Paper Mill Playhouse here, which is unusual, because none are household names or local favorites. The applause is for their characters, some of the most beloved that television has produced. These performers draw a warm welcome simply by looking reasonably like them.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Review: ‘The Honeymooners,’ Still Striving, but Now Tunefully

2017-10-10.abstract: Ms. Block moved just outside the white-hot center of the New York art world, where alternative spaces and smaller museums overlap and cross-fertilize.
2017-10-10.snippet: Ms. Block moved just outside the white-hot center of the New York art world, where alternative spaces and smaller museums overlap and cross-fertilize.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Holly Block, the director of the Bronx Museum of the Arts and a longtime cultural force in New York, died on Friday at her home in Manhattan. She was 58.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Holly Block, Director of the Bronx Museum, Dies at 58

2017-10-10.abstract: Exploiting the popular Kaspersky antivirus software, Russian hackers searched millions of computers for American intelligence keywords. Israeli intelligence tipped off American officials.
2017-10-10.snippet: Exploiting the popular Kaspersky antivirus software, Russian hackers searched millions of computers for American intelligence keywords. Israeli intelligence tipped off American officials.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: It was a case of spies watching spies watching spies: Israeli intelligence officers looked on in real time as Russian government hackers searched computers around the world for the code names of American intelligence programs.
2017-10-10.headline_main: How Israel Caught Russian Hackers Scouring the World for U.S. Secrets

2017-10-10.abstract: A far-fetched headline and short story that were part of a technology test mistakenly went out on the Dow Jones Newswire on Tuesday morning.
2017-10-10.snippet: A far-fetched headline and short story that were part of a technology test mistakenly went out on the Dow Jones Newswire on Tuesday morning.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: The Dow Jones Newswire headline seemed too far-fetched to be true. And it was.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Google Buying Apple? Sorry, That Was Just a Test

2017-10-10.abstract: An intimate evening with the Boss soars at the box office.
2017-10-10.snippet: An intimate evening with the Boss soars at the box office.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Not bad for a first week on the job: Bruce Springsteen’s Broadway show raked in $2.33 million last week from just five performances, an astonishingly strong financial performance fueled by high ticket prices.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Big Grosses for Bruce Springsteen as Broadway Run Begins

2017-10-10.abstract: Evidence collected at a bombing site last year suggested how a suspect used a flip phone to rig a device to explode with a signal from a homemade timer.
2017-10-10.snippet: Evidence collected at a bombing site last year suggested how a suspect used a flip phone to rig a device to explode with a signal from a homemade timer.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: A cellphone found near an exploded bomb in a secluded corner of Seaside Park, N.J., last year had been altered. Two wires, one red, one green, protruded from its black plastic case.
2017-10-10.headline_main: In Chelsea Bombing Trial, a Lesson on How a Phone Becomes a Trigger

2017-10-10.abstract: Joseph Duo, a former child soldier, put down his weapons and went back to school when peace came to Liberia. Then he ran for office.
2017-10-10.snippet: Joseph Duo, a former child soldier, put down his weapons and went back to school when peace came to Liberia. Then he ran for office.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: ZANGAR TOWN, Liberia — Joseph Duo edged his yellow taxi toward the river and boarded a canoe with stacks of grimy Liberian dollars and a backpack full of fliers promising more food, free education and better clinics. He marched down a damp muddy path, until the forest parted into a poor village named Zangar Town. His message was simple: Vote for me.
2017-10-10.headline_main: He Was the Face of Liberia’s Endless War. Now He Wants to Govern.

2017-10-10.abstract: A patrol officer in the Bronx was charged with videotaping a teenager performing sexual acts.
2017-10-10.snippet: A patrol officer in the Bronx was charged with videotaping a teenager performing sexual acts.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: A New York City police officer has been indicted on charges that he patronized a 15-year-old girl for prostitution and made videos of her performing sex acts, the Bronx district attorney’s office announced on Tuesday.
2017-10-10.headline_main: City Police Officer Paid 15-Year-Old for Sex and Taped It, Prosecutors Say

2017-10-10.abstract: Five observations from Tuesday night’s three-way debate among Mayor Bill de Blasio, Nicole Malliotakis and Bo Dietl.
2017-10-10.snippet: Five observations from Tuesday night’s three-way debate among Mayor Bill de Blasio, Nicole Malliotakis and Bo Dietl.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio sparred for 90 minutes on Tuesday with his two main rivals in a rowdy and rambunctious debate that devolved into shouting, finger-pointing and cut-off microphones.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Five Takeaways From the New York City Mayoral Debate

2017-10-10.abstract: Ending goals to cut emissions from coal-fired power plants will be the most serious blow to President Obama’s legacy on global warming.
2017-10-10.snippet: Ending goals to cut emissions from coal-fired power plants will be the most serious blow to President Obama’s legacy on global warming.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: The Trump administration formally proposed on  Tuesday to roll back yet another of President Barack Obama’s efforts to position the United States as a global leader in the fight against climate change. The move, though widely anticipated, was deeply disheartening. In March Mr. Trump ordered Scott Pruitt, the administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, to repeal the Clean Power Plan, which was aimed at reducing carbon dioxide emissions from coal-fired power plants. Mr. Pruitt, a climate denier closely tied to the fossil fuel industry, was only too happy to oblige — boasting to an audience of Kentucky coal miners on Monday that the plan was dead and that “the war on coal is over.”
2017-10-10.headline_main: Mr. Trump Nails Shut the Coffin on Climate Relief

2017-10-10.abstract: President Trump said Senator Bob Corker “gave us” the Iran nuclear deal. Actually, Mr. Corker opposed it — and has the votes to prove it.
2017-10-10.snippet: President Trump said Senator Bob Corker “gave us” the Iran nuclear deal. Actually, Mr. Corker opposed it — and has the votes to prove it.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Call it the two birds, one tweet approach: As he continues to feud with Senator Bob Corker, President Trump is now also blaming the Tennessee Republican for the Iran nuclear deal that the White House is threatening to decertify, perhaps as soon as this week.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Trump Misleadingly Blames Bob Corker for Iran Deal

2017-10-10.abstract: As both countries suspended visa services, Turkey defended its arrest of a United States Consulate employee.
2017-10-10.snippet: As both countries suspended visa services, Turkey defended its arrest of a United States Consulate employee.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — Turkish officials assailed the United States on Tuesday for its decision to suspend visas for Turkish citizens, defending their right to detain American Embassy employees they accused of spying and blaming the American ambassador for the diplomatic dispute.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Turkish President Erdogan Blames U.S. Ambassador for Visa Row

2017-10-10.abstract: NSangou Njikam’s good-natured but overlong play sends a nerdy teenager into rap battle, and beyond.
2017-10-10.snippet: NSangou Njikam’s good-natured but overlong play sends a nerdy teenager into rap battle, and beyond.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Gordon may be a nerdy teenager, but he also has appreciable assets: He is sweet, smart and possesses an encyclopedic knowledge of the hip-hop canon, especially the early-1990s vintage. In the world of the lively new play “Syncing Ink,” staged in the round at the Flea Theater, this is a formidable weapon.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Review: A Student of the Classics, Hip-Hop Variety, in ‘Syncing Ink’

2017-10-10.abstract: Five years after Hurricane Sandy struck New York City, proponents of storm-surge barriers stumped for support.
2017-10-10.snippet: Five years after Hurricane Sandy struck New York City, proponents of storm-surge barriers stumped for support.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: With some memories of the destruction caused by Hurricane Sandy five years ago beginning to fade, proponents of a set of offshore barriers to protect the New York metropolitan area from storm surge are re-sounding their alarm.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Making a Pitch, Again, for Barriers to Block Storm Surges

2017-10-10.abstract: She called him Peach. He called her the Queen. “The fact that they went together is probably what they would have wanted,” a son of Sara and Charles Rippey said.
2017-10-10.snippet: She called him Peach. He called her the Queen. “The fact that they went together is probably what they would have wanted,” a son of Sara and Charles Rippey said.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Sara and Charles Rippey first locked eyes at their elementary school in tiny Hartford, Wis., close to 90 years ago. “They’ve basically been together ever since,” said one of their sons, Mike Rippey.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Couple, 98 and 100, Who Died in Fire ‘Just Couldn’t Be Without Each Other’

2017-10-10.abstract: The first lady’s visit to a clinic in West Virginia is a signal that her interests — so far stated broadly as helping children and combating cyberbullying — have narrowed.
2017-10-10.snippet: The first lady’s visit to a clinic in West Virginia is a signal that her interests — so far stated broadly as helping children and combating cyberbullying — have narrowed.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: HUNTINGTON, W.Va. — Melania Trump, a once-reluctant first lady who has lately been ramping up her travels as well as directing her aides to lash out at rivals, allowed the public a glimpse at her nascent platform on Tuesday at a clinic that treats infants born with addiction.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Melania Trump Says She Aims to ‘Give a Voice’ to the Victims of Opioids

2017-10-10.abstract: Disney once owned Miramax, which Harvey Weinstein co-founded. Mr. Weinstein is also a longtime Democratic donor with ties to the Clintons and the Obamas.
2017-10-10.snippet: Disney once owned Miramax, which Harvey Weinstein co-founded. Mr. Weinstein is also a longtime Democratic donor with ties to the Clintons and the Obamas.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — As actresses came forward publicly on Tuesday with vivid accounts of sexual harassment by Harvey Weinstein stretching back decades, questions arose about Disney, which owned his Miramax studio when some of the harassment was alleged to have taken place.
2017-10-10.headline_main: Disney, Hillary Clinton and the Obamas Condemn Weinstein

2017-10-10.abstract: Angelina Jolie, Gwyneth Paltrow, Rose McGowan and Ashley Judd are among those who say the Hollywood executive sexually harassed them, or worse.
2017-10-10.snippet: Angelina Jolie, Gwyneth Paltrow, Rose McGowan and Ashley Judd are among those who say the Hollywood executive sexually harassed them, or worse.
2017-10-10.lead_paragraph: Days after a series of sexual harassment allegations against the film producer Harvey Weinstein were reported by The New York Times, women continue to come forward to tell their stories.
2017-10-10.headline_main: The Women Who Have Accused Harvey Weinstein

2017-10-11.abstract: The team is combining forces with the owners of the Mets and Oak View Group, an investment advisory firm, in pursuit of a new venue at Belmont Park.
2017-10-11.snippet: The team is combining forces with the owners of the Mets and Oak View Group, an investment advisory firm, in pursuit of a new venue at Belmont Park.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Jon Ledecky, a co-owner of the Islanders, made his strongest statements yet that the team intends to leave Barclays Center in Brooklyn and hopes to build an arena near Belmont Park racetrack, for which New York State recently accepted proposals to redevelop.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Islanders’ ‘Singular Focus’ Is New Arena at Belmont Park

2017-10-11.abstract: The case against Ayla Albayrak, an Istanbul-based journalist currently in New York, came amid a crackdown against the news media by Turkish authorities.
2017-10-11.snippet: The case against Ayla Albayrak, an Istanbul-based journalist currently in New York, came amid a crackdown against the news media by Turkish authorities.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: A Turkish court convicted a longtime Wall Street Journal reporter in absentia on terrorism charges and sentenced her to two years and one month in prison.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Turkey Convicts Wall Street Journal Reporter in Absentia

2017-10-11.abstract: The company, which operates separately from Sears Holdings of Hoffman Estates, Ill., plans to start liquidation sales next week, pending court approval.
2017-10-11.snippet: The company, which operates separately from Sears Holdings of Hoffman Estates, Ill., plans to start liquidation sales next week, pending court approval.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — After a failed effort to find a solution to save the company, Sears Canada said on Tuesday that it would shut down operations, leaving about 12,000 employees out of work.

2017-10-11.abstract: Upending centuries of custom matters more than you think.
2017-10-11.snippet: Upending centuries of custom matters more than you think.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump ran for the White House as a change agent hostile to the habits of Washington, the place he nicknamed “the swamp.” It worked. But the customs he continues to upend as president are the scaffolding that supports the otherwise fragile words of our written Constitution. Mr. Trump’s rejection of them is more threatening to both his presidency and our constitutional regime than any technical violation of the law that he has been accused of (at least so far).
2017-10-11.headline_main: The President’s Self-Destructive Disruption

2017-10-11.abstract: We’re all connected online, but no one’s in charge to prevent abuses.
2017-10-11.snippet: We’re all connected online, but no one’s in charge to prevent abuses.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: There is an abiding dream in the tech world that when all the planet’s people and data are connected it will be a better place. That may prove true. But getting there is turning into a nightmare — a world where billions of people are connected but without sufficient legal structures, security protections or moral muscles among companies and users to handle all these connections without abuse.
2017-10-11.headline_main: From Russia With Poison

2017-10-11.snippet: The Tehani Photo Workshop, started by Stephanie Sinclair and the Samburu Girls Foundation, provides both photo skills and a community for girls rescued from child marriage.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Having spent 15 years photographing child marriages around the world, Stephanie Sinclair is uniquely positioned to understand its lasting impact on communities and, especially, on the girls who were forced to wed against their will. “You can’t expect individuals who have been through significant abuse to just act normal as soon as they get out of that situation,” she said. “They need to be nurtured, to be given the time and the tools to heal.”

2017-10-11.abstract: For Republicans, the purges never stop, and the leadership void is never filled.
2017-10-11.snippet: For Republicans, the purges never stop, and the leadership void is never filled.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: The only fitting reaction to the news that Steve Bannon intends to support primary challengers against Republican incumbents from sea to shining sea is a terrible, almost Teutonic sort of world-weariness. Bannon’s grand ambitions should inspire the same soul-deadening déjà vu, the existential exhaustion, with which Bill Murray’s weatherman greeted every morning in Punxsutawney, Penn. They should bring to mind both Friedrich Nietzsche’s idea of eternal recurrence and his warning that if you stare deep into the abyss, it stares into you. They should inspire a vision of the Republican Party as a wheel turning endlessly in darkness, with the illusion of movement but the light forever out of reach.
2017-10-11.headline_main: The Bannon Revolution

2017-10-11.abstract: Lee Friedlander provided an early study of our national fascination with statuary.
2017-10-11.snippet: Lee Friedlander provided an early study of our national fascination with statuary.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Lee Friedlander’s “The American Monument” was first published in 1976. That’s “monument” singular, though one of the many singular things about Friedlander is that he’s nothing if not a pluralist. Whitman-like, he is great, contains multitudes. In an essay appended to the sumptuous new edition of this landmark work, Peter Galassi (who curated the 2005 Friedlander retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art) deems it “pointless” to try to count precisely how many books the photographer has published since 1976 before settling on roughly one a year. The retrospective was huge, and, inevitably, the accompanying catalog was almost too hefty to lug home comfortably. It was sort of monumental, though monuments tend to be erected to the dead.
2017-10-11.headline_main: The Photographer Who Saw America’s Monuments Hiding in Plain Sight

2017-10-11.abstract: The podcaster on not calling people “trolls,” being combative on the internet and why he genuinely loves talking to people.
2017-10-11.snippet: The podcaster on not calling people “trolls,” being combative on the internet and why he genuinely loves talking to people.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Your podcast, “Conversations With People Who Hate Me,” is exactly what it sounds like: You interview people who have posted racist, homophobic or otherwise terrible things about you on the internet. Fast Company said it’s the “timeliest podcast of 2017.” Why would you want to put yourself through this? Just because someone says something outrageously mean to you online doesn’t mean they’re sad and lonely. I wanted to go toward these messages rather than run away.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Dylan Marron Wants to Know Why People Hate One Another

2017-10-11.snippet: Parents, therapists and schools are struggling to figure out whether helping anxious teenagers means protecting them or pushing them to face their fears.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: The disintegration of Jake’s life took him by surprise. It happened early in his junior year of high school, while he was taking three Advanced Placement classes, running on his school’s cross-country team and traveling to Model United Nations conferences. It was a lot to handle, but Jake — the likable, hard-working oldest sibling in a suburban North Carolina family — was the kind of teenager who handled things. Though he was not prone to boastfulness, the fact was he had never really failed at anything.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Why Are More American Teenagers Than Ever Suffering From Severe Anxiety?

2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Playing outside is my cat’s greatest joy. During the long Maine winters, he stares wistfully out the window. The moment the snow melts, he’s outside climbing trees and running laps. The whole street knows my cat, Jasper, by name. Children play with him; he follows the mailman door to door; one neighbor even took photos of him, framed them and gave them to me.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Can My Cat Go Out if He Bullies Other Cats?

2017-10-11.abstract: Koyasan is one of the premier destinations for Buddhist pilgrims in Japan. As its popularity peaks, can it still be enjoyed by a visitor seeking quietude?
2017-10-11.snippet: Koyasan is one of the premier destinations for Buddhist pilgrims in Japan. As its popularity peaks, can it still be enjoyed by a visitor seeking quietude?
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: “Your eyes should be neither open nor closed,” explained the monk at the front of the room. “They should be sort of sleepy — like a Buddha.” It was my first time meditating, and I was anxious about making some sort of conspicuous misstep. I squinted, then tried to relax my eyelids, but inadvertently began to focus on the bright orange cushion of the person in front of me. I closed my eyes with an inward sigh of exasperation at having such a difficult time following instructions. The monk leading the session told us cheerfully that it might help to rest our vision on the tips of our noses.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Seeking Solitude in Japan’s Mountain Monasteries

2017-10-11.abstract: In an ancient city of stone and caves, what was old is new again.
2017-10-11.snippet: In an ancient city of stone and caves, what was old is new again.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: One look at Matera, in Italy’s deep south, and you’ll wonder why the historic Puglian towns of Ostuni and Lecce get all the attention. This city of pale gold limestone, just over the border from Puglia in Basilicata, has more layers than a sfogliatella pastry: Its two cave districts, Sasso Barisano and Sasso Caveoso, are composed of individual dwellings carved into fossil-stuffed strata and stacked on top of each other like cells in a haphazardly constructed beehive. They were inhabited from prehistory until the 1950s, when — overcrowded, poverty-stricken and disease-ridden — they were evacuated by the state. Dubbed “the shame of Italy,” Matera remained largely abandoned for decades. In the 1990s, the Sassi became playgrounds for Matera’s errant youth.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Where to Stay (and What to Eat) in Matera, Italy

2017-10-11.abstract: In this lesson we invite students to learn about the Roman Empire through stories about the communities that have developed in its wake. From modern Rome to the far reaches of the ancient empire in Syria, they will seek to understand the role that history can play in everyday lives.
2017-10-11.snippet: In this lesson we invite students to learn about the Roman Empire through stories about the communities that have developed in its wake. From modern Rome to the far reaches of the ancient empire in Syria, they will seek to understand the role that...
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Imagine living near the ruins of an ancient culture. Each day offers both delights and challenges, as you witness the ways in which time and modern problems have affected these precious artifacts. What are the costs of protecting these signs of history? And how has daily life changed for people living in such places in the 21st century, at the far end of a timeline reaching back generations?
2017-10-11.headline_main: Then and Now: Exploring Modern Life Amid Relics of the Roman Empire

2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: BlackRock, the world’s largest asset manager, is getting even larger.

2017-10-11.abstract: Leslie Abramson knows that whoever controls the narrative of this budding reality show controls the outcome.
2017-10-11.snippet: Leslie Abramson knows that whoever controls the narrative of this budding reality show controls the outcome.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: A little less than two years before the debut of Court TV, known today as truTV, Lyle and Erik Menendez walked into the family room of their Beverly Hills home and emptied 15 shotgun blasts into their parents, Jose and Kitty. “I’ve seen a lot of homicides, but nothing quite that brutal,” the retired police detective Dan Stewart later told Dominick Dunne, who was writing about the Menendez murders for Vanity Fair. “Blood, flesh, skulls. It would be hard to describe, especially Jose, as resembling a human that you would recognize. That’s how bad it was.”
2017-10-11.headline_main: ‘Law & Order True Crime’ Season 1, Episode 3: Court TV

2017-10-11.abstract: Mr. Barak, Israel’s former leader and defense chief, does not want Mr. Trump to decertify the deal — a step the president is expected to take.
2017-10-11.snippet: Mr. Barak, Israel’s former leader and defense chief, does not want Mr. Trump to decertify the deal — a step the president is expected to take.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Ehud Barak, the former Israeli leader known for his hawkish views on Iran, said it would be a “mistake” for President Trump to decertify the Iran nuclear deal, both because it would play to Iran’s advantage and because it would scuttle any hope of a negotiation with North Korea.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Ehud Barak, Israeli Hawk and No Friend of Iran, Urges Trump to Keep Nuclear Deal

2017-10-11.snippet: The clubs get the headlines, but the international game still has the allure.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, England — It started in San José, Costa Rica, late on Saturday night, with a goal from Kendall Waston, the Costa Rica defender, and a scream from Kristian Mora, commentating on his nation’s game with Honduras for Teletica Deportes. “El Mundial, el Mundial, el Mundial,” he bellowed, over and over again, as Waston raced toward the fans in the Estadio Nacional and thousands more spilled out onto the streets to celebrate. “That’s what the country is shouting.”

2017-10-11.abstract: On a Belfast street built to overcome sectarian divisions, at least three Catholic families have fled following a threat.

2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: BELFAST, Northern Ireland — When a young Catholic cook moved into a newly built house in a Protestant part of Belfast last September, it was a vote of faith in not just his own future — but that of the province of Northern Ireland.
2017-10-11.headline_main: A New Street Was Meant to Bridge Belfast’s Sectarian Divide. Then the Doorbell Rang.

2017-10-11.abstract: These three books deal with the issue of sexual misconduct in the office.
2017-10-11.snippet: These three books deal with the issue of sexual misconduct in the office.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Last week, an investigation by The New York Times exposed decades of sexual misconduct allegations against film producer Harvey Weinstein. Since then, Weinstein was fired from The Weinstein Company, and more women — including Gwyneth Paltrow and Angelina Jolie — have come forward accusing Weinstein of inappropriate advances. Below, three books delve into the topic of sexual harassment in the workplace: one is a deep dive into the case of Anita Hill, whose 1991 testimony against Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas ignited conversations about women’s experiences at work; another takes aim at start-up culture; and a third offers a satirical “solution” to the problem.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Amid Weinstein Accusations, 3 Books on Workplace Sexual Harassment

2017-10-11.headline_main: Discussing the Rohingya Refugee Crisis

2017-10-11.abstract: The girl in the No. 8 jersey scored a soccer goal. Her parents were 600 miles away, getting ready for a concert in Las Vegas.
2017-10-11.snippet: The girl in the No. 8 jersey scored a soccer goal. Her parents were 600 miles away, getting ready for a concert in Las Vegas.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: NOVATO, Calif. — I was on the sideline of a soccer field two Saturdays ago, watching my 12-year-old daughter and her Novato teammates. I don’t remember much about that game, but Novato won, and one of the goals was scored by the smallest girl on the team, a quick and feisty forward who wears a long ponytail and jersey No. 8. We whooped and cheered her name. I found out later that her parents weren’t there that afternoon. They were in Las Vegas for a getaway weekend.
2017-10-11.headline_main: The Girl in the No. 8 Jersey

2017-10-11.abstract: Charlie Gilkes and Duncan Stirling specialize in cheeky clubs with names like Bunga Bunga (after Berlusconi’s exploits) and Maggie’s (as in Thatcher).

2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: LONDON — At Bunga Bunga supper club, a sublimely ridiculous ode to Italian kitsch in Covent Garden, there’s a speedboat turned table that seats 10, communal cocktails served from four-foot-high replicas of Michelangelo’s David — yes, the tap is that part of his anatomy — and a Pompeii-style fresco featuring cavorting nudes.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Psst! Prince Harry Parties Here. Also Pippa and J-Law.

2017-10-11.abstract: Four sustainable labels that are changing fashion as we know it.
2017-10-11.snippet: Four sustainable labels that are changing fashion as we know it.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Slow has never been so chic. Designers, even those at the largest fashion houses, where punishing speed is the norm, are pushing back against the pressure to deliver new products at an ever-faster clip. Alessandro Michele, the magpie designer of Gucci, is feeling the burn. In his notes for last month’s show in Milan, he implored attendees: “Resist the mantra of speed that violently leads to losing oneself. Resist the illusion of something new at any cost.” That’s a message plenty of up-and-coming designers are spreading, too. Often they’re forsaking traditional retail schedules and creating staples made to last and, often times, available year-round. Here, a look at some who are leading the charge.
2017-10-11.headline_main: What Is Slow Fashion? We Explain

2017-10-11.abstract: A bill introduced in Congress would compel top administration officials to disclose whether regulatory changes would benefit them financially. So far, the legislation has no Republican support.
2017-10-11.snippet: A bill introduced in Congress would compel top administration officials to disclose whether regulatory changes would benefit them financially. So far, the legislation has no Republican support.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: A group of Democratic lawmakers introduced a bill on Wednesday that would compel top federal officials, including President Trump, to disclose how changes to regulations might benefit them financially.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Democrats Move to Force Trump Team Members to Divulge Industry Ties

2017-10-11.abstract: Because of his birthplace and his family’s tennis pedigree, Gomes has an unusual baseball biography. Regardless, he is a battler on the field.
2017-10-11.snippet: Because of his birthplace and his family’s tennis pedigree, Gomes has an unusual baseball biography. Regardless, he is a battler on the field.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — Game 2 of this American League division series was hanging in the balance Friday night when Yan Gomes stood at home plate in the bottom of the 13th inning, waving his bat at the best the Yankees relief pitcher Dellin Betances had to offer.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Indians’ Secret Weapon May Be Yan Gomes, Their Catcher From Brazil

2017-10-11.abstract: Ten years after her debut, Annie Clark teams up with the hitmaker Jack Antonoff for an album that paints pop as deep, dark and filled with paradoxes.
2017-10-11.snippet: Ten years after her debut, Annie Clark teams up with the hitmaker Jack Antonoff for an album that paints pop as deep, dark and filled with paradoxes.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Ten years after she released her debut album as St. Vincent, Annie Clark makes her decisive move into mainstream pop with “Masseduction.” She does it in the ways St. Vincent has always worked: accomplished, self-conscious, precise, unblinking, completely in control and exactly as revealing as she wants to be. “I am a lot like you/boys/I am alone like you/girls,” she sings over tense electropop in “Sugarboy,” bonding with listeners even as she acknowledges her separation.
2017-10-11.headline_main: St. Vincent Makes Her Move Into Pop With ‘Masseduction’

2017-10-11.abstract: The shift was a significant change for the Boy Scouts, where membership has slipped in recent decades. Girl Scouts leaders said they were “blindsided” by the move.
2017-10-11.snippet: The shift was a significant change for the Boy Scouts, where membership has slipped in recent decades. Girl Scouts leaders said they were “blindsided” by the move.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: The Boy Scouts of America announced plans on Wednesday to broadly accept girls, marking a historic shift for the century-old organization and setting off a debate about where girls better learn how to be leaders.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Boy Scouts Will Accept Girls, in Bid to ‘Shape the Next Generation of Leaders’

2017-10-11.abstract: On his new solo album, “Carry Fire,” the onetime Led Zeppelin frontman explores “grooves and moods,” from the blues to North African rhythms.
2017-10-11.snippet: On his new solo album, “Carry Fire,” the onetime Led Zeppelin frontman explores “grooves and moods,” from the blues to North African rhythms.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: A few years ago, Robert Plant found himself suddenly overcome with an urge to return to his roots. “I know I’m emphatically British,” he said. “But I didn’t realize how much that was true until I’d been away for a while.”
2017-10-11.headline_main: Robert Plant, Party of One. (With Friends, Too.)

2017-10-11.abstract: You don’t have to be a member of the Strokes to get Richie Baxt to set up your Les Paul. But you do have to know somebody who has his phone number.
2017-10-11.snippet: You don’t have to be a member of the Strokes to get Richie Baxt to set up your Les Paul. But you do have to know somebody who has his phone number.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Got a gig downtown in two hours and there’s no sound coming from your ’68 Stratocaster? Action need adjustment? Are you afraid your bass is possibly haunted? “Call Richie” is the mantra — if you’re connected enough in the music world to have the business card with the phone number for Richie’s Guitar Shop, which has been promoted solely through word of mouth since Mr. Baxt started teaching himself to fix guitars in 1978.
2017-10-11.headline_main: The Secret Zen Master of Guitar Repair

2017-10-11.abstract: Tired of wondering who gave you that terrible cold? There’s a genealogical test for that.
2017-10-11.snippet: Tired of wondering who gave you that terrible cold? There’s a genealogical test for that.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Is your winter schedule disrupted by colds that frequently turn into painful ear and throat infections? Worse, do you often know exactly who gave you a cold and find yourself unable to say anything because you lack proof?

2017-10-11.abstract: The 22 major blazes raging in California have been much more ferocious than the state’s typical fire season, for reasons that were years in the making.
2017-10-11.snippet: The 22 major blazes raging in California have been much more ferocious than the state’s typical fire season, for reasons that were years in the making.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: Intense, fast-moving fires have been raging across much of California since Sunday night. The blazes have barreled through communities like freight trains, turning homes to dust in a blink and leaving at least 23 people dead. The largest of the fires are in the state’s wine country  north of San Francisco.
2017-10-11.headline_main: California’s Wildfires: Why Have They Been So Destructive?

2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: The most popular comedy in America is “The Big Bang Theory,” now in its 11th season. The second most popular is “Modern Family,” now in its ninth season. Despite the vast altars on which networks make gruesome sacrifices while cantillating to their gods, neither of these shows will last forever. Some day, a new network comedy will ascend.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Review: ‘The Mayor,’ ‘9JKL’ and ‘Ghosted’ Offer Three Flavors of Network Comedy

2017-10-11.abstract: The actor took over the former Eastern Bloc gay bar, and turned it into Club Cumming.
2017-10-11.snippet: The actor took over the former Eastern Bloc gay bar, and turned it into Club Cumming.
2017-10-11.lead_paragraph: When Alan Cumming reprised his role of M.C. in the 2014 Broadway production of “Cabaret,” he kept the party going offstage, hosting impromptu gatherings in his dressing room. He called it “Club Cumming” and had a neon sign made for the soiree. That sign now hangs in the East Village, where Mr. Cumming took over a gay bar formerly known as Eastern Bloc and gave it a Weimar-theme makeover, complete with a small stage for esoteric entertainment.
2017-10-11.headline_main: Alan Cumming Brings His Cabaret to the East Village
