2017-10-16.abstract: The inability of the Nordstrom family to team up with a potential buyer suggests even risk-tolerant investors are cool on the retail sector.
2017-10-16.snippet: The inability of the Nordstrom family to team up with a potential buyer suggests even risk-tolerant investors are cool on the retail sector.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Retailers hoping to put themselves up for sale are in for a long winter. Take Nordstrom. With large insider stakes and growing revenue, the $6.7 billion department store chain was a prime candidate for a buyout. Now it is shelving its sale until after the holidays. It may be hoping for a higher price, but the delay suggests even risk-tolerant buyers are cool on the sector.
2017-10-16.headline_main: A Chilly Winter Forecast for Nordstrom and Other Retailers

2017-10-16.abstract: The policies, which are supported even by many gun owners, would prevent more deaths if they were in place nationwide, researchers concluded.
2017-10-16.snippet: The policies, which are supported even by many gun owners, would prevent more deaths if they were in place nationwide, researchers concluded.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Waiting periods in 17 states for handgun purchases prevent about 750 gun deaths each year in the United States, new research has found.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Handgun Waiting Periods Save Hundreds of Lives a Year, Study Finds

2017-10-16.abstract: Senator Thad Cochran was expected back in Washington on Monday after an extended illness. His failure to appear has increased speculation about his health.
2017-10-16.snippet: Senator Thad Cochran was expected back in Washington on Monday after an extended illness. His failure to appear has increased speculation about his health.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Capitol Hill’s most anticipated arrival on Monday did not come to pass: Senator Thad Cochran, the aging Republican patrician from Mississippi, stayed at home to continue recovering from a urological issue, his aides said.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Mississippi Senator’s Health Woes Narrow Republican Majority

2017-10-16.abstract: Even in a country accustomed to pervasive violence, the double truck bombings that killed hundreds in Mogadishu on Saturday were a shock.
2017-10-16.snippet: Even in a country accustomed to pervasive violence, the double truck bombings that killed hundreds in Mogadishu on Saturday were a shock.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: MOGADISHU, Somalia — Car bombs, grenade attacks, assassinations and abductions by Shabab insurgents shatter the fragile veneer of calm in Somalia with such regularity that barely a week goes by without a deadly assault.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Somalia Blasts Expose Security Failings and Possible Shabab Infiltration

2017-10-16.abstract: Officials say they are prepared to exit the talks rather than accept a deal they see as harmful. Already, they are looking to contain the effects and to adapt.
2017-10-16.snippet: Officials say they are prepared to exit the talks rather than accept a deal they see as harmful. Already, they are looking to contain the effects and to adapt.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Mexico is steeling itself for the increasing possibility that the United States will pull out of the North American Free Trade Agreement, envisioning how the Mexican economy would adapt without the deal that has guided relations between the neighbors for a quarter-century.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Mexico Braces for the Possible Collapse of Nafta

2017-10-16.abstract: The new braiser from Staub is a versatile addition to a cook’s batterie de cuisine.
2017-10-16.snippet: The new braiser from Staub is a versatile addition to a cook’s batterie de cuisine.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: At Staub, the French cookware company, they call this a heritage braiser because it was inspired by one in their archives. It was originally made for chefs, and it is handsome enough to go from stove to table. The sloping 3½-quart enameled cast iron vessel is extremely versatile and can cook paellas, risottos, frittatas, clams or mussels, in addition to braising meats and poultry. The lid, with its dimpled underside, helps the basting process. The pan is easy to clean, but not as easy to lift and carry, as it clocks in at about 14 pounds empty: Staub Heritage Braiser, Sur La Table, $199.96, 800-243-0852, surlatable.com.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Heavyweight Pot for Holiday Entertaining

2017-10-16.abstract: The family behind the high-end retail chain cited “difficulty of obtaining debt financing” in postponing its privatization plans.
2017-10-16.snippet: The family behind the high-end retail chain cited “difficulty of obtaining debt financing” in postponing its privatization plans.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: The family behind the 116-year-old Nordstrom retail chain is shelving its efforts to go private until after the holiday season, the company said Monday.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Nordstrom Suspends Effort to Go Private Until After the Holidays

2017-10-16.abstract: President Trump and Senator Mitch McConnell, the Republican leader, put on a public display of bonhomie, waving aside reports of a disintegrating relationship.
2017-10-16.snippet: President Trump and Senator Mitch McConnell, the Republican leader, put on a public display of bonhomie, waving aside reports of a disintegrating relationship.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump and Senator Mitch McConnell, the Republican leader, tried to convey a sense of harmony on Monday after months of bitter, private feuding that threatened to undermine their party’s legislative push in the coming weeks to enact a sweeping tax cut.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Trump and McConnell Strive for Comity Amid Rising Tensions

2017-10-16.abstract: The incidence of mouth and throat cancers caused by the human papillomavirus in men has now surpassed the incidence of HPV-related cervical cancers in women.
2017-10-16.snippet: The incidence of mouth and throat cancers caused by the human papillomavirus in men has now surpassed the incidence of HPV-related cervical cancers in women.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: The incidence of mouth and throat cancers caused by the human papillomavirus in men has now surpassed the incidence of HPV-related cervical cancers in women, researchers report.
2017-10-16.headline_main: 7 Million American Men Carry Cancer-Causing HPV

2017-10-16.abstract: Hazelnut-filled chocolate bars in the shape of Swiss Army knives are a fun adult Halloween treat. Stash them away as stocking stuffers, too.
2017-10-16.snippet: Hazelnut-filled chocolate bars in the shape of Swiss Army knives are a fun adult Halloween treat. Stash them away as stocking stuffers, too.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Keep your hands off the children’s fun-size Milky Ways this Halloween. Here is wrapped chocolate for adult revelers. The slender milk chocolate bars with hazelnut filling are wrapped to mimic Swiss Army knives; they come from Switzerland, of course, and security screeners should not confiscate them at the airport (unless the guard is hungry). Buy extras — after Halloween you may need some as stocking stuffers: Victorinox Chocolate Knife, $9.99 per box of five, Fairway Markets through Oct. 26.
2017-10-16.headline_main: A Sweet Utility Knife for the MacGyver in Your Life

2017-10-16.abstract: Here are answers to some questions you might have about the discovery that was announced on Monday.
2017-10-16.snippet: Here are answers to some questions you might have about the discovery that was announced on Monday.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: On Monday, astronomers made a universe-shaking announcement about the detection of reverberations from the collision of two neutron stars.
2017-10-16.headline_main: It Was a Universe-Shaking Announcement. But What Is a Neutron Star Anyway?

2017-10-16.abstract: The witness, Maksim G. Lapunov, who says he was abducted and beaten by the police, has filed a formal complaint with the authorities and publicly identified himself.
2017-10-16.snippet: The witness, Maksim G. Lapunov, who says he was abducted and beaten by the police, has filed a formal complaint with the authorities and publicly identified himself.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — In what human rights workers are widely hailing as a courageous move, a gay man who says he was abducted and tortured in Chechnya has publicly identified himself and filed a complaint with the authorities.
2017-10-16.headline_main: After Anti-Gay Crackdown in Chechnya, a Witness Steps Forward

2017-10-16.abstract: She wrote of women oppressed by the Taliban, “I carried with me their pleading voices and ultimately their screams, while the world looked away.”
2017-10-16.snippet: She wrote of women oppressed by the Taliban, “I carried with me their pleading voices and ultimately their screams, while the world looked away.”
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Sima Wali, who fled the Soviet-backed coup in Afghanistan in 1978 to wage what she called a “jihad for peace and equality” by women against “gender apartheid” imposed by the Communists and then by the Taliban, died on Sept. 22 at her home in Falls Church, Va. She was 66.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Sima Wali, Champion of Afghan Women’s Rights, Is Dead at 66

2017-10-16.abstract: Cook Space Culinary Studio in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, holds classes and rents its kitchens for food events.
2017-10-16.snippet: Cook Space Culinary Studio in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, holds classes and rents its kitchens for food events.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Cook Space Culinary Studio is a new cooking school and catering facility in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, from the restaurateur Michelle Jackson Mannix, the chef Nini Nguyen and Lara Southern, a Londoner who has worked in similar spaces. Cook Space specializes in six-week workshops at different levels and offers small hands-on classes. In the coming weeks, they’ll cover cooking with apples, Vietnamese street food, turkey brining and Thanksgiving sides. Children can also learn yummy skills like how to make dim sum. The complex has elegant catering spaces for dinner parties and food events: Cook Space Culinary Studio, 603 Bergen Street (Carlton Avenue), Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, 631-830-1117, cookspacebrooklyn.com.
2017-10-16.headline_main: New Cooking School Offers Space for Dinner Parties, Too

2017-10-16.abstract: President Trump’s assertion belied a long record of meetings his predecessor, Barack Obama, held with the families of killed service members, as well as calls and letters.
2017-10-16.snippet: President Trump’s assertion belied a long record of meetings his predecessor, Barack Obama, held with the families of killed service members, as well as calls and letters.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump falsely asserted on Monday that his predecessor, Barack Obama, and other presidents did not contact the families of American troops killed in duty, drawing a swift, angry rebuke from several of Mr. Obama’s former aides.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Trump Falsely Claims Obama Didn’t Contact Families of Fallen Troops

2017-10-16.abstract: The winner will be announced tomorrow.
2017-10-16.snippet: The winner will be announced tomorrow.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: The winner of the Man Booker Prize will be announced on Tuesday. Here are reviews for the books on the shortlist.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Reviews for All the Books on the Man Booker Prize Shortlist

2017-10-16.abstract: Five types of Japanese green tea are included in this set from Ippudo.
2017-10-16.snippet: Five types of Japanese green tea are included in this set from Ippudo.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Ippodo, a Japanese tea company based in Kyoto, has just introduced an elegant green-tea sampler. Tidy canisters hold five typical styles: powdered matcha, whole-leaf sencha, shade-grown gyokuro, nutty roasted hojicha and genmaicha, a tea mixed with brown rice: Set of five green teas, $80; three green teas, $55; ippodo-tea.co.jp/en.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Sample the Japanese Tea Standards

2017-10-16.abstract: As a congressman, Tom Marino, the president’s choice to lead the drug policy office, championed legislation to undercut enforcement efforts against the drug industry.
2017-10-16.snippet: As a congressman, Tom Marino, the president’s choice to lead the drug policy office, championed legislation to undercut enforcement efforts against the drug industry.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s plans to combat the nation’s opioid epidemic were disrupted on Monday as he came under pressure to abandon a nominee for drug czar who championed legislation undercutting the government’s power to go after pharmaceutical companies that contribute to the crisis.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Trump Says He’ll Consider Pulling Drug Czar Nomination

2017-10-16.abstract: This strong Mexican spirit from Michoacan is buried underground in a cemetery to age.
2017-10-16.snippet: This strong Mexican spirit from Michoacan is buried underground in a cemetery to age.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: There is a tradition in Mexico — especially in the State of Michoacan, west of Mexico City — to bury special batches of mezcal in large glass bottles to age, often in cemeteries. Don Lupe Perez, the distiller at Mezcales de Leyenda, has released a limited edition of just such a mezcal. The clear, slightly viscous liquor is smoky, with rich, fruity notes. It’s a spirit for sipping, perhaps with a simple squirt of lime and a salty nibble alongside: Mezcales de Leyenda, Cementerio Mezcalero, $269.96, Astor Wine & Spirits, 399 Lafayette Street (East Fourth Street), 212-674-7500, astorwines.com.
2017-10-16.headline_main: A Mezcal Ideal for Day of the Dead

2017-10-16.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-10-16.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2017-10-16.headline_main: Trump, Weinstein, Kirkuk: Your Monday Evening Briefing

2017-10-16.abstract: One person’s fumble yields another person’s snack.
2017-10-16.snippet: One person’s fumble yields another person’s snack.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:
2017-10-16.headline_main: Watermelon Man

2017-10-16.abstract: Michael L. Dourson has been nominated to take over the top job in regulating toxic chemicals at the Environmental Protection Agency. For much of the last two decades, he has worked as a consultant, frequently hired by chemical manufacturers to evaluate some of the same chemicals he will now be asked, on behalf of the E.P.A.
2017-10-16.snippet: Michael L. Dourson has been nominated to take over the top job in regulating toxic chemicals at the Environmental Protection Agency. For much of the last two decades, he has worked as a consultant, frequently hired by chemical manufacturers to eva...
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Michael L. Dourson has been nominated to take over the top job in regulating toxic chemicals at the Environmental Protection Agency. For much of the last two decades, he has worked as a consultant, frequently hired by chemical manufacturers to evaluate some of the same chemicals he will now be asked, on behalf of the E.P.A.

2017-10-16.abstract: President Trump signed an executive order paving the way for cheaper insurance policies with fewer benefits.
2017-10-16.snippet: President Trump signed an executive order paving the way for cheaper insurance policies with fewer benefits.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump, after failing to repeal the Affordable Care Act in Congress, signed an executive order on Thursday paving the way for cheaper policies with fewer benefits.
2017-10-16.headline_main: When Repeal and Replace Fails, Undermine and Undercut

2017-10-16.abstract: The Netanyahu government is trying to balance domestic demands with international opposition to new construction in the occupied territories.
2017-10-16.snippet: The Netanyahu government is trying to balance domestic demands with international opposition to new construction in the occupied territories.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Israel is moving ahead with plans for a significant expansion of its settlements in the occupied West Bank, including apartments in the volatile city of Hebron and the first approval of a new settlement in 20 years.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Israel Moves Ahead on West Bank Settlements, but Guardedly

2017-10-16.abstract: The judge denied a motion to dismiss the corruption case based on a major Supreme Court decision last year, ensuring that jurors will decide the outcome.
2017-10-16.snippet: The judge denied a motion to dismiss the corruption case based on a major Supreme Court decision last year, ensuring that jurors will decide the outcome.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: NEWARK — The federal corruption trial of Senator Robert Menendez resumed Monday after a judge rejected a motion by the defense to dismiss the case based on a major Supreme Court decision last year that overturned the corruption conviction against a former Virginia governor.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Menendez Trial Judge Rejects Motion to Dismiss the Case

2017-10-16.abstract: The victorious People’s Party needs to reject a coalition with a party with ties to the Third Reich.
2017-10-16.snippet: The victorious People’s Party needs to reject a coalition with a party with ties to the Third Reich.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: An anti-immigrant, anti-Muslim party won the Austrian elections on Sunday, and its leader might form a government with a party founded by ex-Nazis.
2017-10-16.headline_main: In Election, Austria’s Nazi Past Raises Its Head

2017-10-16.abstract: Separate decisions to not prosecute Harvey Weinstein and Ivanka and Donald Trump Jr. have forced the Manhattan district attorney to do damage control.
2017-10-16.snippet: Separate decisions to not prosecute Harvey Weinstein and Ivanka and Donald Trump Jr. have forced the Manhattan district attorney to do damage control.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: It was supposed to be a quiet October for Cyrus R. Vance Jr. as he glided unopposed to a third term as Manhattan’s district attorney. It has been anything but.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Running Unopposed, Vance Is Suddenly on the Defensive

2017-10-16.abstract: Politics can devolve into a fight between people who believe society is moving upward and those who think all is broken.
2017-10-16.snippet: Politics can devolve into a fight between people who believe society is moving upward and those who think all is broken.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: The popular gloom notwithstanding, we’re actually living in an era of astounding progress. We’ve seen the greatest reduction in global poverty in history. As Steven Pinker has documented, we’ve seen a steady decline in wars and armed conflict. The U.S. economy is the best performing major economy in the developed world.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Upswingers and Downswingers

2017-10-16.abstract: Condoms are almost guaranteed giggle-inducers, so serious reporting about a new line available in 60 different sizes was a bit of a balancing act.
2017-10-16.snippet: Condoms are almost guaranteed giggle-inducers, so serious reporting about a new line available in 60 different sizes was a bit of a balancing act.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Writing about condoms presents a conundrum. Reproductive health is serious, but condoms are almost guaranteed giggle-inducers. So covering a new line of condoms that are available in 60 different sizes was a bit of a balancing act.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Covering Condoms: A Notoriously Slippery Subject

2017-10-16.abstract: Republicans on taxes: the most dishonest selling job in U.S. political history.
2017-10-16.snippet: Republicans on taxes: the most dishonest selling job in U.S. political history.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: According to a new CBS News poll, almost 60 percent of the American public believes that the current Republican tax plan favors the wealthy. Some people see this number as a sign that the plan is in trouble; I see it as a sign that Republican lies are working far better than they deserve to.
2017-10-16.headline_main: The G.O.P. Is No Party for Honest Men

2017-10-16.abstract: The results, with pro-government candidates winning a majority of state races, shocked many and raised new questions about the integrity of the nation’s electoral system.
2017-10-16.snippet: The results, with pro-government candidates winning a majority of state races, shocked many and raised new questions about the integrity of the nation’s electoral system.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela — For members of Venezuela’s opposition, the big question heading into Sunday’s elections seemed less about whether they would win than how much power they would be allowed to wield once they did.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Venezuelan Opposition Denounces Latest Vote as Ruling Party Makes Gains

2017-10-16.abstract: The ruling, by a federal judge in Texas, is a setback for Allergan, which had transferred the patents to a Mohawk tribe in order to protect them.
2017-10-16.snippet: The ruling, by a federal judge in Texas, is a setback for Allergan, which had transferred the patents to a Mohawk tribe in order to protect them.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Texas invalidated four key patents for the dry-eye treatment Restasis on Monday, dealing a blow to its manufacturer, Allergan, which had sought to protect its patents by transferring them to a Native American tribe.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Patents for Restasis Are Invalidated, Opening Door to Generics

2017-10-16.abstract: If the goal can be achieved by hiring a group of 12 white male employees, you can guess who will remain left out.
2017-10-16.snippet: If the goal can be achieved by hiring a group of 12 white male employees, you can guess who will remain left out.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — Discussing her work at Apple at an event last week about fighting racial injustice, Denise Young Smith, the company’s vice president of diversity and inclusion, said, “There can be 12 white, blue-eyed, blond men in a room and they’re going to be diverse, too, because they’re going to bring a different life experience and life perspective to the conversation.”
2017-10-16.headline_main: Tech’s Troubling New Trend: Diversity Is in Your Head

2017-10-16.abstract: The movie business is corrupt and depraved. The Republican Party under Trump is worse.
2017-10-16.snippet: The movie business is corrupt and depraved. The Republican Party under Trump is worse.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Say this for Donald Trump: When it comes to sex, he’s less of a hypocrite than Harvey Weinstein. Until Weinstein’s abrupt downfall amid proliferating accusations of sexual assault and harassment, he posed as a backer of women’s rights. He made films with substantive female leads (82-year-old Judi Dench joked that she’d tattooed his name on her butt in gratitude), donated money to politicians supporting feminist policies and contributed to endow a chair at Rutgers University honoring Gloria Steinem. He even attended the Women’s March at Sundance. Yet privately, he appears to have been a sexist ogre, using his power to exploit and humiliate women. After the truth about his conduct was widely revealed, he was cast out of his professional community and rendered a pariah.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Save the Phony Weinstein Outrage, Republicans

2017-10-16.abstract: Using the leaked Panama Papers, the journalist, Daphne Caruana Galizia, exposed Malta’s links to offshore tax havens.
2017-10-16.snippet: Using the leaked Panama Papers, the journalist, Daphne Caruana Galizia, exposed Malta’s links to offshore tax havens.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: An investigative journalist in Malta who exposed her island nation’s links to offshore tax havens using the leaked Panama Papers was killed in a car bombing on Monday, an attack that shocked Malta and was condemned by leaders of the European Union.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Investigative Journalist in Malta Is Killed in Car Bombing

2017-10-16.abstract: Writers from across the political spectrum on the continuing rifts inside the Republican Party.
2017-10-16.snippet: Writers from across the political spectrum on the continuing rifts inside the Republican Party.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. That’s why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Right and Left React to Bannon’s Harsh Words for McConnell

2017-10-16.abstract: The company beat expectations by adding 5.3 million subscribers in the third quarter and said it would ramp up its spending on original content.
2017-10-16.snippet: The company beat expectations by adding 5.3 million subscribers in the third quarter and said it would ramp up its spending on original content.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Netflix will spend between $7 billion and $8 billion on content in 2018, up from the roughly $6 billion it will spend this year, the streaming service said while announcing its third-quarter earnings on Monday.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Netflix Says It Will Spend Up to $8 Billion on Content Next Year

2017-10-16.abstract: President Trump, during a news conference, touched on topics as wide-ranging as disaster relief, the special counsel and assault allegations.
2017-10-16.snippet: President Trump, during a news conference, touched on topics as wide-ranging as disaster relief, the special counsel and assault allegations.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a joint news conference on Monday with Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, President Trump sought to reaffirm his relationship with Republican leaders in Congress, promised new decisions on the opioid epidemic, tax cuts and health care, and blamed the Cuban government for mysterious illnesses that racked the United States Embassy’s staff in Havana.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Hillary Clinton, the N.F.L., Roy Moore and Other Asides From the President

2017-10-16.abstract: An administrator said they knew of about 160 sexual abuse claims that may qualify for compensation from the Diocese of Rockville Centre, and they expect more.
2017-10-16.snippet: An administrator said they knew of about 160 sexual abuse claims that may qualify for compensation from the Diocese of Rockville Centre, and they expect more.
2017-10-16.lead_paragraph: Thomas McGarvey was going through a hard time as a teenager in 1981 when he first reached out to his parish priest, the Rev. Robert L. Brown, for spiritual guidance and someone to talk to.
2017-10-16.headline_main: Long Island Diocese Creates Program for Victims of Clergy Abuse

2017-10-17.abstract: Even as the fires still burn, public health officials and environmental cleanup experts are starting to think about the next chapter of the disaster.
2017-10-17.snippet: Even as the fires still burn, public health officials and environmental cleanup experts are starting to think about the next chapter of the disaster.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: SANTA ROSA, Calif. — Dr. Karen Relucio has heard reports of people digging into the ashes of their burned homes in recent days without gloves, wearing only shorts and T-shirts, looking for sentimental items that might have survived California’s horrific wildfires. And as the chief public health officer in Napa County, one of the hardest-hit places, she has used her office as a bully pulpit to urge them to stop, immediately.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Cleanup From California Fires Poses Environmental and Health Risks

2017-10-17.abstract: By backing out of international commitments, he is ceding the future to the powers he claims to be protecting Americans from.
2017-10-17.snippet: By backing out of international commitments, he is ceding the future to the powers he claims to be protecting Americans from.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Americans have long struggled with the question of whether this country should be more involved in world affairs, or less. The contest of ideas between internationalists and isolationists has been particularly fierce among Republicans, going all the way back to Teddy Roosevelt and William Howard Taft and continuing on to the beginning of World War II.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Under Mr. Trump, America Surrenders

2017-10-17.abstract: At a news conference projecting Republican unity, President Trump spoke about four Green Berets killed in Niger, and made false claims that his predecessors did not call the families of fallen soldiers.
2017-10-17.snippet: At a news conference projecting Republican unity, President Trump spoke about four Green Berets killed in Niger, and made false claims that his predecessors did not call the families of fallen soldiers.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: At a news conference projecting Republican unity, President Trump spoke about four Green Berets killed in Niger, and made false claims that his predecessors did not call the families of fallen soldiers.

2017-10-17.abstract: Nash, who is a player development consultant with the Warriors, says he would prefer to be out of the spotlight when the team gets its title rings on Tuesday.
2017-10-17.snippet: Nash, who is a player development consultant with the Warriors, says he would prefer to be out of the spotlight when the team gets its title rings on Tuesday.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: No matter how incongruous it might look to an outsider to see a former point guard extraordinaire tutoring one of the most distinctive lanky forwards in the history of the sport, there is zero hesitation from Steve Nash.
2017-10-17.headline_main: The Warriors Want Steve Nash in Their Ring Ceremony. He’d Rather Pass.

2017-10-17.abstract: Ken Giles and Brad Lidge share a bond as relievers to star for the Houston Astros and Philadelphia Phillies, but what truly unites them is the ability to command a wicked slider.
2017-10-17.snippet: Ken Giles and Brad Lidge share a bond as relievers to star for the Houston Astros and Philadelphia Phillies, but what truly unites them is the ability to command a wicked slider.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Players retire and the game marches on. Some have sons who grow up to reach the majors, but few others can relive their glory in a personal way. They have a chance, perhaps, if they have left something tangible behind.
2017-10-17.headline_main: A Nasty Slider Unites Houston Closers Old and New

2017-10-17.abstract: A new study by a pair of professors concludes that many so-called unicorn companies are worth half of what is commonly reported for their valuation.
2017-10-17.snippet: A new study by a pair of professors concludes that many so-called unicorn companies are worth half of what is commonly reported for their valuation.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Uber is said to be worth $62.5 billion. Airbnb is valued at $31 billion. Elon Musk’s SpaceX Technologies is valued at $21 billion, and Pinterest at $12.3 billion.
2017-10-17.headline_main: How Valuable Is a Unicorn? Maybe Not as Much as It Claims to Be

2017-10-17.abstract: James M. Bradley Jr. admitted to a role in transporting illegal immigrants across South Texas in July, after 10 men died in a hot tractor-trailer.
2017-10-17.snippet: James M. Bradley Jr. admitted to a role in transporting illegal immigrants across South Texas in July, after 10 men died in a hot tractor-trailer.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: A tractor-trailer driver accused of hauling undocumented immigrants in a scorching truck through South Texas in July, which resulted in the deaths of 10 men, pleaded guilty on Monday to human smuggling charges.

2017-10-17.abstract: On the centenary of the October Revolution, the former secretary of state writes about the books that best help us understand Russia.
2017-10-17.snippet: On the centenary of the October Revolution, the former secretary of state writes about the books that best help us understand Russia.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: “This is where it happened,” my Russian guide declared. It was 1979 and I was a graduate student in Moscow for the summer. A side trip to Leningrad was a must for me, a first time traveler to the country. “Czar Alexander II was riding down this road when the assassins struck,” she said. Almost under her breath, she added, “He was a reformer.” Any hope for the liberalization of Russia seemed to die with the czar who had freed the serfs and attempted to modernize the country. Alexander II’s death brought to power his hard-line successor Alexander III, who initiated a harsh crackdown (among those soon executed was the older brother of Vladimir Ilyich Lenin). This would only sharpen the conflict in the country. Peasants had no bread. Workers’ lives were miserable and often endangered. And soldiers were forced into battle in the Great War, a fight they could not win. Alexander III’s son and successor, the hapless Nicholas II, would abdicate in 1917. The parliamentary government of Alexander Kerensky would survive less than a year.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Condoleezza Rice on the 10 Days Still Shaking the World

2017-10-17.abstract: Accusations of “politicizing” may seem like mudslinging but reflect deeper assumptions about what is objective truth.
2017-10-17.snippet: Accusations of “politicizing” may seem like mudslinging but reflect deeper assumptions about what is objective truth.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Politicization is the last refuge of the scoundrel. To “politicize” something — hurricanes, intelligence, science, football, gun violence — is to render it political in a way that distorts its true meaning. That, at least, seems to be the reasoning of those who use the term as an insult: We adhere to pristine, unadulterated facts and call for unity; they politicize those facts for partisan gain and divide us even more.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Why Is ‘Politicization’ So Partisan?

2017-10-17.snippet: Not only can the Ethiopian capital be done inexpensively, you will also find fascinating cultural landmarks, wonderful food and an almost unparalleled coffee culture.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: I’ve stayed in some unusual digs on my travels but this was something new. I walked through the colorfully hand-painted door to music emanating from a boombox and the soft thud of bodies hitting gymnastics mats. There were about a dozen kids learning how to tumble, and I could see a trapeze, a Cyr wheel and aerial silks. This place was a circus — literally. These were my hosts: the members of an Ethiopian circus troupe — good-natured and helpful, and eager to educate me about their country — who rent out a spare room to travelers.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Navigating Sometimes Chaotic, Always Fascinating Addis Ababa

2017-10-17.abstract: With an isolated leader, a demoralized diplomatic corps and a president dismantling international relations one tweet at a time, American foreign policy is adrift in the world.
2017-10-17.snippet: With an isolated leader, a demoralized diplomatic corps and a president dismantling international relations one tweet at a time, American foreign policy is adrift in the world.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: One afternoon in late September, I sat down with Rex Tillerson on what, in hindsight, may well have been his last comparatively normal day as secretary of state. It was a little more than 72 hours before President Donald Trump would take to Twitter to declare that Tillerson, his top diplomat, was “wasting his time trying to negotiate with Little Rocket Man,” as the president now refers to the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, and admonish Tillerson: “Save your energy Rex, we’ll do what has to be done!” Which was a few days before NBC News would report that Tillerson, after a July meeting with Trump, called the president a “moron” and wanted to resign until Vice President Mike Pence talked him out of it. Which was just a couple hours before Tillerson would hold an extraordinary news conference in the State Department’s Treaty Room — the magisterial, blue-walled chamber where secretaries of state typically greet foreign dignitaries — in order to tell reporters that Trump “is smart”; deny that he ever considered resigning; and refuse to answer a question about whether he had indeed called the president a moron.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Rex Tillerson and the Unraveling of the State Department

2017-10-17.abstract: A three-word answer to the global question, ‘Where are you?’
2017-10-17.snippet: A three-word answer to the global question, ‘Where are you?’
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: As a young reporter, I lived in Managua, Nicaragua. The city had been leveled by an earthquake in 1972 and never rebuilt. It was still a bit of a moonscape. It’s different now, but back then few streets had names and the houses had no addresses — not as we know them, anyway. If you needed to tell someone where you lived, you referenced well-known landmarks, for example: “two blocks south and 20 yards toward the lake from the giant tree.” Or worse, people would say “from where the giant tree used to be” — a tree that had been toppled in the earthquake.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Beyond the GPS, Mapping Every Place, Everywhere

2017-10-17.abstract: A film that opened in Paris in 1979 finally surfaces in the United States.
2017-10-17.snippet: A film that opened in Paris in 1979 finally surfaces in the United States.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: The peculiar dark magic of “L’Enfant Secret,” a 1979 film by Philippe Garrel only now seeing theatrical release in the United States, begins with its models. “Models” was the term the monumental French filmmaker Robert Bresson used for the men and women he cast in his films; he believed acting was an art best reserved for the theater, so he recruited faces and bodies he felt could carry his intents, and instructed them to enact precise physical movements, but not to emote.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Review: The Crushed Romanticism of Philippe Garrel’s ‘L’Enfant Secret’

2017-10-17.abstract: A new documentary examines Hitchcock’s film from various angles. Did you know Scorsese modeled a fight sequence in “Raging Bull” on the shower scene?
2017-10-17.snippet: A new documentary examines Hitchcock’s film from various angles. Did you know Scorsese modeled a fight sequence in “Raging Bull” on the shower scene?
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: At three minutes and change, the shower scene in Alfred Hitchcock’s “Psycho” is one of the most familiar in film history. The deadly encounter between Marion Crane and the cross-dressing Norman Bates was shot over seven days in 1959, and every element is instantly recognizable: the shadowy figure tearing aside the shower curtain, the stream of blood and water circling the drain, Bernard Herrmann’s shrieking violins. The scene has been dissected by scholars and critics and parodied by everyone from Mel Brooks to “The Simpsons”; its score has become aural shorthand for “something really scary is about to happen.” Is there anything a “Psycho” fan still might not know about this most famous of cinematic moments?
2017-10-17.headline_main: 5 ‘Psycho’ Surprises: Inside the Most Familiar Scene in Movies

2017-10-17.abstract: An innovative cocktail bar heads to Greenpoint, Brooklyn, and other restaurant news.
2017-10-17.snippet: An innovative cocktail bar heads to Greenpoint, Brooklyn, and other restaurant news.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: WOKUNI Another Japanese import, this one from Tokyo Ichiban Foods, a company that has about 50 restaurants in Japan, features izakaya fare that’s more polished than usual. The menu lists dishes, some fairly uncommon, in a slew of categories, like cold items that include baby sardines with grated daikon, steamed monkfish liver with ponzu sauce, and cold udon with tempura. Hot dishes, appetizer-style, include chawan mushi, and miso-glazed eggplant with seafood, with more substantial portions for items like tuna tail steak. Fried dishes, kushiyaki skewers, plus sushi, sashimi, rolls, salads, soup and desserts round out the menu. All served in a subdued and elegant setting decorated with handmade ceramic tiles. The chain has its own aquaculture facility for bluefin tuna and king yellowtail, which it flies in to its restaurants daily, including now to New York. But unlike the places in Japan, which are simpler izakayas, this branch has a retail counter where soon, these fish and other seasonal varieties will be sold; for now, handmade Japanese tableware is available. (Wednesday): 325 Lexington Avenue (39th Street), 212-447-1212, wokuninyc.com.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Wokuni, From Japan, Opens in Murray Hill

2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — In the final act of Janacek’s “The Cunning Little Vixen,” a litter of fox cubs comes upon a dead hare that carries a whiff of human scent. Their mother warns her young that the carcass is bait, and mocks the person who laid such an obvious trap. But moments later she runs into the Hunter, who kills her with one shot of his rifle.

In front of a three-channel video assemblage, three performers re-create Alaska’s past and present in quick-fire scenes that somehow take on way too much and, yet, perhaps not enough.

2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: The protagonist of our film, Santiago Gonzalez IV, is a first-generation college student, son of Mexican immigrants, surfer, flamenco dancer, bullfighter, dedicated Christian and a young gay man navigating his first same-sex relationship, with his classmate Austin McKinley. As he graduates from his conservative Christian college in San Diego, Mr. Gonzalez manages to beautifully balance these identity categories, which can often divide communities, families, and individuals.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Gay and in Love at an Evangelical College

2017-10-17.abstract: It’s odoriferous. It’s insidious. It’s America.
2017-10-17.snippet: It’s odoriferous. It’s insidious. It’s America.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: There are villains out there of infinitely greater consequence than the one I’m about to describe, and the news of late teems with them. But surely we still have the levity, and the taste buds, to look past the White House and beyond Hollywood and tremble before a lesser boogeyman.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Will Pumpkin Spice Destroy Us All?

2017-10-17.abstract: Stifling the protests would be illegal.
2017-10-17.snippet: Stifling the protests would be illegal.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: As National Football League owners and players’ union representatives meet in New York today and tomorrow to discuss the players’ recent demonstrations — the kneeling, linking arms or raising fists during the national anthem — they should know how the law views these protests. This will not only tell them what the league lawfully can do; it also will reveal something about American values.
2017-10-17.headline_main: The Law Is on the N.F.L. Players’ Side

2017-10-17.abstract: Goldman Sachs posted strong results, but its rival on Wall Street has earnings that look more repeatable.
2017-10-17.snippet: Goldman Sachs posted strong results, but its rival on Wall Street has earnings that look more repeatable.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs edged past Morgan Stanley on style points in the third quarter, but not on substance. Lloyd Blankfein’s firm cranked out $2 billion of earnings in the three months to the end of September, at an annualized return on equity of 10.9 percent. That bested the 9.6 percent showing of Goldman’s main Wall Street rival — the first time this year that it has come out ahead. Morgan Stanley’s boss, James Gorman, though, has crafted a more attractive-looking business for the longer term.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Goldman Sachs Had Good Earnings, but It Could Learn From Morgan Stanley

2017-10-17.abstract: In “Generation Wealth,” the photographer shows that she can satirize her subjects. But does she give insight into why we live the way we do?
2017-10-17.snippet: In “Generation Wealth,” the photographer shows that she can satirize her subjects. But does she give insight into why we live the way we do?
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: There are some things money can’t buy: for example, intimacy. Few people, rich or poor, really like to disclose their financial standing to the world — which means a photographer interested in wealth and poverty needs a special gift for seduction. Whether depicting privation, as in Gordon Parks’s indelible essay of a struggling Harlem family, or privilege, as in the high society portraits of Tina Barney, the most powerful images of American money rely on trust. They are mutual exchanges between lenser and lensed, although there is always a third element in the frame: the economy itself.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Lauren Greenfield Tries to Capture the Meaning of Money

2017-10-17.abstract: Two regions of northern Italy will vote on whether to request greater autonomy. They’re not demanding secession, but the referendums are being closely watched.
2017-10-17.snippet: Two regions of northern Italy will vote on whether to request greater autonomy. They’re not demanding secession, but the referendums are being closely watched.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: MILAN — Catalonia has been racked by sound and fury over a drive to secede from Spain, but on a recent morning in Lombardy, which will vote on Sunday on whether to demand greater autonomy from Italy, the mood was distinctly more laid back.
2017-10-17.headline_main: First Scotland, Then Catalonia. And Now? Milan and Venice

2017-10-17.abstract: Hours before the ban was to take effect, a federal judge in Hawaii halted its enforcement against travelers from six countries while the opponents challenge it in court.
2017-10-17.snippet: Hours before the ban was to take effect, a federal judge in Hawaii halted its enforcement against travelers from six countries while the opponents challenge it in court.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s attempts to block travelers from a handful of countries — most of them predominantly Muslim — from coming to the United States hit another legal snag on Tuesday, when a federal judge in Hawaii issued a nationwide order freezing most of Mr. Trump’s third travel ban the day before it was to take effect.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Judge Temporarily Halts New Version of Trump’s Travel Ban

2017-10-17.headline_main: Google Serves Fake News Ads in an Unlikely Place: Fact-Checking Sites

2017-10-17.abstract: The University of Wisconsin’s anti-protest policy shows it’s more worried about protecting conservative opinions than student expression.
2017-10-17.snippet: The University of Wisconsin’s anti-protest policy shows it’s more worried about protecting conservative opinions than student expression.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: I only remember a little of what I learned during my first days as a University of Wisconsin-Madison freshman in the late 1990s. The vegetarian chili sold in the student union’s bar tasted of beans and sawdust. The most important unwritten rule required freshmen to take blurry Polaroid pictures of ourselves seated atop the lap of the Abraham Lincoln statue at 2 a.m. And if we wanted to protest anything, we could.
2017-10-17.headline_main: When Conservatives Suppress Campus Speech

2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Reggie Jackson watched on Monday as Aaron Judge ripped impressive batting-practice rockets into the farthest reaches of Yankee Stadium. All the while, Mr. October was explaining why pitches that dart low and outside should, in theory, present excellent opportunities for a power hitter.
2017-10-17.headline_main: In the Cage and at the Plate, Aaron Judge Is Still Trying to Figure It Out

2017-10-17.snippet: President Trump claims that he has “done more against ISIS” than President Obama. But he hasn’t ventured far from the path his predecessor set.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Trump took office in January, the Islamic State controlled about 23,300 square miles of territory across Iraq and Syria. Now, as an American-backed militia declared on Tuesday that it had liberated Raqqa, Syria, the capital of the extremists’ self-proclaimed caliphate, the Islamic State’s territory has dwindled to no more than 9,300 square miles.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Can Trump Claim Credit for a Waning Islamic State?

2017-10-17.abstract: A state of emergency has already been declared in preparation for the white nationalist’s appearance at Florida’s flagship university on Thursday.
2017-10-17.snippet: A state of emergency has already been declared in preparation for the white nationalist’s appearance at Florida’s flagship university on Thursday.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Richard B. Spencer, a prominent white nationalist, is scheduled to speak at the University of Florida on Thursday, prompting an outcry over whether his views are protected speech, dividing the campus and putting law enforcement officials on high alert.
2017-10-17.headline_main: University of Florida Braces for Richard Spencer

2017-10-17.abstract: Financial firms are big donors and the backbone of the American economy.
2017-10-17.snippet: Financial firms are big donors and the backbone of the American economy.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Many of the most prominent voices in the Democratic Party, led by Bernie Sanders, are advocating wealth redistribution through higher taxes and Medicare for all, and demonizing banks and Wall Street.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Why Democrats Need Wall Street

2017-10-17.abstract: Towns across the country hand out fines for minor infractions and jail anyone too poor to pay. It’s time for more judges to speak out.
2017-10-17.snippet: Towns across the country hand out fines for minor infractions and jail anyone too poor to pay. It’s time for more judges to speak out.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Toward the end of the Obama administration, the Justice Department called on judges to end the cash-register system of justice that had taken root across the country. In what is a clearly unconstitutional practice, people in localities nationwide were being sent to jail solely because they were too poor to pay the fines and fees that municipalities increasingly rely on for revenue.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Ending Cash-Register Justice

2017-10-17.abstract: The president’s approach is: Rip things apart without thought and leave the problem to someone else.
2017-10-17.snippet: The president’s approach is: Rip things apart without thought and leave the problem to someone else.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Well, it took almost a year, but we now have the “Trump Doctrine.” It’s very simple. And, as you’d expect, it fits neatly into a tweet. On nearly every major issue, President Trump’s position is: “Obama built it. I broke it. You fix it.”
2017-10-17.headline_main: The Trump Doctrine

2017-10-17.abstract: Sorry, Woody Allen. I know you hate rumor mills, but sometimes they’re our only recourse.
2017-10-17.snippet: Sorry, Woody Allen. I know you hate rumor mills, but sometimes they’re our only recourse.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: It is unclear what possessed Woody Allen, of all people, to comment on the accusations of sexual predation against Harvey Weinstein, when he could have just not said anything, not expressed sympathy for an alleged serial rapist, not accused long-silenced women who said they were sexually assaulted of contributing to “a witch hunt atmosphere” and not felt compelled to issue a pouty follow-up statement in which he didn’t apologize but, in fact, reiterated how “sad” he feels for Weinstein because Weinstein is “sick.”
2017-10-17.headline_main: Yes, This Is a Witch Hunt. I’m a Witch and I’m Hunting You.

2017-10-17.abstract: From Danish modern furnishings to African masks, a jewelry power couple’s collections are inspired by memories and travels.
2017-10-17.snippet: From Danish modern furnishings to African masks, a jewelry power couple’s collections are inspired by memories and travels.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: When the SoHo jewelry-design power couple David and Sybil Yurman bought the adjacent penthouse in their building two years ago, converting much of it into studio space, it gave them the opportunity to stretch out stylishly in their original loft just across the hall. Since then they have been rearranging and adding to their collections of furniture and art.
2017-10-17.headline_main: David and Sybil Yurman: Out of Africa — and the Subconscious

2017-10-17.abstract: Dr. David Dao was violently taken off an April flight, prompting policy changes and now the firing of two Chicago Department of Aviation employees.
2017-10-17.snippet: Dr. David Dao was violently taken off an April flight, prompting policy changes and now the firing of two Chicago Department of Aviation employees.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Two airport security officers in Chicago have been fired for their roles in an episode in which a screaming passenger was violently dragged from a United Airlines flight in April — an act that was captured on video, sending the airline into a public relations tailspin.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Security Officers Fired for United Airlines Dragging Episode

2017-10-17.abstract: In an unusual move, a federal judge in Brooklyn has told the city to prepare for a court hearing that will examine whether police lying goes largely unpunished.
2017-10-17.snippet: In an unusual move, a federal judge in Brooklyn has told the city to prepare for a court hearing that will examine whether police lying goes largely unpunished.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Brooklyn has told the city to prepare for a court hearing regarding the prevalence of lying by New York City police officers and whether the New York Police Department has done too little to discipline officers who testify falsely.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Brooklyn Judge Seeks to Examine Prevalence of Police Lying

2017-10-17.abstract: The artists claim a Queens developer destroyed their art and want to be paid. The developer said the buildings were his to demolish.
2017-10-17.snippet: The artists claim a Queens developer destroyed their art and want to be paid. The developer said the buildings were his to demolish.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: Graffiti has come a long way since the 1970s when fly-by-night taggers sprayed their work on bridge abutments or subway cars then slipped away before the authorities arrived. These days, fashion labels use it in their photo shoots. Huge corporations include it in their ad campaigns. In museums and auction houses, it has been rebranded with a classy new name: aerosol art.
2017-10-17.headline_main: At Core of 5Pointz Trial: Is Graffiti Art Protected by Law?

2017-10-17.abstract: The nominee to lead the E.P.A. chemicals office is a threat to public health.
2017-10-17.snippet: The nominee to lead the E.P.A. chemicals office is a threat to public health.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: President Trump has made a habit of filling important jobs with people dedicated to undermining the laws they’re supposed to administer while pampering the industries they’re supposed to regulate. His nominee for the Environmental Protection Agency’s top clean air post, William Wehrum, is a retread from the George W. Bush administration with a deep doctrinal dislike of clean air regulations. His choice to run the White House Council on Environmental Quality is borderline comical: Kathleen Hartnett White, a former Texas official who believes that the main greenhouse gas, carbon dioxide, is harmless. Yet no nomination has been as brazen, as dangerous to public health and as deserving of Senate rejection as that of Michael Dourson to run the E.P.A. office in charge of reviewing chemicals used in agriculture, industry and household products.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Mr. Trump Outdoes Himself in Picking a Conflicted Regulator

2017-10-17.abstract: The administration is pushing a version of “trickle-down economics,” where corporate tax cuts deliver big pay raises for workers
2017-10-17.snippet: The administration is pushing a version of “trickle-down economics,” where corporate tax cuts deliver big pay raises for workers
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House inflated the potential benefits to workers from a proposed corporate tax cut, according to a Harvard University economist whose work informed the estimate, highlighting a challenge Republicans face as they push a tax rewrite that President Trump has promised will benefit the middle class.
2017-10-17.headline_main: White House Push to Help Workers Through Corporate Tax Cut Draws Skepticism

2017-10-17.abstract: President Trump announced that the United States would not recertify Iran’s compliance with the nuclear deal. Here's how Iran’s news media reacted.

2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Until Tuesday, the North American Free Trade Agreement looked like it might be headed for a quick demise. Now, it could be headed for a slow, painful one.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Nafta Talks’ Extension May Make for Slow, Painful Demise

2017-10-17.snippet: Some of the nation’s most prominent prosecutors, police chiefs and criminal justice overhaul advocates are expected to urge President Trump to change his policies on policing and criminality.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: A broad coalition of law enforcement officials and activists is expected to urge President Trump on Wednesday to adjust policies on policing and criminality, the first time such a group has spoken out against the Trump administration.

2017-10-17.abstract: Women complained of groping, lewd comments and suggestions of trading sexual favors for legislation in Sacramento.
2017-10-17.snippet: Women complained of groping, lewd comments and suggestions of trading sexual favors for legislation in Sacramento.
2017-10-17.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The groundswell over sexual harassment that has rocked Hollywood moved into California’s capital on Tuesday as more than 140 women — including legislators, senior legislative aides and lobbyists — came forward to denounce what they describe as pervasive sexual misconduct by powerful men in the nation’s most influential legislature.
2017-10-17.headline_main: Women Denounce Harassment in California’s Capital

2017-10-18.abstract: President Trump is testing the reluctance of his chief of staff, John F. Kelly, to discuss the death of his son Second Lt. Robert Kelly, who died in combat in 2010.
2017-10-18.snippet: President Trump is testing the reluctance of his chief of staff, John F. Kelly, to discuss the death of his son Second Lt. Robert Kelly, who died in combat in 2010.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Four days after his son died in Afghanistan, John F. Kelly, then a Marine Corps general, eulogized two Marines killed by a truck bomb in Iraq. He made only a fleeting, oblique reference to his son Second Lt. Robert Kelly as he paid tribute to the two other fallen service members who held their ground for six seconds as a truck bore down on them.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Top General’s Grief Becomes Political Talking Point for Trump

2017-10-18.abstract: The lawsuit, filed in federal court in Washington, cited as evidence contracts between the companies and the Iraqi government, leaked diplomatic cables, and the testimony of informants.
2017-10-18.snippet: The lawsuit, filed in federal court in Washington, cited as evidence contracts between the companies and the Iraqi government, leaked diplomatic cables, and the testimony of informants.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A lawsuit filed in federal court on Tuesday contends that major American corporations doing business with the Iraqi government during the Iraq War also provided it with free drugs and medical devices that became an important source of funding for a Shiite militia that targeted United States troops.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Lawsuit Claims Three U.S. Companies Funded Terror in Iraq

2017-10-18.abstract: The Emmy award-winning actor John Lithgow and Brendan Emmett Quigley team up to brighten the middle of our solving week.
2017-10-18.snippet: The Emmy award-winning actor John Lithgow and Brendan Emmett Quigley team up to brighten the middle of our solving week.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE — I like to think of myself as a “word person” — someone who knows and loves words — but every once in a while, that perception gets jolted. As in most areas of life, we soon learn that no matter how smart we think we are, there are always those who are smarter. There are word people and then there are people who really, really know their words.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Nanki-Poo’s Pursuer

2017-10-18.abstract: The Emmy Award-winning actor John Lithgow on adding “crossword puzzle constructor” to his list of accomplishments.
2017-10-18.snippet: The Emmy Award-winning actor John Lithgow on adding “crossword puzzle constructor” to his list of accomplishments.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE — The Emmy-award winning actor John Lithgow does not have a favorite word, he says, because he loves too many of them to narrow the choice down to a single one. When pressed, he comes up with “eldritch,” an intriguing word that means sinister and eerie, and which seems to have made a kind of comeback in the 20th century. It is exactly the type of word that a logophile like Mr. Lithgow might like, and he savors it as it leaves his lips.
2017-10-18.headline_main: John Lithgow Is Not Eldritch

2017-10-18.snippet: The Yankees were held to one hit through six innings but put together a rally against the Astros’ relievers and seized momentum in the series.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Lifeless, listless and about to be facing an elimination game, the Yankees discovered a path back into the American League Championship Series. It came by opening the gate to the Houston Astros’ bullpen.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Yankees Feast on the Astros’ Bullpen in a Comeback Victory

2017-10-18.abstract: Everyone’s an actor. The lawyers’ job is to determine their motivations.
2017-10-18.snippet: Everyone’s an actor. The lawyers’ job is to determine their motivations.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Let’s talk about acting. Admittedly, that’s not always the safest bet for opening a discussion of a “Law & Order” episode. But the notion of acting has become a central motif in this case. Indeed, motif is the apt word, originating, as it does, in the French word for motive: “All the world’s a stage,” as Shakespeare put it, and if everyone is acting, then everyone has hidden motives. Determine the motive, decode the act.
2017-10-18.headline_main: ‘Law & Order True Crime’ Season 1, Episode 4: There’s the Rub

He rushed home to Palermo, arriving just in time for the viewing, a powerful, if painful moment. Afterward, the body was cremated.

2017-10-18.abstract: Misogyny and abuse are rampant in society. But the military is well equipped to stop it in its own ranks.
2017-10-18.snippet: Misogyny and abuse are rampant in society. But the military is well equipped to stop it in its own ranks.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: It was 2004 and I had been in the Army for only three months when I first began to suspect something was wrong. I was walking by our drill sergeant’s desk, where he sat, leaning back in his chair. On the floor in front of him was a newly arrived female soldier. She was on her back, dressed in T-shirt and shorts, doing scissor kicks. He sat perfectly poised to see her crotch and the insides of her thighs.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Military Women, Too, Should Serve Unmolested

2017-10-18.abstract: Republicans are using the budget process to invade the pristine Arctic National Wildlife Refuge.
2017-10-18.snippet: Republicans are using the budget process to invade the pristine Arctic National Wildlife Refuge.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Few landscapes remain virtually untrammeled by the growing impact of the planet’s seven and a half billion inhabitants — places where the natural environment is so overwhelmingly intact and truly wild that coming across so much as a boot print is a surprise. It seems unlikely in this day and age, but such areas do still exist.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Protect Alaska’s Last Great Wilderness From Oil Drilling

2017-10-18.abstract: Food shortages and rising inflation have made basic groceries unaffordable for many Venezuelans, over 80 percent of whom now live in poverty. After losing her job two years ago, Francia has been feeding her family from the garbage of a supermarket in Caracas.

2017-10-18.abstract: Strobe Talbott on Alan Bullock’s “Hitler and Stalin” and Timothy Snyder’s “On Tyranny,” which span the arc of the Russian Revolution to the present.
2017-10-18.snippet: Strobe Talbott on Alan Bullock’s “Hitler and Stalin” and Timothy Snyder’s “On Tyranny,” which span the arc of the Russian Revolution to the present.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: A hundred years ago, a malignant form of governance, both modern and barbaric, slouched towards St. Petersburg to be born. As it grew, it swept across Eurasia, enveloping the largest territorial state on the planet and cloning itself elsewhere. As the decades passed, the monstrosity was given a name: totalitarianism.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Stalin, Hitler and the Temptations of Totalitarianism

2017-10-18.abstract: The activist on the intersection of faith and politics and the importance of white protesters in Charlottesville.
2017-10-18.snippet: The activist on the intersection of faith and politics and the importance of white protesters in Charlottesville.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: It’s been a little over two years since you removed a Confederate flag from the flagpole on the grounds of the South Carolina statehouse. Are you surprised that we’re still having a debate over monuments to the Confederacy? Is it possible to not be surprised in retrospect? There was a point when it was shocking — maybe a year and a half ago, as I saw the ascendance of Donald Trump. But looking back, it makes sense to me that, given the history of America, there would be this backlash that accompanies the election of the first black president.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Bree Newsome Thinks Allies Should Be Protesting

2017-10-18.abstract: As a young social psychologist, she played by the rules and won big: an influential study, a viral TED talk, a prestigious job at Harvard. Then, suddenly, the rules changed.
2017-10-18.snippet: As a young social psychologist, she played by the rules and won big: an influential study, a viral TED talk, a prestigious job at Harvard. Then, suddenly, the rules changed.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: I first met Amy Cuddy in January, soon after she moved into a new office at the Harvard School of Public Health. Cuddy was, at the time, officially on the faculty at Harvard Business School, but she was taking a temporary leave, her small box of an office filled with boxes. As she talked about her life in recent years, my attention kept drifting to her left arm, which she had trapped underneath her right leg, which crossed the left. She was slightly hunched over, and yet her right arm, long and lean — she danced for many years — gesticulated freely and expressively, so that the contrast gave the impression of someone in a conflicted emotional state, someone both wanting to tell her story and unsure about doing so.
2017-10-18.headline_main: When the Revolution Came for Amy Cuddy

2017-10-18.snippet: After a Marine attacked an Iraqi restaurant in Portland, Ore., his family said he was provoked by trauma, not hate, and that he needed help, not jail time.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: PORTLAND, Ore. — The DarSalam Iraqi restaurant, with its steaming plates of falafel and kebab, has for years served as a popular community gathering spot here. The Iraqi family who ran it felt welcome in this eclectic city.
2017-10-18.headline_main: A Marine Attacked an Iraqi Restaurant. But Was It a Hate Crime or PTSD?

2017-10-18.abstract: At issue is whether the Trump Hotel in Washington violates a provision banning federal officials from accepting economic benefits from governments at home or abroad.
2017-10-18.snippet: At issue is whether the Trump Hotel in Washington violates a provision banning federal officials from accepting economic benefits from governments at home or abroad.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: The defendant was elsewhere, stirring and twittering in his new city, his name rarely spoken — just the title sufficed — but always top of mind inside an overstuffed Manhattan courtroom.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Is Trump Violating the Constitution? In Absentia, He Defends Himself in Court

2017-10-18.abstract: As the zombie apocalypse drama returns for Season 8, the AMC series is looking to rebound from a stretch of storytelling shenanigans that alienated viewers.
2017-10-18.snippet: As the zombie apocalypse drama returns for Season 8, the AMC series is looking to rebound from a stretch of storytelling shenanigans that alienated viewers.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: SENOIA, Ga. — A drive through the 120 acres of sound stages and Georgia countryside that serve as home base of AMC’s “The Walking Dead” encompasses landmarks both grandiose, like the ersatz colonial mansion built for the Hilltop set, and quietly chilling, like the shady grove where the arch-villain Negan bludgeoned two of the show’s most beloved characters to death last fall.
2017-10-18.headline_main: ‘The Walking Dead’ at 100: Still a Hit, but for How Much Longer?

2017-10-18.abstract: In Silicon Valley, small companies used to unseat big ones. Now the clutches of the five biggest tech companies are hard to escape.
2017-10-18.snippet: In Silicon Valley, small companies used to unseat big ones. Now the clutches of the five biggest tech companies are hard to escape.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: The tech giants are too big. But so what? Hasn’t that always been the case?
2017-10-18.headline_main: How the Frightful Five Put Start-Ups in a Lose-Lose Situation

2017-10-18.abstract: The country’s peculiar trading entanglements make sanctions possible. Will its longtime enabler finally make them enforceable?
2017-10-18.snippet: The country’s peculiar trading entanglements make sanctions possible. Will its longtime enabler finally make them enforceable?
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Down the street from my home in Bangkok, next to a tailor and a nail salon, sits a peculiar outpost of the North Korean state. Inside the Pyongyang Okryu restaurant, five tall, pale waitresses float among the tables in sparkly dresses and carefully cultivated smiles. “Are they really North Korean?” my wide-eyed young son asked, a bit too loudly, on a recent visit. He’d been reading about the country’s isolation and the fusillade of insults and threats exchanged by President Trump and Kim Jong-un, North Korea’s leader. A waitress overheard him and nodded, but her blank smile — a rictus of nonrevelation — never wavered.
2017-10-18.headline_main: North Korea Is No Longer the Hermit Kingdom — but How Long Will China Be Its Lifeline?

2017-10-18.abstract: The Bureau of Land Management plans to auction drilling rights on land close to the park’s visitor center. Conservation groups have objections.
2017-10-18.snippet: The Bureau of Land Management plans to auction drilling rights on land close to the park’s visitor center. Conservation groups have objections.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Changes loom near remote Dinosaur National Monument in Utah. It’s a rough region of 1,000-foot cliffs and canyons, two wild rivers — the Green and the Yampa — ancient rock art and archaeological evidence of 10,000 years of human history.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Drilling Near Dinosaur National Monument Draws Criticism

2017-10-18.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on the nature of forgiveness and more.
2017-10-18.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on the nature of forgiveness and more.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: My wife and I have been married for just a few years. Early in our marriage I started chatting with a female acquaintance, and things got verbally sexual and eventually led to sexual pictures between the other woman and me. I saved some of the photos to my phone and inadvertently saved them to my computer, where my wife found them and downloaded them to her phone. We’ve gone through marriage counseling together and are working things out. I have since deleted the photos, but my wife still has them. I’m ashamed of the photos and don’t want to see them, let alone have my wife keep them. I’ve tried to delete them from her phone, but the photos keep showing up. When my wife is mad at me, she changes her lock-screen image to one of the photos she’s keeping of the other woman.
2017-10-18.headline_main: My Wife Found My Sexy Phone Pics and Won’t Let It Go

2017-10-18.abstract: With the fall of its capital and loss of territory, the Islamic State may be reeling but not vanquished.
2017-10-18.snippet: With the fall of its capital and loss of territory, the Islamic State may be reeling but not vanquished.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Its de facto capital is falling. Its territory has shriveled from the size of Portugal to a handful of outposts. Its surviving leaders are on the run.
2017-10-18.headline_main: With Loss of Its Caliphate, ISIS May Return to Guerrilla Roots

2017-10-18.abstract: While a few cities provide a spooky vibe all-year-round, festivals, theme park pop-up events and other haunted happenings elsewhere have helped make Halloween a travel season all its own.
2017-10-18.snippet: While a few cities provide a spooky vibe all-year-round, festivals, theme park pop-up events and other haunted happenings elsewhere have helped make Halloween a travel season all its own.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: With all the attention Thanksgiving and Christmas get from travelers, it’s easy to overlook Halloween as a destination holiday. While a few cities provide a spooky vibe year-round, annual festivals, theme park pop-up events and other haunted happenings elsewhere have helped make the holiday a travel mini-season all its own.
2017-10-18.headline_main: 6 Spooky Travel Destinations for the Halloween Season

2017-10-18.abstract: Do the volunteers behind Unicode, whose mission is to bring all human languages into the digital sphere, have enough bandwidth to deal with emojis too?
2017-10-18.snippet: Do the volunteers behind Unicode, whose mission is to bring all human languages into the digital sphere, have enough bandwidth to deal with emojis too?
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Anshuman Pandey was intrigued. A graduate student in history at the University of Michigan, he was searching online for forgotten alphabets of South Asia when an image of a mysterious writing system popped up. In eight years of digging through British colonial archives both real and digital, he has found almost 200 alphabets across Asia that were previously undescribed in the West, but this one, which he came across in early 2011, stumped him. Its sinuous letters, connected to one another in cursive fashion and sometimes bearing dots and slashes above or below, resembled those of Arabic.
2017-10-18.headline_main: How the Appetite for Emojis Complicates the Effort to Standardize the World’s Alphabets

2017-10-18.abstract: Attorney General Jeff Sessions declined to answer many questions in his first Judiciary Committee appearance as the top law enforcement officer.
2017-10-18.snippet: Attorney General Jeff Sessions declined to answer many questions in his first Judiciary Committee appearance as the top law enforcement officer.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — One after another, Democrats on the Senate Judiciary Committee pressed Attorney General Jeff Sessions to provide information. And again and again in nearly five hours of testimony on Wednesday, Mr. Sessions refused.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Sessions Refuses to Discuss His Conversations With Trump About Comey or Russia

2017-10-18.abstract: A new program, aided by companies like Facebook, will aim to teach students how to recognize and stop the sharing of fake news and conspiracy theories.
2017-10-18.snippet: A new program, aided by companies like Facebook, will aim to teach students how to recognize and stop the sharing of fake news and conspiracy theories.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: ROME — After reading the horrors in Dante’s “Inferno,” Italian students will soon turn to the dangers of the digital age. While juggling math assignments, they’ll also tackle work sheets prepared by reporters from the national broadcaster RAI. And separate from the weekly hour of religion, they will receive a list of what amounts to a new set of Ten Commandments.
2017-10-18.headline_main: In Italian Schools, Reading, Writing and Recognizing Fake News

2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: After 22 years in a condo near the beach in Shirley, N.Y., Dan and Donna Cresci longed for a home in a walkable community. They considered Port Jefferson, Bellport, Patchogue and East Hampton, but finally settled on Sayville, a congenial 5.4-square-mile hamlet with about 16,853 residents, on the South Shore of Long Island, midway between Manhattan and Montauk.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Sayville, N.Y.: A Walkable Downtown and Victorians by the Bay

2017-10-18.headline_main: Ireland’s Transition, and Mine

2017-10-18.abstract: How the party of Trump became a liberal caricature.
2017-10-18.snippet: How the party of Trump became a liberal caricature.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Thirteen years ago, in the midst of a different Republican administration, the liberal book of the moment was Thomas Frank’s “What’s the Matter With Kansas?” In answering his title’s question, Frank argued that hardworking heartland Americans were being duped by a Republican Party that whipped up culture-war frenzy to disguise its plutocratic aims. Middle-class and working-class Republican voters, he insisted, were voting against their own economic self-interest and getting worse than nothing in return.
2017-10-18.headline_main: What’s the Matter With Republicans?

2017-10-18.abstract: A large-scale new study found that concussions in adolescents can increase the risk of later developing multiple sclerosis.
2017-10-18.snippet: A large-scale new study found that concussions in adolescents can increase the risk of later developing multiple sclerosis.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Here’s yet another reason to protect young athletes from head trauma: A large-scale new study found that concussions in adolescents can increase the risk of later developing multiple sclerosis. The risk of multiple sclerosis, or M.S., an autoimmune nervous system disorder with an unknown cause, was especially high if there were more than one head injury.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Concussions in Teenagers Tied to Multiple Sclerosis Risk

2017-10-18.abstract: The killings in 1965-66 played to anti-Communist attitudes, and U.S. diplomats mostly stayed silent while tallying the deaths, documents show.
2017-10-18.snippet: The killings in 1965-66 played to anti-Communist attitudes, and U.S. diplomats mostly stayed silent while tallying the deaths, documents show.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: BANGKOK — It was an anti-Communist blood bath of at least half a million Indonesians. And American officials watched it happen without raising any public objections, at times even applauding the forces behind the killing, according to newly declassified State Department files that show diplomats meticulously documenting the purge in 1965-66.
2017-10-18.headline_main: U.S. Stood By as Indonesia Killed a Half-Million People, Papers Show
