2017-10-18.headline_main: Samsung Is Under Scrutiny Again as South Korean Police Raid Offices

2017-10-18.abstract: President Xi Jinping of China gave a 205-minute speech to open the Communist Party congress. Here is what mattered.
2017-10-18.snippet: President Xi Jinping of China gave a 205-minute speech to open the Communist Party congress. Here is what mattered.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — As Xi Jinping’s first five-year term as China’s leader ends, he gave himself a shining report card on Wednesday — and a big to-do list for his next five years. Speaking at the start of a Communist Party congress in Beijing, Mr. Xi gave a work report that summed up his achievements so far, while also laying out where he wants to take China in his second term, which starts after this congress. Sitting on a podium before 2,300 delegates, he spoke for 205 minutes, long enough that his predecessor, Hu Jintao, pointed at his watch when Mr. Xi finally finished.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Xi Jinping’s Marathon Speech: Five Takeaways

2017-10-18.abstract: A conversation with Greg Asbed, co-founder of the Coalition of Immokalee Workers, who was recently awarded a MacArthur Foundation “genius grant.”
2017-10-18.snippet: A conversation with Greg Asbed, co-founder of the Coalition of Immokalee Workers, who was recently awarded a MacArthur Foundation “genius grant.”
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Greg Asbed has spent much of his life fighting horrific labor abuses, including slavery. An organizer and human rights strategist, he co-founded the Coalition of Immokalee Workers, a group that pioneered a system for overcoming brutal conditions in American agriculture. Last week, the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation awarded Mr. Asbed one of 24 annual fellowships, known colloquially as a “genius grant,” to support his work in this area.
2017-10-18.headline_main: A MacArthur ‘Genius’ on Overcoming Modern Farm Slavery

2017-10-18.abstract: A furious back-and-forth turned what can be an emotionally wrenching encounter into an ugly spectacle between the president and a bereaved citizen.
2017-10-18.snippet: A furious back-and-forth turned what can be an emotionally wrenching encounter into an ugly spectacle between the president and a bereaved citizen.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s condolence call to the widow of a slain soldier exploded into a vicious row that swamped the White House on Wednesday, with the soldier’s grieving mother accusing the president of disrespecting her family and a defiant Mr. Trump complaining that his words had been cynically twisted for political purposes.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Trump’s Condolence Call to Soldier’s Widow Ignites an Imbroglio

2017-10-18.abstract: Patty Chang’s show at the Queens Museum sees water as a metaphor for gender fluidity, migration and life.
2017-10-18.snippet: Patty Chang’s show at the Queens Museum sees water as a metaphor for gender fluidity, migration and life.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Patty Chang made her mark 20 years ago with wickedly provocative body-centered video and performance works, the best known of which is probably “Eels” (1999). The title of this video explains what’s wriggling unseen inside the artist’s shirt, creating a comically — if powerfully — quasi-erotic ruckus. In another celebrated early video, she exchanges an onion, mouth to mouth, with each of her parents; tears ensue.
2017-10-18.headline_main: A Bold Explorer Surfaces in ‘Wandering Lake’

2017-10-18.abstract: Guiyang has built a museum and park to Wang Yangming, a 16th-century philosopher at the center of a propaganda drive by China’s leader, Xi Jinping.
2017-10-18.snippet: Guiyang has built a museum and park to Wang Yangming, a 16th-century philosopher at the center of a propaganda drive by China’s leader, Xi Jinping.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: GUIYANG, China — Nearly 500 years after he died, the Chinese philosopher Wang Yangming once again wielded a calligraphy brush, carefully daubed it into a tray of black ink and elegantly wrote out his most famous phrase: “the unity of knowledge and action.”
2017-10-18.headline_main: Forget Marx and Mao. Chinese City Honors Once-Banned Confucian.

2017-10-18.abstract: They’re members of a Slovenian band, and they don’t like to reveal too much, even in a documentary.
2017-10-18.snippet: They’re members of a Slovenian band, and they don’t like to reveal too much, even in a documentary.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: The Slovenian band Laibach is best appreciated not as a music group but as a deliberately confounding aesthetic construct. Its publicity photos, the personas of band members and their music videos have, since the group’s 1980s beginnings, borrowed from the imagery and style of 20th-century totalitarian regimes. But their music never matched the provocation of their presentation. The critic Robert Christgau once commented: “Not fascists — in fact, probably antifascists. That’s something.”
2017-10-18.headline_main: Review: ‘Liberation Day,’ Rocking in Pyongyang With Laibach

2017-10-18.abstract: Thanks to a bullpen that has been immaculate, Los Angeles needs just one victory to capture its first pennant since 1988 and then go for it all.
2017-10-18.snippet: Thanks to a bullpen that has been immaculate, Los Angeles needs just one victory to capture its first pennant since 1988 and then go for it all.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — If major league teams held a fantasy draft for their playoff rosters, Clayton Kershaw might go first over all. Every team would covet the best pitcher in baseball in a short series, but only the Los Angeles Dodgers have him. They have started the last five postseasons by giving Kershaw the ball — and just to feel even more secure, they have always had Kenley Jansen, an electrifying closer, at the end.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Dodgers Are on the Edge of Forgotten Territory: The World Series

2017-10-18.abstract: The music weekly Les Inrockuptibles featured Bertrand Cantat, who was jailed for fatally beating his partner in 2003, on the front of its latest issue.

2017-10-18.abstract: Here’s an opportunity to develop “the world’s first neighborhood built from the internet up,” but will humans be put first?
2017-10-18.snippet: Here’s an opportunity to develop “the world’s first neighborhood built from the internet up,” but will humans be put first?
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Google’s founders have long fantasized about what would happen if the company could shape the real world as much as it has life on the internet.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Google’s Founders Wanted to Shape a City. Toronto Is Their Chance.

2017-10-18.abstract: The murder of Daphne Caruana Galizia in Malta illustrates the stakes for journalists pushing back against power.
2017-10-18.snippet: The murder of Daphne Caruana Galizia in Malta illustrates the stakes for journalists pushing back against power.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: The car bomb that killed the investigative journalist Daphne Caruana Galizia on Monday did not go off in Honduras, Afghanistan or any other country where one might expect to hear about brutal violence against reporters. The device exploded in the early afternoon down the road from her home in the tiny European nation of Malta, where, for the greater part of the last decade, the 53-year-old had held some of the most powerful people in the country accountable for political corruption, offshore financial dealings and abuse of power.
2017-10-18.headline_main: When the Price of Reporting Is a Car Bomb

2017-10-18.abstract: The Naem traffic circle in Raqqa teemed with life before the Syrian civil war. Then it came to symbolize death.
2017-10-18.snippet: The Naem traffic circle in Raqqa teemed with life before the Syrian civil war. Then it came to symbolize death.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: It was never just a traffic circle.
2017-10-18.headline_main: From Playground to Killing Ground: An ISIS Legacy

2017-10-18.abstract: After voicing support, the president offered a different take on the plan, while its Republican architect predicted it would pass before the end of the year.
2017-10-18.snippet: After voicing support, the president offered a different take on the plan, while its Republican architect predicted it would pass before the end of the year.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Wednesday backed away from his endorsement of a bipartisan Senate proposal to stabilize health insurance markets, throwing the legislative effort into doubt even as the chief architect of the deal predicted that it would become law before the end of the year.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Trump Pulls Back From Senate Deal to Fund Health Subsidies

2017-10-18.abstract: Congress, not the Supreme Court, should decide the fate of data held abroad.
2017-10-18.snippet: Congress, not the Supreme Court, should decide the fate of data held abroad.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: In 2013, United States agents served a warrant on Microsoft seeking the emails of a suspect in a drug case. Microsoft balked at the request, saying that the data was stored on a server in Ireland and out of the reach of United States law enforcement. To access the data, the United States would need to make a request to the Irish government through diplomatic channels — a slow and burdensome process. The government fought back, arguing that the Washington State-based company could access the emails from the United States, without ever stepping foot in Ireland, and was required to comply.
2017-10-18.headline_main: There’s No Good Decision in the Next Big Data Privacy Case

2017-10-18.abstract: Knopf will publish “Spy of the First Person,” which the actor and playwright wrote in the final months of his life.
2017-10-18.snippet: Knopf will publish “Spy of the First Person,” which the actor and playwright wrote in the final months of his life.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: In the months before his death in July, the playwright Sam Shepard worked on a novel, narrated by a man recalling his past as he is treated for a debilitating medical condition.
2017-10-18.headline_main: A New Novel From the Late Sam Shepard to Be Published in December

2017-10-18.abstract: Inside the making of “Introduce Yerself,” the intimate new solo album that the Tragically Hip frontman made before his death this week.
2017-10-18.snippet: Inside the making of “Introduce Yerself,” the intimate new solo album that the Tragically Hip frontman made before his death this week.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: In the first week of January 2016, the Canadian singer-songwriter Gord Downie paid a visit to the Bathouse, the recording complex that his band, the Tragically Hip, owns in a small town outside Toronto. Rising early each morning, he put on a snowsuit and walked a short distance from the studio to the frozen shores of Lake Ontario, where he sat and hand-wrote lyrics in the cold.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Gord Downie, a Canadian Rock Legend, Sings Goodbye

2017-10-18.abstract: After a recent digital restoration, this French film noir adapted from a Georges Simenon novel will have a weeklong run at Metrograph.
2017-10-18.snippet: After a recent digital restoration, this French film noir adapted from a Georges Simenon novel will have a weeklong run at Metrograph.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: “Maigret Sets a Trap,” most likely the movie that introduced American audiences to Georges Simenon’s best-known character, was hailed as an event by the New York Times film critic Bosley Crowther. “If you haven’t yet made the acquaintance of French writer Georges Simenon and his famous and fascinating Parisian detective, Inspector Maigret,” he wrote in his review in 1958, “you can’t ask a better introduction.”
2017-10-18.headline_main: In ‘Maigret Sets a Trap,’ Pack Your Pipe and Track a Killer

2017-10-18.abstract: After nine years of tumult moving from home to home, Shaquille Samuel, 23, now possesses a Regents diploma, a food handler’s license and motivation for a brighter future.
2017-10-18.snippet: After nine years of tumult moving from home to home, Shaquille Samuel, 23, now possesses a Regents diploma, a food handler’s license and motivation for a brighter future.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Every new foster home came with a fresh set of rules. It did not matter how many or how few. It did not matter if they were lax or unreasonable. They would not be obeyed.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Playing by the Rules After Breaking Them in Foster Care

2017-10-18.abstract: The Bard Hall Players, a theater company made up of Columbia University medical students, is marking its 50th season with a production of “Into the Woods.”
2017-10-18.snippet: The Bard Hall Players, a theater company made up of Columbia University medical students, is marking its 50th season with a production of “Into the Woods.”
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: At a Wednesday evening rehearsal for the musical “Into the Woods,” the actors playing two lovesick princes were practicing the choreography for their big Act I duet, “Agony.” The director, Lia Boyle, wanted them to rip their shirts open at the end of the number, and the costume designer asked how far down their bodies the tear should go.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Scalpel, Sponge, Show Tunes: When Doctors Moonlight as Actors

2017-10-18.abstract: Survey results also reveal a deep ambivalence about changing gender roles.
2017-10-18.snippet: Survey results also reveal a deep ambivalence about changing gender roles.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Whether or not people think it’s a good time to be a woman or a man in the United States depends largely on their political party, according to a new survey from the Pew Research Center.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Democrats Think Men Have It Easier. Republicans Disagree.

2017-10-18.abstract: The Borromeo Quartet will perform selections from its transcription of Bach’s “The Well-Tempered Clavier” on Friday at Carnegie Hall.
2017-10-18.snippet: The Borromeo Quartet will perform selections from its transcription of Bach’s “The Well-Tempered Clavier” on Friday at Carnegie Hall.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: For string quartets, Bach has generally been off the map. The combination of two violins, a viola and a cello was not yet in use as a standard ensemble when he wrote his dazzlingly rich output.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Listen to Bach, Transformed for String Quartet

2017-10-18.abstract: Anthony Hernandez’s photography, Tom Friedman’s short animated videos and Julia Bland’s fiber weavings are among the works on display around town.

2017-10-18.abstract: The move is another shake-up in the pharmacy benefits manager industry, and deals a blow to Express Scripts.
2017-10-18.snippet: The move is another shake-up in the pharmacy benefits manager industry, and deals a blow to Express Scripts.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Anthem, one of the nation’s major health insurance companies, said on Wednesday that it planned to start its own business to manage prescription drug plans by partnering with CVS Health, the large pharmacy benefit manager and drugstore chain.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Anthem Joins With CVS to Start Its Own Pharmacy Business

2017-10-18.abstract: The former Cavaliers guard wanted to forge his own path as one of the N.B.A.’s premier players, but not this way, not without Gordon Hayward.
2017-10-18.snippet: The former Cavaliers guard wanted to forge his own path as one of the N.B.A.’s premier players, but not this way, not without Gordon Hayward.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — On the morning of his first game with the Boston Celtics, Kyrie Irving sat at the center of a scrum of reporters along one of the baselines at Quicken Loans Arena and refused to talk about what everyone wanted him to talk about, specifically his reasons for demanding a trade from the Cleveland Cavaliers over the summer.
2017-10-18.headline_main: It’s Up to Kyrie Irving How the Celtics Move On From a Painful Opener

2017-10-18.abstract: These styles are effortless, classic — and good for those in-between days that feel both hot and cold.
2017-10-18.snippet: These styles are effortless, classic — and good for those in-between days that feel both hot and cold.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: With a natural boxy fit, the denim jacket continues to be one of the most riffed-upon staples of fashion. So, in time for the transitional fall weather, we’ve sifted through the market and found six of our current favorites.
2017-10-18.headline_main: 6 Denim Jackets for This Weird Fall Weather

2017-10-18.abstract: The role of motor sports’ world governing body has drawn the attention of France’s financial crimes investigators.
2017-10-18.snippet: The role of motor sports’ world governing body has drawn the attention of France’s financial crimes investigators.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Financial corruption investigators in France are examining the role played by the world governing body for motor sports in the $4.4 billion sale of the Formula One auto-racing series, according to two people familiar with the inquiry.
2017-10-18.headline_main: French Investigator Seeks Information About Formula One Sale

2017-10-18.abstract: Daniil Trifonov, Khatia Buniatishvili and more talented pianists (and one harpsichordist) share their favorite albums by the great Argentine musician.

2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Martha Argerich, one of the greatest pianists in the world, rarely plays in New York. But on Oct. 20, she will return to Carnegie Hall after a decade away to perform Prokofiev’s Piano Concerto No. 3. For her younger fans, this may be the first opportunity to hear her in person.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Hear the Martha Argerich Recordings That Inspired 8 Young Pianists

2017-10-18.snippet: You’ve planned months and months in advance and now weather, wildfires and other unforeseen events are wreaking havoc. Here’s how you might save the day.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: For most couples, wedding planning begins at least a year in advance, and typically starts with booking the perfect venue. While many of the preparations can be controlled — the menu, flowers and guest list — sometimes things can go terribly wrong.

2017-10-18.abstract: A lavish new book examines the history of Ardrossan and the old-money world of Philadelphia’s Main Line.
2017-10-18.snippet: A lavish new book examines the history of Ardrossan and the old-money world of Philadelphia’s Main Line.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: In 1911, Robert Montgomery, a wealthy Philadelphia stockbroker, commissioned the architect Horace Trumbauer to build his family a home. He chose 300 acres of rolling pasture in an enclave northwest of the city called the Main Line, where, beginning around 1880 and lasting until after World War II, a portion of the American aristocracy lived out a version of English manor life on gentleman farms and large estates.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Inside the Estate that Inspired ‘The Philadelphia Story’

2017-10-18.abstract: Sweeping changes include introducing partisan ballots to judges’ races, the first state to do so in almost a century.

2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: RALEIGH, N.C. — Republicans with a firm grip on the North Carolina legislature — and, until January, the governor’s seat — enacted a conservative agenda in recent years, only to have a steady stream of laws affecting voting and legislative power rejected by the courts.
2017-10-18.headline_main: In North Carolina, Republicans Stung by Court Rulings Aim to Change the Judges

2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: In one of their odder and more chilling moves, the Nazis occupying Lithuania once collected Yiddish and Hebrew books and documents, hoping to create a reference collection about a people they intended to annihilate.

2017-10-18.snippet: A look back at the major elements of the continuing story, which has spilled well beyond Hollywood.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: It can be difficult to keep up on all the developments related to Harvey Weinstein in recent weeks.
2017-10-18.headline_main: How the Harvey Weinstein Story Has Unfolded

2017-10-18.abstract: The nicest guy in Hollywood discusses his love of typewriters and his new collection of short stories, “Uncommon Type.”
2017-10-18.snippet: The nicest guy in Hollywood discusses his love of typewriters and his new collection of short stories, “Uncommon Type.”
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: In addition to being an acclaimed actor, director and screenwriter, Tom Hanks, known as the nicest guy in Hollywood, can now add published author to his list of accomplishments. On Wednesday, his book of short stories, “Uncommon Type,” was published. The collection of 17 stories all include, in one way or another, typewriters, which are Mr. Hanks’s passion. But they are about so much more: In one, for instance, a 9-year-old boy is left to live with his moody father by his mother, a pretty, absent waitress; another follows a recent immigrant in New York City after he leaves a country ravaged by civil war.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Tom Hanks Talks

2017-10-18.abstract: The author of the “His Dark Materials” trilogy returns, with answers to the questions what happened first and what happens next.
2017-10-18.snippet: The author of the “His Dark Materials” trilogy returns, with answers to the questions what happened first and what happens next.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: It’s been nearly two decades since Philip Pullman published “The Golden Compass”and the other two books in the “His Dark Materials” trilogy, but I still remember how intoxicating they were to read, and how bereft I felt afterward. As with a long-ago love affair, they were perfect in part because they ended even as the reader longed for more.
2017-10-18.headline_main: With ‘La Belle Sauvage,’ Philip Pullman Begins a New Trilogy

2017-10-18.snippet: Women who slept less than 6.25 hours a night were almost three times as likely to have gestational diabetes as those who slept more.

2017-10-18.abstract: Brett Morgen’s documentary tells her story through footage of Ms. Goodall’s interactions with chimpanzees in what is now Tanzania.
2017-10-18.snippet: Brett Morgen’s documentary tells her story through footage of Ms. Goodall’s interactions with chimpanzees in what is now Tanzania.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Jane Goodall’s observations of chimpanzees in the wild challenged conventional wisdom about what made humans exceptional. Brett Morgen’s documentary “Jane,” which tells Ms. Goodall’s story largely through footage of her expeditions, is such an absorbing account of her experiences at a reserve in what is now Tanzania that you may not pause to think about how its imagery was captured.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Review: ‘Jane’ Is an Absorbing Trip Into the Wild With Jane Goodall

2017-10-18.abstract: They rely on bad data in opinions — and they shouldn’t simply dismiss evidence they don’t understand as “gobbledygook.”
2017-10-18.snippet: They rely on bad data in opinions — and they shouldn’t simply dismiss evidence they don’t understand as “gobbledygook.”
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Supreme Court justices have a tough job. They are required to hand down decisions that can affect millions of people and cost billions of dollars. And while some of the issues before them are purely legal, many turn on complex policy questions: Do black voters in the South still face substantial discrimination? How reliable are eyewitnesses? Are people convicted of sex offenses very likely to reoffend?
2017-10-18.headline_main: The Supreme Court Justices Need Fact-Checkers

2017-10-18.abstract: Some Republicans see the rules on unwinding failing banks as another bailout. But a global perspective reveals some reasons to keep them in place.
2017-10-18.snippet: Some Republicans see the rules on unwinding failing banks as another bailout. But a global perspective reveals some reasons to keep them in place.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: Global bank watchdogs are acting as a line of defense against an American deregulatory push. The Treasury Department will soon decide whether to recommend scrapping the Dodd-Frank Act’s rules for liquidating failing banks, as some Republicans are urging. But foreign regulators are threatening to impose new curbs on American firms if it’s ditched.
2017-10-18.headline_main: A Shortsighted Plan to Scrap Dodd-Frank’s Liquidation Rules

2017-10-18.abstract: Democrats are facing a test of their ability to inspire black voters, with elections in Virginia and Alabama hinging on black turnout.
2017-10-18.snippet: Democrats are facing a test of their ability to inspire black voters, with elections in Virginia and Alabama hinging on black turnout.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: DUMFRIES, Va. — President Barack Obama will hit the campaign trail on Thursday to rally black voters behind candidates for governor in Virginia and New Jersey amid stern warnings that African Americans may not come out in force on an Election Day that is just three weeks away.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Obama Returns to Campaign Trail to Rally Black Voters

2017-10-18.abstract: The mayoral candidate faces long odds to unseat the Democrat incumbent, Mayor Bill de Blasio.
2017-10-18.snippet: The mayoral candidate faces long odds to unseat the Democrat incumbent, Mayor Bill de Blasio.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: During nearly seven years as a Republican in the New York State Assembly, Nicole Malliotakis earned a reputation for embracing unpopular stances in the Democrat-controlled chamber, opposing minimum wage increases, paid family leave, gay marriage and public financing of elections.

2017-10-18.abstract: Here’s how to get a jump on next season’s trends right now.
2017-10-18.snippet: Here’s how to get a jump on next season’s trends right now.
2017-10-18.lead_paragraph: It’s good to be ahead of the curve, especially when it comes to fashion. The spring 2018 collections, fresh off the runways, offered a little something for everyone. Provocateurs may gravitate toward the completely sheer (at Sonia Rykiel) or fringe laden (Calvin Klein); pragmatists will appreciate the abundance of blazers (Balenciaga), anoraks (Public School) and trench coats (Margiela). There were also some surprises: Bicycle shorts, which haven’t seen the light of the runway in some time, showed up at Dolce & Gabbana, Off-White and Saint Laurent, a welcome addition for the shorts lover who’s after more coverage but doesn’t exactly yearn for baggy Bermudas. Here, a look at some of the trends — and how to wear them now.
2017-10-18.headline_main: Who Doesn’t Like Being First?

2017-10-19.abstract: At only an hour’s domestic flight away from Nairobi, Diani Beach is becoming one of the most popular sun, sea and sand destinations in Kenya.
2017-10-19.snippet: At only an hour’s domestic flight away from Nairobi, Diani Beach is becoming one of the most popular sun, sea and sand destinations in Kenya.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Until recently, Kenya’s Diani Beach was a well-kept secret for a cultured international crowd that has been vacationing on the coast since the 1970s, fueled by a passion for the sparkling white-gold beaches, rare sea safaris and luxury hotel scene that characterizes this strip of coastline on the Indian Ocean. But with the arrival of new dining, shopping and drinking spots, and a celebrity following, Diani Beach is now the trendy escape for tourists looking for respite after safari trips in the Samburu and Maasai regions.  At only an hour’s domestic flight away from the Kenyan capital, Nairobi, the golden stretch of beach is becoming one of the most popular sun, sea and sand destinations in the country.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Five Places to Go in Diani Beach, Kenya

2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Silent clues to a violent past are buried among the scores of mass graves that dot Chungui district in the mountainous Ayacucho region of Peru. There, above layers of earth that mark geological time, lie relatively new remnants attesting to the massacres carried out by both the Shining Path guerrillas and the military and police forces that hunted them.

2017-10-19.abstract: An Oslo building seen as a symbol of social democracy, and damaged in a deadly 2011 car bombing, is to be torn down, with its artworks relocated.
2017-10-19.snippet: An Oslo building seen as a symbol of social democracy, and damaged in a deadly 2011 car bombing, is to be torn down, with its artworks relocated.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: OSLO — Walking through Oslo’s government quarter, it’s hard to miss the monumental concrete mural that dominates its central square. The semiabstract depiction of three people on a boat, pulling in a catch under a blazing sun, is on the end of a swooping modernist building known as Y-Block. “The Fishermen” bears the unmistakable lines of the artist who designed it: Pablo Picasso, who created it in 1970, in collaboration with a Norwegian artist, Carl Nesjar. It is one of five murals by the two men in the government complex here.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Picasso Murals Caught Up in Terrorist Attack’s Bitter Legacy

2017-10-19.abstract: Katsudon — a bowl of rice topped with slices of pork cutlet, onions and barely cooked eggs — can be transcendent.
2017-10-19.snippet: Katsudon — a bowl of rice topped with slices of pork cutlet, onions and barely cooked eggs — can be transcendent.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Like so much of the exuberant food imagery that I’m drawn to in anime, the katsudon in “Yuri!!! on Ice,” a series about a competitive figure skater in his early 20s, appeared as a less detailed but somehow more vivid version of itself. A Japanese rice bowl capped with golden slices of pork cutlet, held together with barely cooked eggs and translucent onions — textures exaggerated, colors saturated, aromas made visible — occasionally twinkling in soft focus, as if seen through a Vaseline-greased lens. “Is this what God eats?!” one character asked another, trembling, cheeks flushed, eyes wide with the shock of its pleasure. What I love about food in anime is the truth in its hyperbole.
2017-10-19.headline_main: In Pursuit of Cartoonish Perfection in a Japanese Rice Bowl

2017-10-19.abstract: To revamp the most boring superhero in the Marvel pantheon, the company turned to an eccentric indie filmmaker from New Zealand. Will Americans like the view inside Taika Waititi’s head?
2017-10-19.snippet: To revamp the most boring superhero in the Marvel pantheon, the company turned to an eccentric indie filmmaker from New Zealand. Will Americans like the view inside Taika Waititi’s head?
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: It was 394 days before the scheduled release of “Thor: Ragnarok,” and at 4:30 in the morning, the movie’s director, Taika Waititi, was already dressed for another long day: knit cap, dapper wool shirt buttoned up to the neck, cup of coffee in hand. He was three months into the shoot for this $180 million superhero movie based at the massive Village Roadshow Studios in Queensland, Australia, and he enjoyed acting like someone still not quite used to his role. “Every morning,” he confided, “I get in the car and think, Man, they still don’t know that I don’t know what I’m doing.” He laughed, a high-pitched giggle. “They still haven’t cottoned on!”
2017-10-19.headline_main: The Superweirdo Behind ‘Thor: Ragnarok’

2017-10-19.abstract: A teenager asking, ‘What choice did you make?’ is often wondering, ‘What choice should I make?’
2017-10-19.snippet: A teenager asking, ‘What choice did you make?’ is often wondering, ‘What choice should I make?’
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Adolescents sometimes raise important topics by putting adults on the spot. When asked if they have ever used marijuana, many parents feel surprised, defensive or wary. But with new research confirming that parents who provide direct information, guidance or advice about substances like marijuana have adolescents who are less likely to experiment with drugs, we might also feel grateful that our teenager has put the topic on the table.
2017-10-19.headline_main: When Your Teenager Asks, ‘Did You Smoke Weed?’

2017-10-19.abstract: I’ve covered genocide in Sudan and children being blown apart in Iraq. I’ve been dispatched to earthquakes, hurricanes and famines. But Rajuma’s story stopped me.
2017-10-19.snippet: I’ve covered genocide in Sudan and children being blown apart in Iraq. I’ve been dispatched to earthquakes, hurricanes and famines. But Rajuma’s story stopped me.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: As I walked out of the refugee camp, my phone rang. The instant I said hello, my wife could hear it in my voice.
2017-10-19.headline_main: My Interview With a Rohingya Refugee: What Do You Say to a Woman Whose Baby Was Thrown Into a Fire?

2017-10-19.abstract: This film, which features Sam Shepard in his final, all-too-brief screen role, plays more like an experimental art project.
2017-10-19.snippet: This film, which features Sam Shepard in his final, all-too-brief screen role, plays more like an experimental art project.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: More experimental art project than fully-formed movie, “Never Here” might snag some attention for providing Sam Shepard with his final, all-too-brief screen role. Otherwise, this narrative feature debut from Camille Thoman is mostly a frustrating jumble of surreal puzzle pieces that audiences will likely be uninterested in solving.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: Secrets and Lies in ‘Never Here’

2017-10-19.abstract: Daniel Radcliffe suffers for his art in this true-life survival tale about the Israeli adventurer Yossi Ghinsberg.
2017-10-19.snippet: Daniel Radcliffe suffers for his art in this true-life survival tale about the Israeli adventurer Yossi Ghinsberg.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: You have to hand it to Daniel Radcliffe: Instead of luxuriating in all that Harry Potter cash — maybe accepting the occasional cushy acting gig to keep his hand in — he seems to be going out of his way to suffer. In last year’s magical “Swiss Army Man,” he played a gassy, much-manhandled corpse; now he’s embracing the muck and mortifications of “Jungle,” a real-life survival tale from the Australian horror specialist Greg McLean.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: Braving Foot Rot and Fire Ants in the Amazon ‘Jungle’

2017-10-19.abstract: History shows that the central bank needs to maintain broad political and public support, or risk having its autonomy curbed by Congress and the president.
2017-10-19.snippet: History shows that the central bank needs to maintain broad political and public support, or risk having its autonomy curbed by Congress and the president.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve’s inner workings are a mystery to most Americans. Presidents can’t order it around, nor can Congress — that much is generally believed. Along with its reputation for independence, the Fed can seem economically omnipotent.
2017-10-19.headline_main: The Fed Claims to Be Independent. That’s Mostly a Myth.

2017-10-19.abstract: The documentary listens to the stories of two women tormented by Mexican law enforcement and criminal gangs.
2017-10-19.snippet: The documentary listens to the stories of two women tormented by Mexican law enforcement and criminal gangs.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Nightmarish stories intertwine with dreamy visuals to create an unsettling, and strangely entrancing, film in “Tempestad.”
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: ‘Tempestad’ Peers Into Mexico’s Horrific Legal System

2017-10-19.abstract: This documentary, directed by Heidi Ewing and Rachel Grady, follows three ultra-Orthodox Jews who have left the Hasidic community.
2017-10-19.snippet: This documentary, directed by Heidi Ewing and Rachel Grady, follows three ultra-Orthodox Jews who have left the Hasidic community.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: A thread emerges early in “One of Us,” a documentary about three Hasidic Jews who have left that community, and it’s that leaving doesn’t only mean severing a spiritual connection; the toll is complete. “Nobody leaves unless they’re willing to pay the price,” says Chani Getter of Footsteps, a support group for former ultra-Orthodox Jews as well as those considering straying from the fold.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: ‘One of Us,’ a Portrait of Starting a New Life

2017-10-19.abstract: Part of autumn’s great migration, the sharp-shinned hawk is a cunning hunter among the horde headed south.
2017-10-19.snippet: Part of autumn’s great migration, the sharp-shinned hawk is a cunning hunter among the horde headed south.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: The bird migration south along the Atlantic Flyway, one of nature’s most remarkable and ancient journeys, is nothing less than astounding. Every autumn, tens of thousands may pass through the city and vicinity in hours if conditions are right – certain birds by day, some by night. Responding to hidden cues, insects, birds and bats embark on journeys that take them over enormous bodies of water, through entire weather systems, often to the extreme corners of our continent and beyond. From the smallest hummingbirds to bald eagles, and from migratory neotropical songbirds to oceangoing seabirds who rarely see more of North America than a sliver of Atlantic coast, the diversity and the spectacle of this mass movement is powerful. And all are winging southbound following instinct alone.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Little Terror of the Flyway

2017-10-19.abstract: Injury problems and issues with teammates hurt her confidence, but she worked to turn around the negative experiences.
2017-10-19.snippet: Injury problems and issues with teammates hurt her confidence, but she worked to turn around the negative experiences.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Has Caroline Garcia had the last “LOL”?
2017-10-19.headline_main: A Difficult Season Makes Caroline Garcia Stronger

2017-10-19.abstract: This documentary focuses on the hyperkinetic card magician Richard Turner.
2017-10-19.snippet: This documentary focuses on the hyperkinetic card magician Richard Turner.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: The card magician Richard Turner reveals that he has more than just a few tricks up his sleeve in Luke Korem’s captivating documentary “Dealt.” Mr. Turner’s magic prowess lies in his nimble hands that manipulate any deck of cards. But behind the facade of a self-assured showman is the secret Mr. Turner tries to keep to himself: He’s blind.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: In ‘Dealt,’ a Magician Never Shows His Hand (Until He Does)

2017-10-19.abstract: This documentary follows Izak Szewelewicz, who was sent to Israel as a toddler after World War II, on a search for the brother he didn’t know he had.
2017-10-19.snippet: This documentary follows Izak Szewelewicz, who was sent to Israel as a toddler after World War II, on a search for the brother he didn’t know he had.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Directed by Alon and Shaul Schwarz, “Aida’s Secrets” chronicles one man’s late-in-life search for his brother, from whom he was separated as a toddler at the Bergen-Belsen displaced persons camp after World War II. But the remarkable tale it tells — of a family split up and dispersed to different continents, and the detective work required to figure out what had happened — turns this documentary into a fascinating mystery of reshuffled identities. In this time of mass displacement across the globe, it is a stark reminder of how traumatic the refugee experience often is.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: Uncovering a Displaced Family’s Past in ‘Aida’s Secrets’

2017-10-19.abstract: When the American Express C.E.O. steps down in February, there may be just three black men running Fortune 500 companies.
2017-10-19.snippet: When the American Express C.E.O. steps down in February, there may be just three black men running Fortune 500 companies.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Good Thursday morning from Andrew Ross Sorkin in New York and Michael J. de la Merced and Amie Tsang in London. We’re thinking about the implications of the decision by Ken Chenault, one of the financial world’s biggest names, to retire as C.E.O. of American Express next year. More on that in a moment.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Ken Chenault’s Retirement Makes a Small Club Smaller: DealBook Briefing

2017-10-19.abstract: A round of positive findings from Toyota, Honda and Mazda could help lift a cloud over the Japanese supplier, which has said its inspectors falsified data.
2017-10-19.snippet: A round of positive findings from Toyota, Honda and Mazda could help lift a cloud over the Japanese supplier, which has said its inspectors falsified data.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Three Japanese automakers that have been investigating the safety of aluminum purchased from Kobe Steel, the supplier caught up in a scandal over fabricated quality data, said on Thursday that they did not believe the material posed a danger to vehicles or their occupants.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Japanese Carmakers Call Kobe Steel’s Products Safe Despite Scandal

2017-10-19.abstract: Sunday marks her last back-page interview for The Magazine’s “Talk” column. This time, she’s the one doing the introspection.
2017-10-19.snippet: Sunday marks her last back-page interview for The Magazine’s “Talk” column. This time, she’s the one doing the introspection.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: All interviewers halfway decent at their jobs are genuinely curious about their subjects. Being the Talk columnist for the past two years meant that once a week, almost every week, I called a new person and tried to get to know them for an hour. We journalists often confuse soliciting new information with wanting to understand a subject. Chasing after a showy quote or treating the interview like an interrogation is a power trip, but it doesn’t mean you know your subject any better. My editors supported my decision to chase after introspection instead of scoops: Rather than wanting a truth that Talk subjects had been keeping from the world, I wanted one they’d also been keeping from themselves.
2017-10-19.headline_main: For Ana Marie Cox, Goodbyes Can Be Awkward

2017-10-19.abstract: In this lesson, students learn about how human activity threatens the Earth’s biodiversity, and then they research possible solutions.
2017-10-19.snippet: In this lesson, students learn about how human activity threatens the Earth’s biodiversity, and then they research possible solutions.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: The African wild dog. The Asian elephant. The Eastern lowland gorilla. These are just three of the many vertebrate species facing possible extinction because of human activities. Is there anything we can do to protect endangered species, and slow overall extinction rates?
2017-10-19.headline_main: Fighting Extinction: Researching and Designing Solutions to Protect Endangered Species

2017-10-19.snippet: The shopping site keeps a record of the products you browse in the hope you’ll return to close the deal, but you can turn off the tracking.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Q. When I go to the Amazon site on my computer, it shows me a bunch of stuff I previously looked at. Is there a way to make it stop recording every product I click on?
2017-10-19.headline_main: Editing Your History on Amazon

2017-10-19.abstract: In this slasher comedy, two high school social media stars find that murder is the best way to drum up followers for their online horror brand.
2017-10-19.snippet: In this slasher comedy, two high school social media stars find that murder is the best way to drum up followers for their online horror brand.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Midway through the horror comedy “Tragedy Girls,” the director Tyler MacIntyre delivers this slasher movie’s first real scare. Two high school social media stars and secretly budding serial killers, Sadie and McKayla, are holding a school assembly for one of their victims, a fellow cheerleader who got fresh about McKayla’s choice of sneakers. As their sanctimonious In Memoriam slide show plays, the dates of the fallen cheer captain’s birth and death flash onscreen, bringing a sickly realization more frightening than any kill: These teenagers were all born in the year 2000.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: In ‘Tragedy Girls,’ Teenagers Terrorize (and Tweet)

2017-10-19.snippet: Long’s checks will go to educational charities and scholarships.

2017-10-19.abstract: This action drama from Joseph Kosinski — about the Granite Mountain Hotshots of Prescott, Ariz. — offers some real feeling under a schematic surface.
2017-10-19.snippet: This action drama from Joseph Kosinski — about the Granite Mountain Hotshots of Prescott, Ariz. — offers some real feeling under a schematic surface.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Given what Northern California has endured recently with wildfires, perhaps it’s high time to honor those risking life and limb to contain such conflagrations. If only Joseph Kosinski’s action-drama “Only the Brave” — based on the exploits of the real-life Granite Mountain Hotshots, a troop of elite firefighters near Prescott, Ariz. — had a less generic title and fewer formulaic beats. But under its slick, schematic surface, this tale of aspiration and redemption at least offers moments of genuine feeling.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: ‘Only the Brave’ Is an Inspiring Tale of Firefighter Sacrifice

2017-10-19.abstract: The Upright Citizens Brigade will be leaving its famed space in Chelsea and moving to a location on West 42nd Street by early December.
2017-10-19.snippet: The Upright Citizens Brigade will be leaving its famed space in Chelsea and moving to a location on West 42nd Street by early December.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: The Upright Citizens Brigade, which has nurtured the careers of many beloved improv and sketch comedians, is upgrading the real estate for one of its theaters.

2017-10-19.abstract: Through its first five episodes, this moody series has some good ideas as it tries to adapt the franchise to the times. But it could use an energy boost.
2017-10-19.snippet: Through its first five episodes, this moody series has some good ideas as it tries to adapt the franchise to the times. But it could use an energy boost.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Capt. Gabriel Lorca (Jason Isaacs), who commands the starship that gives “Star Trek: Discovery” its title, injured his eyes in a battle. This requires him to work in a dimmed light that gives his vessel the techno-noir moodiness of a dystopian dance club. In the fifth episode, his old friend Admiral Cornwell (Jayne Brook) asked him what I’d been wondering: “Why don’t you get your damn eyes fixed?”
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: ‘Star Trek: Discovery’ Slowly Goes Where Dark TV Has Gone Before

2017-10-19.abstract: If you expected the white nationalist to skulk away after Charlottesville, you misunderstood his strategy.
2017-10-19.snippet: If you expected the white nationalist to skulk away after Charlottesville, you misunderstood his strategy.

2017-10-19.snippet: Crossword editor Will Shortz reports from the World Sudoku Championship

It was the largest WSC to date — 206 competitors from 32 countries. Most countries were represented by four-person teams, although individual solvers could take part as well.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Chinese Team Wins the World Sudoku Championship

2017-10-19.abstract: Ms. Handler said she is quitting the series, “Chelsea,” to work on a new Netflix documentary project, in which she’ll talk to “people of different ethnicities, religions and political philosophies.”
2017-10-19.snippet: Ms. Handler said she is quitting the series, “Chelsea,” to work on a new Netflix documentary project, in which she’ll talk to “people of different ethnicities, religions and political philosophies.”
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Netflix is ending one of its first forays into the topical talk-show genre, and with it, the number of female hosts in this space will be reduced by one. “Chelsea,” the program hosted by Chelsea Handler, will not continue after its current second season; in a statement posted on her Twitter account, Ms. Handler said that she was ending the series to focus on political activism, travel the country and work on a new Netflix documentary project.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Chelsea Handler, Ending Netflix Show, Says She Will Focus on Political Activism

Simons, a veteran antitrust lawyer who has represented tech giants like Microsoft, to lead the Federal Trade Commission at a time of broad bipartisan concern over corporate consolidation and big deals in the waiting, the White House said Thursday.

2017-10-19.abstract: Ms. Darrieux’s career of sophisticated roles spanned indelible incarnations as ingénue, coquette, femme fatale and grande dame.

2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Danielle Darrieux, the French actress and singer whose career of sophisticated film roles spanned eight decades and indelible incarnations as ingénue, coquette, femme fatale and grande dame, died on Tuesday at her home in Bois-le-Roi, France, south of Paris. She was 100.

2017-10-19.abstract: Does Harvey Weinstein prove the case against a “consenting adults” sexual ethics? Not quite.
2017-10-19.snippet: Does Harvey Weinstein prove the case against a “consenting adults” sexual ethics? Not quite.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Amid the cascade of sexual assault stories coming out of liberal Hollywood in the wake of Harvey Weinstein’s fall, David French argues that the time is ripe for social conservatives to claim vindication in their critique of our society’s elevation of “consent” as the only rule of sexual morality:
2017-10-19.headline_main: The Age of Consent and Its Discontents

2017-10-19.abstract: Engineers are finding ways to have cars do much more than take us from Point A to Point B — including producing and dispensing water.
2017-10-19.snippet: Engineers are finding ways to have cars do much more than take us from Point A to Point B — including producing and dispensing water.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: A few years ago, Doug Martin, an engineer at Ford, read an article about an unusual billboard in Lima, Peru: It was designed to collect and filter water that condenses on the billboard’s cool surfaces when humid air rolls in from the coast.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Would You Like My Car to Make You Some Water?

2017-10-19.headline_main: Complaints About Branding Inside Secretive Group Are Under Review

2017-10-19.abstract: Yorgos Lanthimos’s follow-up to “The Lobster” is a family drama, starring Colin Farrell and Nicole Kidman, that doesn’t reach the same imaginative peaks of his earlier films.
2017-10-19.snippet: Yorgos Lanthimos’s follow-up to “The Lobster” is a family drama, starring Colin Farrell and Nicole Kidman, that doesn’t reach the same imaginative peaks of his earlier films.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Stop me if you’ve heard this one. The members of an upstanding, upper-middle-class nuclear family are terrorized by a malign force. Their suffering is not entirely arbitrary, because not all of them are completely innocent. (Usually it’s Daddy’s fault.) Their tormentor metes out a cruel and disproportionate kind of justice, and revels in the punishment. Meanwhile, the audience squirms in complicity, taking both masochistic and sadistic pleasure at a game of cat and mouse in which the roles keep shifting.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: ‘The Killing of a Sacred Deer’ Depicts Familiar Torment

2017-10-19.abstract: Mr. Haynes’s lovely adaptation of Brian Selznick’s book centers on a girl in the 1920s and a boy in the ’70s whose lives are mysteriously connected.
2017-10-19.snippet: Mr. Haynes’s lovely adaptation of Brian Selznick’s book centers on a girl in the 1920s and a boy in the ’70s whose lives are mysteriously connected.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Stars glitter and worlds collide in Todd Haynes’s “Wonderstruck,” a lovely ode to imagination and to the stories that make us who we are. A cleverly bifurcated tale of two children, it starts in 1977 with Ben (Oakes Fegley), a boy of about 10 in rural Minnesota. He’s in mourning for his mother (Michelle Williams in flashback) and has a question mark — an absent father — that needs solving. First, though, there’s David Bowie on the turntable (“ground control to Major Tom”) and a lightning strike that leaves Ben deaf. Fearless and resourceful, Ben splits for New York to find his father.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: ‘Wonderstruck,’ Todd Haynes’s Imitations of Life

2017-10-19.abstract: Austria. France. Part of Canada. More regions are considering or adopting laws that restrict such garments in public.
2017-10-19.snippet: Austria. France. Part of Canada. More regions are considering or adopting laws that restrict such garments in public.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The Canadian province of Quebec is the latest place to make it a crime to wear a face-covering garment in public, a move that critics derided as discriminatory against Muslim women.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Burqa Bans: Which Countries Outlaw Face Coverings?

2017-10-19.abstract: Jacob Ding, the owner and noodle chef at Yuan, presents the dish that made Guilin famous.
2017-10-19.snippet: Jacob Ding, the owner and noodle chef at Yuan, presents the dish that made Guilin famous.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Jacob Ding, the owner and noodle chef at Yuan, presents the dish that made Guilin famous.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Southern China and the East Village, Tied Together by a Rice Noodle

2017-10-19.abstract: The owner of Yuan brings the most famous dish from Guilin, in southern China, to southern Manhattan.
2017-10-19.snippet: The owner of Yuan brings the most famous dish from Guilin, in southern China, to southern Manhattan.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: The karst peaks of Guilin, in the Guangxi region of southern China, touch the clouds in centuries of Chinese ink-brush paintings. But most Americans know them only as part of the backdrop for the planet of the Wookiees in “Star Wars: Episode III — Revenge of the Sith.”
2017-10-19.headline_main: Rice Noodles Stretching From Guangxi to the East Village

2017-10-19.abstract: Cataracts usually afflict the old, but doctors in Africa have been shocked to find them in Ebola survivors as young as 5.
2017-10-19.snippet: Cataracts usually afflict the old, but doctors in Africa have been shocked to find them in Ebola survivors as young as 5.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: FREETOWN, Sierra Leone — Hoisted onto the operating table by a nurse, Aminata Conteh, a spunky 8-year-old, crossed her skinny ankles jauntily and held stock-still as doctors numbed her eye and then pierced it with a needle to withdraw a sample of fluid.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Ebola’s Legacy: Children With Cataracts

2017-10-19.abstract: Marc Bamuthi Joseph’s dance-theater show considers racism, colonialism and aging as refracted through the world’s most popular sport.
2017-10-19.snippet: Marc Bamuthi Joseph’s dance-theater show considers racism, colonialism and aging as refracted through the world’s most popular sport.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: A line in the dance-theater show “/peh-LO-tah/” hits a timely raw nerve: “The Defender explains why Americans suck at soccer.” When these words flash on the back wall of the Brooklyn Academy of Music’s Harvey Theater, they are a biting reminder that the U.S. recently failed to qualify for the next World Cup, and in ignominious fashion at that.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: Life is Soccer, and Soccer is Life, in ‘/peh-LO-tah/’

2017-10-19.abstract: This passionate historical drama from Robin Campillo follows young French activists through an emotional battle for respect and care.
2017-10-19.snippet: This passionate historical drama from Robin Campillo follows young French activists through an emotional battle for respect and care.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: It is said of one of the characters in Robin Campillo’s “BPM (Beats Per Minute)” that “he lived his politics in the first person.” Even in translation and even in a movie set a quarter-century in the past, this suggestive phrase, which is part of a eulogy, cannot fail to resonate. The words, and the passionate, uncompromising sentiment behind them, offer an implicit rebuttal to the currently fashionable critique of “identity politics,” a phrase that seeks to trivialize struggles that are, for the people who practice such politics, a matter of life and death.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: ‘BPM (Beats Per Minute)’ Captures the Fierce AIDS Fight

2017-10-19.abstract: Cities in Syria and Iraq have been wrested from the Islamic State at a terrible cost. They are ghosts of their former glory.
2017-10-19.snippet: Cities in Syria and Iraq have been wrested from the Islamic State at a terrible cost. They are ghosts of their former glory.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: The declarations of victory played out across Iraq and Syria: The long campaigns to retake city after city from Islamic State militants had come to an end.
2017-10-19.headline_main: This Is What Victory Over ISIS Looks Like

2017-10-19.abstract: DNA phenotyping uses genes from human remains to give police an idea of what an unknown person looked like. Critics say the technology isn’t ready for crime-fighting.
2017-10-19.snippet: DNA phenotyping uses genes from human remains to give police an idea of what an unknown person looked like. Critics say the technology isn’t ready for crime-fighting.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Freezing winds whipped the snow-covered coastline of Brooklyn’s Calvert Vaux Park on the day two years ago that a severed hand washed up on the rocks.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Using DNA to Sketch What Victims Look Like; Some Call It Science Fiction

2017-10-19.abstract: The chef and his partner, facing an expensive overhaul, are shutting down after 12 years, and two stars from The Times.
2017-10-19.snippet: The chef and his partner, facing an expensive overhaul, are shutting down after 12 years, and two stars from The Times.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Bobby Flay, the chef and restaurateur known for brash flavors and energy-driven dining rooms, and his partner, Laurence Kretchmer, have announced they will close Bar Americain, their American brasserie in Midtown, after service on Jan. 17, 2018. They said, in a statement, that renewing the lease for the restaurant, in the AXA Equitable Center, would require an expensive overhaul, which they were unwilling to undertake at this time. They hinted at new projects on the horizon, to which they preferred to devote their resources.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Bobby Flay Will Close Bar Americain in Midtown

2017-10-19.abstract: Entering its eighth season, with no end in sight, one of TV’s highest-rated series has forsaken terror for franchise building.
2017-10-19.snippet: Entering its eighth season, with no end in sight, one of TV’s highest-rated series has forsaken terror for franchise building.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: AMC’s horror series “The Walking Dead” reaches a significant television milestone on Sunday: Its Season 8 premiere is also its 100th episode, a traditional benchmark of enduring success and the ability to unlock even greater profits through syndication sales.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: At 100 Episodes, ‘The Walking Dead’ Is Walking in Circles

2017-10-19.abstract: A trip to Italy with a dead smartphone resulted in some predictable withdrawal pains, but also provided welcome respite from the clutter of information.
2017-10-19.snippet: A trip to Italy with a dead smartphone resulted in some predictable withdrawal pains, but also provided welcome respite from the clutter of information.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Two weeks ago, my smartphone shut down because of a low battery as I was about to board a flight to Europe. That seemed odd, given that I had barely used it that day. I plugged it in on the plane, but seven hours later, it still wasn’t functioning. When I arrived at my hotel I tried a different charger, to no avail. The phone was dead — terminally so, it turned out.
2017-10-19.headline_main: My Smartphone Died, and I Didn’t Miss It. Well, Maybe a Little.

2017-10-19.abstract: Men and women develop hypertension at roughly the same rates, but men do not get it under control until much later in life, researchers find.
2017-10-19.snippet: Men and women develop hypertension at roughly the same rates, but men do not get it under control until much later in life, researchers find.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Hypertension is dangerous. High blood pressure damages the inner lining of the arteries, limits the ability of the heart to pump blood and strains the organ in a way that can lead to heart failure.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Women Are More Likely to Address High Blood Pressure

2017-10-19.abstract: Fifteen states, most recently California, have rules allowing for the liquefaction of human remains through a process called alkaline hydrolysis.
2017-10-19.snippet: Fifteen states, most recently California, have rules allowing for the liquefaction of human remains through a process called alkaline hydrolysis.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: What do you want done with your body after you die?
2017-10-19.headline_main: An Alternative to Burial and Cremation Gains Popularity

2017-10-19.abstract: A Super Bowl rematch is poorly timed, with the Atlanta Falcons coming off consecutive losses. The Rams should win, and the Chiefs should get back on track. Here are our picks against the spread.
2017-10-19.snippet: A Super Bowl rematch is poorly timed, with the Atlanta Falcons coming off consecutive losses. The Rams should win, and the Chiefs should get back on track. Here are our picks against the spread.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: The Atlanta Falcons getting another crack at the New England Patriots trumps any other game this week. And while neither team has looked particularly sharp, with both seemingly suffering from a Super Bowl hangover, the game is of particular importance to the Falcons, a team that may be in free-fall. Here are our picks against the spread for N.F.L. Week 7.
2017-10-19.headline_main: N.F.L. Picks: Patriots and Falcons Meet in Super Bowl Rematch

2017-10-19.abstract: George W. Bush and Barack Obama emerged from political seclusion and denounced the politics of division, sending a message to their successor in the White House.
2017-10-19.snippet: George W. Bush and Barack Obama emerged from political seclusion and denounced the politics of division, sending a message to their successor in the White House.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Neither of them mentioned President Trump by name but two of his predecessors emerged from political seclusion on Thursday to deliver what sounded like pointed rebukes of the current occupant of the Oval Office and the forces of division that propelled him to power.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Without Saying ‘Trump,’ Bush and Obama Deliver Implicit Rebukes

2017-10-19.abstract: The New-York Historical Society’s show on the Vietnam War highlights racial and class divisions, generational rifts and government mendacity.
2017-10-19.snippet: The New-York Historical Society’s show on the Vietnam War highlights racial and class divisions, generational rifts and government mendacity.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: For the people who live it, history is personal. And if you live it intensely, you feel you own it, or it owns you. A lot of Americans still feel that way about the Vietnam War years. No matter how removed you were from actual combat, if the war consumed your attention, shaped your emotions, and dictated your actions, you were in the middle of it.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Vietnam, Up Close and Personal

2017-10-19.abstract: Nationalism, an unchecked ethnic majority and support for authoritarian values have put Myanmar well down the road to becoming an “illiberal democracy.”
2017-10-19.snippet: Nationalism, an unchecked ethnic majority and support for authoritarian values have put Myanmar well down the road to becoming an “illiberal democracy.”
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: YANGON, Myanmar — Nearly a decade into Myanmar’s transition out of military rule, the country’s once-celebrated transition toward democracy is hardening into something very different from what activists and world leaders had hoped for.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Myanmar, Once a Hope for Democracy, Is Now a Study in How It Fails

2017-10-19.abstract: Card debt has soared to record levels, generating big profits for banks but leaving some people with unmanageable payments.
2017-10-19.snippet: Card debt has soared to record levels, generating big profits for banks but leaving some people with unmanageable payments.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Udean Murray, a 62-year-old retired telephone operator in Brooklyn, relies on more than a dozen credit cards to make ends meet. Her prescription medication often goes on a Capital One card. She pays for groceries with one from Discover Financial Services.
2017-10-19.headline_main: A Boom in Credit Cards: Great News for Banks, Less So Consumers

2017-10-19.headline_main: Suspecting Russian Meddling in ‘Brexit’ Vote, Lawmaker Seeks Inquiry

2017-10-19.abstract: The time our Pentagon correspondent’s mail was about a different sort of “arms” control.
2017-10-19.snippet: The time our Pentagon correspondent’s mail was about a different sort of “arms” control.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The envelope was innocuous enough, addressed to me at the “NY Times” in New York, though some soul in the mail department had obviously opened it, marked it “personal” and forwarded it to our Washington office.
2017-10-19.headline_main: ‘Dear Helene: Could You Not Wear Beachwear on Sunday A.M. Talk Shows?’

2017-10-19.abstract: “People should know that this is not just happening in Hollywood,” McKayla Maroney, a former Olympic gymnast, wrote in a brave Twitter post. “This is happening everywhere.”
2017-10-19.snippet: “People should know that this is not just happening in Hollywood,” McKayla Maroney, a former Olympic gymnast, wrote in a brave Twitter post. “This is happening everywhere.”
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: There were more names. Of course there were.
2017-10-19.headline_main: The ‘Me Too’ Movement Inevitably Spills Into Sports

2017-10-19.abstract: We’ve pulled together some of the biggest issues in investing in a quarterly report that can help you navigate the murky waters of finance, with some laughs and lessons along the way.
2017-10-19.snippet: We’ve pulled together some of the biggest issues in investing in a quarterly report that can help you navigate the murky waters of finance, with some laughs and lessons along the way.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Figuring out what is going on in financial markets isn’t easy, even for professionals who trade constantly.  In fact, for many people, forgetting about day-to-day market swings and taking a long-term perspective may be the best approach.
2017-10-19.headline_main: 9 Ways to Help You Become a Smarter Investor

2017-10-19.abstract: Michael Fassbender and other talented people wander through this leaden mess.
2017-10-19.snippet: Michael Fassbender and other talented people wander through this leaden mess.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: There are a couple of mysteries swirling through “The Snowman,” a leaden, clotted, exasperating mess. This ostensible whodunit involves a serial killer who’s preying on women, leaving behind carefully arranged body parts and a childlike snowman as a kind of elaborate signature. The greater puzzle, though, is how an enterprise studded with so much talent — starting with the director Tomas Alfredson (“Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy”) and including the star Michael Fassbender — has led to such a grim, thrill-free thriller, one without a twitch of real feeling and next to no elementary story sense.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Review: ‘The Snowman’ Is a Thrill-Free Thriller Tied in Knots

2017-10-19.abstract: The ride-hailing company is exploring a 2018 initial public offering, as it added fresh capital to its coffers from investors including a venture arm spun out of Google.
2017-10-19.snippet: The ride-hailing company is exploring a 2018 initial public offering, as it added fresh capital to its coffers from investors including a venture arm spun out of Google.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In an escalation of its ride-hailing war against Uber, Lyft has begun to explore going public in 2018 and is trying to strengthen its position by raising more capital, including $1 billion in new financing led by an investment arm of Google’s parent company.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Lyft Is Said to Explore I.P.O. as It Raises $1 Billion Led by Alphabet

2017-10-19.abstract: Mahmud Ahmad had acted as a link to the group’s central command in Syria, helping funnel money and foreign fighters who ransacked a city in the south.
2017-10-19.snippet: Mahmud Ahmad had acted as a link to the group’s central command in Syria, helping funnel money and foreign fighters who ransacked a city in the south.

2017-10-19.headline_main: Key ISIS Operative in Philippines ‘Taken’ in Gunfight, President Says

2017-10-19.abstract: The Senate’s budget blueprint, while ostensibly an outline of federal spending and revenues, would allow a tax bill to be approved with only Republican votes.
2017-10-19.snippet: The Senate’s budget blueprint, while ostensibly an outline of federal spending and revenues, would allow a tax bill to be approved with only Republican votes.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate’s proposed budget blueprint stretches 93 pages, sketching out trillions of dollars in spending over the coming decade on areas ranging from the military to Medicare.

2017-10-19.abstract: The online retailer is moving in. Booksellers are nervous. But disrupting Australians’ reading habits might not be so easy to do.
2017-10-19.snippet: The online retailer is moving in. Booksellers are nervous. But disrupting Australians’ reading habits might not be so easy to do.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: MELBOURNE, Australia — When Borders opened in 2002 across the street from Readings, Melbourne’s best-known independent bookseller, retail experts predicted catastrophe for the musty old shop competing with the shiny new chain store.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Australia’s Amazon Book Battle

2017-10-19.abstract: The Belgian designer photographs his garden, his dog, Harry — and more.
2017-10-19.snippet: The Belgian designer photographs his garden, his dog, Harry — and more.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: The Belgian designer Dries Van Noten is one of the seven cover stars of T’s Oct. 22nd Greats issue — so, to mark the occasion, we gave him the creative challenge of capturing his life in Polaroid. The resulting shots, which appear below, were taken around his Antwerp office and sprawling garden. As he put it, “Many a fashion designer’s career was founded using packs upon packs of Polaroids and though we love them, we forget that the image quality was often circumspect.” See his images — including many of his dog, Harry — below.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Dries Van Noten Captures His World — in Polaroids

2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Ella McCallion woke up at 2 a.m. on Monday, Oct. 10 when she smelled smoke.

2017-10-19.abstract: And: a daughter’s new boyfriend has medical bills he can’t pay; a dear friend has become one-sided in conversation; and a troubling excess of figs.
2017-10-19.snippet: And: a daughter’s new boyfriend has medical bills he can’t pay; a dear friend has become one-sided in conversation; and a troubling excess of figs.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: While I was waiting to check out at the market, an older white woman in front of me turned to the black man behind me and said, “You look just like a young Gandhi. Has anyone told you that?” He said no. “Well, you do,” she said. “It’s wonderful!” When she resumed her place, he said, “That’s a new one.” He seemed dismayed. Clearly, this was not the first time a white person told him he looked like a famous person of color. I didn’t want to make his shopping any worse by confronting her, so I said nothing. Was I right?
2017-10-19.headline_main: Microaggressions at the Market

2017-10-19.abstract: A little over a week after Ms. Myers stepped down from her position at the magazine, she and her two children had to evacuate their apartment.
2017-10-19.snippet: A little over a week after Ms. Myers stepped down from her position at the magazine, she and her two children had to evacuate their apartment.

2017-10-19.snippet: Jenna, Barbara and their ever-texting, emoji-addicted father aren’t who you think they are.

2017-10-19.headline_main: The Bush Twins Want to Set the Record Straight

2017-10-19.abstract: Joe Ide’s follow-up to his award-winning debut novel, “IQ,” begins in the exact spot that story left off: in a junkyard with a car full of evidence.
2017-10-19.snippet: Joe Ide’s follow-up to his award-winning debut novel, “IQ,” begins in the exact spot that story left off: in a junkyard with a car full of evidence.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Last year, Joe Ide became the best thing to happen to mystery writing in a very long time. He made a smashing debut with “IQ,” which won the Macavity Award for best first novel, and if you can possibly read it before approaching its follow-up, “Righteous,” you won’t be sorry. Ide is nothing if not precise, and he begins his new book in the exact spot where the last one ended.
2017-10-19.headline_main: In ‘Righteous,’ a Stand-Up Sleuth Investigates His Brother’s Murder

2017-10-19.abstract: The gala program, with two premieres (one by Alexei Ratmansky one by Jessica Lang), demonstrated how this troupe has been changing.
2017-10-19.snippet: The gala program, with two premieres (one by Alexei Ratmansky one by Jessica Lang), demonstrated how this troupe has been changing.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: How do you judge the success of a gala? On Wednesday, Stella Abrera and David Hallberg, principal dancers of American Ballet Theater, announced to the audience that this, the opening night of the company’s two-week season at the David H. Koch Theater, was the most successful of these grand occasions in the company’s history.
2017-10-19.headline_main: At American Ballet Theater Gala, All Is the Same but Different

2017-10-19.abstract: A look at our favorite comments from the last several days, and an invitation to join the conversation yourself.
2017-10-19.snippet: A look at our favorite comments from the last several days, and an invitation to join the conversation yourself.

2017-10-19.abstract: This week’s dispute over President Trump’s phone call to the widow of a soldier killed in Niger hit too close to home for the White House chief of staff.
2017-10-19.snippet: This week’s dispute over President Trump’s phone call to the widow of a soldier killed in Niger hit too close to home for the White House chief of staff.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — John F. Kelly, the White House chief of staff, delivered a searing, personal defense of President Trump’s phone call this week to the widow of a slain Army soldier, describing on Thursday the trauma of learning about his own son’s death in Afghanistan and calling the criticism of Mr. Trump’s condolences unfair.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Kelly Delivers Fervent Defense of Trump Call to Soldier’s Widow

2017-10-19.abstract: As Egypt works to bring together two rival Palestinian factions, President Trump’s special Middle East envoy visited Cairo to help move those talks along.
2017-10-19.snippet: As Egypt works to bring together two rival Palestinian factions, President Trump’s special Middle East envoy visited Cairo to help move those talks along.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — With Egypt brokering a reconciliation between the two rival Palestinian factions, President Trump’s special envoy to the Middle East visited Cairo on Thursday to help move those talks along while trying to ensure that the Egyptians do not take them in a direction unacceptable to the United States and Israel.
2017-10-19.headline_main: U.S. Works to Keep Palestinians’ Talks on Track to Aid Peace

2017-10-19.abstract: Partly because of an influx of asylum seekers crossing the border illegally into Quebec this year, tens of thousands of people are caught in a bureaucratic limbo.
2017-10-19.snippet: Partly because of an influx of asylum seekers crossing the border illegally into Quebec this year, tens of thousands of people are caught in a bureaucratic limbo.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: A wave of asylum seekers entering Canada this year has exacerbated a backlog of refugee claims that the government is struggling to manage, leaving tens of thousands of people stuck in bureaucratic limbo even as they try to build new lives.

2017-10-19.snippet: The least you could do is speak up about the horror of sexual violence, the lies that blame women and your complicity in all of it.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: Statistics about the scope of sexual violence are always chilling, but even such accountings do little to capture the true breadth and scope of harassment and assault women face. In feminist discourse we talk about rape culture, but the people we most need to reach — the men who are the cause of the problem and the women who feel moved to excuse them — are often resistant to the idea that rape culture even exists.

2017-10-19.abstract: Our guide to cultural events in New York City for families with children and teenagers.
2017-10-19.snippet: Our guide to cultural events in New York City for families with children and teenagers.
2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: ‘A BOOK AS A BRIDGE AMONG TIME AND SPACE’ at the Children’s Museum of the Arts (Oct. 22, 2:45 p.m.). Many artists make statements with brushes and pens; Elena Berriolo uses a needle. Equipped with a sewing machine, she stitches books in a process that is as important as the product. On Sunday she will invite families visiting the museum — they will meet in the lobby — to join her on the No. 1 train from 3 to 5:30 p.m., as she makes a round-trip journey from Houston Street in Manhattan to Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx, all the while sewing a 40-foot-long accordion-style book; passengers will help hold the pages. By highlighting more than the geographic distance between the two neighborhoods — the average life span of a child born in Greenwich Village is greater than that of one born anywhere in the Bronx — Ms. Berriolo intends to protest efforts to repeal the Affordable Care Act. Her performance is part of “In Practice: Works in Progress,” a show through Oct. 29 at the museum, where five professional artists have set up studios to create projects alongside young visitors. 212-274-0986, cmany.org
2017-10-19.headline_main: Events for Children in NYC This Week

2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: For immigrants living far from their homelands, music — even a few notes of a favorite ballad — can summon a lifetime of memories. Music can also connect children born in the United States to the rhythms and cultures left behind by their parents.

2017-10-19.lead_paragraph: After Hurricane Maria laid waste to Puerto Rico last month, Carlos Beltran could not sleep for about 10 days. He said he did not hear from his family there for a week, until his brother relayed stories about waiting in gas lines for nearly 24 hours and his baseball academy taking on three feet of water. More than a dozen relatives from the island temporarily moved in with Beltran’s family in the United States.
2017-10-19.headline_main: Carlos Beltran, With Puerto Rico on His Mind, Tries to Steady the Astros

2017-10-19.snippet: After a media exposé prompted the representative to withdraw as national drug czar nominee, Pennsylvania voters ask, “Does he even care about his people?”

2017-10-19.headline_main: Harsh Words Back Home for Tom Marino, Congressman Tied to Opioid Law
