2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: Federico Luppi, a dignified Argentine actor well known for his complex performances in the dark fantasy films of Guillermo del Toro, died on Friday in Buenos Aires. He was 83.
2017-10-20.headline_main: Federico Luppi, 83, Actor Known for del Toro Films, Dies

2017-10-20.abstract: The United States recorded its largest annual budget deficit in four years in fiscal 2017.
2017-10-20.snippet: The United States recorded its largest annual budget deficit in four years in fiscal 2017.
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States has recorded its largest annual budget deficit in four years, highlighting the nation’s worsening fiscal trajectory as lawmakers consider a $1.5 trillion tax cut.
2017-10-20.headline_main: U.S. Budget Deficit Swells, Adding Wrinkle to G.O.P. Push for Tax Cut

2017-10-20.abstract: Vincent Boudreau has been the interim president of CUNY’s flagship school and has impressed many on campus with his leadership
2017-10-20.snippet: Vincent Boudreau has been the interim president of CUNY’s flagship school and has impressed many on campus with his leadership
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: More than a year after its president abruptly resigned amid a federal investigation into her finances, the City College of New York, the flagship campus of the City University of New York, is turning to a familiar hand as its next leader.
2017-10-20.headline_main: Leader of City College of New York Will Shed Interim Status

2017-10-20.abstract: At a panel discussion, former secretaries of state Condoleezza Rice and Madeleine K. Albright coached President Trump’s ambassador to the United Nations.
2017-10-20.snippet: At a panel discussion, former secretaries of state Condoleezza Rice and Madeleine K. Albright coached President Trump’s ambassador to the United Nations.
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: At various points, in different eras, they sat across from dictators and kings and ministers, negotiating on behalf of their country. But when former secretaries of state Condoleezza Rice and Madeleine K. Albright took the stage together this week, they focused their diplomacy on a target closer to home — the Trump administration.
2017-10-20.headline_main: For Nikki Haley, an Establishment Tutorial in Statecraft

2017-10-20.abstract: A physiologist and longtime Little League executive, Mr. Hale worked hard to make baseball safer for young players.
2017-10-20.snippet: A physiologist and longtime Little League executive, Mr. Hale worked hard to make baseball safer for young players.
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: Creighton Hale, who in the late 1950s invented a batting helmet that gave Little League Baseball players better protection, and who later rose to the top ranks of the organization as it grudgingly accepted girls, died on Oct. 8 in Williamsport, Pa., where the league has its headquarters. He was 93.
2017-10-20.headline_main: Creighton Hale, 93, Inventor of Little League Helmet, Dies

2017-10-20.abstract: Nearly 50 years ago, the senator called for sensible restrictions on firearms — laws we’re still largely waiting to see.
2017-10-20.snippet: Nearly 50 years ago, the senator called for sensible restrictions on firearms — laws we’re still largely waiting to see.
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: Roseburg, Ore. It’s one of those American places — Aurora, Sandy Hook, San Bernardino — now branded by a mass shooting. On Oct. 1, 2015, a 26-year-old shot and killed eight fellow students and a professor at the local community college. When the town’s name was still hot with grief, the watchword from the gun people was “politics.” No one was to talk about what might have prevented it.
2017-10-20.headline_main: Chris Matthews: What Robert Kennedy Knew About Gun Control

2017-10-20.abstract: Gerald L. Storch will depart the Canadian retailer, which faces increased pressure to raise profits at Saks Fifth Avenue and Lord & Taylor, on Nov. 1.
2017-10-20.snippet: Gerald L. Storch will depart the Canadian retailer, which faces increased pressure to raise profits at Saks Fifth Avenue and Lord & Taylor, on Nov. 1.
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: The chief executive of the Hudson’s Bay Company, the owner of Saks Fifth Avenue and Lord & Taylor, is departing ahead of the crucial holiday shopping season, as the retail industry faces increasing turmoil.
2017-10-20.headline_main: Hudson’s Bay C.E.O. to Step Down Before Holiday Shopping Season

2017-10-20.abstract: The Yankees had always entered the World Series as regular-season champions. But, if they are Series bound this year, it will be on different terms.
2017-10-20.snippet: The Yankees had always entered the World Series as regular-season champions. But, if they are Series bound this year, it will be on different terms.
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: The Yankees captured the 1927 World Series after losing just 44 games in the regular season, and they won only 87 before beating the Mets in the 2000 Series. But as they faced the Houston Astros in Game 6 of the American League Championship Series on Friday night, they were seeking a different sort of accomplishment: advancing to the World Series for the first time as a wild-card team.
2017-10-20.headline_main: For the Yankees, the Wild Card Has a Whole New Meaning

2017-10-20.abstract: Robert Zimmer, head of the University of Chicago, makes the educator’s case for free speech.
2017-10-20.snippet: Robert Zimmer, head of the University of Chicago, makes the educator’s case for free speech.
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: Several years ago Robert Zimmer was asked by an audience in China why the University of Chicago was associated with so many winners of the Nobel Prize — 90 in all, counting this month’s win by the behavioral economist Richard Thaler. Zimmer, the university’s president since 2006, answered that the key was a campus culture committed to “discourse, argument and lack of deference.”
2017-10-20.headline_main: America’s Best University President

2017-10-20.abstract: Amazon’s handling of accusations of sexual harassment involving Roy Price, who ran its movie and television operations, has set off confusion, debate and finger-pointing.
2017-10-20.snippet: Amazon’s handling of accusations of sexual harassment involving Roy Price, who ran its movie and television operations, has set off confusion, debate and finger-pointing.
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Amazon on Friday tried to quell concerns among employees about sexual harassment accusations against an executive, sending an email to its staff saying the company would review its policies to ensure that “they are doing their job to provide a harassment-free workplace.”
2017-10-20.headline_main: Inside Amazon, Diversity Concerns Flare Up After Harassment Accusations

2017-10-20.abstract: The Federal Reserve began to reduce its bond holdings this month. Janet Yellen, the Fed’s chairwoman, said it is making “good progress.”
2017-10-20.snippet: The Federal Reserve began to reduce its bond holdings this month. Janet Yellen, the Fed’s chairwoman, said it is making “good progress.”
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, said on Friday night that the Fed is making “good progress” in reducing its vast portfolio of bond holdings, the most recent stage in the central bank’s gradual unwinding of its post-crisis economic stimulus program.
2017-10-20.headline_main: Yellen Says Reduction of Bond Portfolio Going Well

2017-10-20.abstract: To some, John F. Kelly, President Trump’s chief of staff, expanded an ever-growing gulf between the all-volunteer military and the public it serves.
2017-10-20.snippet: To some, John F. Kelly, President Trump’s chief of staff, expanded an ever-growing gulf between the all-volunteer military and the public it serves.
2017-10-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When John F. Kelly stood in the White House briefing room on Thursday and described how the remains of American troops killed in combat are shipped home and then called on only reporters who knew families of dead service members, he held to an underlying theme: The military is an elite class separated from the American people by its infallible values.
2017-10-20.headline_main: Kelly, in Defending Trump Call, Holds Up Military as an Elite Class

2017-10-21.abstract: The nonprofit 100 Suits for 100 Men provides styling and tailoring — and suits — to men who may never have even owned a tie before.
2017-10-21.snippet: The nonprofit 100 Suits for 100 Men provides styling and tailoring — and suits — to men who may never have even owned a tie before.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: The community center at Redfern Houses was the last place Shareef Wise would have expected to lead him to his next job.
2017-10-21.headline_main: To Get a Job, a Nice Suit Can Help. These Are Free.

2017-10-21.abstract: A move to reduce contribution limits would almost certainly prompt a vocal backlash from middle-class workers who save heavily in such retirement accounts.
2017-10-21.snippet: A move to reduce contribution limits would almost certainly prompt a vocal backlash from middle-class workers who save heavily in such retirement accounts.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Republicans are considering a plan to sharply reduce the amount of income American workers can save in tax-deferred retirement accounts as part of a broad effort to rewrite the tax code, according to lobbyists, tax consultants and congressional Democrats.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Republicans Consider Sharp Cut in 401(k) Contribution Limits

2017-10-21.abstract: An 18-month study of more than 2,000 officers in Washington found that those with cameras used force at about the same rate as those without.
2017-10-21.snippet: An 18-month study of more than 2,000 officers in Washington found that those with cameras used force at about the same rate as those without.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: After a series of high-profile police shootings, police departments across the nation turned to body cameras, hoping they would curb abuses. But a rigorous study released Friday shows that they have almost no effect on officer behavior.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Body Cameras Have Little Effect on Police Behavior, Study Says

2017-10-21.abstract: His three home runs in Game 5 of the National League Championship Series propelled Los Angeles to the World Series for the first time in 29 years.
2017-10-21.snippet: His three home runs in Game 5 of the National League Championship Series propelled Los Angeles to the World Series for the first time in 29 years.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — After earning their first trip to the World Series in 29 years on Thursday night with a dismantling of the Chicago Cubs, the Los Angeles Dodgers celebrated modestly until they headed off the field.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Best Supporting Player? It Has to Be the Dodgers’ Enrique Hernandez

2017-10-21.abstract: Nigerien officials have said that a convoy gave chase to Islamic militants who later returned to ambush them, but American troops say they didn’t pursue the militants before the attack.
2017-10-21.snippet: Nigerien officials have said that a convoy gave chase to Islamic militants who later returned to ambush them, but American troops say they didn’t pursue the militants before the attack.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: The Pentagon is trying to determine whether American forces involved in a deadly ambush in Niger this month diverted from their routine patrol to embark on an unapproved mission, military officials said on Friday.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Conflicting Accounts in Niger Ambush Are Subject of Pentagon Investigation

2017-10-21.abstract: Being a person is terrible. And griping about it is the purest, most soothing form of protest there is.
2017-10-21.snippet: Being a person is terrible. And griping about it is the purest, most soothing form of protest there is.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: There are so many things in daily life that cause me never-ending unease: waiting in the kind of loosely defined wraparound line at the D.M.V. that makes losing your place inevitable; self-service situations whose unmarked rules the savage among us approach “Lord of the Flies”-style, leaving, say, the Starbucks condiment bar in complete disarray in their wake; holding my breath while hoping for the woman two stalls down to hurry up and leave as she hopes for me to hurry up and do the exact same thing.
2017-10-21.headline_main: To Complain Is to Truly Be Alive

2017-10-21.abstract: Despite the common connection, their reactions to Mr. Kelly’s speech were anything but unanimous: Some deplored his defense of the administration, while others insisted he was speaking as a true military man.
2017-10-21.snippet: Despite the common connection, their reactions to Mr. Kelly’s speech were anything but unanimous: Some deplored his defense of the administration, while others insisted he was speaking as a true military man.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: The Reader Center is a newsroom initiative that is helping The Times build deeper ties with our audience.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Military Members and Their Families Respond to John Kelly’s News Conference

2017-10-21.abstract: The threat to the American voting process cries out for national leadership. But don’t expect help from President Trump.
2017-10-21.snippet: The threat to the American voting process cries out for national leadership. But don’t expect help from President Trump.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: As Washington ignores the danger, state election officials have finally begun facing up to the threat of Russian hackers and other troublemakers infiltrating the American voting process in the midterm and presidential elections.
2017-10-21.headline_main: States Take On Election Hacking. Washington Ignores It.

2017-10-21.abstract: By cutting an insurers’ subsidy, the president may accidentally save many Americans money on health insurance.
2017-10-21.snippet: By cutting an insurers’ subsidy, the president may accidentally save many Americans money on health insurance.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: President Trump once promised a health care plan that would have “much lower premiums and deductibles while at the same time taking care of pre-existing conditions.”
2017-10-21.headline_main: The Silver Lining in Trump’s Health Care ‘Sabotage’

2017-10-21.abstract: Some have asserted that President Trump is simply continuing Obama-era immigration policies. But it sure doesn’t feel like it in Texas.
2017-10-21.snippet: Some have asserted that President Trump is simply continuing Obama-era immigration policies. But it sure doesn’t feel like it in Texas.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — When I was a child in the 1960s in San Antonio, agents from the Immigration and Naturalization Service showed up at our house. “La migra,” as we called the I.N.S. in Spanish, was a term that carried an edge of anxiety, though I didn’t quite understand why. I just knew that I wasn’t to open the door to anyone in uniform, and that there were certain bus stops our housekeeper, Juana, avoided.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Texas Pulls Up the Welcome Mat

2017-10-21.abstract: With an argument as weak as it is brazen, the administration is fighting an undocumented immigrant who wants to end her pregnancy.
2017-10-21.snippet: With an argument as weak as it is brazen, the administration is fighting an undocumented immigrant who wants to end her pregnancy.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Jane Doe is a 17-year-old undocumented immigrant detained in Texas who is 15 weeks pregnant and is seeking an abortion. The Constitution grants her that right, but the Trump administration is determined to subvert it as part of its war on women’s reproductive rights.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Abortion Ideologues Subvert a Woman’s Rights

2017-10-21.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, October 21, 2017.
2017-10-21.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, October 21, 2017.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: “I have the advantage of many perspectives as someone who has lived in different kinds of communities: as a woman, as someone who previously identified as a lesbian, as someone who is a person of color. I’ve had a lot of life so that informs what I do.”
2017-10-21.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: In New York, an Influential First Lady With Plans of Her Own

2017-10-21.abstract: Samuel “Not the Newscaster” Donaldson and Brad Wilber team up to offer an exquisite Saturday puzzle.
2017-10-21.snippet: Samuel “Not the Newscaster” Donaldson and Brad Wilber team up to offer an exquisite Saturday puzzle.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — Yes, hi, remember yesterday, when I said that you might as well solve the Friday because it wasn’t as hard as you would imagine it to be and besides, the Saturday puzzle would be much harder? Well, they don’t pay me the medium-sized bucks for nothing. Today’s puzzle by Samuel A. Donaldson and Brad Wilber is a real ... let’s just call it a learning experience, O.K.?
2017-10-21.headline_main: Exquisite Gem

2017-10-21.abstract: Keeping people out has become a defining feature of far too many public places.
2017-10-21.snippet: Keeping people out has become a defining feature of far too many public places.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: In the 1990s, San Francisco removed all of the benches from Civic Center Plaza. In 2001, all remaining seating in nearby United Nations Plaza was removed in the middle of the night. Over the years, public seating has been removed from virtually the entire city. While this anti-homelessness strategy has given way a little with the emergence of the city’s many parklets, it’s still in full effect.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Designing a More Inclusive City

2017-10-21.abstract: Jose Altuve drove in three runs, and starter Justin Verlander dominated with a big assist from center fielder George Springer, who made a leaping catch of a deep drive.
2017-10-21.snippet: Jose Altuve drove in three runs, and starter Justin Verlander dominated with a big assist from center fielder George Springer, who made a leaping catch of a deep drive.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — At the crack of the ball off Todd Frazier’s bat — a sound heavier and more authoritative than any the Yankees have produced off Justin Verlander in the postseason — it seemed as if everyone who had squeezed into Minute Maid Park on Friday night was consumed by a singular thought.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Astros, Their Backs to the Wall, Hold Off the Yankees and Force Game 7

2017-10-21.abstract: Corrections appearing in print Saturday, October 21, 2017.
2017-10-21.snippet: Corrections appearing in print Saturday, October 21, 2017.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: SPORTS
2017-10-21.headline_main: Corrections: October 21, 2017

2017-10-21.abstract: A new portrait of George Michael arrives on Showtime. And Will Ferrell becomes a reluctant protagonist in “Stranger Than Fiction.”
2017-10-21.snippet: A new portrait of George Michael arrives on Showtime. And Will Ferrell becomes a reluctant protagonist in “Stranger Than Fiction.”
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: A new portrait of George Michael arrives on Showtime. And Will Ferrell becomes a reluctant protagonist in “Stranger Than Fiction.”
2017-10-21.headline_main: What’s on TV Saturday: ‘George Michael: Freedom’ and ‘Stranger Than Fiction’

2017-10-21.abstract: Fewer than one in five of the 1,180 candidates running in Sunday’s election for the lower house of parliament are women.
2017-10-21.snippet: Fewer than one in five of the 1,180 candidates running in Sunday’s election for the lower house of parliament are women.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: OBIHIRO, Japan — Standing before an audience of mostly men here on Japan’s northern island, a parliamentary candidate in Sunday’s elections made a pointed appeal.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Japan Ranks Low in Female Lawmakers. An Election Won’t Change That.

2017-10-21.abstract: A map shows the origin and extent of a fire that burned 5,200 buildings in hours.
2017-10-21.snippet: A map shows the origin and extent of a fire that burned 5,200 buildings in hours.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: A map shows the origin and extent of a fire that burned 5,200 buildings in hours.
2017-10-21.headline_main: How California’s Most Destructive Wildfire Spread, Hour by Hour

2017-10-21.abstract: A former economy minister insists he knew nothing of $2 million in cash stuffed in a gift bag for him, along with a basket of wild boar sausages and wine.
2017-10-21.snippet: A former economy minister insists he knew nothing of $2 million in cash stuffed in a gift bag for him, along with a basket of wild boar sausages and wine.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — The Russian elite, the group of oligarchs and other loyalists around President Vladimir V. Putin who amassed great wealth over nearly two decades of hand-in-glove work with the government, is showing signs of cracking.
2017-10-21.headline_main: In Russia, a Bribery Case Lifts the Veil on Kremlin Intrigue

2017-10-21.abstract: Mr. Xi has promised a new “China dream” of prosperity. But in the nation’s hinterlands, locals say there’s a stark disconnect between the bright promises and their hardscrabble reality.
2017-10-21.snippet: Mr. Xi has promised a new “China dream” of prosperity. But in the nation’s hinterlands, locals say there’s a stark disconnect between the bright promises and their hardscrabble reality.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: DATONG, China — At first glance, the coal city of Datong in northern China displays the hopeful signs of change that President Xi Jinping had in mind when he promised his nation a new “China dream.”
2017-10-21.headline_main: In China’s Coal Capital, Xi Jinping’s Dream Remains Elusive

2017-10-21.abstract: Ex-employees and whistle-blowers question whether the provider of investment advice to people in public and nonprofit jobs does put its customers first.
2017-10-21.snippet: Ex-employees and whistle-blowers question whether the provider of investment advice to people in public and nonprofit jobs does put its customers first.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: In the treacherous world of finance, where investors confront biased advice, hidden costs and onerous fees, one investment giant seems to stand apart — the Teachers Insurance and Annuity Association, also known as TIAA. Calling itself a “mission-based organization” with a “nonprofit heritage,” TIAA has enjoyed a reputation as a selfless steward of its clients’ assets for almost a century.
2017-10-21.headline_main: The Finger-Pointing at the Finance Firm TIAA

2017-10-21.abstract: In her first interview since the essay that started a wave of sexual-harassment revelations, Susan Fowler tells her life story and looks to the future.
2017-10-21.snippet: In her first interview since the essay that started a wave of sexual-harassment revelations, Susan Fowler tells her life story and looks to the future.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Susan Fowler was, she recalls, “over the moon” in January 2016. At 24, she had just snagged her dream job as a site reliability engineer at Uber, which had recruited her by telling her the ride-hailing company was a “super-women-friendly” place to work, boasting 25 percent female engineers. And she had her first date with the man who would become her husband, Chad Rigetti, who runs a quantum computing start-up in Berkeley, Calif., and who, she says dreamily, is as “beautiful” as Michael Fassbender.
2017-10-21.headline_main: She’s 26, and Brought Down Uber’s C.E.O. What’s Next?

2017-10-21.abstract: The former Uber employee has deleted her account. But would she ever go back?
2017-10-21.snippet: The former Uber employee has deleted her account. But would she ever go back?
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Maureen Dowd: You’ve deleted your Uber account.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Confirm or Deny ... Susan Fowler

2017-10-21.abstract: The celebratory feel at Nok by Alara in Lagos, Nigeria, owes equally to its hip ambience and its new take on regional staples.
2017-10-21.snippet: The celebratory feel at Nok by Alara in Lagos, Nigeria, owes equally to its hip ambience and its new take on regional staples.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: A few years ago, Pierre Thiam packed up his two restaurants in Brooklyn and headed to his home continent where he hoped to elevate West African street food to gourmet status. The result is Nok by Alara in Lagos, Nigeria, a restaurant whose celebratory feel is informed by both its hip ambience and its new takes on regional staples.
2017-10-21.headline_main: A Rare Gem of a Restaurant in Lagos

2017-10-21.abstract: Plan surprises (a sunset cruise), stay off your phone, write (really write) a love letter.
2017-10-21.snippet: Plan surprises (a sunset cruise), stay off your phone, write (really write) a love letter.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Amid the stresses of daily life, it’s easy to lose some of the magic in a romantic relationship, said Claudia Palma, the director of romance at Las Ventanas al Paraiso, a Rosewood Resort in Los Cabos, Mexico. A relaxing vacation, she said, is the ideal opportunity for couples to reconnect and remember why they first fell in love.
2017-10-21.headline_main: How to Have a Romantic Vacation

2017-10-21.abstract: La Jolla Playhouse’s Without Walls festival takes to San Diego’s streets and public buildings for the first time with a diverse offering of immersive performances.
2017-10-21.snippet: La Jolla Playhouse’s Without Walls festival takes to San Diego’s streets and public buildings for the first time with a diverse offering of immersive performances.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: La Jolla Playhouse’s Without Walls festival takes to San Diego’s streets and public buildings for the first time with a diverse offering of immersive performances.
2017-10-21.headline_main: An Eclectic Mix of Arts Without Walls

2017-10-21.abstract: The shots began at 10:05. Twelve bursts of gunfire later, the police broke down Stephen Paddock’s door at the Mandalay Bay. The Times mapped 30 videos to draw perhaps the most complete picture to date of what happened.
2017-10-21.snippet: The shots began at 10:05. Twelve bursts of gunfire later, the police broke down Stephen Paddock’s door at the Mandalay Bay. The Times mapped 30 videos to draw perhaps the most complete picture to date of what happened.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: The shots began at 10:05. Twelve bursts of gunfire later, the police broke down Stephen Paddock’s door at the Mandalay Bay. The Times mapped 30 videos to draw perhaps the most complete picture to date of what happened.
2017-10-21.headline_main: 10 Minutes. 12 Gunfire Bursts. 30 Videos. Mapping the Las Vegas Massacre.

2017-10-21.abstract: Gabrielle Deydier’s plaintive account and sociological study exposes the many ways the obese face censure and insensitivity.
2017-10-21.snippet: Gabrielle Deydier’s plaintive account and sociological study exposes the many ways the obese face censure and insensitivity.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: PARIS — When a fledgling alternative press published Gabrielle Deydier’s plaintive memoir of growing up fat in France, there was little expectation that the book would attract much notice. Frenchwomen are among the thinnest in Europe, high fashion is big business, and obesity isn’t often discussed.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Memoir of Growing Up Fat Forces France to Look in the Mirror

2017-10-21.abstract: The Great Lakes Cycle is made up of five oil, alkyd and acrylic paintings that depict environmental issues affecting the lakes. The exhibition is traveling around the country.
2017-10-21.snippet: The Great Lakes Cycle is made up of five oil, alkyd and acrylic paintings that depict environmental issues affecting the lakes. The exhibition is traveling around the country.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: In Alexis Rockman’s large mural “Spheres of Influence,” it’s hard to turn away from the dead waterfowl floating belly up, its head hanging underwater near a depiction of type E botulism, which has poisoned thousands of water birds.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Alexis Rockman Portrays the Great Lakes in Glory and Decline

2017-10-21.abstract: The couple readily acknowledge that they are opposites, but her parents immediately saw a match.
2017-10-21.snippet: The couple readily acknowledge that they are opposites, but her parents immediately saw a match.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Sara Slayton O’Rourke and Egon Francis Donnarumma were married Oct. 21 in Chicago. Judge Ann Claire Williams, a senior judge on the Federal Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit, in Chicago, officiated at the Art Institute of Chicago.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Her Parents Had an Inkling Long Before a Proposal

2017-10-21.abstract: The couple met and had a child, but marriage took a little longer.
2017-10-21.snippet: The couple met and had a child, but marriage took a little longer.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Christina Lynn Barr and Alan Barry Deutschman are to be married Oct. 22 at Piper’s Opera House, a historic performing arts space in Virginia City, Nev. Valerie P. Cooke, a magistrate judge of the Federal District Court in Reno, Nev., and a Universal Life minister, is to officiate, with Barbara S. Kohlenberg, a friend of the couple, leading traditional Jewish elements of the ceremony.
2017-10-21.headline_main: ‘Mommy, Will You Marry My Daddy?’

2017-10-21.abstract: Hiroyuki Ito, a photographer who grew up in Tokyo, wanted to see more of his country. So he spent two months this summer documenting interesting moments.
2017-10-21.snippet: Hiroyuki Ito, a photographer who grew up in Tokyo, wanted to see more of his country. So he spent two months this summer documenting interesting moments.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Hiroyuki Ito covered a lot of ground this summer: Moji, Dazaifu, Hakata, Yanagawa and Kumamoto on Japan’s Kyushu Island; Kochi-city and Cape Ashizuri in Kochi; Atami in Shizuoka and Omiya, Saitama. 54 cities in 18 prefectures, to be exact.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Traveling Across Japan

2017-10-21.abstract: When you’re stuck with no foreseeable path ahead, what do you do? The Sugars, with fiction writer Mitchell S. Jackson, advise letter writers who want to turn their lives around.
2017-10-21.snippet: When you’re stuck with no foreseeable path ahead, what do you do? The Sugars, with fiction writer Mitchell S. Jackson, advise letter writers who want to turn their lives around.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: “I remember them finding the drugs and holding them up in the sky. And I was like, “Oh man, I’m going to prison.” This week’s guest, the writer Mitchell S. Jackson, started selling drugs when he was 14 years old, then went to prison for drug possession years later. When his mother tried to buy drugs from him, he knew he couldn’t run away from his bad decisions. “There was no way for me to escape what I was doing,” he tells “Dear Sugars” co-hosts Cheryl Strayed and Steve Almond on this episode of the podcast. “I knew what I was doing was wrong.”
2017-10-21.headline_main: Listen to ‘Dear Sugars’: What Comes After Rock Bottom

2017-10-21.abstract: Her mother had bought a diamond ring 15 years ago at a pawnshop. She didn’t know it was her future son-in-law doing the selling.
2017-10-21.snippet: Her mother had bought a diamond ring 15 years ago at a pawnshop. She didn’t know it was her future son-in-law doing the selling.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Rachel Emma Englander and Adam Matthew Davis were married Oct. 21 at Cipriani 42nd Street in Manhattan. Cantor Raphael Frieder officiated.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Sealed With a Prediction (and the Kisses to Come)

2017-10-21.abstract: Colin Kaepernick’s decision to sit or take a knee during the national anthem exploded into a national conversation about race. Here, high school students tell us why they sit or kneel during the national anthem or the Pledge of Allegiance — or why they stand and participate.
2017-10-21.snippet: Colin Kaepernick’s decision to sit or take a knee during the national anthem exploded into a national conversation about race. Here, high school students tell us why they sit or kneel during the national anthem or the Pledge of Allegiance — or why...
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: In August, 2016, the National Football League quarterback Colin Kaepernick began sitting, and then kneeling, during the national anthem before games as a protest against racist treatment of black people in the United States. His gestures created a new front in the national conversation about race, policing and patriotism.
2017-10-21.headline_main: High School Students Explain Why They Protest Anthems and Pledges

2017-10-21.abstract: An exhibit at the Frans Hals Museum in Haarlem, the Netherlands, will show that many paintings from the Dutch Golden Age “have a joke as their very core.”
2017-10-21.snippet: An exhibit at the Frans Hals Museum in Haarlem, the Netherlands, will show that many paintings from the Dutch Golden Age “have a joke as their very core.”
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: HAARLEM, the Netherlands — If you were asked to quickly close your eyes and conjure a picture of the Dutch Golden Age, you might come up with an image of dour, pale figures clad all in black with stiff white ruffs bracing their necks. But it may be time to update that image.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Need a Good Laugh? Check Out Some 17th-Century Dutch Art

2017-10-21.abstract: The conceptual artist has her first New York gallery show in five years, featuring politically loaded artwork made out of compressed lint.
2017-10-21.snippet: The conceptual artist has her first New York gallery show in five years, featuring politically loaded artwork made out of compressed lint.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — There is a peculiar, almost shameful, pleasure in visiting Mary Kelly’s laundry room. A pioneer of conceptual art, she is a model of precision in many ways. Her thinking is rigorous, her speech is eloquent, and her small home and studio up in the hills are sparsely and beautifully furnished with choice midcentury pieces.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Art Lurks in an Unlikely Place for Mary Kelly: the Dryer

2017-10-21.abstract: Several cities face pressure to tear down the 1960s-era mega-roads and reinstate pedestrian-friendly streets. Jane Jacobs told you so!
2017-10-21.snippet: Several cities face pressure to tear down the 1960s-era mega-roads and reinstate pedestrian-friendly streets. Jane Jacobs told you so!
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: BUFFALO — The Scajaquada Corridor is a city dweller’s dreamland, a culture-vulture Valhalla. Within two miles there is a restored Frank Lloyd Wright house you can visit, an art museum with Picassos and Gauguins, three college campuses, a zoo and a history museum in a majestic Greek Revival building from the 1901 Pan Am Exposition listed on the National Historic Register. All of it borders a 356-acre park designed by Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Once So Chic and Swooshy, Freeways Are Falling Out of Favor

2017-10-21.abstract: The decision outraged medical professionals, rights groups and others who took to social media to call it an “insult” and “a sick joke.”
2017-10-21.snippet: The decision outraged medical professionals, rights groups and others who took to social media to call it an “insult” and “a sick joke.”
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization’s decision to name President Robert Mugabe of Zimbabwe a “good-will ambassador” has provoked outrage from medical professionals, rights groups, opposition leaders and others who took to social media to call it an “insult” and “a sick joke.”
2017-10-21.headline_main: After Making Mugabe a ‘Good-Will Ambassador,’ W.H.O. Chief Is ‘Rethinking’ It

2017-10-21.abstract: Mariano Rajoy, in an unexpectedly forceful move, said Madrid would take control of the independence-minded region, pushing out its separatist administration.
2017-10-21.snippet: Mariano Rajoy, in an unexpectedly forceful move, said Madrid would take control of the independence-minded region, pushing out its separatist administration.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA — The escalating confrontation over Catalonia’s independence drive took its most serious turn on Saturday as Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy of Spain announced he would remove the leadership of the restive region and initiate a process of direct rule by the central government in Madrid.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Spain Will Remove Catalonia Leader, Escalating Secession Crisis

2017-10-21.abstract: The New York Times requested copies of email correspondence related to the March 2017 decision by the E.P.A. to reject a decade-old petition to ban chlorpyrifos, a widely used pesticide that research suggests may cause developmental delays in children exposed to it in drinking water or in farming communities. Here are those documents.
2017-10-21.snippet: The New York Times requested copies of email correspondence related to the March 2017 decision by the E.P.A. to reject a decade-old petition to ban chlorpyrifos, a widely used pesticide that research suggests may cause developmental delays in chil...
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: The New York Times requested copies of email correspondence related to the March 2017 decision by the E.P.A. to reject a decade-old petition to ban chlorpyrifos, a widely used pesticide that research suggests may cause developmental delays in children exposed to it in drinking water or in farming communities. Here are those documents.
2017-10-21.headline_main: E.P.A.’s Decision Not to Ban Chlorpyrifos

2017-10-21.abstract: An internal struggle has broken out in the Environmental Protection Agency over how to regulate toxic chemicals. These documents tell the backstory of the tension, which emerged after the Trump administration named an industry insider as a top agency regulator.
2017-10-21.snippet: An internal struggle has broken out in the Environmental Protection Agency over how to regulate toxic chemicals. These documents tell the backstory of the tension, which emerged after the Trump administration named an industry insider as a top age...
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: An internal struggle has broken out in the Environmental Protection Agency over how to regulate toxic chemicals. These documents tell the backstory of the tension, which emerged after the Trump administration named an industry insider as a top agency regulator.
2017-10-21.headline_main: E.P.A. and Toxic Chemical Rules

2017-10-21.abstract: A scientist who worked for the chemical industry now shapes policy on hazardous chemicals. Within the E.P.A., there is fear that public health is at risk. (At right, a signing ceremony for new rules on toxic chemicals.)
2017-10-21.snippet: A scientist who worked for the chemical industry now shapes policy on hazardous chemicals. Within the E.P.A., there is fear that public health is at risk. (At right, a signing ceremony for new rules on toxic chemicals.)
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For years, the Environmental Protection Agency has struggled to prevent an ingredient once used in stain-resistant carpets and nonstick pans from contaminating drinking water.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Why Has the E.P.A. Shifted on Toxic Chemicals? An Industry Insider Helps Call the Shots

2017-10-21.abstract: The Environmental Protection Agency published toxic chemicals it will evaluate first under a new law. Here is a look at those chemicals, how they are used and the health threats.
2017-10-21.snippet: The Environmental Protection Agency published toxic chemicals it will evaluate first under a new law. Here is a look at those chemicals, how they are used and the health threats.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: The Environmental Protection Agency has published a list of 10  toxic threats it will evaluate first under a law passed last year intended to crack down on hazardous chemicals. They are among 90 chemicals identified by the agency that may harm children, damage nerve tissue, cause cancer, contaminate the environment, accumulate in the bloodstream or show up in consumer products. As the review begins, industry and other interest groups are urging the E.P.A. to limit any restrictions.
2017-10-21.headline_main: The E.P.A.’s Top 10 Toxic Threats, and Industry’s Pushback

2017-10-21.abstract: The artist’s three children and several museum members argue that it is unlawful for the institution to sell two Rockwell paintings and other works.
2017-10-21.snippet: The artist’s three children and several museum members argue that it is unlawful for the institution to sell two Rockwell paintings and other works.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: For decades, the Berkshire Museum in Western Massachusetts has struggled financially as companies have left the region and competing art institutions have sprung up nearby.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Rockwell’s Children Sue Berkshire Museum to Stop Sale of His Works

2017-10-21.abstract: A 1992 law that sought to quell conspiracy theories about the killing mandated the release of the secret documents by Oct. 26 of this year.
2017-10-21.snippet: A 1992 law that sought to quell conspiracy theories about the killing mandated the release of the secret documents by Oct. 26 of this year.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has decided to release a final batch of thousands of classified government documents related to the 1963 assassination of President John F. Kennedy, Mr. Trump announced in a tweet on Saturday morning.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Trump Says He Will Release Final Set of Documents on Kennedy Assassination

2017-10-21.abstract: Gunmen fired bullets and rockets on Egyptian police officers and security officials as they drove toward what was believed to be an Islamist hide-out.
2017-10-21.snippet: Gunmen fired bullets and rockets on Egyptian police officers and security officials as they drove toward what was believed to be an Islamist hide-out.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — Militants carried out a devastating ambush on a convoy of Egyptian police and security officials deep inside the western desert late Friday in the deadliest such attack in years, security officials said on Saturday.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Militants Kill Egyptian Security Forces in Devastating Ambush

2017-10-21.abstract: Charlen Evans, who has been hearing-impaired her whole life, got a cochlear implant in 2012. She has since returned to college in hopes of someday working with deaf students.
2017-10-21.snippet: Charlen Evans, who has been hearing-impaired her whole life, got a cochlear implant in 2012. She has since returned to college in hopes of someday working with deaf students.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Strangers approach Charlen Evans, on street corners and city buses, when they notice her cochlear implant. They greet her by placing a finger just below their ear, gliding it in an arc across the cheek and stopping just shy of the mouth.
2017-10-21.headline_main: For the First Time, Hearing the Birds Chirp and the Wind Whistle

2017-10-21.abstract: Senator John McCain, the irrepressible Arizona Republican, has long felt free to speak his mind. But since his cancer diagnosis, he has been a vocal defender of national ideals.
2017-10-21.snippet: Senator John McCain, the irrepressible Arizona Republican, has long felt free to speak his mind. But since his cancer diagnosis, he has been a vocal defender of national ideals.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator John McCain, the sometimes cantankerous, often charming and eternally irrepressible Republican from Arizona, has never minced words. But in the twilight of a long and storied career, as he fights a virulent form of brain cancer, the 81-year-old senator has found a new voice.
2017-10-21.headline_main: McCain in Twilight: An Unfettered Voice Against Trumpism

2017-10-21.abstract: Records reveal that fraud and abuse in small-business health plans have left employers and employees with hundreds of millions of dollars in unpaid medical bills.
2017-10-21.snippet: Records reveal that fraud and abuse in small-business health plans have left employers and employees with hundreds of millions of dollars in unpaid medical bills.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In signing a recent executive order, President Trump promised that millions of Americans could soon obtain “great, great health care” through inexpensive plans that offer consumers options they had been denied under the Affordable Care Act.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Cheaper Health Plans Promoted by Trump Have a History of Fraud

2017-10-21.abstract: The Astros have a rough history of closing out playoff series, even with late leads, while the Yankees’ last Game 7 was part of their 2004 A.L.C.S. collapse.
2017-10-21.snippet: The Astros have a rough history of closing out playoff series, even with late leads, while the Yankees’ last Game 7 was part of their 2004 A.L.C.S. collapse.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — The Houston Astros hang their championship flags in two vertical columns on the light poles above left field at Minute Maid Park. All of them are blue except for an orange one, from 2005, that signifies their only trip to the World Series. There is no color for a championship, because the Astros don’t have one.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Astros and Yankees Take Some Shaky Memories Into Game 7

2017-10-21.abstract: A brewing Republican vs. Republican fight could test whether the anti-incumbent insurgency backed by Stephen K. Bannon becomes a credible national movement.
2017-10-21.snippet: A brewing Republican vs. Republican fight could test whether the anti-incumbent insurgency backed by Stephen K. Bannon becomes a credible national movement.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: LAUREL, Miss. — In the recent history of Republican infighting, few losses have been more bitter than Chris McDaniel’s. Mr. McDaniel, a Mississippi state senator, still nurses the conviction that he was robbed of a seat in the United States Senate in 2014 by a Republican establishment that race-baited, covered up his opponent’s affair and encouraged Democrats to raid the primary.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Conservatives, With Bannon’s Help, Look for Revenge in Mississippi

2017-10-21.abstract: Alan Arbesfeld debuts a fun new puzzle called “Walls and Doors.”
2017-10-21.snippet: Alan Arbesfeld debuts a fun new puzzle called “Walls and Doors.”
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — When we solve a puzzle, there’s always that point at which we hit a roadblock. We spend time ruminating on how to get ourselves unstuck and then, as if by magic, we figure it out and the puzzle falls for us. That’s a good feeling.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Variety Puzzle: Walls and Doors

2017-10-21.abstract: Andrej Babis, the billionaire leader of an anti-establishment party, is expected to become prime minister of the Czech Republic after mainstream parties fall short.
2017-10-21.snippet: Andrej Babis, the billionaire leader of an anti-establishment party, is expected to become prime minister of the Czech Republic after mainstream parties fall short.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: PRAGUE — An anti-establishment party founded by a billionaire oligarch overpowered the Czech Republic’s longstanding mainstream parties on Saturday, making the blunt-talking, enigmatic tycoon almost certain to become prime minister in a coalition government.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Czech Election Won by Anti-Establishment Party Led by Billionaire

2017-10-21.abstract: In January, the Fox News host was said to have agreed to a $32 million settlement with a former network analyst, the largest of his known payouts.
2017-10-21.snippet: In January, the Fox News host was said to have agreed to a $32 million settlement with a former network analyst, the largest of his known payouts.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Last January, six months after Fox News ousted its chairman amid a sexual harassment scandal, the network’s top-rated host at the time, Bill O’Reilly, struck a $32 million agreement with a longtime network analyst to settle new sexual harassment allegations, according to two people briefed on the matter — an extraordinarily large amount for such cases.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Bill O’Reilly Settled New Harassment Claim, Then Fox Renewed His Contract

2017-10-21.abstract: Here are the winners from the thousands of submissions in my Trump poetry contest.
2017-10-21.snippet: Here are the winners from the thousands of submissions in my Trump poetry contest.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: My readers have the best words, as Donald Trump might say. Evidence for that comes from the caliber of the 2,750 poems submitted to my Trump poetry contest. With the help of the Poetry Society of America, I’ve picked my winners, and here they are, offering us a mix of humor, bite and hope.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Trump Is Inspirational ... for Poetry

2017-10-21.abstract: A decentralized movement can be effective, even without a Martin Luther King Jr.
2017-10-21.snippet: A decentralized movement can be effective, even without a Martin Luther King Jr.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Why has this generation of black activists failed to produce a Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. or a Malcolm X — a charismatic, messiah-like figure who can lead a major movement?
2017-10-21.headline_main: Black Lives Matter Is Democracy in Action

2017-10-21.abstract: Puritanical Democratic former president seeks job with louche Republican current president — but just to save the world.
2017-10-21.snippet: Puritanical Democratic former president seeks job with louche Republican current president — but just to save the world.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: PLAINS, Ga. — Most people would run away screaming at the thought of working for a boss who humiliates subordinates in public, throttles them in private, demands constant flattery, spends all day watching cable TV and behaves in a wildly unpredictable way.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Jimmy Carter Lusts for a Trump Posting

2017-10-21.abstract: A party that will do anything to beat Trump except try to woo his voters.
2017-10-21.snippet: A party that will do anything to beat Trump except try to woo his voters.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: America has two political parties, but only one of them has a reasonably coherent political vision, a leadership that isn’t under the thumb of an erratic reality television star, and a worldview that implies a policy agenda rather than just a litany of grievances.
2017-10-21.headline_main: The Democrats in Their Labyrinth

2017-10-21.abstract: This year, I felt compelled to travel to Mogadishu, the city of my father’s youth. Along the way, I saw order, puritanism, fear and villages without men.
2017-10-21.snippet: This year, I felt compelled to travel to Mogadishu, the city of my father’s youth. Along the way, I saw order, puritanism, fear and villages without men.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — One evening in August, I climbed onto a dusty old truck in the Dadaab refugee camp in the eastern Kenyan desert, about 50 miles from the border with Somalia. A tarpaulin in the truck bed covered the sacks of beans it was transporting to the Somali capital, Mogadishu. The driver readily picked up some passengers: four women and eight men for $60 each.
2017-10-21.headline_main: My Parents’ Country, in the Grip of the Shabab

2017-10-21.abstract: The extraordinary are the ones who need to make things better for everyone.
2017-10-21.snippet: The extraordinary are the ones who need to make things better for everyone.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: He’s disrespecting the flag. He’s slighting veterans. He’s showing contempt for the national anthem. He’s not a true patriot.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Famous Athletes Have Always Led the Way

2017-10-21.abstract: We asked high school students to react to a recent Times article and got over 1,000 responses. Here are 20 of our favorites.
2017-10-21.snippet: We asked high school students to react to a recent Times article and got over 1,000 responses. Here are 20 of our favorites.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: We received more than 1,000 letters from high school students on a wide range of topics in response to our Student Challenge. The most popular subjects included Donald Trump, teenage anxiety, N.F.L. kneeling, birth control, Columbus Day, Harvey Weinstein, Puerto Rico and the Boy Scouts. Here are 20 letters that we particularly liked.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Teenagers’ View of the News

2017-10-21.abstract: The neighborhood fliers of your dreams — or nightmares.
2017-10-21.snippet: The neighborhood fliers of your dreams — or nightmares.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: The neighborhood fliers of your dreams — or nightmares.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Signs of Our Times

2017-10-21.abstract: The region has made huge progress in viewing the condition as a medical problem, not a manhood problem.
2017-10-21.snippet: The region has made huge progress in viewing the condition as a medical problem, not a manhood problem.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Western men’s sperm counts are falling, and we ought to be concerned.
2017-10-21.headline_main: A Male Infertility Crisis Is Coming. The Middle East Can Help.

2017-10-21.abstract: To have lasting impact, a social movement requires action on multiple fronts.
2017-10-21.snippet: To have lasting impact, a social movement requires action on multiple fronts.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Do protests and social movements matter? Do they really bring about change?
2017-10-21.headline_main: How Protest Works

2017-10-21.abstract: Let’s get back into the habit of gathering to celebrate the exceptional among us. Who’s on your list?
2017-10-21.snippet: Let’s get back into the habit of gathering to celebrate the exceptional among us. Who’s on your list?
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: The New York Yankees’ postseason heroics inspired even Mayor Bill de Blasio, a Boston Red Sox fan who would rather chew on razor blades than cheer for the ball club in the Bronx. After their loss on Saturday night to the Houston Astros, the Yanks won’t head to the World Series. But Mr. de Blasio allowed last week that had they gone all the way, he would have held a ticker-tape parade for them along the stretch of lower Broadway known as the Canyon of Heroes.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Where Have All Our Heroes Gone?

2017-10-21.abstract: Party members who reject Bannonism must stand up and be counted.
2017-10-21.snippet: Party members who reject Bannonism must stand up and be counted.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: A year after President Trump’s stunning electoral victory, the Republican Party is in a very strange place. It’s politically dominant but increasingly unpopular, particularly among young people and nonwhites of all ages, whose level of unhappiness with Mr. Trump and his administration is toxic.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Going Against the Republican Herd

2017-10-21.abstract: Governments tempted to close their eyes to Pyongyang’s mischief should be reminded that they’d risk being treated as accomplices.
2017-10-21.snippet: Governments tempted to close their eyes to Pyongyang’s mischief should be reminded that they’d risk being treated as accomplices.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: The chilling survey of North Korea’s cyberpower in The Times, describing a sophisticated program of not only weapons of war but also of theft, blackmail, harassment and score-settling, is shocking, but not surprising. Kim Jong-un is ruthless in his quest for power and survival, and hacking, even more than the nuclear power North Korea is rapidly developing, is the perfect weapon for a small, impoverished, isolated, totalitarian state.
2017-10-21.headline_main: The Power of North Korea’s Cyberthreat

2017-10-21.abstract: Scary facts only special people know.
2017-10-21.snippet: Scary facts only special people know.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: IN “NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD,” the “zombies” were in fact very much alive, as the studio chose not to go through the Zombie Actors Equity. In retaliation, union zombies went on to overtake local drinking establishments, playing fantasy football for hours, dominating the jukebox with college rock and tipping poorly.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Well, Actually, Frankenstein Was the Name of the Doctor

2017-10-21.abstract: Ceaseless statement-writing is sucking us dry. We need daring action.
2017-10-21.snippet: Ceaseless statement-writing is sucking us dry. We need daring action.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: ANN ARBOR, Mich. — Amid the cultural amplification of Donald Trump’s brand of belittling speech, college campuses are wrestling with how to respond to emboldened acts of expressive racism.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Fighting Racism Is Not Just a War of Words

2017-10-21.abstract: Ola al-Qaradawi has been imprisoned in Egypt in harsh conditions since June. Supporters say she is being punished because of her father, a famous preacher.
2017-10-21.snippet: Ola al-Qaradawi has been imprisoned in Egypt in harsh conditions since June. Supporters say she is being punished because of her father, a famous preacher.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — Confined to a tiny windowless cell without a mattress or a toilet, denied visitors and held in solitary for months on end, Ola al-Qaradawi is being subjected to harsh treatment even by the grim standards of Egyptian prisons.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Middle East Feud Looms Over Jailing of Egyptian Woman

2017-10-21.abstract: The elite military group drove the Iranian economy at the peak of the sanctions era. Now, seen as a drag on growth, it is under attack by President Hassan Rouhani.
2017-10-21.snippet: The elite military group drove the Iranian economy at the peak of the sanctions era. Now, seen as a drag on growth, it is under attack by President Hassan Rouhani.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — From its nine-story headquarters in an upscale neighborhood of Tehran, a giant construction company directs its operations across Iran, building mosques, airports, oil and gas installations, hospitals, and skyscrapers.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Iran Saps Strength of Revolutionary Guards With Arrests and Cutbacks

2017-10-21.abstract: I knew my beard would turn out badly. But I had to grow it.
2017-10-21.snippet: I knew my beard would turn out badly. But I had to grow it.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: I apologize for my beard. Not only because it is terrible — thin, patchy and asymmetrical — but also because it is inexplicable. Many people have asked me why I grew it, and most of those people are my wife, and to them and to her I say: I don’t know. I’m sorry.
2017-10-21.headline_main: I Am Sorry for This Scraggly Mess on My Face

2017-10-21.abstract: Daphne Caruana Galizia enraged dozens of powerful people with investigations that exposed corruption. Virtually nobody expects her killing to be solved.
2017-10-21.snippet: Daphne Caruana Galizia enraged dozens of powerful people with investigations that exposed corruption. Virtually nobody expects her killing to be solved.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: VALLETTA, Malta — The blast from the bomb planted in the rented Peugeot of Malta’s best-known investigative journalist was so powerful it took police investigators four days to collect body parts and wreckage scattered across sun-baked fields next to the road.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Brutal Killing of Journalist Exposes ‘Something Darker’ in Malta

2017-10-21.abstract: Cut profit taxes, raise wages? Not so fast.
2017-10-21.snippet: Cut profit taxes, raise wages? Not so fast.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: I very much doubt that additional facts or analysis are going to matter much for the fate of the Trump tax cuts. It’s obvious to pretty much everyone – I suspect even those pushing the cuts – that they will confer huge benefits on the wealthy, do little if anything for the middle class, and greatly increase the deficit. Indeed, in some ways those are not only the likely results, but the goals: big benefits for the donor class, and future deficits that can be used to justify tearing new holes in the social safety net.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Some Misleading Geometry on Corporate Taxes (Wonkish)

2017-10-21.abstract: With a pair of major announcements on Saturday, the century-old organization moved to reclaim its role as the nation’s pre-eminent voice on civil rights.
2017-10-21.snippet: With a pair of major announcements on Saturday, the century-old organization moved to reclaim its role as the nation’s pre-eminent voice on civil rights.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: Moving to reclaim its role as the country’s pre-eminent voice on civil rights, the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People named a new president on Saturday and took steps to allow for more effective lobbying.
2017-10-21.headline_main: N.A.A.C.P., Seeking a New Voice, Names Derrick Johnson as President

2017-10-21.abstract: The weeklong feud between President Trump and a Democratic congresswoman after a soldier’s death might never have happened had either side followed convention.
2017-10-21.snippet: The weeklong feud between President Trump and a Democratic congresswoman after a soldier’s death might never have happened had either side followed convention.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Blame it on these bitter political times.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Political Guardrails Gone, a President’s Somber Duty Skids Into Spectacle

2017-10-21.abstract: Tracy Gray stays in the picture.
2017-10-21.snippet: Tracy Gray stays in the picture.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Pack your bags and travel the world with Tracy Gray. She knows how to have fun, but be warned: Any photo you're in will wind up on social media, so don’t forget to smile. Bonus points if you get photobombed by a squirrel.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Selfies

2017-10-21.abstract: A Mets fan who expressed his displeasure with a home run by the Yankees’ Todd Frazier in a September game against the Rays at Citi Field has become an unlikely celebrity.
2017-10-21.snippet: A Mets fan who expressed his displeasure with a home run by the Yankees’ Todd Frazier in a September game against the Rays at Citi Field has become an unlikely celebrity.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: In an age when people seek fame by making the most noise, Gary Dunaier found his without making a sound.
2017-10-21.headline_main: Things Are Looking Up for the Yankees’ Thumbs Down Guy

2017-10-21.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, October 22, 2017.
2017-10-21.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, October 22, 2017.
2017-10-21.lead_paragraph: “As players in the huddle, you’re all alone in the middle of the field but together at the same time. You see who is hurt, who’s tired or who’s spitting mad. You can take that all in, which can be powerful.”
2017-10-21.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: Fast Offenses Are Sacking the Huddle, Long a Part of N.F.L. Lore

2017-10-21.abstract: Six years after Pablo Neruda’s driver claimed the Nobel laureate was poisoned, forensic experts agree on one fact: His death certificate was wrong.
2017-10-21.snippet: Six years after Pablo Neruda’s driver claimed the Nobel laureate was poisoned, forensic experts agree on one fact: His death certificate was wrong.

2017-10-22.lead_paragraph: Q. I live in a co-op in Morningside Heights. My upstairs neighbors keep plants on their window ledges and fire escape. When they water them, the runoff streams down my windows and into my apartment if the windows are open. I politely asked them to water the plants inside, telling them that the co-op’s house rules prohibit personal items on window ledges or fire escapes. I also wrote a letter to the building’s managing agent and the board. But the problem continues. My neighbors are clearly in violation of building rules, but what about city rules?

The possibility of man to be good. The possibility of improving our surroundings and expressing ourselves. All of these things are collapsed together in my mind.”

2017-10-22.lead_paragraph: Eugene O’Neill’s soapy saga “Strange Interlude” was nearly six hours long when it opened on Broadway in 1928, and the audience got only one intermission, long enough for an unhurried dinner. After every act or two, the audience gets up and moves to a different set.

2017-10-22.lead_paragraph: As the daughter of an American diplomat and naval officer, Diana Hutchins Angulo enjoyed a seemingly idyllic childhood abroad, one full of state dinners and horseback-riding lessons and excursions to exotic-seeming markets and historical sites. Only when her mother started incorporating shrapnel into her interior decorating did the teenage Diana begin to fully appreciate that she had a front-row seat to a tumultuous upheaval in China, a period often forgotten in later years as Communism closed off the country.

2017-10-22.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — By the summer of 1938, President Franklin D. Roosevelt had had enough. His own party controlled both houses of Congress, yet the latest elements of his New Deal were stalled. Exasperated by fellow Democrats standing in the way, Roosevelt resolved to push some of them out of office.

2017-10-23.abstract: With the team carrying a carrying a core of highly talented, young players, it is not difficult to imagine a 28th World Series title in the near future.
2017-10-23.snippet: With the team carrying a carrying a core of highly talented, young players, it is not difficult to imagine a 28th World Series title in the near future.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: It has been years since the future of the Yankees has been as clear as it is now. A dynamic core of young talent, centered on the captivating Aaron Judge, is in place. Burdensome contracts — symbols of the checkbook strategy that the Yankees used to rely on to build contenders — are coming off the books.
2017-10-23.headline_main: The Yankees Have a Consolation Prize: The 2018 Season

2017-10-23.abstract: How many foreign entanglements will the public tolerate, and why is Congress AWOL from this debate?
2017-10-23.snippet: How many foreign entanglements will the public tolerate, and why is Congress AWOL from this debate?
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The United States has been at war continuously since the attacks of 9/11 and now has just over 240,000 active-duty and reserve troops in at least 172 countries and territories. While the number of men and women deployed overseas has shrunk considerably over the past 60 years, the military’s reach has not. American forces are actively engaged not only in the conflicts in Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria and Yemen that have dominated the news, but also in Niger and Somalia, both recently the scene of deadly attacks, as well as Jordan, Thailand and elsewhere.
2017-10-23.headline_main: America’s Forever Wars

2017-10-23.abstract: The light turned red. The cars in front of me began to stop. And I let my car take over.
2017-10-23.snippet: The light turned red. The cars in front of me began to stop. And I let my car take over.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: On my fourth day in a semi-driverless car, I finally felt comfortable enough to let it stop itself. Before then, I’d allowed the car — a Volvo S90 sedan — to steer around gentle turns, with my hands still on the wheel, and to adjust speed in traffic. By Day 4, I was ready to make a leap into the future.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Driverless Cars Made Me Nervous. Then I Tried One.

So it’s no wonder his latest thriller, “The Commuter” (due in January) debuted its new trailer during Fox’s N.F.L. coverage on Sunday.

2017-10-23.abstract: Trump attacks women and minorities on a personal and policy level.
2017-10-23.snippet: Trump attacks women and minorities on a personal and policy level.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump has a particular taste for the degradation of racial, ethnic and religious minorities and women — and God forbid those identities should overlap — as a way of playing out his personal sense of racial, sexist, and patriarchal entitlement. And as he degrades, he plays to those very same entitlements in the base that elected him.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Trump’s Boogeymen? Women!

2017-10-23.abstract: Expectations were high for Claire and Jamie’s reunion. So how did it go?
2017-10-23.snippet: Expectations were high for Claire and Jamie’s reunion. So how did it go?
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: In a show in which a single relationship is the crux of the story, every scene that puts the two main characters together carries weight. And since “Outlander” waited half a season — and 20 years in story time — to bring Jamie and Claire back together, our expectations were through the roof. The success of this episode depends almost entirely on how you feel about their reunion.
2017-10-23.headline_main: ‘Outlander’ Season 3, Episode 6: Time Doesn’t Matter

2017-10-23.abstract: We learn more about a beloved “Star Trek” character in this week’s clunky episode.
2017-10-23.snippet: We learn more about a beloved “Star Trek” character in this week’s clunky episode.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: With so many different casts, episodes, shows, movies and novels over the course of several decades, when it comes to “Star Trek,” there are bound to be violations of canon and plot holes that viewers just have to live with. Some are flagrant (The Enterprise being inexplicably kept from the Earth battle in “First Contact”) and others less so (Geordi La Forge saying Romulan ale is illegal in “Nemesis,” even though in “Deep Space Nine,” an admiral says this is no longer the case.)
2017-10-23.headline_main: ‘Star Trek: Discovery’ Season 1, Episode 6: What’s Up With Sarek?

2017-10-23.abstract: Times Square is changing. But everyone still wants a cut.
2017-10-23.snippet: Times Square is changing. But everyone still wants a cut.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The world of a David Simon show always comes first. For all the detail invested in the particulars of his characters’ lives and in the stories that animate them, Simon insists foremost on revealing how they fit into the larger ecosystem. In that respect, his approach is analogous to that of the great documentary filmmaker Frederick Wiseman, who has spent half a century trying to understand human behavior within the context of systems and institutions — like a high school (“High School”), a mental ward (“Titicut Follies”) or, more recently, the New York Public Library (“Ex Libris”). In a Simon show, individual actions can have far-reaching consequences, especially when the decisions of the powerful bear down on the vulnerable.
2017-10-23.headline_main: ‘The Deuce’ Season 1, Episode 7: Adaptation

2017-10-23.abstract: The almost 800 gouache paintings of “Life? or Theater?”, a semi-autobiographical series by the Berlin-born Jewish artist, are being shown together for the first time, in Amsterdam.
2017-10-23.snippet: The almost 800 gouache paintings of “Life? or Theater?”, a semi-autobiographical series by the Berlin-born Jewish artist, are being shown together for the first time, in Amsterdam.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The details of Charlotte Salomon’s extraordinary life tend to overshadow her work. Often likened to Anne Frank, the Jewish artist was shaped by the Nazis’ rise to power and by a suppressed family history of suicide, before her life was cut short at Auschwitz in 1943. She has inspired plays, an opera, a movie and an award-winning French novel, and is the subject of a forthcoming animated film.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Tragedy and the Will to Live: The Obsessive Art of Charlotte Salomon

2017-10-23.abstract: Alexandra Rose Howland documented a community of internally displaced Abkhazians who made their home inside an abandoned hospital.
2017-10-23.snippet: Alexandra Rose Howland documented a community of internally displaced Abkhazians who made their home inside an abandoned hospital.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The hospital, a cardiology institute in Abkhazia, shut down when the Soviet Union broke up in 1991. The following year, war made it a refuge. From 1992 to 1993, Russian-backed Abkhaz rebels pushed out Georgian troops in a proxy war, several dozen people squatted there, like countless others who were forced to flee their homes on the Black Sea’s east coast.
2017-10-23.headline_main: After Fleeing War, They Made an Abandoned Hospital Their Home

2017-10-23.abstract: Protesters who shut down speech mimic the actions of those they say they oppose.
2017-10-23.snippet: Protesters who shut down speech mimic the actions of those they say they oppose.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: This month, a handful of student protesters at the University of Oregon blocked me from delivering my state-of-the-university speech, one of my jobs as president. I had planned to announce a $50 million gift that would fund several new programs. I ended up posting a recorded version of the speech online.
2017-10-23.headline_main: The Misguided Student Crusade Against ‘Fascism’

2017-10-23.abstract: We can’t eliminate storms and high winds. But we can modernize the electric grid, save on fossil fuels and reduce emissions of greenhouse gases.
2017-10-23.snippet: We can’t eliminate storms and high winds. But we can modernize the electric grid, save on fossil fuels and reduce emissions of greenhouse gases.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: More than a month after Hurricane Maria devastated Puerto Rico, nearly 80 percent of the island remains without power, and food and water can be tough to find. As we rally to help the survivors and look to rebuild, we owe it to the victims there and in hurricane-ravaged Texas, Florida and elsewhere in the Caribbean to build more resilient infrastructure and prevent and reduce such destruction.
2017-10-23.headline_main: How to Keep the Lights On After a Hurricane

2017-10-23.abstract: The Communist leader held a lifelong contradiction in his attitudes toward revolution and state power.
2017-10-23.snippet: The Communist leader held a lifelong contradiction in his attitudes toward revolution and state power.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Toward the end of his life, dying of Lou Gehrig’s disease, Mao Zedong claimed two achievements: leading the Communist revolution to victory and starting the Cultural Revolution. By pinpointing these episodes, he had underlined the lifelong contradiction in his attitudes toward revolution and state power.
2017-10-23.headline_main: How Mao Molded Communism to Create a New China

2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Four months after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo announced a state of emergency on the New York City subway and three months after the Metropolitan Transportation Authority instituted an $836 million rescue plan, transit officials said they have slashed the time it takes to respond to emergencies, reducing the average 45-minute response time by about half with an eventual goal of driving that figure down to 15 minutes.

2017-10-23.snippet: Hurricane Harvey caused flooding in the theater district, so other venues will be used for performances. Museums, restaurants and festivals are also back.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The floodwaters have receded, the temporary shelters have cleared out and Houston has largely returned to normal since Hurricane Harvey dumped up to 51 inches of rain on the city in late August, destroying approximately 135,000 homes and killing 49 people. Today, a drive around the city reveals few signs of the catastrophic rainfall that turned highways into rivers and reservoirs into neighborhood-devouring lakes.

2017-10-23.snippet: Now made public, the government’s surveillance video strongly suggests the agency’s account of a raid in Honduras, where four civilians died, was not accurate.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Drug Enforcement Administration has for five years steadfastly defended the behavior of its agents in a late-night drug seizure carried out with Honduran forces on the remote Mosquito Coast, a mission that resulted in the deaths of four Honduran civilians.
2017-10-23.headline_main: D.E.A. Says Hondurans Opened Fire During a Drug Raid. A Video Suggests Otherwise.

2017-10-23.abstract: Columbia County, a quiet part of upstate New York, has emerged as a 21st-century haven — and a reminder of the ongoing relevance of the queer community.
2017-10-23.snippet: Columbia County, a quiet part of upstate New York, has emerged as a 21st-century haven — and a reminder of the ongoing relevance of the queer community.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: COLUMBIA COUNTY, N.Y., a two-hour drive north from Manhattan, is a bucolic vision of rural America — lush rolling farmland, cow-dotted hillsides, stalwart red barns. The Hudson River School artists of the mid-19th century captured the visual splendor of the region, including the English-born painter Thomas Cole, who first encountered upstate New York in 1825 and once remarked that “the Hudson for natural magnificence is unsurpassed.” Though primarily agricultural, the area has long attracted gentlemen farmers: Over the years, various Livingstons, Rockefellers and Roosevelts have made homes here.
2017-10-23.headline_main: The Place Beyond the Fire Island Pines

2017-10-23.snippet: New York’s transit system is replacing the MetroCard with a technology that can accommodate cellphones and certain kinds of credit or debit cards.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: First there were little paper tickets that cost a nickel. Then there was the nickel itself, because until just after World War II, a nickel was the only thing that made subway turnstiles go around. Then came the dime, followed by the token — the singular currency of New York City. And, since the 1990s, there has been the MetroCard, recognizable, bendable, losable and not always reliable.
2017-10-23.headline_main: New York to Replace MetroCard With Modern Way to Pay Transit Fares

2017-10-23.abstract: A look back at our Emmy-winning audiovisual investigation into last year’s deadly mass shooting in Las Vegas.
2017-10-23.snippet: A look back at our Emmy-winning audiovisual investigation into last year’s deadly mass shooting in Las Vegas.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Nearly a month has passed since Stephen Paddock opened fire on a country music festival at the Mandalay Bay Resort and Casino in Las Vegas, killing 58 people and wounding hundreds more — yet the shooting continues to confound the public and investigators alike. Little is known about Mr. Paddock’s motives. And investigators have revised parts of the timeline of the shooting on three occasions, raising further questions about what exactly happened.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Reporting on Las Vegas, Pixel by Pixel

2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — On a quiet, expensive Beirut street, the dog walkers began to appear. It was precisely that moment in a Mediterranean evening when the light turns golden and the bougainvillea blossoms seem to glow from within. The lengthening shadows magnified a series of lumps on the sidewalk, like cairns marking a mountain trail.
2017-10-23.headline_main: A Legacy of Lebanon’s War: ‘Land Mines’ Left by Beirut’s Dogs

2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Daniel Day-Lewis has always been unpredictable, and he may have delivered his biggest surprise yet when he announced in June that he would retire from acting after reteaming with his “There Will Be Blood” director, Paul Thomas Anderson, on one final film, “Phantom Thread.” The trailer for the movie has just been released, and it looks to be a portrait of an artist as intense and focused as the man who plays him.
