2017-10-23.snippet: Several players on the 49ers continue to kneel for the anthem. None of the Cowboys do, illustrating the divide in the league and the country.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: SANTA CLARA, Calif. — The Civil Rights movement had Selma as a touchstone; the gay rights uprising took flight at the Stonewall Inn; and the N.F.L players’ campaign for social justice on Sunday had Levi’s Stadium as its epicenter. It was here last year that Colin Kaepernick took a knee during the playing of the national anthem in protest of racial oppression after several police shootings of black Americans.

2017-10-23.snippet: In a startling experimental procedure, doctors lift the uterus from a pregnant woman and operate on a fetus with miniature instruments.

2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: DATU SALIBO, Philippines — The leader of the Islamic State in the Philippines, Isnilon Hapilon, is dead. The city his forces seized, Marawi, on the island of Mindanao, is all but completely back in government hands after months of scorched-earth combat.
2017-10-23.headline_main: ISIS Threat in Philippines Spreads in Remote Battles

2017-10-23.abstract: As a Manhattan therapist, Alison Fraser may seem composed. But when she tells her story, Aaron Mark’s ghoulish monologue earns its title.
2017-10-23.snippet: As a Manhattan therapist, Alison Fraser may seem composed. But when she tells her story, Aaron Mark’s ghoulish monologue earns its title.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The playwright and director Aaron Mark likes to tell creepy stories in the dark, or as close as he can get to it. Two seasons ago, when Daphne Rubin-Vega played a woman with a grisly past in Mr. Mark’s monologue “Empanada Loca,” the glow of a trash-can fire illuminated the gloom. “Squeamish,” his ghoulish new play starring Alison Fraser, is also a one-woman affair. Presented by All for One Theater in the Beckett Theater at Theater Row, it, too, is cloaked in an unusually enveloping blackness.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Review: In ‘Squeamish,’ It’s the Therapist Who’s Troubled

2017-10-23.abstract: I had reached out on Facebook to a dozen of the plant’s steelworkers who had agreed to train their replacements from Mexico. Shannon was the one who wrote me back that same day.
2017-10-23.snippet: I had reached out on Facebook to a dozen of the plant’s steelworkers who had agreed to train their replacements from Mexico. Shannon was the one who wrote me back that same day.

2017-10-23.abstract: The inquiry by Eric T. Schneiderman is examining whether allegations of sexual misconduct against Harvey Weinstein reflect broader civil rights violations.
2017-10-23.snippet: The inquiry by Eric T. Schneiderman is examining whether allegations of sexual misconduct against Harvey Weinstein reflect broader civil rights violations.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The New York attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, has opened an inquiry into the Weinstein Company examining whether allegations of sexual misconduct and harassment against its co-founder Harvey Weinstein reflect broad gender discrimination and other civil rights violations.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Weinstein Company Faces Civil Rights Inquiry by New York Attorney General

2017-10-23.abstract: The city has passed a law designed to protect pedestrians staring at their smartphones from themselves. But critics say engineering and redesigning streets would be more effective.
2017-10-23.snippet: The city has passed a law designed to protect pedestrians staring at their smartphones from themselves. But critics say engineering and redesigning streets would be more effective.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: You see them everywhere: people walking with their eyes glued to their mobile phone screens on busy streets. But walking and texting can be dangerous — and cities in the United States and Europe have begun to do something about it.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Reading This While Walking? In Honolulu, It Could Cost You

2017-10-23.abstract: Its home is closed for the season, recovering from Hurricane Harvey. But Houston Grand Opera opened its “La Traviata” in a makeshift auditorium.
2017-10-23.snippet: Its home is closed for the season, recovering from Hurricane Harvey. But Houston Grand Opera opened its “La Traviata” in a makeshift auditorium.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — The big sets had to be jettisoned. The shadow-play in the production was overhauled. The conductor was forced to lead with her back to the singers. But the show went on.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Forced Out By Flooding, Houston’s Opera Gets On With the Show

2017-10-23.abstract: Two health scares, her own and her grandmother’s, sidelined Zoe Morris. Now she’s searching for a job, an integral part of feeling whole again.
2017-10-23.snippet: Two health scares, her own and her grandmother’s, sidelined Zoe Morris. Now she’s searching for a job, an integral part of feeling whole again.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Several months after a debilitating stroke nearly 30 years ago, Zoe Morris ventured outside for the first time. The sidewalks were teeming with impatient pedestrians, and Ms. Morris suddenly found New York City’s familiar streets overwhelming.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Decades After a Stroke, Seeking Independence and Normalcy

2017-10-23.abstract: Lt. Gov. Kim Guadagno emerged from the Republican primary as a moderate. But recent comments and an ad on undocumented immigrants have signaled a more conservative shift.
2017-10-23.snippet: Lt. Gov. Kim Guadagno emerged from the Republican primary as a moderate. But recent comments and an ad on undocumented immigrants have signaled a more conservative shift.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: She launched her campaign for governor at a Mexican restaurant. Her running mate is a Cuban immigrant. And it was not too long ago that she supported a pathway to citizenship for undocumented immigrants.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Guadagno Takes Right Turn on Immigration in Waning Days of Campaign

2017-10-23.abstract: An ice chamber inside this container from David’s Tea chills tea right after brewing.
2017-10-23.snippet: An ice chamber inside this container from David’s Tea chills tea right after brewing.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Making tea, not just coffee, puts a press pot to good use. The Tea Press, a portable drink bottle, works something like a press pot. Put tea leaves in the bottom, add water that is just shy of boiling temperature (best for most teas) to the proper fill line, press and you have hot tea. A removable inner sleeve can be filled with ice to quickly chill the tea. The bottle is insulated to maintain the tea’s temperature and comes in five colors: Tea Press, $35, davidstea.com.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Drink Bottle Brews Tea on the Go

2017-10-23.abstract: The former F.B.I. director re-emerges on Twitter with some pensive pictures during a trip to Iowa.
2017-10-23.snippet: The former F.B.I. director re-emerges on Twitter with some pensive pictures during a trip to Iowa.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, emerged from seclusion in recent days, appearing pensive and contemplative on a rural Iowa road and in a cornfield, based on photographs posted on his Twitter account.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Comey, on Twitter, Contemplates Iowa’s Landscape, Serenity and Sunsets

2017-10-23.abstract: Hemlock Hill Farm in Cortlandt, N.Y., now operates a farm store with produce, meats and preserves.
2017-10-23.snippet: Hemlock Hill Farm in Cortlandt, N.Y., now operates a farm store with produce, meats and preserves.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The farm store at Hemlock Hill Farm, a 120-acre property in northern Westchester County, has been renovated, making it an excellent stop on a fall weekend en route to the Hudson Valley. Most of the produce sold here is grown on the farm — operated by the same family since 1939 — and the shop also sells meat and poultry, butchered and ready to cook, including grass-fed tri-tip Black Angus steaks. Artisanal products, including their own — like pickles, preserves, honeys, granola and dairy items — line the shelves and refrigerated cases. A food truck sells prepared breakfast and lunch dishes Thursdays to Saturdays: Hemlock Hill Farm, 500 Croton Avenue (Maple Avenue), Cortlandt, N.Y., 914-737-2810, hemlockhillfarm.com.
2017-10-23.headline_main: A Produce Stop for Weekend Excursions Upstate

2017-10-23.abstract: A star-studded tribute to the pianist Geri Allen and a showcase of young British jazz musicians will be part of this annual showcase, on Jan. 10-17.
2017-10-23.snippet: A star-studded tribute to the pianist Geri Allen and a showcase of young British jazz musicians will be part of this annual showcase, on Jan. 10-17.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The NYC Winter Jazzfest’s 2018 edition will feature a star-studded tribute to the pianist Geri Allen, a showcase of young British jazz musicians hosted by the D.J. Gilles Peterson, and a concert pairing the indie-rock band Deerhoof with the free-jazz trumpeter Wadada Leo Smith, organizers announced Monday.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Winter Jazzfest Announces a Slightly Less Sprawling 2018 Lineup

2017-10-23.abstract: “The Knish War on Rivington Street” is an illustrated book that tells the story of two rival knish sellers on the Lower East Side.
2017-10-23.snippet: “The Knish War on Rivington Street” is an illustrated book that tells the story of two rival knish sellers on the Lower East Side.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: For the best effect, an adult should read “The Knish War on Rivington Street” to a child. The book, about an actual New York event more than 100 years ago, tells how an immigrant family sold Mama’s knishes from a pushcart on the Lower East Side, and then opened the first knish store on Rivington Street. A rival store came along, a price war ensued and the owners of each added gimmicks to attract customers. The mayor came and could not decide between the baked round knishes of one store or the square fried ones at the other. The rivals made peace, and Rivington Street was named the knish capital of the world. The book includes recipes: “The Knish War on Rivington Street,” by Joanne Oppenheim with pictures by Jon Davis (Albert Whitman, $16.99).
2017-10-23.headline_main: Children’s Book Details the Knish War of 1916

2017-10-23.abstract: Nato Thompson will move from Creative Time, where he has spent 10 years, to the new institution in Philadelphia.
2017-10-23.snippet: Nato Thompson will move from Creative Time, where he has spent 10 years, to the new institution in Philadelphia.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The fledging art institution Philadelphia Contemporary may not yet have a home, but it now has an artistic director: Nato Thompson, currently the artistic director Creative Time. Mr. Thompson, who has been with Creative Time for a decade, will assume his new position in November, and aim to guide the institution as it moves from pop-up projects into a permanent building in Philadelphia.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Philadelphia Contemporary Hires Artistic Director From Creative Time

2017-10-23.abstract: The singer’s new album debuted at the top of the Billboard album chart with the most impressive sales since Drake’s “Views” a year and a half ago.
2017-10-23.snippet: The singer’s new album debuted at the top of the Billboard album chart with the most impressive sales since Drake’s “Views” a year and a half ago.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Pink, the no-nonsense singer who for nearly two decades has made a career of being a pop outsider on top of the charts, has done it again.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Pink’s ‘Beautiful Trauma’ Is No. 1 With Big Sales in a Streaming World

2017-10-23.abstract: The biographer Joe Hagan understands why a rock magazine editor matters to the history of the 20th century.
2017-10-23.snippet: The biographer Joe Hagan understands why a rock magazine editor matters to the history of the 20th century.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: After a career spent editing zeitgeist-tilting writers like Hunter S. Thompson and Tom Wolfe, tapping the journalist Joe Hagan to write his biography “was essentially Jann Wenner’s last great assignment,” Hagan observes in an afterword to “Sticky Fingers: The Life and Times of Jann Wenner and Rolling Stone Magazine,” and “there was no way in hell I was going to screw it up.”
2017-10-23.headline_main: ‘Sticky Fingers’ Captures Rolling Stone’s Jann Wenner and the Culture He Helped Create

2017-10-23.abstract: Will Shortz reports on the results of the 2017 World Puzzle Championship.
2017-10-23.snippet: Will Shortz reports on the results of the 2017 World Puzzle Championship.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: SPECIAL POST — A team from Japan won the 26th World Puzzle Championship, which ended Saturday in Bangalore, India. The U.S.A. and Germany finished second and third.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Japan Wins World Puzzle Championship, U.S.A. Takes Second

2017-10-23.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2017-10-23.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

2017-10-23.headline_main: Rohingya, Marawi, Xi Jinping: Your Tuesday Briefing

2017-10-23.abstract: Washington imposes travel restrictions on Myanmar’s military leaders and threatens sanctions against those responsible for atrocities in Rakhine State.
2017-10-23.snippet: Washington imposes travel restrictions on Myanmar’s military leaders and threatens sanctions against those responsible for atrocities in Rakhine State.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration threatened on Monday to take punitive actions against Myanmar unless it pulls back from its violent military campaign against Rohingya Muslims, expressing what it called “our gravest concern” over a crisis that has killed or displaced hundreds of thousands of people.
2017-10-23.headline_main: U.S. Threatens to Punish Myanmar Over Treatment of Rohingya

2017-10-23.abstract: Do you have regrettable family holiday photos? We’d love to see them.
2017-10-23.snippet: Do you have regrettable family holiday photos? We’d love to see them.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: For an article with advice about family holiday photo shoots, we’d love to see your holiday photos that didn’t go exactly as planned.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Send Us Your Holiday Photo Fails

2017-10-23.abstract: With Glenn Beck at his side, the former Fox News personality says, ‘I never had any problem with Megyn Kelly.’
2017-10-23.snippet: With Glenn Beck at his side, the former Fox News personality says, ‘I never had any problem with Megyn Kelly.’
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Bill O’Reilly struck back at Megyn Kelly on Monday morning, hours after she had expressed shock over the details of a reported sexual harassment settlement involving him, saying that it was “just incomprehensible” that she would attack him.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Bill O’Reilly Goes on the Counterattack Against Megyn Kelly

2017-10-23.abstract: Five hundred canines stepped out in full costume for the 27th annual Tompkins Square Halloween Dog Parade.
2017-10-23.snippet: Five hundred canines stepped out in full costume for the 27th annual Tompkins Square Halloween Dog Parade.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Halloween in New York is terrifying. Haunted houses pop up throughout the five boroughs, subway cars swell with all kinds of characters and, scariest of all, interminable lines for parties snake around city blocks.
2017-10-23.headline_main: All the Good Pups at the Halloween Dog Parade

2017-10-23.abstract: The seedy gluten-free crumble from the popular San Francisco restaurant doubles as a topping for salads and yogurt.
2017-10-23.snippet: The seedy gluten-free crumble from the popular San Francisco restaurant doubles as a topping for salads and yogurt.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Render is a new company that collaborates with chefs on food products. Its first, State Bird Seed, is a crumble made with the guidance of Stuart Brioza and Nicole Krasinski, the chefs and owners of State Bird Provisions in San Francisco. A mixture of seeds with puffed quinoa and seasonings comes in small pieces to use as toppings for salads, yogurt, eggs, pasta or anything that needs some crunch. It goes without saying that the cook is likely to succumb to snacking along the way. There is a sea salt variety, one with almonds and rosemary, and another with seaweed: State Bird Seed, $28 for six 3.5-ounce packages, renderfood.com.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Savory Snacks From State Bird Provisions

2017-10-23.abstract: A reader objects to the White House press secretary’s comment that it was “inappropriate” to doubt the word of a four-star general.
2017-10-23.snippet: A reader objects to the White House press secretary’s comment that it was “inappropriate” to doubt the word of a four-star general.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-10-23.headline_main: Don’t Question John Kelly?

2017-10-23.abstract: Cornell University has digitized many of the cards from the collection of the founder of Kitchen Arts and Letters.
2017-10-23.snippet: Cornell University has digitized many of the cards from the collection of the founder of Kitchen Arts and Letters.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Over the years, Nach Waxman, the founder of Kitchen Arts and Letters bookstore on the Upper East Side, collected illustrated trade cards, as some covet baseball cards. These little fliers from about 1870 to 1900 advertised food and other products. Mr. Waxman donated around 6,500 cards to his alma mater, Cornell University, which is presenting some of them in an online exhibition. They offer a worthwhile glimpse at everything from hairdos to baking to recreation, reflecting the fashions of those times: Trade Cards: An Illustrated History, Cornell University Library Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, http://rmc.library.cornell.edu.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Online Exhibition of 19th Century Trade Cards

2017-10-23.abstract: With sinking quarterly earnings and rising pressure on its stock, General Electric, the last surviving original member of the Dow, risks being pushed out.
2017-10-23.snippet: With sinking quarterly earnings and rising pressure on its stock, General Electric, the last surviving original member of the Dow, risks being pushed out.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: General Electric’s quarterly earnings, so bad that even the new chief executive, John Flannery, called them “horrible,” have put fresh pressure on a stock that’s down more than 25 percent this year. The performance threatens to add insult to injury. The last surviving original member of the Dow Jones industrial average risks being excluded from the benchmark.
2017-10-23.headline_main: The Dow Jones Without G.E.? It’s Possible

2017-10-23.abstract: The New Orleans restaurateur will leave his company after an investigation revealed reports from 25 women of sexual harassment there.
2017-10-23.snippet: The New Orleans restaurateur will leave his company after an investigation revealed reports from 25 women of sexual harassment there.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: John Besh, the high-profile New Orleans restaurateur, is stepping down from the company he founded and co-owns after more than two dozen female employees reported facing sexual harassment there.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Chef John Besh Steps Down Amid Sexual Harassment Scandal

2017-10-23.abstract: Readers condemn the agency’s refusal to let its scientists speak at a climate conference and how industry insiders are shaping policy.
2017-10-23.snippet: Readers condemn the agency’s refusal to let its scientists speak at a climate conference and how industry insiders are shaping policy.

2017-10-23.headline_main: The E.P.A. vs. the Environment

2017-10-23.abstract: Conncullin Irish Gin is less austere than its London dry counterparts.
2017-10-23.snippet: Conncullin Irish Gin is less austere than its London dry counterparts.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Many years ago I took a liking to an Irish gin, Cork Dry Gin, because it was less austere than the typical London dry style. But it was not exported to the United States; the couple of bottles I bought in Ireland eventually ran out, so I moved on. Now a new Irish gin, Conncullin, named for Loch Conn and Loch Cullin, and made by Connacht Whiskey in County Mayo, has hit the market. It, too, conveys a softer expression of gin, despite being 94 proof. The gin is more floral than herbal, and lovely to savor on the rocks with a splash of lime: Conncullin Irish Gin, $29.99, Park Avenue Liquor Shop, 270 Madison Avenue (East 39th Street), 212-685-2442, parkaveliquor.com.
2017-10-23.headline_main: A Softer Gin From the Emerald Isle

2017-10-23.abstract: Officials warn that Hurricane Maria’s effects on manufacturing on the island may be long-lasting.
2017-10-23.snippet: Officials warn that Hurricane Maria’s effects on manufacturing on the island may be long-lasting.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: One of the workhorses of Clarke County Hospital, a 25-bed facility in rural Osceola, Iowa, is an unassuming product known as a Mini-Bag.
2017-10-23.headline_main: U.S. Hospitals Wrestle With Shortages of Drug Supplies Made in Puerto Rico

2017-10-23.abstract: Buying wine from a retailer out of state used to be easy, but a recent crackdown on interstate shipping is leaving wine lovers with fewer options.
2017-10-23.snippet: Buying wine from a retailer out of state used to be easy, but a recent crackdown on interstate shipping is leaving wine lovers with fewer options.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: For a golden moment, motivated wine lovers could rely on high-speed internet as a sort of national wine shop. A consumer in Little Rock, Ark., for example, unable to find particular bottles locally, could order them from a shop in New York. It required only a willingness to pay shipping costs.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Wines Are No Longer Free to Travel Across State Lines

2017-10-23.abstract: A soldier was held captive for five years by the Taliban, and Army investigators recommended against jailing him. Now he faces life in prison.
2017-10-23.snippet: A soldier was held captive for five years by the Taliban, and Army investigators recommended against jailing him. Now he faces life in prison.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: FORT BRAGG, N.C. — At his first major court hearing two years ago, it seemed that Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl had caught a break: The Pentagon’s hostage debriefer, Terrence Russell, testified that the sergeant had “done the best job he could do” during the five years he was held by the Taliban, resisting his captors and attempting escape despite suffering the worst prisoner-of-war abuse since Vietnam.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl’s Odd Journey From Victim to Criminal

2017-10-23.abstract: The decisions came in two cases against Johnson & Johnson, in which women claimed they developed ovarian cancer after using baby powder for years.
2017-10-23.snippet: The decisions came in two cases against Johnson & Johnson, in which women claimed they developed ovarian cancer after using baby powder for years.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: In back-to-back victories for Johnson & Johnson, the courts have reversed two judgments against the consumer products giant totaling nearly $500 million. The money had been awarded to women who said that they developed ovarian cancer after using the company’s talcum powder for decades.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Courts Reverse Johnson’s Baby Powder Judgments for Nearly $500 Million

2017-10-23.abstract: Gun shows in a state with weak gun restrictions increase the short-term risk for firearm-related injuries, a new analysis has found.
2017-10-23.snippet: Gun shows in a state with weak gun restrictions increase the short-term risk for firearm-related injuries, a new analysis has found.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Gun shows in a state with weak gun restrictions increase the short-term risk for firearm-related injuries, a new analysis has found.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Stricter Gun Laws Tied to Fewer Firearm Injuries After Gun Shows

2017-10-23.abstract: The bidders came from 43 U.S. states, as well as Canada and Mexico. Amazon says the project will create 50,000 jobs, and that the winner will be announced next year.
2017-10-23.snippet: The bidders came from 43 U.S. states, as well as Canada and Mexico. Amazon says the project will create 50,000 jobs, and that the winner will be announced next year.

2017-10-23.abstract: Cutting taxes isn’t hard. Paying for them is. Republicans are running into a math problem as they try to change longstanding tax preferences in their $1.5 trillion tax rewrite.
2017-10-23.snippet: Cutting taxes isn’t hard. Paying for them is. Republicans are running into a math problem as they try to change longstanding tax preferences in their $1.5 trillion tax rewrite.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Republicans are unfailingly passionate about cutting taxes, but as they look to craft the most sweeping tax code rewrite in 31 years, one question reliably dampens their enthusiasm: how to pay for the cuts.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Tax Cuts Are Coming. So Are the Fights About Paying for Them.

2017-10-23.abstract: John Skipper, ESPN’s president, cut ties with the controversial media outlet after realizing he could not separate his company from Barstool’s toxic reputation.
2017-10-23.snippet: John Skipper, ESPN’s president, cut ties with the controversial media outlet after realizing he could not separate his company from Barstool’s toxic reputation.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: ESPN abruptly canceled a 10-day-old partnership with the controversial sports media outlet Barstool Sports on Monday, apparently after ESPN’s president realized he could not separate his company from Barstool’s toxic reputation.
2017-10-23.headline_main: ESPN Cancels Barstool Sports Partnership After One Episode

2017-10-23.abstract: Along with cows, sheep and even snails as livestock returns to eastern Long Island farms.
2017-10-23.snippet: Along with cows, sheep and even snails as livestock returns to eastern Long Island farms.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The latest newcomers to flock to Eastern Long Island’s North Fork, between Riverhead and Greenport, are not seeking some cutting-edge new vacation spot. They’re year-rounders: grazing sheep, goats and herds of cattle. And they’re changing the character of the area’s farms.
2017-10-23.headline_main: The Chickens Come Home to Roost on Long Island’s North Fork

2017-10-23.abstract: Starting late next month, electronic cigarettes will be banned from indoor public spaces like bars, restaurants and offices in New York State.
2017-10-23.snippet: Starting late next month, electronic cigarettes will be banned from indoor public spaces like bars, restaurants and offices in New York State.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Electronic cigarettes, the popular vapor substitute to traditional tobacco cigarettes, will soon be banned from public indoor spaces in New York State — just like the real thing.
2017-10-23.headline_main: New York State Bans Vaping Anywhere Cigarettes Are Prohibited

2017-10-23.abstract: A team of scientists matched stone in statues and religious icons to a quarry in the French Alps, reconstructing a medieval European art trade route.
2017-10-23.snippet: A team of scientists matched stone in statues and religious icons to a quarry in the French Alps, reconstructing a medieval European art trade route.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Medieval and Renaissance sculptors carved gorgeous statues and religious icons from alabaster, a soft, creamy white stone similar to marble. Much of their work, from visages of the Virgin Mary to angels slaying demons, now reside in museums like the Louvre in Paris and others across Europe. But a mystery remains: Where did the alabaster come from?
2017-10-23.headline_main: Uncovering an Overlooked Source for Iconic Alabaster Statues

2017-10-23.abstract: After a quick visit to Afghanistan the secretary of state arrives in Baghdad, seeking to ease tensions with the Kurds and to isolate Iran.
2017-10-23.snippet: After a quick visit to Afghanistan the secretary of state arrives in Baghdad, seeking to ease tensions with the Kurds and to isolate Iran.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson slipped into Iraq Monday night after having spent the morning in Afghanistan, but his welcome in Baghdad was far less effusive as the Trump administration pushes to isolate Iran, an important Iraqi ally.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Tillerson Visits Iraq to Chilly Reception Over His Remarks on Iran-Backed Militias

2017-10-23.abstract: An apparent mass killing is the latest example of the brutal reprisals that have taken place when territory changes hands in Syria’s multisided war.
2017-10-23.snippet: An apparent mass killing is the latest example of the brutal reprisals that have taken place when territory changes hands in Syria’s multisided war.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — As pro-government troops drove Islamic State fighters from a central Syrian town over the weekend, the retreating militants killed scores of civilians, dumping some bodies into wells and leaving others in the street, local residents and the Syrian state-run news media said on Monday.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Scores of Bodies Are Found in Syrian Town After ISIS Retreats

2017-10-23.abstract: At 17, he was called a ringleader in the 1986 assault by whites in Queens that left a black man dead and another badly beaten. The family said he committed suicide.

2017-10-23.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

2017-10-23.abstract: There is Curtis Granderson, wearing Carl Furillo’s No. 6. There is Clayton Kershaw wearing No. 22, the number Johnny Podres wore in Los Angeles. In this Series, the old Bums live on, at least in some minds.
2017-10-23.snippet: There is Curtis Granderson, wearing Carl Furillo’s No. 6. There is Clayton Kershaw wearing No. 22, the number Johnny Podres wore in Los Angeles. In this Series, the old Bums live on, at least in some minds.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: The home uniforms remind me of my tormented youth — blue and red trim, “Dodgers” written in script at an angle across the front.
2017-10-23.headline_main: My Field of Memories: I See the New Dodgers and Summon the Old

2017-10-23.abstract: Researchers who documented a head-size reduction of as much as 20 percent say it may be a survival strategy to reduce energy use in the colder months.
2017-10-23.snippet: Researchers who documented a head-size reduction of as much as 20 percent say it may be a survival strategy to reduce energy use in the colder months.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Bad news, bears. Hibernation is no longer the coolest thing animals do to survive the winter.
2017-10-23.headline_main: As Winter Sets In, Tiny Shrews Shrink Their Skulls and Brains

2017-10-23.abstract: Join us on Oct. 25 for a conversation with Julie Davis and Jennifer Steinhauer, two New York Times journalists.
2017-10-23.snippet: Join us on Oct. 25 for a conversation with Julie Davis and Jennifer Steinhauer, two New York Times journalists.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Welcome to Times Insider Events — live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Live Event: A Conversation Among Women in a Post-Weinstein World

2017-10-23.abstract: Republicans are worried that President Trump’s musings could doom their best chance for a sweeping tax rewrite.
2017-10-23.snippet: Republicans are worried that President Trump’s musings could doom their best chance for a sweeping tax rewrite.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Monday that he would oppose any effort to reduce the amount of pretax income that American workers can save in 401(k) retirement accounts, effectively killing an idea that Republicans were mulling as a way to help pay for a $1.5 trillion tax cut.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Cutting Taxes Is Hard. Trump Is Making It Harder.

2017-10-23.abstract: A former State Department official said Senator Robert Menendez, on trial for corruption, did not specifically intervene on behalf of a company owned by a co-defendant.
2017-10-23.snippet: A former State Department official said Senator Robert Menendez, on trial for corruption, did not specifically intervene on behalf of a company owned by a co-defendant.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: NEWARK — A former United States ambassador told a jury in a federal courtroom here on Monday that Senator Robert Menendez had pressed him in broad terms about port security in the Dominican Republic, but that he had not specifically intervened on behalf of a security company that was owned in part by a wealthy friend.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Ambassador Says Menendez Did Not Intervene for Friend’s Company

2017-10-23.abstract: The state wanted to offer lower premiums in exchange for higher deductibles in a far-reaching effort to circumvent the federal law’s requirements.
2017-10-23.snippet: The state wanted to offer lower premiums in exchange for higher deductibles in a far-reaching effort to circumvent the federal law’s requirements.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With just over a week until the Affordable Care Act’s enrollment season begins, Gov. Kim Reynolds of Iowa said Monday that she had withdrawn the state’s request to opt out of the law’s insurance marketplace next year by offering customers a single plan with lower premiums and a high deductible.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Iowa Withdraws Request to Leave Obamacare Market

2017-10-23.abstract: People who can’t admit error shouldn’t be making policy.
2017-10-23.snippet: People who can’t admit error shouldn’t be making policy.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Last week John Kelly, the White House chief of staff, tried to defend President Trump against charges that he was grossly insensitive to the widow of a U.S. soldier killed in action. In the process, Kelly accused Frederica Wilson, the member of Congress and friend of the soldier’s family who reported what Trump had said, of having behaved badly previously during the dedication of an F.B.I. building.
2017-10-23.headline_main: The Doctrine of Trumpal Infallibility

2017-10-23.abstract: The first lady’s visit to a Detroit suburb was meant to lend some attention to “No One Eats Alone” and to acknowledge the “Week of Inclusion.”
2017-10-23.snippet: The first lady’s visit to a Detroit suburb was meant to lend some attention to “No One Eats Alone” and to acknowledge the “Week of Inclusion.”
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: WEST BLOOMFIELD TOWNSHIP, Mich. — The first lady, Melania Trump, in another public indication that she may refocus on efforts related to an early promise to combat cyberbullying, visited a middle school here in this Detroit suburb on Monday, and, in between posing for selfies, urged students to treat one another with respect and kindness.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Melania Trump, in Michigan, Urges Middle Schoolers to ‘Choose Kindness’

2017-10-23.abstract: Vincent Boudreau was expected to be named the school’s president, but after a group of community leaders spoke of not being included in the search process, the decision was postponed.
2017-10-23.snippet: Vincent Boudreau was expected to be named the school’s president, but after a group of community leaders spoke of not being included in the search process, the decision was postponed.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: It’s not a done deal — yet.
2017-10-23.headline_main: City College Delays Appointing President After Leaders’ Criticism

2017-10-23.abstract: RT was early to embrace the video site. Now that relationship is drawing scrutiny as investigators look into Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election.
2017-10-23.snippet: RT was early to embrace the video site. Now that relationship is drawing scrutiny as investigators look into Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When the state-backed Russian news channel RT became the first news organization to surpass one billion views on YouTube in 2013, it marked the achievement with a retrospective of its most popular videos and a special guest — one of the Google-owned site’s senior executives.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Russia’s Favored Outlet Is an Online News Giant. YouTube Helped.

2017-10-23.abstract: There are better ways than shouting back.
2017-10-23.snippet: There are better ways than shouting back.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: I’ve had a series of experiences over the past two weeks that leave the impression that everybody on earth is having the same conversation: How do you engage with fanatics?
2017-10-23.headline_main: How to Engage a Fanatic

2017-10-23.abstract: A progressive megadonor wants more politicians to try to remove President Trump from office.
2017-10-23.snippet: A progressive megadonor wants more politicians to try to remove President Trump from office.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: Last week, Tom Steyer, the billionaire progressive donor, announced a $10 million campaign calling for President Trump’s impeachment, beginning with a television commercial running in all 50 states. Trump, the spot says, has “brought us to the brink of nuclear war, obstructed justice at the F.B.I., and in direct violation of the Constitution, he’s taken money from foreign governments and threatened to shut down news organizations that report the truth.” Appearing on screen, Steyer asks, “If that isn’t a case for impeaching and removing a dangerous president, then what has our government become?”
2017-10-23.headline_main: Democrats Should Embrace Impeachment

2017-10-23.abstract: President Mauricio Macri’s strong showing in midterm elections strengthens his hand to press forward with labor, pension and tax changes.
2017-10-23.snippet: President Mauricio Macri’s strong showing in midterm elections strengthens his hand to press forward with labor, pension and tax changes.
2017-10-23.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES — President Mauricio Macri of Argentina on Monday hailed his party’s strong showing in midterm elections as a mandate to press forward with a controversial package of labor, tax and pension reforms that he says will put the country on a path toward sustained economic growth.
2017-10-23.headline_main: Argentina’s President Says Election Gains Bolster His Reform Plan

2017-10-24.abstract: The Government Accountability Office says costs to the federal Treasury from climate change will continue to rise.
2017-10-24.snippet: The Government Accountability Office says costs to the federal Treasury from climate change will continue to rise.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Fires, floods and hurricanes are already costing the federal government tens of billions of dollars a year and climate change will drive those costs ever higher in coming years, a new federal study warns.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Congressional Auditor Urges Action to Address Climate Change

2017-10-24.abstract: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau banned clauses in the fine print of financial contracts. The Treasury said the agency didn’t adequately evaluate the impact.
2017-10-24.snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau banned clauses in the fine print of financial contracts. The Treasury said the agency didn’t adequately evaluate the impact.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: The Treasury Department took aim on Monday at a rule that would allow millions of Americans to band together in class action lawsuits against Wall Street firms, saying it could trigger frivolous lawsuits and drive up the cost of credit.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Treasury Faults Arbitration Rule Aimed at Protecting Consumers

2017-10-24.abstract: His rush to dismantle regulations and the agencies that enforce them will damage the economy — and the regular people he promised to protect.
2017-10-24.snippet: His rush to dismantle regulations and the agencies that enforce them will damage the economy — and the regular people he promised to protect.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: As a candidate, Donald Trump promised regular people, “I will be your voice,” and attacked the drug industry for “getting away with murder” in setting high prices for lifesaving medications. But as president, he has  declared war on regulatory programs protecting the health, safety and economic rights of consumers. He has done so in disregard of evidence that such protections help the economy and financial well-being of the working-class voters he claims to champion.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Ralph Nader: Trump’s Anti-Consumer Agenda Hurts His Voters

2017-10-24.abstract: The American people should demand to know whether the police are spying on them.
2017-10-24.snippet: The American people should demand to know whether the police are spying on them.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Board of Police Commissioners voted this month to allow the Police Department to use drones in a one-year pilot program. Whatever one thinks of this technology, the public debate about the issue and the vote by the board, a five-member civilian oversight group, was refreshing — but all too rare. Americans deserve transparency and detailed information about the surveillance tools the police are using or considering, and they’re often denied it.
2017-10-24.headline_main: When It Comes to Surveillance, Watch the Watchmen

2017-10-24.abstract: The kingdom is embarking on a big experiment as it diversifies its oil-based economy, and executives looking for investment are making their pitches.
2017-10-24.snippet: The kingdom is embarking on a big experiment as it diversifies its oil-based economy, and executives looking for investment are making their pitches.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia — Private jets ferrying business titans from all over the globe began landing Monday in this sand-swept Saudi capital.
2017-10-24.headline_main: In the Saudi Desert, World’s Business Leaders Follow the Money

2017-10-24.abstract: Of all people, he should have known how to handle a controversy with a Gold Star family, without making matters worse.
2017-10-24.snippet: Of all people, he should have known how to handle a controversy with a Gold Star family, without making matters worse.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: John Kelly, President Trump’s chief of staff, is grimly suited to addressing the family of a fallen service member. Mr. Kelly, a retired four-star general, is the highest-ranking officer to lose a child in Iraq or Afghanistan. His son Second Lt. Robert Kelly was killed in Afghanistan in 2010.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Honor the Truth, John Kelly

2017-10-24.abstract: A new federal rule limits how much customers can borrow and makes lenders determine whether the borrower can afford to pay off the loan.
2017-10-24.snippet: A new federal rule limits how much customers can borrow and makes lenders determine whether the borrower can afford to pay off the loan.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Since the federal Consumer Financial Protection Bureau opened its doors in 2011, the agency’s investigations and enforcement actions have returned more than $12 billion to auto buyers, homeowners, credit-card holders and other borrowers who were victimized by deceptive or predatory practices. Consumers who have been trapped in debt by the notorious payday lending industry will now get extra help from the bureau with a  rule imposed this month.
2017-10-24.headline_main: The Little Guys Win One on Payday Loans

2017-10-24.abstract: More than two years after Officer Brian Moore was fatally shot in Queens, his fellow officers relived what led to the shooting, and the frantic rush to save his life.
2017-10-24.snippet: More than two years after Officer Brian Moore was fatally shot in Queens, his fellow officers relived what led to the shooting, and the frantic rush to save his life.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: More than two years after the New York City police officer Brian Moore was fatally shot while on patrol in Queens, his fellow officers relived that night, as testimony began on Monday in the trial of the man prosecutors say killed him with two bullets to the head from a silver revolver.
2017-10-24.headline_main: In Trial, Officer Recalls Chaos of Shooting That Killed His Partner

2017-10-24.abstract: Modern Love is turning 13. To celebrate, we want to hear your love stories. Here’s the catch: You only get 13 words.

2017-10-24.abstract: This futurist play, starring Cristin Milioti, imagines a world in which reality (or the non-virtual kind) is in retreat.
2017-10-24.snippet: This futurist play, starring Cristin Milioti, imagines a world in which reality (or the non-virtual kind) is in retreat.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: His timing, you must admit, is inspired, and if his cylindrical silhouette means he lacks a matinee idol’s profile, he still has the presence of a Barrymore. In Zoe Kazan’s “After the Blast” — the slender play of weighty subjects that opened Monday night at Lincoln Center Theater — an android called Arthur hijacks the spotlight from the moment he first toddles across the stage.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Review: Romancing the Bot in Zoe Kazan’s ‘After the Blast’

2017-10-24.snippet: A riveting revival of Stephen Adly Guirgis’s prison drama may be more timely today than at its premiere in 2000.

Do constructors and editors really get together in secret, Oreo-fueled meetings to compare notes? Are repetitions committed deliberately, to send messages to puzzle solvers?
2017-10-24.headline_main: What a Sci-Fi Portal Might Lead To

Alone in the scorching sun and dry winds, the decaying Dominican farmhouse and chapel seems to stand through some sheer force of its literary fame.

2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Joao Silva came of age as a photographer documenting social upheaval in South Africa. Between the early 1990s — when apartheid ended — to the country’s first democratic election in 1994, Mr. Silva, a staff photographer for The New York Times, captured deadly political violence that eventually led to the abolition of its system of racial segregation.

2017-10-24.abstract: Poison frogs in a South American rain forest carry tadpoles to water. But the males aren’t choosy about whose tadpoles they transport.
2017-10-24.snippet: Poison frogs in a South American rain forest carry tadpoles to water. But the males aren’t choosy about whose tadpoles they transport.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: South American poison frogs are known to most people for their poison — and their brilliant colors. But in almost all species, the poison frog carries tadpoles on its back to a rain forest pool for their final growth stage.
2017-10-24.headline_main: One Simple Signal Sets Off a Complicated Frog Journey

2017-10-24.abstract: Jill Freedman left behind a career in advertising to live at Resurrection City, an encampment on the National Mall that was part of the Poor Peoples Campaign. Her pictures show a different, human and optimistic side to a historical event that has been labeled a failure by some.
2017-10-24.snippet: Jill Freedman left behind a career in advertising to live at Resurrection City, an encampment on the National Mall that was part of the Poor Peoples Campaign. Her pictures show a different, human and optimistic side to a historical event that has ...
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Devastated by the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., Jill Freedman quit her copywriting job at a New York advertising agency and headed to Washington, D.C., to protest poverty and live among shacks and tents on the National Mall. Little more than an amateur photographer at the time, her commitment to racial and economic justice made her the only photographer who stayed and documented the entire six-week encampment known as Resurrection City.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Finding Inspiration in the Struggle at Resurrection City

2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: France can be a notoriously expensive vacation destination — particularly if you have got your sights set on Paris or the French Riviera. Are luxury seekers on a limited budget out of luck? Not at all, said Joelle Kolich, the director of See Travel, a Bordeaux-based company selling luxury trips to the country.

2017-10-24.abstract: What happens when you identify too much with a patient?
2017-10-24.snippet: What happens when you identify too much with a patient?
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Every medical case, to paraphrase the writer Viet Thanh Nguyen, is lived twice: once in the wards and once in memory. Some of what follows is still intensely vivid, as if it were shot in high-def video. Other parts are blurry — in part because I must have subconsciously deleted or altered the memories. I was 33 then and a senior resident at a hospital in Boston. I had been assigned to the Cardiac Care Unit, a quasi I.C.U. where some of the most acutely ill patients were hospitalized.
2017-10-24.headline_main: The Rules of the Doctor’s Heart

2017-10-24.abstract: Inspired by troubles in the territory, the sculptors Jennifer Allora and Guillermo Calzadilla will debut their latest work at Miami’s new museum in December.
2017-10-24.snippet: Inspired by troubles in the territory, the sculptors Jennifer Allora and Guillermo Calzadilla will debut their latest work at Miami’s new museum in December.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — For the contemporary sculptors, Jennifer Allora and Guillermo Calzadilla, the persistent economic troubles in Puerto Rico were personal, something they had to address.
2017-10-24.headline_main: In Puerto Rico, Creating Art From Hardship

2017-10-24.abstract: Using generators, rationing and even bonfires, Puerto Ricans have had to get creative to survive weeks without power or regular water and food after Hurricane Maria.
2017-10-24.snippet: Using generators, rationing and even bonfires, Puerto Ricans have had to get creative to survive weeks without power or regular water and food after Hurricane Maria.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — A grandmother turned a school bathroom sink into a bath. Neighbors are piling into a garage for communal meals prepared on an old gas stove. A 79-year-old man made a bonfire out of fallen tree branches to cook.
2017-10-24.headline_main: ‘Like Going Back in Time’: Puerto Ricans Put Survival Skills to Use

2017-10-24.abstract: The chef wants his Red Rooster restaurants in New York and London to be expressions of black culture, and he celebrates Harlem history in a new tour app.
2017-10-24.snippet: The chef wants his Red Rooster restaurants in New York and London to be expressions of black culture, and he celebrates Harlem history in a new tour app.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: It’s understandable if it seems as though Marcus Samuelsson never sleeps. The affable New York-based chef and restaurateur, who recharged the Harlem dining scene with his restaurant Red Rooster in 2010, recently opened its first outpost, Red Rooster Shoreditch, along with the taqueria Tienda Roosteria, in London. He now operates a total of 15 restaurant brands, from Streetbird Rotisserie, also in Harlem, to Norda Bar & Grill in Göteborg, Sweden, where he grew up. Two restaurants are planned for downtown Newark and Greenpoint, Brooklyn.
2017-10-24.headline_main: From Cuisine to Apps, Marcus Samuelsson Is Dedicated to Diversity

2017-10-24.abstract: The league had gone 532 days without a head coach being fired when the Suns ousted Earl Watson on Sunday.
2017-10-24.snippet: The league had gone 532 days without a head coach being fired when the Suns ousted Earl Watson on Sunday.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: When the Phoenix Suns fired Earl Watson after three humbling losses to start the season, it brought an end to a remarkable stretch of stability in a famously volatile profession.
2017-10-24.headline_main: N.B.A. Coaches Had Long Stretch of Stability. Has the Chopping Block Returned?

2017-10-24.abstract: Richard Matheson’s legacy is felt in stories of mysterious figures and horrible, dawning realities.
2017-10-24.snippet: Richard Matheson’s legacy is felt in stories of mysterious figures and horrible, dawning realities.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: “When people talk about the genre, I guess they mention my name first,” Stephen King once wrote, “but without Richard Matheson, I wouldn’t be around.” The genre is, of course, horror. Victor LaValle, in his smart introduction to THE BEST OF RICHARD MATHESON (Penguin, paper, $17), states the case even more forcefully: “When you read modern horror, you are still reading Richard Matheson.” I’m not sure I can fully endorse that sentiment; with a lot of current horror fiction, I wish I were reading Matheson instead. But I know what LaValle means. When modern horror is good, Matheson (who died in 2013) is usually in there somewhere, a felt presence, like a ghost.
2017-10-24.headline_main: A Roundup of New Horror, All Indebted to an Early Master

2017-10-24.abstract: Tiny violins, a spooky ondes Martenot and a slamming door come to the pit for Thomas Adès’s “The Exterminating Angel,” based on Luis Buñuel’s film.
2017-10-24.snippet: Tiny violins, a spooky ondes Martenot and a slamming door come to the pit for Thomas Adès’s “The Exterminating Angel,” based on Luis Buñuel’s film.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: To transform Luis Buñuel’s surreal, darkly satirical 1962 film “The Exterminating Angel” into an opera, the composer Thomas Adès added a few very unusual instruments to the traditional orchestra. Some of them have never, or only very rarely, been heard in the pit of the Metropolitan Opera, which will present the work’s American premiere on Thursday.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Hear the Surreal Instruments of the Met’s New Opera

2017-10-24.abstract: Paint companies are predicting a very dark 2018. But designers say that’s a good thing — and here’s why.
2017-10-24.snippet: Paint companies are predicting a very dark 2018. But designers say that’s a good thing — and here’s why.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Judging from the pages of shelter magazines and interior designers’ Instagram feeds, dark colors are in. And paint companies are offering plenty of options.

2017-10-24.snippet: The Metropolitan Opera’s performance of Thomas Adès’s “The Exterminating Angel” features highly unusual instruments, from tiny violins to slamming doors.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Opera’s performance of Thomas Adès’s “The Exterminating Angel” features highly unusual instruments, from tiny violins to slamming doors.

2017-10-24.abstract: While President Trump contemplates the relationship between the United States and Cuba, more museums are attracting crowds fascinated by Cuban art and culture.
2017-10-24.snippet: While President Trump contemplates the relationship between the United States and Cuba, more museums are attracting crowds fascinated by Cuban art and culture.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Cuba is like a giant Ping-Pong, caught in the cross hairs of United States foreign policy. One minute President Obama is relaxing restrictions, making it easier for tourists in the United States to visit the tiny island. Blink, and President Trump is rolling back some of the administration’s changes. Another blink, and the state department is advising Americans not to travel to Cuba after mysterious medical attacks on diplomats at the American Embassy in Havana.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Cuban Art Outshines Politics

2017-10-24.abstract: Virtual paper trails serve as correctives to everyone from pop stars to the president.
2017-10-24.snippet: Virtual paper trails serve as correctives to everyone from pop stars to the president.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Keeping up with the truth has become a miserable business. All the old political stagecraft and prevaricating, the Rumsfeldian tautologies — we’re way past that. Forget smoke and mirrors. These are pants-on-fire times. According to The Washington Post’s “Fact Checker,” President Trump made 836 false or misleading claims in his first six months as president. This summer, The New York Times’s opinion section paired a list of Trump’s statements with contradicting sources from PolitiFact, FactCheck.org, The Washington Post and The Toronto Star. But that kind of reporting doesn’t seem to burn Trump. He’s flame-retardant.
2017-10-24.headline_main: In These Lying Times, ‘Receipts’ Offer a Glimmer of Justice

2017-10-24.abstract: Mr. Noah said that after a tape seemed to disprove Mr. Kelly’s account of a speech by Representative Frederica Wilson, she was owed an apology.
2017-10-24.snippet: Mr. Noah said that after a tape seemed to disprove Mr. Kelly’s account of a speech by Representative Frederica Wilson, she was owed an apology.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep — and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

2017-10-24.abstract: Requiring everyone to serve in some fashion would be a profoundly democratizing action.
2017-10-24.snippet: Requiring everyone to serve in some fashion would be a profoundly democratizing action.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: At the risk of belaboring an unfortunate episode that could have been averted with a bit of White House common sense, we need to examine one aspect of John Kelly’s equivalent of the St. Crispin’s Day speech from “Henry V.” This was when Mr. Kelly, the retired four-star general who is President Trump’s chief of staff, essentially said that those who haven’t served in the military — meaning nearly all Americans — cannot really understand those who have. He may as well have recited “we few, we happy few, we band of brothers” while he was at it.
2017-10-24.headline_main: John Kelly Suggests More Americans Should Have the Honor of Serving. He’s Right.

2017-10-24.snippet: The Bernie Sanders approach to health care politics has never served the party well.

2017-10-24.abstract: We thought it was a routine interview. Then he was detained.
2017-10-24.snippet: We thought it was a routine interview. Then he was detained.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: This month my father and I drove to the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services office in Centennial, Colo., for a routine visit. I offered to drive because my dad was too nervous and excited to take the wheel. “How long have we waited for this day?” he asked me. He had been told to come in for a final interview before he could get approved for legal permanent residency.
2017-10-24.headline_main: I Accidentally Turned My Dad In to Immigration Services

The breadth of Democratic fund-raising is also strong.

Holder Jr., the former attorney general, for a private dinner in July in Bridgehampton, N.Y. 2017-10-24.abstract: A multidisciplinary exhibit on the theme of inspiration among artists and literary figures, and within the work of Rodin, will open Nov. 17 in Berlin.
2017-10-24.snippet: A multidisciplinary exhibit on the theme of inspiration among artists and literary figures, and within the work of Rodin, will open Nov. 17 in Berlin.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — If “The Hero (Man and His Genius)” ranks among Rodin’s lesser-known works, it owns a place in 20th-century literary history. The bronze figure sat on the desk of the Austrian writer Hugo von Hofmannsthal for two decades and was sold with the help of the poet Rainer Maria Rilke, who played a central role in Rodin’s popularization in the German-speaking world. From Nov. 17 to March 18, the 18-inch-tall sculpture will be the centerpiece of the exhibit “Rodin-Rilke-Hofmannsthal; Man and His Genius” at the Alte Nationalgalerie here.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Exploring Rodin’s Place in Literary History

2017-10-24.abstract: Suspending or expelling young students for behavior they can’t control makes matters worse. There is a better way.
2017-10-24.snippet: Suspending or expelling young students for behavior they can’t control makes matters worse. There is a better way.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Matt Hannon was in preschool when he started getting into trouble. Teachers quickly labeled his mischievous behavior — like cutting his hair under the table — problematic. His kindergarten teacher warned that if Matt didn’t stop using “potty words,” she would make him do his work in the bathroom. His first-grade teacher forced Matt to copy the phrase “I will not blurt out in circle” 100 times. Matt began to dread school and developed serious separation anxiety. His acting-out got worse.
2017-10-24.headline_main: The ‘Problem Child’ Is a Child, Not a Problem

2017-10-24.abstract: Opposition to the war in Vietnam was a great moral crusade, yet most Americans recall only enormous protests and social chaos.
2017-10-24.snippet: Opposition to the war in Vietnam was a great moral crusade, yet most Americans recall only enormous protests and social chaos.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: The Vietnam antiwar movement, famous for its sound and fury, deserves credit for more. We were the first mass movement against a war in American history and one of its great moral crusades, yet most Americans recall only enormous protests and social chaos. In fact, the 10-year movement, in which I played a role, was a complex phenomenon that evolved strategically as circumstances changed. It can be broken down into four overlapping stages.
2017-10-24.headline_main: The Four Stages of the Antiwar Movement

2017-10-24.abstract: The Communist Party has added the president’s name and ideas to its constitution. Here is what that means.
2017-10-24.snippet: The Communist Party has added the president’s name and ideas to its constitution. Here is what that means.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: The Chinese Communist Party wrote Xi Jinping’s name and ideas into its constitution on Tuesday, elevating him at the end of his first five-year term to the same exalted status as the nation’s founding father, Mao Zedong.
2017-10-24.headline_main: China Enshrines ‘Xi Jinping Thought.’ What Does That Mean?

2017-10-24.abstract: This feature debut of the writer and director Francis Lee is a bracing, sometimes brutal movie.
2017-10-24.snippet: This feature debut of the writer and director Francis Lee is a bracing, sometimes brutal movie.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Trapped between skies like beaten tin and earth scrubbed raw by wind and rain, the characters in “God’s Own Country” are well used to harshness. Like Johnny (Josh O’Connor), who labors on his struggling family farm in Yorkshire under the critical eyes of his sick father (Ian Hart) and stolid grandmother (Gemma Jones). For relief, he vents his frustrations in binge-drinking and furtive, feral sex with random young men.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Review: Love Is Wild, if Not Pretty, in ‘God’s Own Country’

2017-10-24.abstract: Mr. Morris’s staging of the Azerbaijani opera about star-crossed lovers arrives in New York. “It’s not about sex,” he says. “It’s about infinity.”
2017-10-24.snippet: Mr. Morris’s staging of the Azerbaijani opera about star-crossed lovers arrives in New York. “It’s not about sex,” he says. “It’s about infinity.”
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: The choreographer Mark Morris’s much-lauded musicality often overshadows another important current in his work: the way it connects the individual and the universal. For Mr. Morris, love and universality are inextricable, and universal love is the ultimate good. Couples dances are rare in his work, and usually occur within the context of the larger group. Harmony is greater than romance.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Love, Ecstasy, Infinity: Mark Morris’s ‘Layla and Majnun’

2017-10-24.abstract: The choreographer Karole Armitage’s “Halloween Unleashed” was inspired by Disney’s 1929 “Skeleton Dance” — and Haitian carnival and no-wave New York grit.
2017-10-24.snippet: The choreographer Karole Armitage’s “Halloween Unleashed” was inspired by Disney’s 1929 “Skeleton Dance” — and Haitian carnival and no-wave New York grit.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Usually, the spirit behind Karole Armitage’s dance projects has more in common with Neo-Classicism than with ghosts. But Ms. Armitage, who was given the label of punk ballerina in the 1980s — and still wears it proudly — has choreographed a Halloween show.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Some Screwball Surrealism for Halloween

2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Few American industries are as invested in the decades-long political battle over immigration as agriculture. Paying low wages for backbreaking work, growers large and small have historically relied on immigrants from south of the Rio Grande. These days, over one-quarter of the farmhands in the United States are immigrants working here illegally.

A new two-part play, “The Divide,” by Alan Ayckbourn. The stage premiere of Ingmar Bergman’s 1982 film, “Fanny and Alexander.” A musical dance production, “Sylvia,” directed by Kate Prince, about the female rights campaigner Sylvia Pankhurst.

2017-10-24.abstract: Confronted with a surplus of an amino acid found in many plants, beets evolved the ability to transform it into the scarlet hue found on your dinner table.
2017-10-24.snippet: Confronted with a surplus of an amino acid found in many plants, beets evolved the ability to transform it into the scarlet hue found on your dinner table.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: As the seasons change, a riot of red shows up in the world around us, showcasing some of the most vivid hues that plant biochemistry can create. The red pigments in maple leaves, called anthocyanins, are the same kind that light up the cranberries you might cook for a Thanksgiving feast or the ruddy apples you’d put in a pie.
2017-10-24.headline_main: How Beets Became Beet-Red

2017-10-24.abstract: Knightshift comes to Brooklyn three nights a week, and Momofuku Nishi hits the reset button.
2017-10-24.snippet: Knightshift comes to Brooklyn three nights a week, and Momofuku Nishi hits the reset button.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: VINUM Massimo Felici, who owned La Nonna and Ribollita in Manhattan, has now set up a welcoming Italian wine bar and restaurant on Staten Island, a borough that’s not long on such amenities. Without jumping onto the ferry or driving over a bridge or two, local Italophiles can indulge in a collection of meatball plates and small servings of eggplant parm, burrata, shrimp with white beans, and braised tripe. Four salads based on classics like Caesar, table-size platters of cheeses and cured meats, assorted pastas including fresh pappardelle with wild boar, and a few main dishes like a veal chop paved with ham and fontina round out the menu. A taste of Sicily shows up, with bacalao croquettes, and couscous with cod. In the morning, Mr. Felici, who is the baker as well as the chef, offers fresh breads and pastries with coffee. Lunch includes panini. Grapes from Italy dominate the wine list, with California in second place. Pours are by the glass as well as by the bottle. (Bottles start at $25.) The wood-and-brick-walled setting with a marble bar is invitingly subdued: 704 Bay Street (Broad Street), Stapleton, Staten Island, 718-448-8466, vinumnyc.com.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Vinum, for Italian Food and Wine, Opens on Staten Island

2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: AS A TEENAGER during the 1980s in a Belgian seaside town, Valerie Barkowski watched as her father went about his job organizing yachting regattas on the English Channel. A more stolid soul might have found the gentle waters lulling. But all Barkowski wanted to know was: How do I sail away? Even then, she gathered that a provincial life along the coast wasn’t for her.

2017-10-24.abstract: Guide dogs are taught to keep the blind safe. Now they’re being trained to help guide visually impaired runners in road races — and maybe, someday, in a marathon.
2017-10-24.snippet: Guide dogs are taught to keep the blind safe. Now they’re being trained to help guide visually impaired runners in road races — and maybe, someday, in a marathon.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Thomas Panek had been a runner from a young age, so even when he lost his sight in his early 20s, he continued to compete in road races. And like any blind runner, he has relied on volunteers to guide him. Whether he was running the New York City Marathon (with Rabbi Michael Friedman of Running Rabbis) or the Boston Marathon (with the famed ultramarathoner Scott Jurek), human guides, connected by a tether, have led his way. He has enjoyed this method, despite the lack of independence.
2017-10-24.headline_main: A Blind Runner and His Very Good Boy

2017-10-24.abstract: The viability of a planned $100 billion public offering for the national oil company is being debated as the Saudi crown prince welcomes titans of finance to the desert city this week.
2017-10-24.snippet: The viability of a planned $100 billion public offering for the national oil company is being debated as the Saudi crown prince welcomes titans of finance to the desert city this week.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia — It’s a big week for Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman of Saudi Arabia. For the first time since his elevation as heir to the kingdom, he will play host to a gathering of the global investing elite. Heavyweights from SoftBank’s Masayoshi Son to United States Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin are rolling into this city to see firsthand his plans to make the city a regional financial powerhouse. Hanging over the affairs will be the status of the biggest deal in capital-markets history: the debut of the Saudi Arabian Oil Company on public markets.

2017-10-24.abstract: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around the newsroom are reading.
2017-10-24.snippet: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around the newsroom are reading.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: THE BIG BOOK OF ROGUES AND VILLAINS Edited by Otto Penzler (Vintage Crime, $25.) Penzler takes what is arguably the best part of crime and mystery novels — the villains — and packs them into an encyclopedic anthology that manages to cover both Dracula and Dr. Fu Manchu. To be read through a monocle and with a sinister sneer. THE SECRET LIVES OF COLOR By Kassia St. Clair (Penguin, $20.) Chrome Yellow, Dragon’s Blood and Pitch Black. These are just three of the 75 shades, dyes and hues St. Clair explores as she tells the backstory of the colors that make up our world. WHY WE DON’T SUCK  By Dr. Denis Leary (Crown Archetype, $27.) Leary, the actor and co-creator of the FX series “Rescue Me” (and doctor by honorary degree), takes “equal opportunity aim” at the most partisan issues of our political moment with a mission to #MakeAmericaLaughAgain. PIE & WHISKEY (Sasquatch Books, $19.95.) This project began as a reading series organized by Lebo and Ligon, in which they sent 12 writers a pie and whiskey prompt to inspire new work. Six years later, they have created an anthology that’s just as eclectic, drunk and delicious. THE UNQUOTABLE TRUMP By R. Sikoryak (Drawn and Quarterly, $19.95.) Sikoryak, an artist known for his arch comic adaptations of literary classics, casts President Trump, along with his outlandish claims and alternative facts, as some of the most notable villains in comic book history. Wonder Woman is now “Nasty Woman” and the Black Panther series is reimagined as “The Black Voter.”
2017-10-24.headline_main: New & Noteworthy

2017-10-24.abstract: Mr. Flake, a Republican of Arizona, said he would “no longer be complicit or silent” in the face of the president’s “reckless, outrageous and undignified” behavior.
2017-10-24.snippet: Mr. Flake, a Republican of Arizona, said he would “no longer be complicit or silent” in the face of the president’s “reckless, outrageous and undignified” behavior.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Jeff Flake, the Arizona Republican who has tangled with President Trump for months, announced on Tuesday that he would not seek re-election in 2018, declaring on the Senate floor that he “will no longer be complicit or silent” in the face of the president’s “reckless, outrageous and undignified” behavior.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Jeff Flake, a Fierce Trump Critic, Will Not Seek Re-election for Senate

2017-10-24.abstract: This documentary is directed by Griffin Dunne, Ms. Didion’s nephew, a relationship that limits the movie in certain ways, but opens it up in others.
2017-10-24.snippet: This documentary is directed by Griffin Dunne, Ms. Didion’s nephew, a relationship that limits the movie in certain ways, but opens it up in others.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Joan Didion’s meticulously calibrated prose has the effect of placing her at a particular remove from the reader. The persona she creates on the page is always frank but never ingratiating.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Review: A ‘Joan Didion’ Portrait, From an Intimate Source

2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court dismissed on Tuesday the last remaining appeal in a pair of cases challenging President Trump’s executive order, issued in March, that sought to limit travel to the United States.

2017-10-24.abstract: He was a young, cocky jazz musician, making his way in the New York jazz world. And then, one night, the intimidating Charles Mingus walked into the club.
2017-10-24.snippet: He was a young, cocky jazz musician, making his way in the New York jazz world. And then, one night, the intimidating Charles Mingus walked into the club.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: In 1977, a week after I graduated from New England Conservatory in Boston, I moved to New York to play with the greatest players in jazz — isn’t that why most young jazz musicians come to New York? Soon after I arrived, while I was picking up gigs at a variety of small jazz clubs in the Village (and one night at a piano bar on the Upper East Side, where I unhappily sang show tunes), I began going to Bradley’s, a bar on University Place owned by Bradley Cunningham, a gregarious, imposing former marine in his early 50s.
2017-10-24.headline_main: Fred Hersch: The First Time I Played for Charles Mingus

2017-10-24.abstract: Anthony Atamanuik of “The President Show” never wanted a Trump victory, but it has been great for his career. Now he must avoid the many pitfalls of mocking the man.
2017-10-24.snippet: Anthony Atamanuik of “The President Show” never wanted a Trump victory, but it has been great for his career. Now he must avoid the many pitfalls of mocking the man.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Anthony Atamanuik has at least one thing in common with Donald Trump: Each man finds himself occupying a historic office, somewhat surprisingly and under high stakes. Trump’s office has been home to every president since Taft; Atamanuik’s used to belong to Stephen Colbert. I visited in late August, when Atamanuik was still settling in. There were big windows and high ceilings with exposed rafters. There was an executive bathroom. He showed me a “WristStrong” bracelet, a relic of Colbert’s injury, that he had fished out of the rafters using a decorative saber given to him by J.D. Amato, his friend and former co-executive producer. The saber had “truth” engraved on one side of the blade and “satire” on the other.
2017-10-24.headline_main: The Impossible Burden of Playing Donald Trump

2017-10-24.abstract: The sex and relationship guru Esther Perel’s new book is about the variety of reasons that people stray, and about the paradox of reconciling the erotic and the domestic.
2017-10-24.snippet: The sex and relationship guru Esther Perel’s new book is about the variety of reasons that people stray, and about the paradox of reconciling the erotic and the domestic.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: Thank God for infidelity. It’s the one thing this very divided nation agrees on. Per a 2013 Gallup poll surveying moral attitudes, we hate it more than we hate divorce. We hate it more than polygamy. We hate it more than human cloning. We hate it more than suicide.

2017-10-24.abstract: Once again, we realize that we’re one of the Caribbean peoples on the hurricane highway.
2017-10-24.snippet: Once again, we realize that we’re one of the Caribbean peoples on the hurricane highway.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — The nights are long in Puerto Rico these days. On hot nights, my wife, Nieves, and I spend hours sitting in the patio, sometimes taking showers at 3 a.m. Cooler nights come with rainfall that worsens the still-roofless homes. Of course, there’s still no electricity. A month later, Hurricane Maria is still with us.
2017-10-24.headline_main: In Puerto Rico, We Invented Resilience

2017-10-24.abstract: Subscription clothing services should make you feel great. Shouldn’t they? The authors Emily Gould and Rumaan Alam investigate.
2017-10-24.snippet: Subscription clothing services should make you feel great. Shouldn’t they? The authors Emily Gould and Rumaan Alam investigate.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: As so many emotional journeys do, this one began with me expressing disgust on Twitter. In this instance, I was angry about the proliferation of lifestyle-touting subscription clothing services. I’d recently seen ads for Bombfell on the subway (“If shopping isn’t your bag, you’re going to love our box”) and hit a personal tipping point.
2017-10-24.headline_main: You’ll Wear What They Tell You to Wear

And by then, she was already in federal custody at the border in Texas, one of the multitude of unaccompanied minors caught trying to enter the United States without their parents or relatives. She was 17 years old.
2017-10-24.headline_main: U.S. Must Let Undocumented Teenager Get an Abortion, Appeals Court Says

2017-10-24.abstract: At a packed news conference, Ksenia Sobchak said she spoke of a generation itching to challenge a corrupt political system and ultimately gain power.
2017-10-24.snippet: At a packed news conference, Ksenia Sobchak said she spoke of a generation itching to challenge a corrupt political system and ultimately gain power.
2017-10-24.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Ksenia A. Sobchak, a socialite and popular journalist turned Russian presidential candidate, opened her campaign on Tuesday by calling elections in Russia “a very expensive show of a very low quality” but justifying her participation as the only way to change the country’s corrupt political system.

2017-10-24.snippet: Bid officials say Sunil Gulati’s uncertain grip on the U.S. Soccer presidency will not affect their efforts to bring the event to the United States, Mexico and Canada.
